Upon arriving at the restaurant, we waited for nearly 20 minutes before a server approached our table, and while our elderly waiter was quite friendly, the overall dining experience was unremarkable, with food that failed to meet the standards set by the San Diego location. It is truly unfortunate that this particular Hash House A Go Go did not live up to our expectations, as it is evident that the San Diego site is vastly superior."

Mittagspause gemacht. Essen und Trinken waren flott am Platz. Bedienung nett. Zum Abkassieren war dann aber irgendwie keiner zust\u00e4ndig. Am Ende hab' ich das Geld auf den Tisch gelegt und bin gegangen. Trotzdem den Bus verpasst. Nochmal 20 Minuten warten. Mist!

When you first walk in it looks like you're about to have a great experience. However I was highly disappointed. First of all they UNSANITIZED tools on me. I was charged for a glitter that I didn't even want AND my gel nail polish chipped the next morning!!! I was not happy to pay $60 for a gel mani and a regular pedicure that didn't even last 24 hours. The one positive thing I can say is that they were extremely friendly.

(Bald) Bartender, manifestly discourteous. This review would be excessively protracted if I itemized our dialogue. I interacted with a manager, regarding his "conduct" toward us. The manager offered an apology and purchased us a beverage. That was considerate of him, but I aspire for the bartender to refine his "interpersonal" proficiencies.

The establishment was not overly crowded, approximately an hour subsequent to a Dbacks match. We did not consume any culinary offerings. I have been apprised of the superior quality of their fare. Baldy Bartender generated a negative ambiance, precluding us from prolonging our visit. I possessed minimal inclination to request the bartender alter the television station, laugh out loud.

Was unable to procure a last-minute booking at Craftsteak, which I hold in high esteem, during my sojourn in Las Vegas, thereby necessitating a reluctant visit to Delmonico.

The level of service provided was satisfactory, as anticipated, yet lacked the warmth and cordiality that fosters a genuine connection between patron and server, leaving me with an unfulfilled desire for a more convivial dining experience.

My culinary preferences lean towards the tenderer side, and unfortunately, the rib eye failed to meet my expectations in terms of marbling and overall tenderness, rendering it difficult to fully appreciate its flavor profile.

Given the abundance of alternative steakhouses in the vicinity, Delmonico's shortcomings are further highlighted, thus making it unlikely that I shall return in the future.

This particular buffet was one of the more costly dining experiences I had the pleasure of indulging in during my stay in Las Vegas, with a price point of $21 per individual for a Monday evening meal, which unfortunately did not meet my expectations in terms of quality and value. In contrast, a comparable dining establishment located in close proximity, specifically the 4 Queens, offered a superior culinary experience for a significantly lower price point of $9.
Can you say- alot of food. First time patron and wasn't that impressed. It's alright nothing spectacular. Just feels like and taste like your at olive garden on steroids.

"It is indeed perplexing that TK, who purports to embody the quintessential American spirit, would choose to affiliate himself with an eatery that openly professes its affection for an amorous relationship with anyone, regardless of their background or inclinations. My recent visit to this establishment, specifically to attend a live performance by the illustrious Reverend Horton Heat, served as the impetus for my decision to confer upon it a second star. However, I must admit that I was taken aback by the exorbitant prices charged for certain beverages, including a remarkably pricey well rum and diet, which amounted to a staggering $8, and Pabst Blue Ribbon cans, which were offered at a premium of $5 apiece. As I did not sample the culinary offerings, I cannot provide an assessment of their quality. Nevertheless, my brief encounter with the bartender led me to form an unfavorable impression of the service, and the constant fluctuation in prices throughout the evening only served to reinforce my conviction that this establishment is not worthy of future visits. In summary, while the entertainment provided that night was undoubtedly enjoyable, the excessive cost of drinks and the inconsistent pricing policy adopted by the management make it a decidedly unappealing destination for those seeking a satisfying dining experience."

I really wanted to really like this place.

I have gone there twice during my visit here...

First off, when asked what you would like to drink, if you say water, it's a bit alarming when the waitress asks (tells) you, are you sure you wouldn't like a lemon in that water?  It's cause the water they serve tastes terrible.  Seriously.

Second, I'm a huge fan of Kreplach soup.  So when I saw it on their menu, I got rather excited.  That excitement didn't last for long.  The Kreplach looked like they were mass produced, all identical, not hand made.  They were skinny.  Don't bother ordering it.

If you order a half sandwich, the cole slaw that comes with it, well, you need a magnifying glass to see it... really, why provide a serving in a thimble?  It's a shame, cause the cole slaw actually was good.

The corned beef sandwiches were ok, they seem to get pleasure out of their size... for $13 or whatever, I expect them to be big.  They were good, not great, but good.

The entrance is a dizzy array of the check in area, the register area, the take out area, and a merchandising area.  The seating area is pretty plain.

All in all, if this is Tempe's definition of a wantabee Jewish deli, it has the advantage to most places away from the two coasts, but it really doesn't pass the appearance or taste test.  Better than none, I'll concede that.

But disappointed, perhaps cause it bills itself as something it's not...
Crappy service. Good food..... Ordered, then got food 50mins Later then didn't see the Waitress for another 30 mins..... When she dropped off the check...

This theater does not evoke the fear that people tend to associate with it; rather, it can be perceived as an antiquated remnant from the early 1990s when Mills malls were prevalent throughout the nation. Its aged appearance and outdated ambiance may deter some individuals, but it primarily attracts a distinct clientele.  
I was reluctantly accompanying my companion to this cinema on a Thursday evening, anticipating a lackluster comedic experience in front of a meager audience. Unfortunately, my expectations were met, as there were merely five other individuals scattered throughout the theater. The time spent there seemed irretrievable, and the possibility of obtaining a refund appeared unlikely, given the theater's policy of directing customers to a self-service machine that might potentially malfunction.  
During the process of purchasing tickets, Melinda encountered difficulties with her card at one of the machines, necessitating our migration to an alternative device. Although the transaction was successfully completed, the tickets and receipt failed to print. Consequently, we were compelled to visit the box office, which the automated machines were intended to circumvent. Surprisingly, the manager displayed leniency and allowed us entry without requesting any evidence. It is conceivable that we could have fabricated this narrative, and perhaps we shall attempt to do so in the future.

I used to love this place when they were located at von's shopping center. Then they moved to Food4Less shopping cnter, I still like it. The business closed for several months, don't know why. Now they're back and I'm so excited. Today I came back for my favorite, pad thai. It doesn't taste as good and they no longer have lunch special.

Website does not reflect accurate stock levels, company fails to inform customers of out of stock items and processes the order short, when you call to address the matter, they very rudely talk over you and hang up. I take that as a sign they don;t want my business, I will be happy to oblige.
They have gone severely down hill. Have gone here for a couple years for close by chinese. I wouldn't go back.

Positives:
* The waitress was very nice.
* They were open on Christmas Eve.

Negatives:
* The waitress was not remotely competent.
* The beer was skunked.
* The fries--which took 15 minutes to arrive--were pale and ice cold.

Do you want to die shortly after being slapped in the face with a cover charge that shouldn't be charged and then having your girlfriend gang raped on the dance floor?

It receives two stars simply because I used to like the place.  Pool, good music, dancing, reasonable drink prices.  But, after a couple of tense situations, witnessing fights on a near weekly basis, and a parking lot shooting....I'll pass these days.

I don't do karaoke so that side of the establishment might be okay.
Nothing special here. Average tacos and below average service. If you are drunk and hungry this place might suite you.

so after driving around south phoenix for an hour on a sunday, in search of an open mexican dive joint to get a breakfast burrito, and extremely hungover and tired, i somehow ended up at fili b's.

they serve breakfast all day, which is quite an amazing thing.

i think that if i hadn't had spent so long searching for a joint that was open and starvingly had to stop here before hunger completely overwhelmed me, i would have just gone to a more familiar mexican drive-thru, like the one at 5th ave and camelback, or 40th st and indian - all which serve some pretty dank breakfast burritos.

but i ended up here, and the food was meh. it didn't really hit the spot like i was hoping it would have. too much cheese and the bacon wasn't cooked long enough and was fatty. my friends got chorizo burritos which were bland and extremely greasy. i usually try to avoid fili's and go to one of the sister/knockoff joints like rollbertos, eribertos, armandos, etc.
Meh. The location and the venue is great, but the food is only okay.  I liked the drinks, though! CREATIVE!!

I ordered lasagna, dinner salad and soup.  The Italian wedding soup tasted just like Italian dressing.  It used to be so good. I was so disappointed in it that I saved it for a week to get a refund since I only took two bites but never found the time to take it in and deal with the manager I spoke to that seemed hesitant to provide a refund vs. a replacement product. All the herby delicious flavor was gone and sweet, sweet, sweet took over. Don't they know not to mess with a good thing. Either they changed the recipe or they have a lazy cook.

The lasagna was good but also really sweet. The portion for the price was disappointing. For that much money, I will just make a pan at home and freeze some portions.  

The dinner salad was fantastic. Full of yummy, crispy veggies. If the lettuce had been drained and the dressing didn't come out of a bottle with so much sugar it could gag you, I would get that salad twice a week. 

I won't be returning for anything BUT the salad, and only if I have my own dressing.

Bummer update.

I had pants hemmed here and, while the guy did a decent job (though they still ended up too long even though he pinned them while I had them on?) it was absurdly expensive and took A WEEK.  \n\nCome on now.

"The culinary offerings were merely adequate, akin to those available at a standard Italian eatery, whereas the hospitality was truly exceptional, characterized by an extraordinary level of cordiality. My spouse and I were commemorating our first anniversary, and while the ambiance was not optimal for such a momentous occasion, the staff's eagerness to expedite our departure was manifestly evident, as they removed our plates before we had completed our meals. The establishment was not particularly crowded on this Sunday evening, yet the sense of urgency they conveyed was palpable, making for an unfortunate dining experience that precludes any future visits."

I ordered a mozzarella and tomato sandwich, a small order of pasta salad, and a drink and it came out to $13. For $13 I could of gone to a restaurant. Paradise Bakery has some of the best cookies around but the food is a rip off.

"While the establishment offers an extensive array of beverages at reasonable prices, the culinary offerings are subpar and not commensurate with the quality of the libations. The fried macaroni and cheese dish, in particular, was unremarkable and quickly forgotten. However, the ambiance is enhanced by the presence of numerous large flat-screen televisions strategically positioned throughout the venue."

We visited this establishment and our experience was utterly underwhelming.  My spouse had the vegetarian skillet, which was unimpressive, to say the least, as the vegetables were unpleasantly chilled and were crowned with a lackluster melted cheese.  I opted for pancakes, which, quite frankly, were subpar in both taste and texture, and failed to surpass the quality of those produced by Bisquick, a widely available pre-mixed baking solution.  Needless to say, we shall not be patronizing this establishment again in the future, particularly given its proximity to our place of residence.  Indeed, the whole experience was a profound disappointment.

I was getting my nails done here on Tuesday night, and while my nail lady was fabulous, the ambiance was not. There apparently who is a hairdresser there, Barbara, and she lets her kids run around the entire salon as she works. I think it is highly unprofessional. I was in a complete opposite area of the hair salon, and I could hear the kids. Not to mention, the same lady, was on the phone screaming at someone...also very unprofessional. My nail lady said that was pretty normal and the kids were always at the salon being loud and the mother is very loud herself. I just wanted to relax for an hour or so, and could not do so in that atmosphere. I will not go back, just because I don't want to be bothered with an employees children running around....again....highly unprofessional.

"Complimentary carbonated beverages were provided, a pleasant gesture, albeit, the sole notable attribute encountered during my visit. Pervasive fumigation permeated the interior (even by casino standards), resulting in an unpleasant experience upon returning home, enshrouded in pungent smoke. Furthermore, participation in the rewards program proved somewhat vexatious, as the complimentary $10 slot play was restricted to specific, sparsely dispersed, crown-marked machines, often occupied by individuals with no apparent intention of relinquishing their seats in the near future. Overall, this establishment ranks among my least preferred gaming venues in the greater Phoenix area, thereby rendering it unlikely that I shall revisit in the forthcoming days."

We indulged in a delectable brunch at this establishment this morning; however, our culinary satisfaction was significantly diminished by the subpar service we received. Furthermore, we were taken aback by the presence of a steak knife perched atop the toilet paper dispenser in the ladies' restroom, an unsettling discovery that elicited relief that no young child had accidentally encountered it. Consequently, we are left feeling disillusioned and compelled to seek an alternative venue for our future brunch endeavors. This establishment must expedite efforts to ameliorate their organizational proficiency and rectify the issues that hamper their ability to provide optimal service to patrons.

2.5 stars, but I'll round down.

Reading review online, this was suppose to be one of the best buffets in Vegas.  It was decent, but not something to ride home about.

The theme is a world buffet, with different stations including Chinese, American, Mexican, Mediterranean and I think Japanese.  Though creative, each station only had a few dishes for each theme, which limitis the buffet.  

My husband complained that the crab legs were undercooked.  He was not impressed by their selection of seafood, however this is not a seafood buffet.  I had a roast pork that was very juicy, but nothing spectacular.

I'd say, skip this and go out to a restaurant instead.

Lunch buffet is medicore at best, def. better food to be had elsewhere.  I usually only go there for the chaat.  However, today we were informed that the restaurant wasn't taking any chaat orders as the kitchen was too busy, all after the waitress had already taken our order.  Meanwhile, one or two other customers were given chaat orders to-go, I'm guessing they called ahead of time.

Very disappointed!Heard so much about this place so we were very surprised! Walked in and immediately greeted... Very good service.\nThe place was dead!!! It was after 9 so drinks weren't on special.. But 8 for a corona!? No thanks!

I have fond memories of the 'wichcraft in Bryant Park from a few years ago.  Maybe it was the sitting-outside-and-actually-being-outside that made the experience so enjoyable... but no, I really think it was the fresh, hot sandwiches that made it such a memorable lunch spot.  It's too bad Vegas has Vegas-ized it into mediocrity.

The line was to the door at 4pm on a Saturday.  I was surprised, but I guess I shouldn't be - I forgot how time means nothing when you're in a casino.  Considering the sandwiches were pre-made and just needed to be plopped onto the panini-griller, it seemed to take a while - but I wasn't in a hurry, so I can deal.  

I ordered the ham/cheddar/apple on pumpernickel and got it to go.  I was so excited to savor the awesomeness remembered from Bryant Park that I ripped it open in the car to take a few bites.  

Oooh, messy!  I don't know what happened - maybe the water content of the apples was too much? - but half of the sandwich was so soggy, it was like it had just been bathed.  The other half was just fine - so strange.  I think cheddar was the wrong cheese choice on their part - it made the whole thing so bland, like it zapped out any flavor the apples and ham had brought to the table.  I hate to say it, but I've had a Subway sandwich or two more exciting than this.  Maybe their other creations are better?

Sadly disappointed

Not sure if it was an "off" night for this 4 star yelped restaurant but I was quite surprised.  Someone needs to tackle quality control.

Nothing seemed fresh, the food looked as though it was presented well, but tasted like stale leftovers (I hate leftovers).  ALL the cut  meats were completely dried out and tough (yes.. Ribs, prime rib, turkey.. Dry and tough).  The Asian cuisine made me sick.. Seriously the only things worth eating 1) pizza was editable, and 2) the ice cream was yum.

I will not be returning!

It was indeed one of the initial pleasant weekends in Montreal, and we had become cognizant of the fact that certain rooftop restaurants within the vicinity were offering brunch services. Subsequently, we arrived at the establishment and took a seat, only to be taken aback by the revelation that brunch was not being offered, with lunch being the sole available option. The elevator's signage suggested that brunch was served between the hours of 11 am and 3:30 pm, yet this was seemingly applicable to the restaurant situated below us. Frankly, I remain uncertain about the veracity of this claim. Notwithstanding, we opted to partake in the culinary offerings, as our hunger was quite pronounced. 

We procured some beverages and placed an order for an appetizer, which, upon its arrival, proved to be exceptionally delectable. Unfortunately, this was the sole highlight of the repast, apart from the favorable weather conditions and panoramic view. My vegetarian burger, in particular, bore a strong resemblance to a mass-produced patty, both in terms of its appearance and taste, which was rather unfortunate. 

Following the consumption of our meals, we waited for what seemed like an interminable period of time, amounting to at least thirty minutes, before our bills were presented to us. The establishment was bustling with activity, and our server appeared to be overwhelmed, leading to our table being neglected, much to our dismay. Eventually, our server returned, exhibiting remorse, which was, to some extent, reassuring. In conclusion, I would not advocate for a revisit to this establishment, owing to the subpar quality of the cuisine and the unsatisfactory nature of the service provided.

"The densely populated drinking establishment we visited on a Sunday left me feeling utterly overpowered. Our excursion commenced with the consumption of margaritas at the Hefe on Mill, followed by a convenient Uber ride to the sister venue situated in the historic district of Old Town Scottsdale. \nIt is my conviction that if this bar were located in a less populous urban setting, it would provide a more enjoyable experience; unfortunately, the sheer volume of patrons within the confines of a relatively diminutive space rendered the atmosphere oppressive. Alternatively, management may wish to consider implementing a restriction on the number of individuals allowed to congregate at any given time... The scenario was nothing short of absurd."

I cannot stand this DMV. I refuse to ever go to inside again unless absolutely necessary and will use the kiosk outside.
I was able to go at 2:00 AM this morning and renew the registration on my car at the kiosk outside without having to deal with any worker on the inside rolling their eyes and disliking being there. It took seriously 2 minutes and it spit my registration right out. That was convenient! With the kiosks popping up all over town, I hopefully can just use those for renewals. 

I don't like how the employees treat the customers. They know that we have no other company to go to and have no choice but to use the DMV. 

This location is always to packed with lines at times wrapping around the building outside. There is a snack bar LOL. If you want a hot dog and nachos while you wait then you are in luck!

Never a great sign when you enter a giant restaurant for dinner and the place is completely empty. The next red flag was the menu that was enormous, I am talking on par with the ridiculousness of Cheesecake Factory. Since the menu had my head spinning I went the safe route with the chicken tender plate. My girlfriend ordered a Thai chicken inspired meal and her mom ordered a salad. I will say again the restaurant was pretty much empty, it took nearly 45 minutes for us to receive our meals. My chicken was decent, I think I expected it to be worse but it was nowhere near the wait I could have went to Bojangles for the same quality. \n\nAlso, this place had the saddest beer menu ever.

"We patronized this establishment on an evening when they featured multiple musical acts, yet encountered considerable difficulty in procuring the attention of the waiting staff. After several unsuccessful attempts to hail a server, we opted to approach the bar and placed an order for two draft beers, which amounted to nearly ten dollars. Numerous patrons, including ourselves, endeavored to signal a server, and ultimately, our orders were fulfilled after approximately forty minutes had elapsed. The initial course, an Italian-inspired burrito, was presented to us while still partially frozen within. The soups were unremarkable, whereas the ribs were fairly satisfying, although excessive sauce was applied; it is recommended to request it on the side, lest one prefers a plethora of sauce. The musical performances were quite enjoyable on this particular night, alas, my alcoholic beverage consumption was limited to three drinks, as it appeared to be the maximum quantity they desired to sell me; attempts to acquire additional drinks proved futile, suggesting that if a business chooses to engage live music, it would be wise to optimize both food and beverage sales."

We walked in for happy hour... took a look around... smelled like a funeral home...

Walked out....

Maybe this place is good if you are retired....

The staff was friendly and accommodating. I had an arrangement made for my grandma. After I left I looked at the flowers and some of the roses edges were dried/dead. I think the flower arrangement was over priced for what you what you got. :-(

This was our first experience at this location.  We had been to other place and the pizza was amazing but service was beyond horrible.  Had some friends in town and good pizza seemed like the common thought, we came here to get a good pizza that wasn't a 'normal chain' type place.  We ordered two pizza's and they were both just ok, and the staff here was not as bad as the other location but it amazes me in such a small place such as this that your drinks being empty for extended periods of time as well as the one waitress not being seen in the dining room for extended periods of time.  I will order to go from the other location before I do this stop again.  I'm assuming the drinking and the proximity to UNLV is what keeps this location open.

"What in the name of culinary excellence has transpired at this establishment?!? The pace of service is sluggish, the fare served is unremarkable, the quality has diminished significantly, the dining area is unkempt and appears to have been neglected for an extended period of time... This venue was previously considered an affordable substitute for the illustrious PF Changs; however, it now pales in comparison to even the most middling of dining experiences offered by Denny's. It would appear that the management of this eatery has strayed considerably from its erstwhile commitment to providing a satisfactory dining experience for its clientele."

In today's stringent economic climate, I am reluctant to express dissatisfaction with an eatery unless it truly merits censure. However, my recent dining experience at this establishment left much to be desired, despite the fact that I was the sole patron present. Not only did I have to procure my own condiments, but I also waited an inordinate amount of time for a water refill while consuming my meal. On a positive note, the baba ganoush was palatable and reasonably priced, while the salad was fresh and crisp. Unfortunately, the kafta kabob was somewhat arid and could have benefited from the addition of a tangy tahini sauce to enhance its flavor. Although the woman who served me was polite, her attention to detail was lacking, as she failed to ensure that I had all the necessities required for a satisfying dining experience. Based on my assessment, three stars seems rather generous; nevertheless, I may consider returning in the future, particularly given the presence of appealing lunch specials available between 11 am and 3 pm.

Not terrible but nowhere worth the price.

Went there with some friends. Our server was borderline creepy--- when we asked for more time to view the menu he sarcastically asked if we'd be ready by tomorrow. uhhh, k?

The food was alright. I split 3 dishes with 3 friends. Eggplant parmesan from the appetizer menu, Caprese, and the formaggio raviolis (I forgot whatever fancy name they slapped on them). The eggplant parm was boring and very greasy... I've had better from coffee shops. The raviolis were good, but lacked any stuffing. They were seriously flat. The sauce that accompanied them was a little thick I thought, but tasted fine. Best part of the meal was the Caprese. Very fresh and presented nicely. Only thing worth the money that we tried. 

Also after eating there we asked if we could see the collection of cars they have next to the restaurant, as it is one of the "draws" of this place. Nope, cover charge. Forget that.

In short, skip this place. Overpriced tourist trap.

A very tight parking lot for this Walgreens and I would seriously recommend that you monitor your surroundings when you're going from the store to your car. It is a very tight parking lot.\n\nI didn't go in on this particular visit - we used the drive-through and had a great clerk taking care of our prescription. Top notch and just for her, she gets a star. Otherwise it would have been a one star visit.

"Eagerly anticipating an excruciatingly prolonged experience, I opted for a steaming hot chocolate beverage, specifically one that had been advertised as 'black chocolate 56% blablabla,' but unfortunately, my order was marred by an error in one of the commands. My cassolette, sadly, did not possess sufficient quality to compensate for the entire ordeal."

I went here with some coworkers for happy hour and was not so impressed. The restaurant itself has a nice location overlooking Market Square, but the service and food were not great.

We took advantage of the happy hour special on margaritas and those were decent. Everyone enjoyed their drinks, which were huge and pretty strong.

Appetizers are also half-off during happy hour, so we decided to order a bunch to split for dinner. Among the things I tried were the sopecitos; four thick corn tortillas that were topped (one each) with chicken, steak, carnitas, and chorizo. The meat was okay, but the tortillas did not taste fresh. Also, the dish was only lukewarm when served.

I also tried the empanadas which were okay. I ordered them with beef. There really isn't much I can say, they were just bland and "meh."

There were a few other dishes that were not very memorable. The one thing that we all loved were the flautas. I wish we had just gotten several plates of these instead of everything else!

We also had issues with the service. The food took almost an hour (for appetizers!) and one of the dishes was incorrect once it was finally brought out. I sent it back and did not request a replacement, but the incorrect dish was still on my check. I had them remove it but the whole experience was annoying.

Pretty much meh.  It wasn't terrible, but nothing worth making a special trip for.  I tried the al pastor and lengua tacos.  The pastor was a little dry and lacked the usual sweetness.  The lengua was tender, but didn't have enough seasoning or something... just kind of bland.

Staff was ok except one. Went there during lunch hour and as we are getting ready to prepare our bowl. one of the members of their staff yells at me with an attitude \" you cant be back here\" what she is talking about the area between the 2 self serve veggie/ meat station. One bar was closed but with all the respect it is hard to reach to an item that is way in the back so I went to the other side to make it easier to reach and this girl yells at me from across instead of coming closer to me and warning me it is not allowed to be on the other side. How rude! what is ur location's goal here? go big or go home! I wont be visiting again.

Following my companion's effusive endorsement and ardent enthusiasm regarding this establishment, I was disillusioned to discover that it fails to cater adequately to the dietary restrictions of vegetarians and vegans. The culinary offering I selected, specifically the burger, lacked a palatable flavor profile, characterized by an unpleasant combination of acidity and an overpowering sweetness. My dissatisfaction with the dish was so profound that I abandoned consumption of it, an occurrence that rarely transpires.

Veggie omelette was way over cooked,  hard and dry ... Not good at all ... Very disappointing since I had had better food there a couple of years ago. My companion experienced the same with her omelette. So my advice ... At the very least ... Don't order an omelette ... Especially given the price.

I am what you would consider a mexican food snob. Small, hole in the wall type places are what i live for. 

I had the mini chimis (5) with beans and rice... Cost me $10 which is a little steep for me especially given the quality of food. 

The chimis had cream cheese and beef in them. More cream cheese than beef. They were sweet. Almost tasted like they were made with a flaky pastry dough or something. The rice was nothing special but their refried beans were delicious. I wish i would have had the option to get chicken ones. 

Their salsa bar salsas were nothing special to me, flavorless.  Their avocado + salsa verde one was pretty unique and delicious though. 

The restraunt was super clean and a little over the top friendly. Im from the south and enjoy being greeted with a smile, but 4 different times while i am trying to eat? Overkill. 

They have a fried ice cream milkshake that i would love to try! I might go back to try that, but that's about it. This place definitely isn't Carolina's/los dos melinos status.

"Flying into this location is exceptional. It embodies the essence of Las Vegas. Upon arrival, one experiences an unparalleled sense of excitement, eager to indulge in frivolous pursuits...

However, one's financial resources are rapidly depleted due to excessive gambling, rendering it impossible to cover the cost of an evening meal, gain entry into exclusive nightclubs, and ultimately leading to feelings of disappointment and the desire to return home forthwith.

Upon arriving at the airport, one is met with an extensive queue, stretching back to the walls, which would typically remain unoccupied. Following a prolonged waiting period of approximately one to two hours, one finally clears security protocols, albeit with considerable relief...

Subsequently, one becomes cognizant of the necessity to proceed to the D gates. Unfortunately, the sole means of conveyance, the tram, is nonoperational. Thus, one must undertake a brisk, mile-long trek while burdened with cumbersome luggage exceeding the recommended weight limit for checked baggage (a consequence of excessive purchases during one's stay in Las Vegas). 

Upon reaching the designated gate, one discovers a two-hour delay, further exacerbating the already trying circumstances...

In summary, this airport experience has been particularly unsatisfactory, marred by an interminable security line, the malfunctioning of the tram, and a protracted delay prior to departure."
Enjoyed my veggie burger with fries. Service sucked the last 2 times. We had to flag down a waitress to get our refills. Next time we'll do take out to avoid tipping poor service

Nice place, friendly staff, but I can honestly say I've had better. The therapist was super friendly and worked on every spot I asked, but actually created a knot that has been bugging me now that I didn't have before. The place is really nice and the front desk staff was very pleasant... but it is a little pricey and you can find the same quality massage for cheaper at other places. I was referred here and had really high hopes because the person who referred me has always been pleased. Maybe I am hard to please or expectations are too high, but I doubt I will be back. Nothing special or out of the ordinary here... And that's what I look for... Especially if I am going to spend that kind of money.

Okay, unfortately SW Airllines needs to train their employees better.\nSW Airlines can only issue to a passenger two (2) boarding passes in a travel day. Example: Travel day 12/1; traveing from PHX to GEG with connecting flight in OKL (changing airplanes), got two boarding passes; got to GEG did my business and got an boarding pass at GEG with stop in LAS (no change of planes). It's frustrating because GEG was a full (over booked) flight.

had a $20 slow cooked pork dish (cochinito pibil) that was described as a house speciality.  Nothing special.  Salty, a little dry...lots of spices. Obvious sauce drips on plate rim were partially wiped off...made the plate look unapetizingly dirty at first.  The $7 Modelo tasted great!

I am not a big Yelp contributor,  but I am so disappointed in The Haymaker.  I loved this restaurant when it first opened and I would always take friends and family there when they visited from out of town.  Each time I have visited in the past few months, it has been going down hill.  When I used to visit The Haymaker, my glass would never be empty. Now, I never get a refill.  They used to put a leaf of lettuce on the burgers/sandwiches,  now it's shredded. They used to offer a to go iced Coffee when we left, now they do not. They had the best Toasted Almond flavored iced coffee, now they do not. They didn't have marinara sauce for the mozzarella sticks, no marinara available (Saturday afternoon). They have $2 Bud Light drafts for happy hour which is fantastic. There was a butt end of a tomato on my \"medium\" burger which was medium/rare. I asked for an onion slice on my burger, there was one ring of onion (see picture). I will not be visiting The Haymaker unless I hear things change.

We actually eat here fairly regularly so you think I would rate it higher, but when I really think about it, it could be a lot better. I think we mostly end up here for the chips and salsa, lol!

The positives:

The "endless" chips and salsa are pretty yummy.

The margaritas are usually really good

I like the new pretzel stick appetizer they have

Most of the servers we have had have been friendly and attentive

The negatives:

The FOOD! Really that is the only thing, but this is a restaurant. I have pretty much given up on trying to get a good meal here. I have tried a million and one things and while parts of it are sometimes good, I have never gotten a consistently good meal. The margarita chicken is good, but the sides suck and seem old and stale. Same with the burger, decent but the fries are usually bad. The kids meals are TERRIBLE, to the point I never even pick this as a place to take the kids for dinner anymore. 

Usually if I come here, its the hubby and me for lunch.  When we come we generally get the chips and salsa endless lunch with soup and salad, but lately even the soup and salad kind of sucks. 

With all that said, will I be back there at some point enjoying a margarita, chips and salsa and pretzel sticks? Yep. But if I want an actual dinner or lunch, not just a salty (in a good way), carb fest, I would pick somewhere else.

I have had the privilege of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions, and unfortunately, my experiences have been less than satisfactory. The stylists have been adequate, at best, and their prices, while reasonable, do not align with the quality of service provided. My primary grievance lies with the customer service, which has been subpar. On numerous occasions, I have attempted to contact them outside of operational hours, leaving messages that have gone unreturned. It appears that they are either too busy or uninterested in addressing customer concerns, as they have failed to reciprocate my attempts at communication. As a result, I will not be patronizing this business further and would advise others to exercise caution before doing so themselves.

This is the fourth hawaiian barbecue place I been to is by far the worst. No teriyaki sauce and katsu sauce which are a given of any Hawaiian barbecue place! Was given soy sauce/glowing red over processed sweet and sour sauce with my food instead. Macaroni in the salad was over cooked and mushy with some type of seasoning that looked like pepper. It was also runny using a low quality mayo and missing the sprinkles of carrot shavings that I'm so used to in a good Hawaiian macaroni salad. The barbecue chicken was dry and could not taste any of the marinade it was supposed to be cooked in. The bed of vegetables was old dry cabbage resembling the fake grass you see in an easter basket. This menu was confused if it should have been hawaiian barbecue or ghetto chinese food of south phoenix. The elderly Asian couple was very friendly and service was quick which should be expected being the only customer in there. The place was clean compared to the next closest one in Avondale. Location is among a lot of other fast food places and can easily be overlooked. I might give this place a second chance the next time I am that far west again and am have a craving for something hawaiian.

Hallo, ich gehe ins Milano seid 1990, diese Bar WAR der absolute Kultleider ist dem nicht mehr so. Zu wenig Puplikum, oft launiges, wenig motiviertes Personal, oft zu laute Musik, so das man sich wirklich anstrengen mu\u00df beim unterhalten zu h\u00f6ren und geh\u00f6rt zu werden.Deshalb dann auch die Fenster geschlossen werden, damits von drau\u00dfen keine Beschwerden gibt, die alte kleine Klimaanlage \u00fcberfordert ist und dabei die T\u00fcr vom Raucherzimmer aber offen bleibt, damit das Personal zum bedienen schneller rein und raus kommt. Du stinkst nach verlassen der Bar genauso nach Rauch wie fr\u00fcher. Ein Plus - die Tische drau\u00dfen, das macht Spa\u00df.

This is one of my regular stops for breakfast. Normally a great breakfast joint but not today. The greeter wasn't friendly and the food was average. This place has been around for a long time with a good reputation. The kitchen needs to try harder and they need a friendly, happy greeter. It will be a while before I go back.

"The personnel within the establishment exhibit amicable demeanors, however, subsequent experiences deteriorate precipitously from such an auspicious beginning. Specifically, Room 1122 should be avoided at all costs if a restful slumber is desired, as the confluence of a nearby train, an ice machine, and an antiquated AC/heat wall unit renders sleep an unattainable luxury. Furthermore, the peeling wallpaper in shared spaces and outmoded decor detract from the overall ambiance. Additionally, the culinary offerings served during the midday repast were unacceptably chilly, and a dearth of accessible power outlets hinders the charging of electronic devices."

I'm a thrift store junkie and this particular Goodwill location is just junkie. I've never really been impressed with the finds at this location and it has that stale grandma's dead cat smell when you walk in. That being said, they seem to have an OK selection of older furniture if you're looking for something to fix up or paint. \n\nYou should really go to the one on 20th St. & Indian School if you're in this area. They just built that one about a year and a half ago and it's clean and has great stuff.

We arrived at this eatery with the intention of partaking in a midday repast, and as such, I opted for the 'Sweet Deal' option, which offered three items for the sum of four dollars. My selections consisted of a standard cheeseburger, an order of onion rings, and a beverage. The culinary creations were delivered to our table in a prompt manner, almost to the point of haste, as the kitchen staff appeared to have been remiss in their preparation of my burger, resulting in an excessive amount of mustard and ketchup, which caused the contents to overflow from the bun, creating an unappealing spectacle. However, the onion rings proved to be somewhat satisfying.

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition." 
  The ambiance of the establishment appeared pleasant, and favorable critiques alluded to delectable pizza; however, our order of a large, thin crust pizza, adorned with tomato, mushrooms, pepper, cheese, and pepperoni, fell short of expectations.  The crust, rather than being crisp and delicate, was somewhat doughy and lacking in the characteristic crunch of a traditional Palermo-style pizza crust, which was a notable disappointment, given our familiarity with the authentic variety from having lived in Italy for four years.  Moreover, the mushrooms possessed a distinctly canned flavor, detracting from the overall quality of the dish.  Our encounter with the youthful server was marked by his stoic demeanor and an absence of even a cursory greeting, casting a further pall over the already unimpressive culinary experience.  In contrast, our brief interaction with an affable gentleman, presumably the proprietor, upon exiting the premises, was characterized by his congenial demeanor and warmth, offering a faint glimmer of hope that future visits might yield more satisfactory results.

I heard many good things about this place and so was excited to try it out.

My friends and I ordered the Thai Beef Salad, Asian Chicken Salad, Monsters Meatball and Spaghetti, and Grilled Salmon. We were extremely disappointed. I don't even know what the meatballs tasted like. The spaghetti and salad dressings were BAD. The rice was hard. The salmon was a-ok, but the portion was small compared to other dishes.

On the bright side, I tried their famous frozen hot chocolate, and I loved it! We all loved it! Totally made my experience better. 

I don't know if we didn't order the right food, but I'm definitely not coming back here for their food, ONLY FOR DESSERT!

Waited 10 minutes for menu and water. Didn't help it was 100 degrees outside.  Anytime the server was at our table, he never looked at us once. He was always looking around at passerby's. Took our wine list away before we even looked at it, then asked if we wanted drinks. I politely told him he took our drink menu away so we never had a chance to look at it. It was very obvious he would be very quick to get an attitude in any situation. Plus, it was Mother's day and it wasn't a very pleasant customer experience. But customer service is huge and they easily failed at that. The food was not very good. Caprese salad was just \"ok\" and the calamari was HORRIBLE!!! Bland and overly chewy. No flavor. No one thanked us for dining or wished happy mothers day as we walked out. Not a very pleasant experience. We DEFINITELY won't be returning. Their name shouldn't be Luna Rossa.....it should be Luna Grossa.
I expected so much more. The food here was eatable, there wasn't much variety. The \"sushi\" was rice and veggie rolls. I'm not coming back.

2 stars for decent service. 

The sushi rice however, is always mushy and falling apart. 

I love kabuki in California and they never seem to have this problem. I've given this place multiple visits and chances to see if maybe it was just off days, but they just don't have their sushi together apparently. 

Work on that Alaskan roll sushi chefs! 
Maybe Los Angeles locations can help you have better quality sushi.

The table booths seem dirty. The walls are nasty looking. The little glass separators always have finger prints. The sunshade has sauces all over them. It's dusty in table lights. Not a very clean atmosphere. 

What is going on with this KABUKI in Las Vegas?!

"Expressing my utter discontent with my recent dining experience at Bravo, I must say that this establishment has failed to meet my expectations on two separate occasions. During my initial visit, I opted for a grilled chicken salad, only to discover upon its arrival that the poultry was undercooked and sported an unappetizing pink hue. Compelled to return the dish, I was left feeling frustrated and disillusioned. Upon my second visit, I decided to sample their sangria rosa, which unfortunately proved to be excessively saccharine and bore a striking resemblance to a daiquiri. Furthermore, the chicken caprese I ordered was problematic, as the fowl was unacceptably lean and possessed a rubbery texture that made it nearly impossible to cut. Coupled with the lack of seasoning in the orzo, my meal was a culinary catastrophe. It is with great regret that I must express my profound dissatisfaction with Bravo, and I fear that future visits may not be forthcoming."

This location formerly served as my preferred venue for acquiring items at a discounted rate; however, circumstances have undergone a transformation. It appears that word has spread about the store's reputation, resulting in an influx of eBay vendors who have assumed control of the premises. These individuals display erratic behavior, engaging in unethical practices to gain an advantage over their competitors. Attempting to compete with them proves futile, as they seem to enjoy a preferential relationship with store employees, thereby securing early access to merchandise. During my most recent visit, I witnessed one of these eBay sellers providing food for the staff, which raises questions regarding their moral principles. In light of such occurrences, I now prefer to purchase items at full price from establishments like Nordstrom.

"This eatery can aptly be described as a 'tourist trap,' offering subpar culinary delights, unremarkable service, and an ambiance that fails to impress. While I am willing to pay a premium for superior quality, the offerings here fell short of even my most basic expectations. A 12-ounce beer commanded a price of $10, while the steak and fries set me back a whopping $30. The female staff members were certainly easy on the eyes, but their charm proved to be the only redeeming quality in an otherwise lackluster dining experience."
Went recently, and the sushi did not seem as fresh as I remember. I am not sure I would go back.

"It is emphatically advisable to refrain from ordering the wings, as the supposed 'lollipops' offered for $14 are merely scraps of the wing, devoid of any substantial meat and instead comprising solely of bony fragments and extremely dry parts, effectively rendering the consumption of said 'drums' (middle pieces) an impossibility. Furthermore, the flavor profile of the General So wings is subpar, bearing an excessive saltiness and an unpleasant resemblance to a generic sweet and sour sauce commonly associated with Panda Express. This raises questions regarding the qualifications and competence of those in the culinary profession, specifically pertaining to their ability to create visually appealing dishes that are simultaneously palatable and satisfying. The presentation of essentially cleaned chicken bones on a plate, accompanied by a side of sauce, only serves to further exacerbate the sense of indignation and disappointment experienced by patrons who have been misled into expecting a genuinely fulfilling dining experience. One cannot help but wonder what becomes of the actual meat, whether it is discarded or repurposed in some manner, thereby warranting additional compensation without providing commensurate value."

"Although it possesses some appeal, I surmise that this establishment has plateaued in quality, as my experiences over the past several years have indicated a gradual decline in the culinary excellence of its offerings, despite the continued proficiency of its staff. Furthermore, I have noticed that the facilities are not consistently maintained, particularly during early morning hours. Notwithstanding, I have contributed substantially to this business and anticipated enhancements, but unfortunately, they have not materialized. My apologies to the proprietors."

This is a painful review as I really used to like this place.  Echoing most of the other reviews as well as mine, the service here is still horrible.  The portions  have gotten smaller and the prices higher.  The quality of the food, DOWNHILLL..

The Wor Wonton Soup, compared to what you get in ANY other place, it was the smallest pot I have ever seen not to mention they use imitation crab meat.

This is the second time in a row I have ordered the Spring Rolls and they are cooked on the outside but still cold/frozen on the inside.

Like I said I used to really like this place but after this visit with continued CRAPPY POOR service, NO communication between the staff and overall they just don't seem to really care about customer service or quality of the food any more.  The portions have gotten smaller and the value for the price along with the service, this place is NO LONGER a place I can recommend.

WORST PEDICURE EVER. I was just there this morning for a full set and a pedi. The man that did my full set was patient... he had to pry off an old set as I wanted a new fresh one... and I had just gotten a fill so it took a little bit of work. My only complaint with him is that he cut me pretty good with the drill and if it hurts this much now, boy is it gonna smart tomorrow. But I do love how my nails look. Thin and shaped perfectly. The pedi however is where things really head south. She did an ok job on the scrubbing, cutting and filing but that's where it ends. When it came time for the best part, the massage, it's like she was a zombie. She barely rubbed my feet, she rubbed my shins a little bit and my knees (???) but would NOT rub my feet. Thats the part that hurts after being on them all day!!  She squeezed them, pinched my toes, slapped the bottoms of my feet but still no massage. It was like she had no clue what she was doing. Definitely the strangest experience at a salon ever. The polish job was sloppy, polish on my cuticles that she didn't clean up. WEIRD WEIRD WEIRD.  Won't be going back.

Ended up here since Mill was slammed for the ASU game..ordered the souvlaki, one beef and the other lamb.  The lamb was pretty under seasoned, the beef had a better taste except it was chewy and hard to swallow.  Had to spit out a piece in the napkin so someone got a surprise unfortunately.  Didn't think I got enough for what I paid for either.  The veg was also under seasoned, just bland tasting food.  I looked around and most people were ordering Apps like the hummus, so I may have missed something.  The waitress was very good and friendly, the extra star is for her.  Not sure I can go back with all the choices around there.

Bouchon is one my favorite places to go when I am in Vegas,
My last trip in March was marked with a scar. I left a comment on their website and have not heard back so I decided to post here as well.
If you have been there you would know that the food is good and prices are on the expensive side. So what stunned me when I got my bill is the charge of their house water for $7 a carafe. ($21 for 3). Seriously! You are charging me for tap water at a place where we pay more than regular prices for food. Shame on you for trying to rip off your customers. And btw I didn't ask for any special water, I said tap water when I was asked what do I want to drink. 
The good news is that they adjusted the price but that was embarrassing in front of my business guests.

Slow service. Waited over 2 hours for oil change. Watched others come and go. Clean place, friendly service but mismanaged. I will take my business elsewhere.\n\nSlow service. Waited over 2 hours for oil change. Watched others come and go. Clean place, friendly service but mismanaged. I will take my business elsewhere.

Remember when Pomo used to occupy that touristy faux-Mediterranean space in the most upscale part of Scottsdale?  They served one of the best Napoletana pizzas I have ever had in one of the most pretentious, snooty atmospheres imaginable.  I am thrilled to report that my experience with the downtown Pomo was not at all the same.

Having just walked from Cibo, where we enjoyed a decent pie (I'm still not convinced that Cibo comes anywhere close to its level of hype), we stepped into Pomo, expecting to be lambasted with stucco, fake accents, and photos of Florence.  Imagine our surprise when it turned out to be... trendy?  That's right, it was modern decor, and the waitstaff was of the hipster variety.  Wow, that was unexpected!

My biggest problem with the original store had been taken care of.  This was turning out to be an excellent dining experience.  We then ordered our pie, expecting the same quality we had enjoyed from the old Scottsdale oven.

Nope.

What happened?  The pizza was not adequately soupy.  It lacked the amazing flavor and attention to detail that made it somewhat worthwhile to brave Scottsdale's most self-absorbed patrons.  In short, it was underwhelming. 

After we left here, we proceeded to walk right down the street to La Piazza Locale (also VPN certified), for our third and best pie of the evening.  I suggest you do the same.  They have the same modern vibe with a much better Napoletana pie.

This place was ok. I was with great friends on a birthday outing, so we could've been anywhere to have a fab time (and we did sample a few places that night). We had a good time by virtue of being the fun girlies we are, but I won't go out of my way to return to this particular bar.  I will, however, return to the Cosmo just for the secret pizza place...it's unmarked down a long dark hallway and has awesome pizza AND an old-timey arcade game and pinball machines. Sorry...did I digress? That's how interesting the Chandelier Bar was to me.\n\nIt's a multi-level bar with decent bartending (in fact, the barkeeps did present a touch of class to the place). The chandelier over the liquor bottles  was kinda pretty, but the plastic \"chandelier\" that draped from floor to ceiling...meh. Was pretty tacky looking, actually...reminded me of a giant version of the Mardi Gras beads you get for showing your boobies. Maybe they were going for Diva but got closer to Dive-y. I know it's Vegas, but there are plenty of less tacky places to hang. It felt very dated and old-fashioned. Dated can be good if there's at least a pinch of glam, but the obviously plastic almost-shimmer fell short of that pinch. Call me a snob, but it felt good to leave the verging-on-suffocatingly naff decor.

MENU CAHNGE: So I've always enjoyed the flatbread tapas at happy hour. I dragged a bunch of friends for full price dinner here last night and...

they have replaced their flatbread with what appears to be straight up from the box Matzoh Ball CRACKERS.

I think any toddler is familiar with the difference between crackers and bread.

So $10 for some crackers and tiny scoops of hummus, bruschetta and tapenade is steep. But then I realized my friend had ordered the flatbread pizza and was struggling to eat it because CRACKERS can't support the weight of pizza toppings and sauce.

Another guest politely asked the waiter about the crackers and the server said it was a permanent change.

Here's a permanent change: I will be going to one of the other couple hundred gastro pubs in town with great atmosphere. Or hell, just walk across the street to Firefly for actual tasty food! 

And the fresh brewed beer isn't worth it--a lot of the brews are heavy with a syrupy honey taste. bleh.

1st time there, went to buy a toy helicopter for my child.  Didn't hold charge so we had to take it back for exchange and manager took care of us since I didn't save receipt.  While he was helping us he took on another task or decided to take a call rather then finishing our transaction.  The whole process took about 15 minutes since I had to wait for him to actually help but the actual exchange took 1 min.  He was still on the phone the entire time and customer service wasn't actually priority there.  Bad quality in toy helicopters and not very good customer service. Not a good 1st time experience.

UPDATE:

The owner is very personable.

The bid made to my insurance company was the highest of any bidder, I needed repairs, however, the bid submitted was for total replacement of all siding on my house.

The company did not get my business because the insurance company would not fund total replacement of all the of home's siding.

Unless you procure a "Go Room", you are destined to encounter an unkempt, unhygienic environment. The establishment displays an utter lack of concern towards providing cleanliness and maintenance. We were compelled to relocate thrice due to the deplorable conditions. Upon voicing our grievances, another guest was allowed to check-in prior to our complete evacuation, sans any tangible resolution to our concerns.

The carpet was in a state of extreme soiling, exuding an unpleasant odor and exhibiting prominent stains and dirt throughout. The mere act of stepping into the bathtub after walking on the carpet resulted in visible black footprints. There exists no reasonable justification for such squalor, nor for disregarding it and introducing subsequent guests to these unsanitary environs.

The hotel boasts an aged ambiance, accompanied by an unmistakable musty scent. Efforts are underway to modernize and enhance the facilities; however, substantial progress remains to be made. In light of the abundance of appealing hotels in Las Vegas, it is perplexing why anyone would opt to patronize this particular establishment. This experience marked both my initial and final encounter with the Flamingo. The quality of service I received was appalling.

Notwithstanding, a solitary aspect of the Flamingo merits commendation. Junius Johnson, Jr., a dedicated server within the buffet, has devoted thirty years of service to the organization. His exceptional dedication to customer satisfaction warrants recognition. He exemplifies the epitome of excellent clientele service, and his expertise would greatly benefit the remainder of the staff. My sincere admiration is extended towards this individual.

"May 29th - A utterly abysmal experience ensued, characterized by an unpleasant throng and a dearth of suitable seating arrangements, with the sole exception being the picturesque panorama. It is abundantly clear that the ambiance was subpar, as evidenced by the minuscule dance floor and the absence of any semblance of comfort. Furthermore, the fact that entry was gratis serves as the sole redeeming quality of this woeful excursion."

First let me say I'm a HUGE fan of all things cheesey and a growing fan of food trucks. For weeks I had been tracking Chedda on instagram waiting for him to be in the neighborhood. Zia Records, on records day, we were there. I was stoked! 

Husband and I both got dirt bags (burger & cheese) & tots. Both lacked flavor. Both weren't cheesey. Both were disappointing. I almost cried. So much built up anticipation for... nada! And it set me back $19.

Burgers were huge, bun was thick and burnt. Tots tasted like bland mashed potatoes and the sauce was super odd. Wouldn't recommend.

Came here again after my last review and we had to get gas for our rental van and so I pulled up to a pump and I went inside and said the the same lady I seen last time if I could get $120 on pump 2 regular and she said its ready and if u need change or/and receipt come back inside and so I went back outside and put the nozzle into my tank and lifted the nozzle holder on the pump and I talked to my family while getting gas in the car and after the pump clicked off at $100.10 i went back Inside for my change and the lady gave my my change and receipt and I ask her if there car wash was ever going to reopen an the lady said yes it's going to reopen in a month and we are going to have new gas pumps and another gas island and I said ok and thank you. 


This place is now improving. My last review was on this place and I said to stay away. But I will give this place 2 more times.

I suppose when it's Gordon Ramsay's restaurant you expect more or better than average.
Like everyone else I have watched his shows and he seems to be a passionate chef.
There was a 45 minute wait to get a table- that's fair it was a Friday night so we went and killed some time until our text message informed us the table was ready. The staff uniforms are RIDICULOUS, so blatantly inappropriate, ill fitting and unflattering. Please change them- what a joke they are. The umbrella girls at motorpsorts events are wearing more clothes than the poor girls working at BURGR.
The burgers took another 45 minutes to come out and they were okay but not great. My husband got the truffle fries with the truffle aioli, which frankly all just tasted like garlic and not much else. I cook for my family most nights so the burgers were not earth shatteringly good or something I couldn't whip up in 15 minutes. i just expected more.
Well I did get more when the bill came $150 for 2 adults and 2 kids for a burger meal. 
We won't go back to BURGR, but there certainly is a slew of Gordon Ramsay restaurants to choose from in Las Vegas. He seems to be a hard worker and he's making hay while the sun shines.

Tequila Bar, I came here after reading reviews on yelp. I was looking for a cheap bar with decent drinks. When I saw they had a 128oz Blue Fishbowl for $20 I YELPed! But was disappointed to hear they had no 
"fishbowls" and would service it in two large cups. The two cups turned out to be 64oz Plastic pitchers, which was pretty fun. What wasn't fun was that 1. It has no "fishies" in it (like the picture) and 2. It was 90% Soda. Boo! But hey, for the novelty- the price wasn't bad!

The Nacho's at the next table did look pretty delectable, but I just came from a big dinner so I just ordered the "southwestern corn on the cob". I was curious. What made it southwestern? I should have known when I ordered it and the waiter said, corn- you want the corn? ok. And Corn is exactly what I got. Just boiled corn with a square of butter... for $3 - FAIL

"Four stars for the two appetizers (calamari and spicy shrimp), both of which were thoroughly enjoyed. The salad was also of superior quality. However, a solitary star must be assigned to the main entrees, as both mine and my spouse's were subpar. Specifically, my tilapia with asparagus suffered from an unfortunate combination of overcooked asparagus and a distinct lack of moisture in the fish. My spouse's pasta dish, unfortunately, did not meet expectations either. Although the children's meals were adequate, the overall atmosphere of the establishment was marred by various areas of disarray in both the waiting area and the dining area adjacent to the fireplace. Furthermore, the service was inconsistent, with our server displaying a regrettable lack of attention to detail while the waitress at the adjacent table demonstrated a commendable level of dedication to her patrons, necessitating our request for refreshments of bread, salad, and beverages from her as our own server was conspicuously absent. In conclusion, it is recommended that potential patrons seek alternative dining options in the Concord Mills area."

I've been to this office several times in the last year and  strongly agree with Joan C.'s review.  The hygienist  pushes extra dental work and cleanings.  I got the deep-cleaning 2 months ago and my gums feel worse than before.  I \"saw\" the dentist once--she peeked in, looked at my x-rays and told me I needed fillings.  She barely smiled or made eye contact.  I've been at the front desk when she's walked by and she didn't even acknowledge me.  I am now looking for a new dentist.

Dos Gringos is definitely bringing trashy back.  And I think the whole trailer park theme has really gotten the best of them.  Two cases in point.

A) Drinks are EXTREMELY weak.  They give you tall glasses, but have very thin pours of liquor.  Thinking maybe it was the vodka, we switched to rum, but alas, the trailer park was just being cheap. 

B) The vomit stench wafting from the mens restroom really takes the trailer park theme a little too far, right?  After I reported to staff that puke was all over a men's urinal, it was still there an hour later.

Doesn't that make you yearn for the good old college days??

Granted it was a Sunday afternoon and all, and the DJ and crowd was fun.  A definite fun place to day drink, and bring the pooch.  Call me an old-fashioned prude, but the puke-fest and sucky drinks kind of killed the mood.  And believe it or not, I didn't have the appetite to try any of their award-winning tacos.

"While our experience at this establishment was by no means extraordinary, we did encounter certain aspects that left much to be desired. Specifically, our server, though adequate in their duties, failed to exhibit the warmth and attention to detail that one might expect from a truly exceptional dining experience. It appeared that their primary focus was on catering to the male patrons who were engrossed in the sporting events being broadcast, which unfortunately resulted in a lack of consideration towards our table. Furthermore, the gratuities seemed to be allocated in a manner that was disproportionate to the level of service provided. As for the culinary offerings, we were underwhelmed by the quality of the crispy tacos, which were merely passable. In light of the numerous superior dining options available in the surrounding area, it is unlikely that we will return to this restaurant in the future."

One of the most unfortunate coffee establishments I have had the misfortune of visiting is this particular Crazy Mocha location. Convenience played a significant role in my decision to patronize this establishment, as it was situated in close proximity to the Cultural Trust, where I had a class. Unfortunately, my experiences at this coffee shop were marred by a series of unpleasant encounters. Firstly, the chai tea was excessively sweet and lacked the depth of flavor that one would expect from a well-crafted chai. It was almost as if they had merely added milk to black tea and neglected to incorporate any discernible spices. This was a profound disappointment, as I had been eagerly anticipating a flavorful and invigorating beverage. Furthermore, the coffee was consistently brewed to a weakness that bordered on insipidity. I suspect that the coffee had been left to sit for an extended period before I received it, as it lacked the rich, bold flavor that I have come to expect from a freshly brewed cup of coffee. In fact, the second time I ordered coffee from this establishment, it was so unpalatable that I was compelled to discard it after only a few sips. The service at this coffee shop was adequate, but it fell short of being exceptional. While the staff was not unfriendly, their pace was somewhat leisurely, and they failed to demonstrate the kind of attentive, personalized service that one might hope to encounter at a reputable coffee shop. However, I must admit that the Wi-Fi connection was quite reliable, which proved to be a welcome consolation in light of the subpar quality of the beverages.

Was a huge fan of subway but they got rid of my favorite sandwitch chicken pizziola. I was able to still get it but they said that they couldnt anymore. I had to find a new fav but would like it more if they would bring it back. Most the subways in las vegas favor their own people or if you speak the language. Other than that could be better.

I will eat here when a friend insists, but I think almost every time I've eaten here, I have gotten diarrhea.  And the food isn't worth the diarrhea.  Its kind of bland.  And its overpriced.  Just my opinion though.  I know lots of people are ga-ga over this place.

They must have erroneously placed the refrigerated poultry intended for the grilled chicken salad within my sandwich, while the fries were merely lukewarm, bordering on unpleasantly tepid, in one of the two meals; however, the service was amicable and I do appreciate the novel choices that align with the contemporary inclination towards gourmet fast food, such as brioche buns and pretzel buns, as well as the availability of a purported "fresh lemonade" and various salad options.

"Indulged in an array of deep-fried delights, including tofu, pork, peanut butter dumplings, and eggplant, however, the fried items exhibited a notable lack of moisture and tenderness, leading one to question the establishment's culinary prowess, particularly when compared to other superior Chinese restaurants in the city, rendering it a less than desirable dining destination, save for those who find themselves in a state of utter gastronomic deprivation within close proximity."

Pretty lame, even for Casa Grande. Went on a Thursday night when they are supposed to be open until midnight. They apparently decided they wanted to close early because hardly anyone was there, so the waitress told us it was last call at 9:30 even though we had not even been there very long and were clearly planning to stay for the evening. Awesome.\n\nThe beer selection is very basic. Maybe two of the taps rise above the level of barely tolerable, for anyone who's into flavorful beer. But, I guess that's a function of their clientele more than anything else. I'm not a beer snob by any means, but give me something more than light domestics.

"MONTE CARLO, a prestigious name brand, conjuring images of luxury and refinement. However, our experience was anything but satisfactory. Despite requesting a non-smoking room, we were erroneously assigned a smoking room, which furthermore, had an evident fissure on the carpet adjacent to the window. The state of the room was also subpar, with evident signs of neglect and disrepair. The ambiance of the hotel was uninviting, exacerbated by its advanced age and apparent lack of maintenance. I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this establishment, as it failed to meet even the most basic expectations. The customer service we encountered was also inadequate, prompting me to question the quality control measures implemented by MGM Mirage. If you seek a less than satisfactory lodging experience, and a taste of what can be described as 'BARFED OUT EUROPE', then perhaps the Monte Carlo might suffice. However, I must emphasize that this hotel falls short of even the most lenient standards, and its sub-par quality is reflective of a deeper issue within the organization."

This was the first groomer we tried out in the Phoenix area. They had good reviews on yelp and good prices so we gave them a try. I was not impressed and left really missing our groomer back in CA. I asked for my dog's tail to get special attention. She was given back to me with matts still in her tail and her face hadn't been cleaned thoroughly. Pretty disappointed will not be returning.

I really hate cold buffet food. Nd today all items were cold. Maybe we arrived too soon after opening but we had to leave and I asked for a refund. I was given a gift card for a return visit which was nice.

The thermally-administered peanut butter and jelly cake, characterized by its conspicuously fluid peanut butter and arid, dense texture, was presented at an elevated temperature. Consequently, the inherent viscosity of the peanut butter rendered it somewhat challenging to consume, while the cake's desiccated nature made it rather difficult to chew. Furthermore, the flavor of the jelly, which was situated at the core of the culinary creation, was only accessible upon penetrating the center of the cake. It is worth mentioning that the warm grape jelly, owing to its unremarkable taste, did not contribute significantly to the overall gastronomical experience. Lastly, the latte, with its unexceptional flavor profile, proved to be unremarkable in the grand scheme of things.

I have a propensity to enjoy this establishment, however, my most recent visit proved to be somewhat disillusioning. I sampled their eggs Benedict, but unfortunately, the Hollandaise sauce they had concocted did not meet my expectations. In hindsight, I would have been better off adhering to my customary blueberry pancakes. My companion, on the other hand, seemed to enjoy his meal, specifically the wolf pack he had ordered. The quality of service was satisfactory, as we were seated promptly on that busy Memorial Day Monday morning. Regrettably, both my companion and I experienced unpleasant stomach upsets later in the day, which served as a deterrent to my future patronage, considering the sole meal we had consumed was from this venue.

The novel proprietors are precipitating the degradation of this establishment, and upon my recent return to Montreal for a brief respite, I have observed that the personnel are excessively burdened with workload, thus impeding their ability to provide adequate service; consequently, I have decided not to revisit this venue, as it is preferable to preserve its former glory within my recollections, rather than exposing myself to the diminished quality of the culinary offerings.

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."
 That's how I would summarize my visit to Portillo's. Despite the high expectations built up by the extensive promotion, the actuality fell short in multiple aspects. Firstly, the robust exterior of the hot dogs did not align with my personal preference, and the flavors failed to impress me as well. It is my conviction that Portillo's reputation plays a more significant role in its popularity than the culinary quality itself.

"I have had the privilege of partaking in the culinary offerings of this esteemed establishment on two separate occasions, with the initial visit being particularly enjoyable due to the exceptional quality of the service and the delectable Macaroni and Cheese dish. Unfortunately, my second experience was marred by a series of unfortunate events, beginning with a telephone conversation at 5:54 PM, during which I inquired about the availability of happy hour specials and was misinformed by an employee that they were indeed available until 7:00 PM. Upon arriving at the establishment merely ten minutes later, I was dismayed to discover that this information was incorrect, and that happy hour had already concluded. This sequence of events has led me to deduce that the quality of service and communication within this establishment is inconsistent, thus warranting a rating of two stars."

This is NOT the best brunch in Charlotte. It's a small chain located in a shopping plaza full of families with their 2 strollers and screaming children. The food was decent but I'm sad I made a drive this way for brunch.

I was definitely not impressed with this restaurant. There wasn't enough variety and my street noodle dish was subpar at best. It lacked any wow factor. The only dish I would recommend is the steamed pork bun. Literally the only thing I will go in there for. Otherwise, I would not suggest going here. It is overhyped.

I went to Caramel because I heard that it was great. It was a nice, simple, very small lounge. I was surprised at how small it was. I had the Oreo martini, which cost $20. I could care less about drink prices, and don't mind paying a lot for drinks in Vegas, but $20 was a bit much for a so-so martini with Oreo crumbs at the bottom. Or possibly Hydrox - who knows?\n\nLove the Bellagio, not wild about Caramel. Take the ten steps to the Sports Bar, put $20 in the video poker machine and get a free martini instead. The bartenders were much friendlier at the sports bar, too.

"I visited this establishment on a Saturday evening, anticipating an enjoyable experience, particularly since Kaskade was slated to perform. However, upon arriving, I encountered an extensive queue for those who possessed tickets, which proved to be quite frustrating. After waiting for approximately an hour and thirty minutes, I finally reached the entrance, only to discover that the club had already reached its maximum capacity. Consequently, the dance floor was closed, and there were no available tables. This led me to ponder the reasoning behind allowing additional patrons to enter when there was no sufficient space or accommodations for them. Security personnel continued to urge individuals to proceed forward, yet there was no obvious destination. The club's diminutive size was another contributing factor to the overcrowding issue. Moreover, the entryway was situated beneath a narrow staircase, which added to the overall unpleasantness of the experience. Despite these drawbacks, Kaskade's performance was impressive, albeit brief."

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of satisfactory quality, however, my overall assessment of this restaurant would be significantly higher if it were not for the consistent negative interactions I have had with the staff during my two visits. Specifically, the service has been subpar, with prolonged waiting periods for food delivery and an absence of attention to detail in terms of ensuring a satisfying dining experience.
