(+) The guest chamber itself is spacious, featuring a majestic high ceiling, a plush king-size bed, and a compact kitchenette, thereby providing ample space for relaxation and convenience.

(+) The hospitality of the staff is worthy of mention, as they exhibit a warm and welcoming demeanor, readily accommodating requests for additional amenities, such as the complimentary provision of a cot, graciously bestowed without any supplementary charges.

(+) The lodging offers complimentary internet access, conveniently furnishing guests with a unique code upon check-in, enabling them to seamlessly stay connected during their sojourn.

(+) A delicious continental breakfast buffet is included in the tariff, featuring an assortment of fresh pastries, crusty croissants, healthy cereals, succulent fruits, and aromatic coffee, all served in a cheerful ambiance.

(-) Unfortunately, a minor drawback was encountered, as the reservation, which specifically requested two separate beds, was inadvertently allocated a single bedroom, prompting a visit to the front desk to address the inconvenience. Although the accommodation was ultimately unable to offer an alternative room exchange, the staff graciously offered a cot at no additional cost.

(-) A slight criticism pertains to the towels, which bore an unpleasant odor, detracting from the overall comfort experience.

(-) While the daily parking fee of $22 is reasonable, the fact that it is exclusively valet-based and requires the assistance of the concierge for item retrieval may prove inconvenient for some visitors who value ease of access to their vehicles.

I know this is a rare 3 star review for this place and I will preface it by saying it is the only Las Vegas buffet I have ever been to, so I have nothing to compare it to, but enjoyed the experience.

I went here for dinner while wandering along the strip one night and I thought it was your typical buffet with a wide variety of options that weren't gourmet but still good.  I think the key is to choose the right options.  The crab legs were awesome and totally worth the $20 since I probably ate $30 of legs alone.  Other favorites included prime rib, mashed potatoes, and spicy tuna rolls.  Salad bar was just OK and so were the desserts.

This is a really good deal if you are hungry! The atmosphere is pretty tacky but it is within the Imperial Palace so that's to be expected.

"I have had the privilege of lodging at this esteemed establishment on two separate occasions, and my experiences have been vastly dissimilar. It appears that only a portion of the hotel has undergone renovation, which has resulted in a conspicuous disparity between the quality of the accommodations. During my initial stay, my significant other and I were assigned a spacious room equipped with a king-size bed, which was tastefully updated and featured an impressive bathroom. However, upon my return with a group of female companions, we were allocated rooms containing two double beds, which were noticeably outdated, worn, and lacking in aesthetic appeal. Notwithstanding these inconsistencies, the hotel's prime location and competitive pricing make it a viable option for those who do not intend to spend considerable time within their lodgings. Unfortunately, access to the fitness center comes at an additional cost, and the pool area tends to be overcrowded, making it challenging to secure a lounge chair. While the gaming facilities are satisfactory, the beverage service could benefit from improvement, as it can be somewhat sluggish."
Maybe my expectations were too high - but food was very disappointing.  It was ok - nothing spectacular or noteworthy.  Therefore it was definitely overpriced.  Wait staff was great though.

Just ordered a pizza and wings for delivery. I picked up my pizza before and I got a weird vibe from the staff. They are very unpleasant, thought if I phoned it in I would get a happy tone on the other end.... WRONG! They need to hire delightful people to work the register and take the phone calls. This will be my last time ordering from them until my free pizza coupon is valid lol! Oh and the pizza's not all that bad! Definitely better than Pizza Hut!

Hakkasan is located inside the MGM grand. I was on the GL so we went to the GL line and it was free before 1am, so we had to hurry our asses there! We made it & it was free, thank god! Anywayyys, bouncers were nice and they made our transition inside the club pretty smoothly. Once we got in, I immediately noticed how SMALL it was. The dancefloor was sooooo tiny! :( When I finally made my way over, I could barely move/dance. It was literally body to body ... and this was on a day where there's NO ONE famous dj-ing! So imagine how bad the crowd would get if Tiesto or Hardwell was up there .... I wouldn't wanna be there! \n\nBut that's all I can really say because I got super messed up and I can't remember anything else. Only that I couldn't dance at all because there was no room and the parts where it's kinda open, the security made you move :(

I have had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on two separate occasions, and on both instances, I opted to forgo scheduling an appointment in advance, instead choosing to arrive unannounced, and much to my delight, I was warmly received upon entry, with nary a moment's delay in being attended to by the courteous front desk staff. Notably, the individual responsible for performing the eyebrow threading procedure demonstrated exceptional proficiency in their craft, yielding a most satisfactory outcome. However, it is worth mentioning that said individual could benefit from honing their customer service skills, as they failed to inquire about my preferences regarding the shape and style of my brows, nor did they engage me in conversation during the process. Despite this minor shortcoming, I remain inclined to return to this establishment, as the end result of their efforts did indeed render my eyebrows in a most flattering state.

For a buffet, I thought this place was pretty good. Food was authentic, the food and spices were prepared the way I remember real Indian food tasting. They had a good selection, even though I had no idea what half of it was. I think next time I may go to an Indian restaurant instead of buffet simply because all the flavors started to meld together and I like just one dish to enjoy, like chicken marsala or curry.

"Relatively pricey in comparison to the nearby Gandhi's restaurant, the culinary offerings were satisfactory yet unremarkable, while the atmosphere was somewhat more refined than the typical Indian eatery."

"It is not deceptive to admit that I relished a thoroughly enjoyable experience during my recent visit to this esteemed eatery. The interior design exudes an air of contemporary sophistication, complete with elevated platforms that double as performance areas for scantily-clad dancers to showcase their talents while patrons partake in their culinary indulgences. However, my overall satisfaction was slightly compromised due to a few minor drawbacks. Specifically, the hostesses displayed an excessively stringent demeanor, feigning ignorance of my prior reservation despite the fact that my hotel concierge had already arranged it over the phone. Furthermore, they seemed to be under the impression that they were conferring a favor upon me by accommodating my request, albeit after an extended period of time. In contrast, our server exhibited exceptional proficiency and attentiveness throughout the evening. The cuisine itself was adequate, with the Black Cod appetizer being particularly noteworthy, while the crab cake counterpart fell short of my expectations. The fried shrimp dish was also commendable, and the steak offerings adhered to the established standards associated with the Morton's brand. In conclusion, although my dining experience was generally satisfying, the abundance of exceptional eateries in Las Vegas renders it unlikely that I will return to this specific location in the future."

"This culinary establishment offers an enjoyable ambiance for consumers to indulge in gastronomical delights, however, it does not quite align with my personal preferences. 

The hospitality demonstrated by the staff was indeed commendable and played a significant role in elevating the overall experience to a passable level. 

Regrettably, the fare served was merely mediocre, with each dish excessively seasoned to the point where I could only consume half of it, despite feeling famished. It is not advisable to order the special hash and potatoes together, as they share a strikingly similar flavor profile, which would necessitate an abundance of hydration to successfully complete consumption. However, the quality of other menu items appears to be satisfactory, and this may explain its popularity among patrons. Perhaps restricting options to waffles and pancakes would be a wiser choice, as they seemed visually appealing. 

It is challenging to endorse this eatery wholeheartedly, unless one's taste buds incline towards heavily seasoned cuisine. Nevertheless, the atmosphere is conducive to a pleasant dining experience."

"Having initially been perceived as a mere imitation of Panera, Atlanta Bread has subsequently expanded its menu to include a diverse array of innovative offerings. Upon sampling the Italian vegetable panini on a recent evening, I found the flavors to be palatable, yet the cost was somewhat prohibitive considering the modest serving size. Notwithstanding the complimentary pickle and kettle chips accompanying the dish, I remained slightly unsatisfied. While the ambiance and complimentary wireless internet access are certainly appealing aspects, the quality of service leaves something to be desired. Nevertheless, this establishment remains a viable choice for those seeking a satisfying sandwich experience, although the pasta selections tend to be rather unremarkable."

In a culinary ocean saturated with gourmet eateries, occasionally one yearns for a mundane repast. For an unassuming cafÃ©, the edifice was not devoid of merit. We merely sought a quotidian sustenance for a tardy luncheon. Numerous establishments were still in the process of inaugurating their daily operations, while others proffered a restricted noontime menu. It was a Sunday replete with gridiron matches, thus numerous drinking establishments teemed with enthusiasts. 
The ambiance evoked memories of Cheesecake Factory, boasting an extensive bill of fare. The staff exhibited amicability. I opted for deep-fried poultry accompanied by mashed potatoes. Although not particularly greasy, the poultry possessed a discernible saltiness, situating it somewhere between mediocrity and excellence. The potatoes lacked a certain je ne sais quoi, but the savory chicken effectively counterbalanced the deficiency. I requested a Pear Martini, only to discover that the components were unavailable. Thus, I indulged in a scrumptious Strawberry Martini instead. My spouse opted for a cheeseburger and fries. While the latter satisfied my taste buds, I did not sample the former. Nevertheless, my better half consumed it with relish and claimed it surpassed his expectations. 
Given the abundance of superior dining establishments within walking distance, the likelihood of my return remains uncertain. However, in a pinch, I might consider partaking of their offerings once more.

This buffet can be considered satisfactory for local patrons, in my opinion. However, if I had to pay for it myself, I might have been more critical since it's merely a mid-range buffet charging over $50 for two individuals. We visited on seafood Friday, and the offerings were unremarkable, with most dishes being standard fare found at many mid-range Las Vegas buffets. Our server was friendly and attentive, though, and the hot crab legs were quite enjoyable.  

However, some aspects were disappointing. The sushi was cold and lackluster, while the cold shrimp was mushy and lacking texture. Although the salmon appeared moist, its taste was underwhelming. The hush puppies were overly salty and crunchy, and the fried catfish had an unpleasant softness due to sitting out too long, despite having a flavor reminiscent of "chicken fried" catfish. The carrot cake and chocolate fudge pieces were also subpar, with the latter feeling almost weightless.  

In summary, the crab was the highlight, and the presentation of the shellfish dishes was visually appealing and flavorful. Everything else we tried was mediocre, neither terrible nor inedible. Children would likely enjoy this establishment, as would those with sufficient funds seeking a leisurely dining experience.

HUGEEEE pasta portion. Appetizers were definitely not needed with the heft of my spaghetti. When I can't find something thrilling on the menu at an Italian restaurant, I'll often opt for the spaghetti with meatballs. It's a classic dish that, if they can't get right, bodes unwell for anything else. Fortunately, the noodles were cooked al dente and the meatballs moist. Unfortunately, we started with a selection of cured meat and flatbread pizza so I was stuffed by the time my entree arrived :(\n\nCame back later after a night of drinking, though, to have some extremely satisfying post-drinking pizza. But so did everyone else.

I reviewed this in 2009 to let people know that I got food poisoning here. I ate here again and am rating it more highly cause I ate the veg food and it was fine, but mostly because I highly approve of the quantity and quality of their rice.  Working class Asian Americans like myself love their rice and this place is super generous and the quality is very very good. Better than the entree itself in fact.

They now have vegetarian fajitas, $10, not a bad price but you don't get much tofu at all and the ones at Jack Astor's are better in every way.\n\nOver all they're not bad, but I don't think I'd order them again.

"As an aficionado of superior burgers, I must confess that it is arduous to surpass my expectations when it comes to savoring these delectable delights. Despite my penchant for culinary indulgence, I find myself frequently disappointed by the inability of establishments to prepare my burger to the precise temperature I request. This lackluster performance elicits my ire, and I yearn for a dining experience that mirrors the quality of the Outback chain, where the culinary staff unfailingly executes the cooking process with meticulous attention to detail, ensuring that each burger patty is cooked to perfection. Moreover, I implore these eateries to invest in a sufficient quantity of salt to enhance the flavor profile of their beef offerings. Lastly, I would like to highlight the importance of offering reasonable prices for beverages during happy hour, as this gesture would undoubtedly contribute to an establishment's popularity among patrons seeking a satisfying dining experience."

Awesome food and great service! Don't miss out on the 'sides'.. I got the hummus and lentils, which were both amazing. I ran out of pita bread but they were nice enough to give me more upon request. I would also highly recommend dessert.. I got some kind if strawberry bar (forgot what it was called) but it was delish.

I also ordered the good earth sandwich which had really fresh ingredients, but the flavor profile of the sauce was kind of weird for me, I think I would order it without it if I was ever to go back again (I'm not from Nevada). I also ordered the guacamole sandwich, which I liked better.. But the I would have to say the red sauce on it was too sweet for me. I split these with a friend and we both felt the same about these entrees. 

There was one other vegan sandwich option, tree of life, and I ordered all three for my boyfriend and his 2 other friends to split, and they liked the tree of life the best... So hopefully that helps!

I've been a member of Lifetime for a few months and their facilities are hands down the best. You can read the other reviews for how awesome tha facility is but I'm going to speak to some of the interesting events that take place in the men's locker room and I am not joking at all......

Apparently the men's locker room gets rather friendly after hours and when I say after hours I state that loosely as in 10-11pm.   On two occasions.....I repeat.....two occasions I had the same 55 year old man pull up to a sink next to me and blow dry his junk.  I'm not exagerrating and my friend was at the sink to his left.   He was sandwiched between us butt naked stretching his stick and blow drying his junk dry.   I ran out of the gym in fear.   A few weeks later the SAME MAN did it again except this time I was by myself.   

Another time, 2 young men in their 30's were slapping each other in behinds with towels NAKED and chasing each other around the gym.  They almost knocked me over.....Thankfully I am not homophobic but come on, there's a time and place for everything......and apparently Lifetime is where it's at.   CAUTION - BEWARE

"My expectations may have been excessively elevated, thus, allowing me to initiate an assessment of the eatery's attributes by highlighting its positive aspects. The establishment boasts a capacious parking area, modern decor, and an expansive interior design. Notably, the restaurant's personnel demonstrated proficiency in efficiently managing the front-of-house operations, despite being understaffed. Our culinary excursion encompassed orders of chicken red curry, papaya salad, BBQ chicken, pad thai, and a supplementary side dish of sweet rice. Unfortunately, the sweet rice manifested a disappointing texture, characterized by sogginess and overcooking, which was further exacerbated by its unremarkable presentation within a plastic sandwich bag. The BBQ chicken failed to meet my expectations, as it was served with a generic sweet chili sauce, rather than a genuine barbecue flavor. Moreover, the chicken itself was merely a piece of marinated chicken breast, seasoned with a dried curry rub, resulting in a pan-fried taste that did not align with my preconceptions of barbecued cuisine. The papaya salad exhibited a strong sodium presence, which overpowered the lime flavor, while the inclusion of minuscule peanut fragments seemed incongruous and culturally adapted. In contrast, the chicken red curry dish featured an appreciable assortment of bamboo shoots and customary curried vegetables; nonetheless, the curry sauce lacked a zesty quality, rendering it insipid and unimpressive. Notwithstanding, my children expressed immense fondness for the pad thai, which temporarily alleviated my gastronomical disenchantment. Given my relentless pursuit of authentic Thai cuisine in Arizona, my likelihood of revisiting this establishment remains uncertain."

"Consequently, I have decided to confer three stars upon this establishment, primarily due to the Manager's diligent efforts in addressing our bill. However, I must emphasize that this rating is not without certain reservations, as my boyfriend and I have encountered issues with the service during two separate visits. Specifically, on our first occasion, we were neglected twice regarding our request for water, and subsequently, the bill failed to materialize in a timely manner. Furthermore, during our most recent visit, an unfortunate mishap occurred where our food was mistakenly delivered to another table, resulting in a 15-minute delay before it was eventually served, albeit at a frigid temperature. Although I appreciated the Manager's gesture of offering us the meal complimentarily, I cannot help but feel that such errors are indicative of subpar service. Therefore, I must deduce that the ambiance, characterized by comfortable seating, appealing tables, and an engaging screen, does not suffice in compensating for the shortcomings in the dining experience. In light of these circumstances, I suggest that patrons consider alternative options for enjoying a film, perhaps by bringing their own provisions and relying on the cinema's atmospheric elements to enhance their viewing pleasure."

"Ah, yes, this establishment exudes an undeniable charm, boasting a capacious dance floor that serves as the focal point of the venue's sprawling layout. The sheer magnitude of the space is accentuated by the tasteful embellishments and ornate fixtures that adorn the interior, creating an ambiance that is at once vibrant and sophisticated. The staff, particularly the bartenders, exhibit a warmth and hospitality that is both welcoming and refreshing. However, it must be noted that the male patrons who frequent this establishment tend to lack a certain je ne sais quoi, their demeanor and attitude being somewhat uninspired and unremarkable. Nonetheless, this locale remains an excellent choice for those seeking a stylish and dynamic environment in which to indulge in the finer aspects of nightlife, with the added bonus of being able to don one's finest attire and partake in the joys of dancing."

"It's an exuberant celebration within the establishment's interior, boasting an aesthetically pleasing ambiance and an captivating display of pyroclastic activity, ostensibly emulating a volcanic eruption; furthermore, the culinary offerings surpass those of its predecessor, 'The Burger Joint,' which previously occupied the same location, although the fare may be somewhat pedestrian, it remains a worthwhile investment for those seeking a satisfying dining experience."

"Roberto's, a culinary establishment boasting multiple locations throughout Las Vegas, was once the epicenter of my gastronomical infatuation. However, as time has elapsed, my ardor for their offerings has waned, correlatively mirroring a perceived decline in the overall quality of their cuisine. Despite this, Roberto's continues to surpass numerous other dining options within the city limits, though my personal standards have been elevated by exposure to exceptional street food vendors and authentic Mexican eateries. Thus, while still enjoyable, Roberto's has relegated itself to the realm of 'average' in my esteem, eliciting an occasional craving that I satiate intermittently."

I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary offerings of this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say that the quality of the service has been exceptional, with the staff exhibiting a proficiency in their duties that is truly commendable. Furthermore, the ambiance of the restaurant itself is quite pleasant, boasting a relaxed and informal atmosphere that is conducive to an enjoyable dining experience.

However, I must admit that my experiences with the pizza offered by this establishment have been somewhat mixed. While I have sampled a few different varieties of pizza here, I have not been entirely enamored with the sauces employed, nor have I been particularly fond of the texture or flavor of the crust. Nevertheless, I have been impressed by the quality of the non-pizza items available on the menu, such as the delectable sides, salads, and soups that have graced my palate with their presence.

In light of these observations, I must confess that I am intrigued by the prospect of exploring the remaining options on the menu, and I would not hesitate to return to this establishment in order to do so. However, it is unlikely that I will be ordering the pizza again in the near future, as my previous experiences with it have not been entirely satisfactory.

Nice place, nice atmosphere, and I've always had good service here but - for me - the bread is mediocre. I'm guessing they are intending to go for a very moist, 'heavy' bread, which I'm sure some people love. I've just discovered Wildflower Bread Company and their bread is 'perfect' for me - drier, lighter, but still with moisture and 'stretch' or 'bite'.

"During my recent visit to Las Vegas, I had the opportunity to partake in the lunch buffet offered by this establishment, and I must say that the culinary offerings were quite satisfactory.  It was, in fact, a fortuitous discovery, made on the final day of our stay in the city, following a series of disappointing experiences at the Studio Cafe.  The fixed daily tariff appeared to be an exceptional value, particularly when considering the exorbitant prices typically associated with dining in Las Vegas.  However, the ambient temperature of the seating area was rather chilly for some inexplicable reason, but our server was quite attentive and accommodating, noticing our discomfort and kindly suggesting hot beverages, which she subsequently ensured were consistently replenished."

Situated in the heart of the shops at Palazzo, this unassuming wine bar offers decent selections at the bar and good to great selections in the shop located adjacent to the bar. 

Bottle prices are a bit high, but that's what Vegas is all about. 

I was disappointed with the glassware, which ranging from either the O-Line series to small bowled glasses with short stems, reminiscent of bad hotel banquets. For a wine bar, I simply expected more in terms of glassware.

Other than that, the staff was friendly and kept my glass filled!!!

"An excellent location for recreational activities, offering ample opportunities for physical exertion and enjoyment, yet, unfortunately, hampered by inadequate maintenance and lax officiating. Specifically, the lack of a functioning speed ball arena significantly diminishes the overall experience, while the apparent reluctance of referees to oversee games properly has become increasingly problematic. However, management's willingness to provide complimentary repair services for damaged equipment and thorough cleaning procedures offers some consolation. To elevate this venue to a five-star status, a concerted effort towards revitalizing the playing fields and instituting more rigorous standards for referees would be necessary."

We had been wanting to go to the Block & Grinder since it opened and we heard some great things.  Overall the food was 4-5 stars, but the atmosphere and service was 2 stars.

In terms of service, we sat down in a cramped space next to a large table, and did not have a waiter assigned to us.  After 12 minutes, we finally had a waiter (who was very nice) notice that no one was assigned to us.  From there, he took over, but he also had other large tables, so the service was slow.

On to the positive aspects....for an appetizer, we got the jar of pimento cheese and crackers, which was delicious, and probably the best pimento cheese we have had in our short time being exposed to pimento cheese.  We decided to order the ribs for an entree, which was a great choice.  They were lean and tender, and rank up there as one of the best ribs we have ever had.

I think we would come back here, but would attempt to go on a weeknight (or off-peak time), which would hopefully improve the service.  I would also love to try the cocktails.

I live pretty close to Papago, so it's a place I regularly hike. But it's not because I love this park, it's really because of the convenience of living so close, and the fact that the trials are not challenging at all. Papago is one of the few places that I feel 100% safe about hiking on my own. Unless you take a wrong step while climbing one of the buttes, it's pretty hard to hurt yourself. \n\nThe park is clean and well kept, and you do get some good views of Phoenix, Tempe and Scottsdale on your hike. Once in a while I've even spotted some cool birds flying around. Because it's such an easy hike, Papago is a great spot for beginner/novice hikers, and a pretty good spot to take your kids or the dog. If you're looking to get outside and get some air, Papago is the place to hit up for an hour or two on a quiet afternoon or morning.

All the locals recommended this place to me for burgers and I've tried them twice to just make sure the first time wasn't a goof. But both times, the food was so blah. It should take more then just a massive piece of meat to get good ratings. I've tried both a burger and a steak, and they were both so bland. There's no flavor what's so ever. I was highly disappointed.

Bed Bath & Beyond -- thoroughly overpriced and suffering from subpar parking facilities at this specific location, much to my dismay. I only frequent BB&B when I am in possession of one of those highly sought-after 20% discount coupons. On a recent visit, I was in pursuit of an exceptional linen spray, specifically the Egyptian Cotton-scented variety. Unfortunately, they were out of stock on both occasions I visited the store. My quest for a suitable "everyday" cookware set was also thwarted, as they only offered premium Calphalon products, which were beyond my budget. However, I did manage to procure a new shower curtain liner and a pair of candles, albeit at a different retail establishment.

"My anticipation for dining at this establishment was immense, but unfortunately, my expectations were not entirely fulfilled. Prior to attending a performance by Cirque du Soleil, we opted to partake in a culinary experience here. Our initial selections included the frisee salad and lobster bisque, both of which proved to be scrumptious. Notably, the frisee boasted substantial portions of bacon, which, when combined with the runny yolk, elevated the flavor profile of the dish significantly. Additionally, we indulged in a half-bottle of red wine whose quality merited its cost. However, my enthusiasm for Craftsteak ended there. I opted for the flat iron steak and sampled the surf and turf option, which featured a ribeye and lobster tail. In all honesty, I have savored superior cuts of meat in my native Texas. Disappointment also characterized my experience with the bread rolls, as their reputation preceded them, but ultimately, they failed to impress me. To put it into perspective, if you have had the pleasure of consuming a yeast roll from Hartz Chicken, then you have essentially tasted the offering from Craftsteak. My desire to elaborate further on this dining establishment is limited."

This hotel establishment represents the sole lodging facility I have had the pleasure of inhabiting within the downtown district; it is indeed challenging to fathom that an individual hailing from Hawaii has yet to experience the accommodations offered by the California Hotel, but I possess a discerning nature when it comes to selecting lodgings, and the California, along with its contemporaries situated in the downtown locality, has consistently induced an unpleasant sensation akin to pruritus during my traversals within their premises, thus leading me to utter the phrase, "Happy Faye, happy stay!"

The rooms, while unremarkable in their appearance and amenities, have served their purpose adequately during my brief sojourns in their standard guest quarters.

Fortunately, my encounters within this hospitality venue have been largely positive, and I have never felt threatened or vulnerable (within the confines of the hotel room and gaming area). The staff members have consistently displayed courteous and helpful demeanors, which serves as a testament to the quality of their customer service. Furthermore, their 24-hour coffee shop offers palatable victuals at reasonable price points, including certain menu items that cater specifically to patrons with a penchant for "Hawaii-friendly" cuisine.

Realistically, I give this place 3.5 stars. The decor is nice and the menu is appealing. They list everything that comes on and with ur orders.... But I felt that it was a tad bit too show-ee for me... Maybe that's what u get in Vegas? Came in based on a recommendation for the oxtail chili fries. That did not disappoint. It was good. A lot of meat, and flavorful. I would say it's a must try if it's your first time. I also had their summer special, the Manga burger. That was OK. A bit too much sauce...couldn't really get too much of the burger flavor. I washed it down with the matcha green tea milk shake. Yum! Maybe I'm spoiled with the burger joints in LA. But Bachi Burger is opening a location on Sawtelle soon. I guess then we can see how they do head to head with the other burger joints out here. That will be fun!

Want to stay on the strip but you're a cheapskate? Sahara is the place for you.

Old + Falling Apart + Terrible Shows =  great character.

Only problem is it's a little too far away from the heart of the strip.

When I was employed at the Renaissance tower, I would frequent this establishment when I was feeling particularly indolent and opted to procure sustenance from a nearby source rather than expending the effort to traverse the street in search of a superior dining experience. This decision was motivated by the fact that, in my opinion, their pizza failed to meet even the most basic standards of culinary excellence, falling short of both greatness and goodness. However, on two separate occasions, I did partake of their breakfast muffin, which far surpassed my expectations by boasting an optimal amount of grease that effectively conveyed its quality without overwhelming the palate. Additionally, the price point was remarkably reasonable, making it an eminently affordable option for those seeking a satisfying repast without breaking the bank.

"Although my culinary predilections do not necessarily incline me towards the rich and diverse cuisine of India, if I were to indulge in such gastronomical delights, this establishment would be my preferred venue. Moreover, their menu boasts an array of dishes that cater to the palates of those who do not partake in the consumption of meat, thereby rendering it an ideal destination for vegetarians and vegans alike. Additionally, the fare served here tends to be characterized by its bold and genuine flavors, which are often synonymous with the piquant and aromatic qualities that are inherent in Indian cuisine."

I procured a haircut and was thoroughly enamored with the result, yet I harbored some reservations regarding the salon's ambiance, as it seemed to exude an excessively contemporary aesthetic that did not necessarily align with my personal preferences. Nonetheless, I would venture to say that this establishment appears to be a suitable choice for individuals who are partial to cutting-edge hairstyles and hues.

"Although I have not had the opportunity to sample a considerable number of dishes or partake in the midday buffet offered by this establishment, my culinary experiences thus far have led me to formulate the opinion that it constitutes a passable alternative for those seeking Indian cuisine. Furthermore, as an individual who adheres to a vegetarian dietary regimen, I find solace in the knowledge that there exists no possibility of animal flesh being incorporated into my meals, thereby rendering it a relatively risk-free dining destination for me."

The sushi here is not bad, but not great. Service is also up to par. Sushi rock pails in comparison, however, to nearby restaurants, that have much better quality sushi, and hover around the same price. Though I may come here again for Korean food, I will not be returning for sushi.

We take immense pleasure in frequenting this establishment with the intention of acquiring attire and travel accessories. The prices offered here are indeed competitive, and we have had the privilege of discovering remarkable bargains within these premises. Moreover, the assortment of luggage available is quite extensive, encompassing an array of styles and designs that cater to diverse preferences. It is not uncommon for us to encounter fellow shoppers in this location, particularly during peak days such as weekends. To optimize our shopping experience and avoid the throngs of people, we tend to visit during weekdays, specifically during the afternoon when the crowd has thinned out somewhat. The staff members here have consistently displayed a welcoming demeanor towards us, and we must commend their dedication to maintaining a tidy and organized environment throughout the store. Notwithstanding, we have deducted a few points from our overall satisfaction rating due to the occasional presence of lengthy queues at the checkout counters, which can be somewhat vexing. Nevertheless, we remain steadfast in our enthusiasm for patronizing this retail outlet, and we hold high hopes for our future shopping excursions to this destination. Return Factor - 60%.

These state employees don't necessarily like their job, but they did a great job of helping me out. 

I just moved to the state and required a change of residency. I have no car here yet so a drivers license wasn't a necessity, but it would have been nice to have already. Unfortunately, proof of insurance specifically for this state is necessary to do that. State ID it was then. The lady at the front (I didn't grab her name) was very  kind and accommodating for my noob questioning of changing state ID's. The line, although around the room, moved very quickly.It's a lot faster than what I'm used to from Chicago/Illinois DMV lines.

Overall, if you have all your required paper work with you,  it is a fair experience got being a thing of necessity. Props to the kind lady in the beige cardigan up front!

we stayed here for 4 days in august last year and it was an OK stay.  probably the last time i will stay here unless there's some supersale on the hotel.
the hotel is a bit older but since our friends were getting married at Mandalay Bay, and since we couldnt afford staying there, we chose the closed hotel so the 23 of us didnt have to go too far to be there in time for the wedding.
there were construction going on all wknd.  so annoying as we were ok w/ it on Thursday but it seems be pounding w/ those machine all wknd.

the pool area was small and was not "pretty" as the other hotels.
club LAX is there and we all got in for free as we were staying there - one of the best part of the stay as there were lots of us and went in without lines etc. 
like the ability to go to Excalibur and Mandalay bay on the tram without walking too much but the wait is about 15minutes in the hot sun :(
our room was not that big...good enough for 2ppl.  if more, it will be tight.
their food court needs more variety.

overall, you really dont get that much but then again, you dont pay that much for the room.

After experiencing an incongruous sequence of events involving being accommodated at three dissimilar tables, we opted to transition to the bar area, only to discover that the establishment was facing a dearth of their flagship beverage, lager. The revelation elicited incredulity, as it seemed implausible for a brewery to encounter such a shortage, especially considering the rudimentary nature of its production process. Notwithstanding this setback, the culinary offerings proved to be passable, albeit unremarkable, while the quality of service rendered by the staff fell short of expectations, owing to a lack of attentiveness and an apathetic demeanor. Furthermore, the demographic composition of the clientele consisted predominantly of elderly Caucasians, which seemed to permeate the atmosphere with an air of familiarity and stagnation, characteristic of the quintessential Glendale setting.

Very up-to-date hotel. Pleasant atmosphere. Make sure if you want 3G/4G access in your room that you stay on the west side. Pool has horrible hours IMHO. If you want wifi access, be prepared to spend a fortune.  Drinks at the pool are outrageously priced!  $17 for one drink (includes mandatory tip)

"Culinary indulgences are undoubtedly a source of pleasure, but it's essential to acknowledge that the provision of such gastronomic delights can sometimes be accompanied by an excessive duration of time, particularly in relation to the attainment of beverages and sustenance. Therefore, it's advisable to refrain from scheduling any subsequent activities for the remainder of the evening when partaking in the consumption of food and drinks at this establishment, as the prolonged waiting period may potentially encroach upon your plans."

"I had the privilege of attending my inaugural Panthers' game recently, and, despite my indifference towards the team, I must admit that I had an enjoyable experience. It appears that I am an anomaly in this regard, as the venue was filled to capacity with ardent supporters of the Panthers. This is quite remarkable, given the relatively brief tenure of the team in the league. 

The stadium's surroundings were teeming with enthusiastic fans engaging in pre-game festivities on the day of the event, creating a palpable atmosphere of excitement. However, during the remainder of the week, the stadium exudes an aura of solitude, standing vacant and unassuming just outside the city center. This paradoxical contrast is not unique to this particular stadium, as it is a common trait among many sports venues. 

In terms of the facilities, I was impressed by the modern amenities and services available. While the culinary offerings were unremarkable, consisting primarily of standard fare such as hot dogs, pretzels, and beverages, the prices were surprisingly reasonable. This affordability is a welcome aberration in the world of sports events, where exorbitant costs are often the norm. 

Moreover, I was pleased to observe that the fan base comported themselves in an orderly and convivial manner. The atmosphere was welcoming and appropriate for families, and ticket availability was plentiful. Thus, I would recommend taking advantage of the opportunity to experience a game at this venue."

I've only eaten there twice, but the food both times was very very average... not reflected in the prices. At this price point, the food should be out of this world. 

The happy hour specials are decent and the atmosphere is outstanding, but I don't really see a reason to go here unless you want to impress someone with how much money you have. It's not like going to Ocean Club where the food is fucking rad.

I won't be going here unless someone gives me a gift certificate. I put that it's Spendy, but if you get a drink it can easily get you over 60 bucks and into the splurge area. Not worth it.

"Underwhelmed by the uninspiring ambiance and unimpressive decor, we were disinclined to indulge in a dining experience at this establishment. The cacophonous music further exacerbated our dissatisfaction, rendering an in-house meal utterly unpalatable. Thus, we opted for take-out, which, regrettably, entailed an interminable wait exceeding 10 minutes on multiple occasions, even in the absence of a queue. Despite the prolonged delay, the culinary offerings were relatively satisfying, albeit resembling grilled wraps more closely than authentic burritos, as astutely observed by a fellow reviewer. It is worth noting, however, that the restaurant's payment options were woefully limited, with only cash transactions facilitated, a decidedly antiquated practice in this era of ubiquitous digital payments. Furthermore, the parking arrangement, characterized by angled spaces requiring a precarious traversal of the sidewalk, struck us as hazardous and ill-conceived. To avoid endangering pedestrians while exiting, we advise exercising extreme caution."

Murphy's greatest attribute is its location. The downtown Chandler area has so much potential and this is a good start. Murphy's is located in a nice plaza near the heart of the city. It's an Irish pub because we don't have enough of these in the Valley, right? 

It's in a narrow suite but the bar runs almost the full length of the place. It's not very large so it gets crowded fast. The weird thing is that it dies down after 11pm. I don't know why, the people just leave. Perhaps they know something I don't. But when there are people it a mix of late 20's to young 40's crowd.

They have a lot of beers on tap, so you're sure to find something you like. The staff is friendly and they try their hardest to get to everyone. On certain nights they have live music playin in the corner. Not a lot of room, so it's usually a one or two piece band. 

I'm not worried, but I hope that this place sticks around. This area needs them.

"Beverages were exceptional, yet the demeanor of the mixologist was discourteous! Following a few libations at VBGBs, my associates and I ventured to Willies, whereupon entering, we proceeded to the bar to place an order for additional potations. Being unfamiliar with the establishment, my companion inquired as to which beverage might resemble chocolate in taste, to which the bartender retorted with a hint of sarcasm that 'chocolate tasted like chocolate.' Furthermore, when we endeavored to request the Call-a-Cab, he queried whether we enjoyed Robatussen. Although I do value being apprised of the flavor profile of a cocktail, the bartender's disposition was somewhat vexing. In contrast, during a previous visit to the Myrtle Beach location, the bartender exhibited a more hospitable demeanor, offering samples and periodically checking in on us due to our proximity to the bar. \n\nAs others have cautioned, it is ill-advised to order Call-a-Cab independently, as its potency can prove challenging. Nonetheless, every other concoction I have had the pleasure of sampling (including Shock Treatment, Chocolate Thunder, and Sour Apple) was truly delectable."

"The Saturday night smorgasbord boasts a price tag of 26.95 per individual as of this writing, which, in my opinion, would be a reasonable rate at 20, but the current cost of 27 is slightly elevated. While some delectable offerings graced the table, such as the savory steak and succulent salmon, as well as the rich yet not overwhelming peanut butter chocolate cream pie, a notable disappointment emerged in the form of the purported French onion soup. Unfortunately, this dish was fabricated with what can only be described as subpar ingredients, closely resembling the questionable ones served by McDonald's on their sandwiches, and barely palatable even for a budget-friendly buffet priced at a mere 7 dollars. In fact, a cup of Lipton instant soup would have been a superior alternative. It is worth mentioning that fresh onions are not particularly expensive, and while a truly exceptional French Onion soup does require some time and effort to prepare, it is hardly an arduous task, even for a novice culinary student. In summary, I concur with previous assessments; the quality of the buffet varies greatly, ranging from impressive to unacceptable."

Pros:
Good music on radio.They played Todd Rundgren during dinner

Lots of server attention

Decent selection of draft beer

Pulled pork was good

Corn side was good

Portions were large

Cons,

Hush puppies were unbeatable.Awful

Beef brisket was waaaay too salty

Mac and cheese was a fried puck with cheese sauce 

Tiny serving of vinegar sauce

Expensive$24 for two meat platter with one beer.NYC prices

here's the deal: if you come here expecting berthillon, you will be disappointed.  if you come here expecting very fine american style gelato, you'll probably leave very very happy.  \n\ni came somewhere in the middle---i recognize that i can't get a certain quality of gelato this side of the atlantic, but i was expecting a little bit more.  the choc was milk choc.  gelato ought to be made with dark choc.  i'm not sure i'd trust the fruity gelato, knowing it won't compare to france/italy.  but, i bet the nutella is great---i'll try that next time!

"Dim-sum enthusiasts seeking an early morning culinary excursion in Las Vegas may find solace in the fact that this particular establishment boasts an uncharacteristically early opening time of 10:00 am, a full hour prior to the customary commencement of operations at neighboring eateries. While the quality of the diminutive steamed dumplings, known colloquially as har gow, may fall short of expectations due to their unremarkable proportions, the flavors therein remain palatable. It is worth noting, however, that the prices charged for these delectable morsels are somewhat elevated in comparison to those offered at alternative venues, presumably as a consequence of the restaurant's location within the Rio Casino complex, which, despite its once-luxurious appointments, now exudes an air of faded splendor."

"Commissioned their culinary services for an occasion, and the gastronomic offerings were indeed of superior quality, boasting two varieties of quiche that garnered effusive praise from all attendees. However, a fruit platter was inadvertently omitted, fortunately, I had prudently arranged for a surplus of sustenance, rendering it a relatively insignificant misstep, although admittedly, not the most favorable first impression. Additionally, the delivery was precipitously expedited, arriving some 15-20 minutes ahead of schedule, while punctuality is generally appreciated, the premature arrival of hot fare presents logistical difficulties...nonetheless, the victuals were fastidiously prepared. It is likely that their services will be solicited again, albeit with rigorous quality control and emphasis on precise timing."

So, the good:  Plaintain and black bean mash, lump crab nachos, skinny margarita, chipolte ribs

The bad:  Service is hit or miss, enchiladas are meh, greens are very plain.

Note: The grilled corn used to be fabulous when served on the cob.  Too many people complete complained about it being messy so they now strip it from the cob.  It has lost something.  Let's worry less about being "clean" and more about good food!

Last evening's experience was somewhat disillusioning, as it failed to meet the expectations established by previous visits to this establishment. Despite the ambiance of the patio, which was enhanced by the presence of heaters and a live DJ, the culinary offerings and service fell short of satisfactory. Specifically, the food, while adequate, lacked the flavor and quality anticipated, with the mozzarella and tomato panini being particularly unimpressive. Furthermore, the service was subpar, with a waitress who exhibited bizarre behavior, including sarcastic and underhanded comments, spilling water on the table, and taking an inordinate amount of time to deliver the bill and process payment. It is conceivable that the waitress was experiencing a personal difficulty, but her conduct was nonetheless unprofessional and detracted from the overall dining experience. Notwithstanding this, Bomberos remains a popular venue, and future patrons would be advised to avoid the panini and exercise caution when interacting with the waitstaff.

One of the things I love about this place is the outdoor seating in the cooler months.  I also love the Bellini, Toasted Ravioli, and Rosemary-Chicken Pizza.

There IS room for improvement, however.  The takeout "system" they are using has caused me to go somewhere else more than once.  I don't think that having certain pickup "windows" for loyal customers is a sufficient way to reward them, especially at that price point.

Oregano's, you have a LOT of good competition (especially in Central Phoenix) so you may want to rethink the way you are treating customers.  I'm going to try you out again soon so we'll see how things go from there.

I ordered the seafood trio over risotto. I wish I would have ordered something else because my plate was 1/3 of the size of everyone else's but was more expensive than anyone else's. The salmon and shrimp tasted good but the rest was just ok. For appetizers we got the calamari and spinach artichoke dip. Those were really good. And for dessert a peanut butter mousse thing that was awesome. Overall it was just an ok experience. Don't hate it. Don't love it. If someone wanted to go I wouldn't object but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there.

Pizza is like sex.  Even if it's bad, it's still good.  That pretty much sums up how I feel about this place.  The pizza itself wasn't too bad.  I liked the garlic stuff they put on the crust.  I was disappointed that they screwed up my order and instead of pepperoni and garlic, I got pepperoni and olives.  They didn't even apologize or offer to give us a discount or anything.  We also tried their chicken fingers which were alright. Nothing special.  You could tell they were the cheaper ones.  For the price though, I'd go back again (2 med 2 topping pizzas, 5 fingers for $15).

"Consistent with the opinions articulated by previous patrons, this lodging option offers an affordable tariff, and it is essential to acknowledge that the quality of accommodations corresponds to the economic pricing. The advantageous aspect of this establishment is its prime location, situated directly in the center of the renowned Las Vegas Strip. Notwithstanding, even the premier penthouse failed to elicit my amazement, as I have had the pleasure of experiencing superior accommodations in the past. A unique attribute of this venue is the presence of dealer-impersonators, which provided an initial source of amusement until I noticed that the same performers were presented multiple times throughout the evening. Despite this observation, the experience remained enjoyable."

"On this particular occasion, it was my maiden visit to this establishment. I opted to place my order via the internet to facilitate a convenient and expeditious retrieval of my culinary selections. The digital ordering process was remarkably efficient and user-friendly, allowing me to complete my transaction with minimal effort and expediency. Upon arriving at the venue, I was pleased to discover that my order was being prepared at that very moment, ensuring that my meal was delivered promptly and maintained an optimal temperature. It was reassuring to note that my food was not left to linger and become stale or unpalatable.

I elected to sample their Brisket Burger, a delectable combination of a cheeseburger augmented with BBQ sauce, Brisket, and bacon. The portion of sauce accompanying my meal was appropriately proportioned, thereby preventing the bun from becoming overly saturated and compromising its structural integrity. The flavor profile of the Brisket was satisfying, although I would have preferred a more tender texture. My burger was cooked to a well-done finish, which was slightly disappointing as I generally prefer a slight pinkish hue to indicate a less thorough cooking process. In retrospect, I should have included this specification in the comment section while placing my order online.

In addition to the burger, I also requested a bowl of chicken tortilla soup as a supplementary item. This proved to be an excellent decision, as the soup was truly delicious and brimming with rich, bold flavors. The spicy kick was subtle yet discernible, and the generous helping of shredded chicken and corn elevated the dish to a superior level of culinary excellence. In fact, I found myself enjoying the soup more than the burger.

In conclusion, while the meal was not without its minor shortcomings, the overall experience was positive, and I would consider returning to sample additional menu items."

I am somewhat of a self-proclaimed movie "snob" since I was a projectionist in college and helped run the campus cinema (one theater, but we showed everything).  I'm pretty particular how and where I watch my movies.  Don't get me wrong, I will watch a movie anywhere, but how the movie is delivered definitely contributes to the overall movie-going experience.

I know this place is fairly new ("new" to me since I don't find myself on this side of town too often), but I felt like the theater had aged too quickly - almost like it was smoking 10 packs of cigs a day.  Something about it didn't feel right... the bathrooms (had nice finishes, but not too terribly clean).  Maybe I just caught them on an "off" day, but an untidy theater is really off-putting to me.

The movie was over all was fine... the seats left something to be desired.  Stadium seating, but narrow rows so if you have some neighbors with small bladders like I did, your feet got a steping on.  I think I may just be spoiled with the trendy theaters around town that serve alcohol and food to you while you watch, but would I go out of my way to watch a movie here?  Probably not...

PROS:
1. Burgers are big and juicy (although a bit overpriced.)
2. Onion rings crispy and big
3. Black Milk Tea boba ...delish!!
4. Kimchi burger is the BOMB!
5. Staff were nice

CONS:
1.  My Kiki burger tasted exactly like the Ronin burger and that means they were just ok.  Had a weird sweetness to it but both got better 1/2 way thru.

2.  Ordered Oxtail Chili fries which were forgotten and then brought out long after we had finished our burgers.  And these we just - meh.

3.  Bar counter and tables were wiped down with mildew-smelling rag.

4.  Only 2 individual bathrooms, so line is long.  

5.  Beer was overpriced.  

I'd go back to try a different burger  or maybe just stick with the kimchi burger!!

I've been to Mimis a few times and I have to say that they are fairly inconsistent.  Sometimes they are good, sometimes they are bad.  It seems as though breakfast is usually pretty good, but dinner seems to be lacking most of the time.

I went this past weekend for dinner.  I got the three course steak meal for $9.99.  I know, I should have known better, but I couldn't resist.  The salad was ok.  Then came the steak with mashed potatoes.  The steak was terrible.  It definitely had fake chargrilled marks on it.  Then came the "sundae" to finish off the meal, which turned out to be a scoop of vanilla ice cream with chocolate syrup on it.  

Again, I guess you get what you pay for.

"I visited this establishment for a midday repast, and my initial impression was that it offered an extensive array of culinary options, rivalling those of other prominent hotels in the city. However, upon subsequent visits, my enthusiasm waned somewhat, as the quality of the fare failed to meet my expectations. Despite its spacious interior, the ambiance of the venue struck me as somewhat utilitarian, and the prices, while lower than those of premier establishments such as the Wynn or Bellagio, seemed incongruous with the compromised gastronomic experience. Nonetheless, for those seeking a broad variety of dishes at a relatively affordable cost, this buffet might still prove to be a suitable choice."

Picked up filled croissants for myself and the boys this morning.  
They were a little overbaked today but still tasty.
I still miss the original place that was I'm the strip mall a couple suites down.
Price has increased twice, at least, for individual croissants since it changed ownership.  Quality of croissants has not improved and if anything it seems to have gone from alright to mediocre.  Sometimes lacking filling, sometimes looking especially small -c'mon, for the price you don't want something that's a tad bigger than a grocery store cinnamon fry.
I rather they would get rid of all the new flavors they've added and simply offer a better quality product that was brought over from the original store/owner/baker(s).

Because the price of one croissant has gone up again I have opted to pick up treats to deliver to friends or a business (the staff at my vets office) from an excellent bakery that's across town.
More options and more for my money too.

"How should I rate and review this establishment without appearing judgmental? Haha, I couldn't care less!!! Away from the children yet again... Rented a car, drove to Las Vegas, arrived in 3 1/2 hours at an average speed of 80 miles per hour. Arrived at 12:35 a.m. 

Met with two other couples, coerced them away from the Baccarat tables at Caesars Palace, and joined us for a drink at OG. 

The optimal approach is to contact O.G. and reserve a table; they will dispatch a limousine to transport you from your accommodations. In this manner, you avoid paying the cover charge. Purchase a Grey Goose bottle or another type of liquor bottle, and you'll receive a complimentary "Smirnoff" bottle. The total cost, including tax and gratuity, was $415.00. Other forms of entertainment would be funded individually. Hehehehe... We enjoyed a lovely booth adorned with sheer curtains. 

Oh my goodness, oh my goodness, oh my goodness, ah my goodness... Upstairs, the women explored independently to examine the male patrons. It was relatively deserted. Only a handful of women accompanied these incredibly attractive men. Their physiques were muscular, their abdomens prominent, their biceps bulgingâyikes! I felt somewhat uneasy since they began approaching us like fresh meat. We quickly retreated downstairs. 

When my spouse inquired, "Back so soon?" I laughed out loud. 

Well, we all treated ourselves to lap dances, some of which were enjoyable, others unpleasant, some genuine, and others fabricated. Utilize your creative abilities. 

I strongly suggest visiting in pairs of couples, as it will undoubtedly provide the most enjoyable experience, given its social nature."

"Although the sizable portions of pizza at this establishment may appear generous, the overall dining experience does not particularly warrant repeated visits, despite the palatable flavors; the prices charged do not seem to align with the culinary quality offered, thereby making it an inconsequential venue for frequent pizza consumption."

"It so transpired that I found myself within the confines of a shopping mall, specifically the renowned Galleria Mall in Las Vegas, during my leisurely sojourn in that city. Feeling somewhat exhausted and financially depleted due to my relentless pursuit of retail therapy, I opted to take a respite and partake in a casual repast at a nearby eatery. My thoughts were interrupted by an insistent craving for a delectable hamburger, which prompted me to seek out a suitable establishment capable of satiating my gastronomical yearnings. As fate would have it, a Red Robin restaurant happened to be situated within close proximity, thereby rendering it an ideal choice for my culinary endeavors. Admittedly, my initial reaction was tinged with incredulity, as there existed a plethora of exceptional dining options within the city limits, yet I chose to frequent a chain restaurant that was seemingly ubiquitous. However, my desire for a straightforward, uncomplicated dining experience ultimately prevailed, leading me to select this particular venue. Upon entering the premises, I was escorted to a cozy table positioned near a window, affording me an unobstructed view of the bustling mall. Following a cursory examination of the menu, I settled upon a basic, unadorned burger, dubbed the 'Keep it Simple' option. The server, cognizant of the brief delay, offered an apology and proceeded to take my order. The ensuing wait, though perceived as somewhat prolonged, did not unduly perturb me, as I was not particularly pressed for time. Ultimately, my patience was rewarded, as the arrival of my culinary creation elicited feelings of satisfaction and contentment, owing to both its generous proportions and satisfying taste. For those who harbor a penchant for superior burgers, a visit to the Red Robin located within the Galleria Mall is certainly worth considering. Furthermore, I must admit that I am eager to explore the breadth of their menu offerings and sample alternative burgers during a future visit. In conclusion, I would assign this establishment a rating of three out of five stars, thereby acknowledging its merits while simultaneously underscoring room for improvement."
Crepes station is top notch. Seafood was okay.  Kind of worn down in the last 5 years. A deep cleaning would be great for this whole seating area. Probibly backstage too.

I have to rate this location 1 star on the whole parking situtation as well as the ease of getting in & out of the parking lot.   As Bill noted, whoever designed the layout and flow here was a total moron. 

The location gets 5 stars - it is convienent to my work and home. 

I would give the service here about 3.5 stars, because the employees are normally pretty helpful here.  And if you go at 10 minutes 'til closing time when there is a big line, sometimes the employees are down-right entertaining! 

There is almost always a line when I go here - so if you are planning a visit, just plan on having a wait if you need full service.

We have repeatedly traversed this location en route to Sushi Creek, culminating in a multitude of opportunities for exploration. Ultimately, it was not until this morning that we were able to allocate sufficient time to halt and partake in an examination of the premises. Upon initial observation, it became apparent that the establishment maintained a high level of hygiene and tidiness. Following our seating, we opted to sample their gastronomical offerings, specifically a Denver omelet and a breakfast bowl of indeterminate composition. Our culinary experience was generally satisfying, with the wait staff exhibiting proficiency in their duties and ensuring that our beverages remained replenished and our comestibles met our approval.

I haven't been to old navy in awhile so I was okay with this store. First time it was pretty messy from all the Christmas shoppers but the second time was a little cleaner. They did have good sales for all ages.

Normally I'd give this joint 5 stars bcuz almost EVERYTHING IS *AWSM*
However- just went w/my moms & ewww what a disappointment :(
She had the fried chicken & me a basic burger - burger was ehh ok at best but the chicken was bad news bears!!! The corn bread muffin was delivered warm but turned to a rock shortly after, leading me to believe they nuked it ... The batter on the chicken was nasty & the chicken itself was ALLLL FAT! Even the mixed veggies were gross!
At $14 bucks this dish is NO BUENO!
If you find yourself @ BBD - try the Cali Benedict or the sweet cream waffle & finish w/a personal pie of your liking or the diners specialty - a  big bear bear claw ;) enjoy!

We choose this hotel based on the yelp reviews. The room was clean and welcoming. Comfy beds and and I liked the little balcony. However the free wi fi never worked. We didn't take advantage of the free snacks as this was to inconvenient to go down to the lobby every time we wanted something. It was loud at night with thin walls but it was understandable as there was a wedding going on.  The breakfast in the morning was nice quaint and busy. I didn't see much of the staff, so can't make a comment there. I don't know that I would stay again but it was a nice little get away.

Agree with everyone about looks, place is beautiful!  Gym is sorta small and hot, but has a ton of cardio (treadmills and Xfit).  If you are coming, be SURE to ask what is still closed.  We came looking for poolside fun, and the pool is closed for at least another MONTH! I could see happy sunbathers at Bellagio from my room splashing around...Vdara you are a cruel Mistress!!  Service friendly, but rather inefficient...tried to get burned out bulb in bathroom fixed, no luck.  Coffee in room is Kcup, two free and more in mini bar, bring your own milk, only creamer.  Also found out that on-site restaurant (Silk Road) will no longer be open for dinner.  Call before you book for amenities...I think they are having some issues.

By the time we reached here, we have so much liquid in us.  We stopped and rejuvenated ourselves with whatever soda and water we can find while walking on the strip, well u want to make sure u are amply hydrated with that 105 degree heat.\n\nBut I still wanted to taste at least 3 float samplers, but the line was too long and unruly, ppl were darting in and out like crazy, so that was enough for me.  C'mon, kids, move along...perambulating, to the M & M World.

I arrived at this establishment in the company of several associates, with the intention of partaking in beverages prior to a group meal. However, I was taken aback by the fact that seating at the bar was not feasible sans the intervention of the hostess. Despite this initial setback, we opted to sample certain potations and fried potatoes, which, while palatable, were somewhat exorbitant in price, thereby precluding any fervent desire to return in the near future.

"Although the current state of the market may be satisfactory, it is essential to acknowledge that an augmentation of fresh produce would contribute positively to the overall quality of the merchandise available. Furthermore, the presence of friendly and accommodating vendors does not negate the necessity for a greater diversity of market-oriented establishments."

"It is an establishment belonging to the fast-food chain known as Burger King, and it is characterized by its lack of distinctive features or remarkable aspects worth mentioning, yet this particular location is well-maintained and provides a satisfactory level of service; furthermore, it remains open for business around the clock, which is convenient for customers who may require sustenance during unconventional hours, and it offers my preferred beverage of choice, specifically VAULT soda, which is dispensed from a tap."

So the name is like naming a place The Pizza or The Burger or The Taco. 

That said, The Sushi wins big points for the taste, but not for the portions or the price.

Inside is nice and cozy, with a basketball-arena style four-screen TV in the middle.

If price and portions were no object, this would be a five-star sushi bar as the care and taste of the sushi and sashimi can't be beat. 

The problem is the pricing is above many other sushi bars in the area. And the portions - especially when it comes to the teriyaki dishes - are more set for hamsters than people. 

The staff was cordial and offered hot tea or water to this guest waiting for a to-go order. 

All in all, a slight recommendation if price is no object and you're not THAT hungry.

I love this wee place. Edinburgh has done well to preserve the old school pubs in the city centre so that they can be enjoyed by new generations. The Rose St Brewery is very quaint, the upstairs lounge is my favourite part of the pub. Carpeted floors and old pictures of the city line the walls. A plaque boasts it as being the Pub of The Year in 1985.\n\nI popped in for lunch here and ordered a goats cheese salad - very unlike me as I'm a huge carnivore, however it sounded light and refreshing on the menu, and light and refreshing it was. It came with two huge chunks of goats cheese on a bed of mix salad leaves and seasonal veg with a light dressing. With a nice Guinness this it hit the spot perfectly. Staff could have been a bit more attentive, though I doubt they get much training. Nevertheless it is a boozer, so expect nothing more! Kudos Rose St Brewery, and don't ever change!
Seems to want to be O. But it did have good effects, music and talented artists. However, the actual story is lacking coherency and things aren't as stemless as a Cirque show.

"Evaluating the overall quality of a coffee shop based solely on a single French soda is inherently challenging, as it is difficult to accurately assess the diverse array of factors that contribute to a truly exceptional coffee experience; however, this particular establishment appears to possess certain attributes that suggest it may be worthy of further exploration. Specifically, the price point of approximately $3 per French soda is somewhat elevated, yet the taste is reportedly satisfying, and the utilization of high-quality syrups suggests a commitment to using premium ingredients. To form a more comprehensive opinion of the shop's offerings, it would be necessary to repeatedly visit and sample their coffee products in order to assess the full scope of their culinary capabilities."

"A diminutive, tranquil gaming establishment with a preference for minimal patronage and an emphasis on pristine, well-maintained equipment, complemented by an array of beverage and culinary options, thereby creating a low-traffic environment characterized by a scarcity of secondhand smoke, constitutes our optimal casino experience."
Grabbed a couple of dozen bagels and took to work.  Man they don't last long.  Bagels are good and the service is friendly.  They were real busy but make time to chat will working.

Cute little spot! Nice ambiance, ok food. The BF & I ate here for our birthday dinner over the summer. Honestly the only reason why I wanted to come here was because I was curious about the Matilda Wong.. it was even better than I imagined.. seriously drop what you're doing & get. it. NOW

We started off with the Sweet Potato Ravioli with the Gorgonzola Cream sauce. Four pieces of delicious ravioli, but I didn't really care for the creamy sauce- it was a little too rich & salty for my taste. LOVED the ravioli itself though. It was topped with walnuts & served with some bread. 

For entrees, BF got the Hanger Steak & I tried the Muffuletta Pizza without meat. BF liked the steak, but my pizza, while it looked good, was so damn salty! Must be because of the olive spread but jeez.. Nothing that another Matilda Wong couldn't remedy though :)

We split a dessert, but I don't remember what it was.. it had been a few months since we ate here. Guess that means it wasn't horrible, but also wasn't memorable :(

I would come here again & try a different entree.. perhaps the Farro Saute? I found the prices to be pretty reasonable: $12 for ravioli, $12 for the pizza, & I think around $20 for the steak, probably under $10 for the dessert .. & $11 for each mini pitcher of the Wong.. hell yeah

24/7 Local video poker sports bar, everything you'd expect. It seems like I'm always just stopping in for a cheap breakfast, the Pt's Platter is way better than its Ihop and Denny's counterparts and the waitresses are much friendlier. Unfortunately, I always get sucked into the video poker machines and end up leaving with a full tummy and an empty wallet.

I went there to celebrate my wife's completion of second year dental school from UNLV. Interior design is nice and upscale and hostess was very friendly. We ordered Steak Special for two and we had to wait about 20 min to get our plate. It was ok. However, The waiter was really busy so he did not take care of us. He did not even refill my water so I had to take my wife's water and drank. compare to the price and atmosphere, service was not that great.

A quick update after my first business trip in more than 8 months:

As a nursing mom, I now have more to worry about when going through security.  At 5am on a Friday (which is actually quite busy because of all the business travelers returning home to the East Coast).  TSA had to place each of my clear bags into the bomb-matter-detecting machine, but the agent was more than courteous, explaining the process and what would happen if the machine alarmed.  Luckily it didn't.  Even though I had over a dozen bags that had to be scanned, I was done in 5 minutes.

There's not much in the Delta portion of Terminal 3, but Starbucks and Wendy's are usually open for breakfast, though the lines are quite long.

Now that the construction is done, it's much easier to find the rental car shuttle.  And I was pleasantly surprised at how short the wait was at 12:30am, despite the multitude of people who'd arrived late like me.   The rental car shuttles always smell quite strongly of soapy air freshener, almost to the point of making me sick.  I guess that's better than smelling dirty, but it is quite overpowering. 

#Yelp365 - 169/365

If you happen to be inebriated to the extent that your cognitive faculties are significantly impaired, resulting in boisterous, rowdy, or disoriented behavior, and you are seeking a culinary establishment that can accommodate your current state, then this particular venue may be an ideal choice for satiating your gastronomical desires. It is not uncommon for patrons who have indulged in excessive alcoholic beverages to experience memorable moments within these premises, as they endeavor to regain a semblance of sobriety amidst the aromatic ambiance of freshly baked pizza, which, although palatable, may not be the most advisable option for consumption during the daylight hours due to its rich, artery-clogging characteristics, yet somehow manages to tantalize the taste buds in a manner that is particularly satisfying when consumed at an ungodly hour such as 1:45 am.

Pros: Casual, fun ambiance. Good location at Cosmopolitan. Awesome decor--lucha libre meets Las Vegas--red lamps on the ceiling, video screens with pictures flashing of Mexican artist Frida Kahlo and Chinese leader Mao, etc.\n\nCons: The menu was extensive but underwhelming. A bit over-priced for such a casual setting that basically served fried rice and tacos. It's tapas style, so expect to order several dishes for sharing. I don't think it was a fusion, but rather a menu with average Chinese and Mexican dishes.

"On the eve of Christmas Eve, pondering what to do, we opted to perambulate around Carolina Place Mall, capitalizing on its extended hours until 11 pm, and observe the frenzied shoppers seeking gifts. While not my preferred shopping venue, I acknowledge its convenience for those residing in the southside of town, particularly with the presence of an H&M, a welcome addition for those craving a diverse range of apparel options. Although not necessarily outdated, the mall exudes an old-school vibe, characterized by traditional anchor stores. Not a top choice for a shopping excursion, but a feasible alternative when proximity is a factor."

Came here for brunch before a Cardinals' game. Food was good and drinks very generous. Love that they have the bus to the games. Very nice that everyone could enjoy their time and nobody had to worry about driving.

Food was absolutely delicious,  but pricey. We were dressed in comfortable clothing (jeans/shorts/sweatshirts) and clearly did not fit in; this is a dressy crowd. We were also the youngest people there... it was mostly older adults 65+. Great views and good service.

This club is the new hit in Vegas for being so big but I didn't see anything that great about it. There's so many stairs. For a girl in heels and having to go up and down stairs all night to go back and forth between rooms is a hassle. The main room at the very top of the stairs is where they have their big shows/djs. The set up there sucks because there is a row of tables lining the front area and everyone stands up at those tables so you can't even see the performer no matter where you are standing. Always fun staring at a bunch of people's backs when a top DJ is playing and you paid money to see them. Same for the balcony in this main room. Just a row of tables right in front of the balcony so you can't see anything. Club is definitely made to try and force people to get tables. On the other hand Lights was a really awesome club. I suggest going there for shows instead.

I'd really wanted to like this place, but it just isn't happening. Family has eaten here several time and we've had excellent meals (burgers in particular), but not consistently. There is always something wrong: burger over cooked, cold food, orders not correct. If a restaurant is going to charge the higher prices, I expect consistently good food and service - not hit and miss.

"I thoroughly enjoy the ambiance of this establishment, it possesses a distinctly quaint and charming 'little main street' quality that is reminiscent of a bygone era. The culinary offerings are quite satisfactory, with prices that are eminently reasonable and affordable. However, I must caution that the pace of service is somewhat leisurely, so it may not be the optimal choice for individuals who are pressed for time or have a particularly tight schedule to adhere to."
