The bagel sandwiches tasted good (I tried a tomato basil bagel) and liked it. I also thought the variety in bagels was nice. The muffin wasn't my favorite but was edible. Prices were reasonable but nothing great. Just like my review says, A-OK.

Was quite disappointed with this restaurant! After reading some good reviews about this place, I decided to take my family for some Pho cause I was really craving for it. As we were getting ready to order...the waitress notified us that they had no pho at the moment. How can they not have any pho...when they specialize in \"Pho\" and isn't that why their name is \"Pho Bosa\"? If the waitress would have told us as soon as we walked in, we could have gone else where for some pho. On top of that, the food that were ordered where not all that great. The only reason why I gave this store a 3 is because the staffs were very friendly! I don't think I'll be coming back again!

Although the pungent odor permeating throughout the facility may prove somewhat overwhelming to one's olfactory senses, the exceptional proficiency and dedication exhibited by the instructional staff serves as a notable compensation for the unpleasantness. Unfortunately, the same level of excellence cannot be extended to the front desk personnel, whose demeanor tends to be brusque and unfriendly, thereby creating a stark contrast between the two aspects of the establishment. Were it not for the subpar customer service, this studio might have maintained its appeal as a preferred destination; however, given its remote location and the presence of alternative, more hospitable environments, it becomes increasingly impractical to continue patronizing this particular facility. Notwithstanding the aforementioned drawbacks, the amenities available at this studio do include a well-maintained changing area, complete with two showers that are stocked with complimentary body wash, shampoo, and conditioner for the purpose of revitalizing one's physique following a rigorous class. It is worth mentioning that Summer and Stacy, two standout individuals among the instructional staff, offer unique and engaging experiences that set them apart from their peers.
Breakfast with Rob,  The food is good.  I had eggs, bacon and pancakes.  Not my favorite pancakes, but ok.  Love their sausage gravy however.

This place wasn't as good as we were expecting.  My pizza (Classic Maggie) was good, but nothing outstanding.  My husband's burger was completely charred and basically inedible.  We didn't bother sending it back as our waitress was nowhere to be found.\n\nIt's your typical bar food with a decent beer selection...nothing more, nothing less.

Been her a couple of times now. I LOVE their beer. They ONLY serve their OWN beer. Food items are okay but not anything to write home about, nothing special. I DID NOT like their wings at all and would not recommend them. Great atmosphere and a good place to go drink. Food's a lil overpriced but it does sit in Ahwatukee. I highly recommend their \"craft brews\" that they brew there. Actually that's the ONLY beer you can get is \"Uncle Bears\" brewed beer. I'll be back but I won't make it a POINT to come here again. Just an okay place to go with friends. TV'S EVERYWHERE! Which makes it a good place to go to watch football. THEY ALLOW DOGS (on the patio and ON a leash\") If you take an 8 X 10\" picture of your dog AND FRAME it, they'll hang his/her picture up in memoriam! That's REALLY cool

"Turkish Kitchen presented itself as a respectable and economical dining establishment, catering to a group of patrons who had not reserved a table in the city center on a Friday evening. Upon being seated, we were served an assortment of bread accompanied by an extraordinary dip, whose flavor profile was so remarkable that it became the focal point of our culinary experience. Not feeling particularly famished, I opted for the Turkish ravioli, which, despite its absence from the menu, was complemented by a side of salad and rice. While the sides were somewhat awkwardly presented and resulted in a degree of waste, they were undeniably delectable. Unfortunately, the ravioli failed to meet expectations, primarily due to its overcooking, causing it to disintegrate upon attempted consumption. Although its taste was passable, it paled in comparison to my previous encounter with Turkish ravioli, which was a considerable disappointment. It is likely that I should have selected a kebab-style dish, as did everyone else, but my craving for something other than a meat-centric meal prevailed. The remaining patrons appeared content with their choices, however. One peculiarity was that our order of beer was served in glasses of varying sizes, smaller than customary pint or large bottle glasses. In conclusion, while Turkish Kitchen offered a satisfactory dining experience for a group seeking a reasonable and convivial meal, it falls short of being Edinburgh's premier Turkish restaurant, in my estimation."

"An exceptional venue for a Friday evening of merriment and indulgence! The Chambord margarita is a superior libation, while the achiote chopped chicken salad is truly delectable and worthy of praise. However, the trio appetizer platter, though delicious, is only recommended when offered at a discounted price during happy hour. Unfortunately, the manager's haughty demeanor, the hostesses' ineffectuality, and the servers' lack of attentiveness somewhat mar the overall experience. Nevertheless, after consuming a couple of margaritas, one can readily overlook these shortcomings."

I have no idea why there was such a huge hype, it was just a typical thin crusted pizza. Seriously!!!!! The toppings were good, pepperoni, sausage, etc... but honestly you can get a better pizza elsewhere.\n\nHowever, if you are dying for a late  night snack after Marquee it's conveniently located.

My experience here was just okay. I ordered Pho and the broth just didn't cut it for me as being good but it was just alright. My boyfriend ordered the cashew chicken for the first time and he loved it. My friend got chicken fried rice and that was good as well. The price is fairly cheap for the portions at this place which is great for college students. I would come back here for food but not for the pho. 

I'm only giving three stars because of two reasons. One of them is that I ordered the Thai iced tea for almost $3 and I expecting to have some refreshing authentic Thai iced tea, but instead it was a really small bottled one from the fridge which was pretty disappointing and not worth $3. The woman behind the cashier said "I'm too lazy to make a real one," as her excuse. My second reason is that the restaurant was way too humid and hot with the doors open on a humid rainy day. I was sweating uncomfortably while eating my hot pho and it was unpleasant. There were workers fixing the ceiling tiles or something nearby too, which I thought was unacceptable for when people are eating around them only a few feet away. 

The food was good, the atmosphere not so much. I will still be coming back for a quick Thai fix because it's so accessible and conveniently located on Green st.

We ventured to Kings on a Saturday for an early culinary excursion, coinciding with our post-Christmas shopping extravaganza. I've had the pleasure of frequenting this esteemed establishment on several occasions prior, and I must say that the sluggishness of the service has been a constant theme throughout. However, I digress. We initiated our gastronomic journey with the chilled seafood platter, a veritable cornucopia of delights, featuring four Dungeness crab legs, four oysters, four clams, and eight shrimps, all for the reasonable sum of $24.95. In my opinion, this platter ranks among the most exceptional values in Las Vegas for shellfish enthusiasts. Our entrees included grilled shrimp and scallop skewers, a kid's burger, and a combination fried platter. Unfortunately, the latter was somewhat disappointing, with an overabundance of breading and questionable texture of the shrimp and scallops, accompanied by a solitary piece of cod/haddock. In hindsight, I would adhere to my customary practice of opting for the sanddabs or a dish du jour, as the shellfish platter remains the primary draw for my patronage.

I live just north of the Burger Factory, its always busy.  The menu offers a little bit of everything, making it a great place to bring an office group with  different tastes.  \n\nThe food portions are large and if your looking for a greasy spoon the burger factory might be your place for a quick bite.

For an extended period, I have been under the impression that Ping Pong Thai was an eatery catering to adult clientele, featuring Thai cuisine and entertainment, specifically ping pong shows. However, my assumptions were proven incorrect, as this establishment solely focuses on providing delectable Thai fare, sans any ping pong-related activities or equipment. Disappointingly, the Panang curry has failed to impress, lacking depth of flavor and an unfortunate watery consistency. In contrast, the Pad Kee Maw has proven to be a saving grace, boasting sufficient spiciness to satiate my taste buds, albeit at a medium level of heat. This dish remains the primary draw for my patronage, despite subpar service. Dining in yields sluggish service, while takeout orders experience an inverse phenomenon - an abundance of efficiency. Regrettably, both scenarios culminate in a lackluster experience, leaving the customer feeling inconsequential. It is worth mentioning that the restaurant tends to attract sizable crowds during the lunch hour, further contributing to the underwhelming ambiance. Were Ping Pong Thai to incorporate a ping pong table, a novel and engaging element, my rating would undoubtedly increase. It is plausible that the proprietor hails from Thailand, harboring a profound passion for the sport, which would undoubtedly elevate the dining experience.

"Despite its proximity and appealing happy hour offerings, we continue to experience frustration during our repeated visits to this establishment. Specifically, we are dismayed by the limited beer selection, which features only three options on tap. Furthermore, the service has been inconsistent, characterized by overly attentive servers at the onset of the meal, followed by an inexplicable absence during the payment process. This lack of attention to detail raises concerns about potential losses for the restaurant, as it is not uncommon for patrons to depart without settling their bills. Additionally, the cuisine has been variable in quality, with the more affordable selections, such as the calamari, proving to be the most satisfying, while the pricier options, like the elk meatballs, have fallen short of expectations due to their bland and arid texture."

"Wow, such vitriolic appraisals! \n\nI had the pleasure of encountering an employee who was stationed at the counter, and he proved to be quite assistance in facilitating my culinary experience by offering judicious recommendations that led me to a delectable meal. Specifically, the BBQ'd tilapia and Chicken Adobo dishes were particularly savory."

Close to the strip in between harrahs and ballys area in the Linq. Cool new concept, supposely all their slushies have top shelf liquor but I felt it wasn't strong enough, I believe I've gotten more drunk at fat Tuesdays slushies. They have more flavors though and we chose the patron grand mariner because it was sour.The staff is very friendly and cutely dressed, just needs more signs on the cups of drinks. The saxophone cup is seriously amazing! I think its the sexiest and bangest cup there is. ;) Ha ha

"Are you expected to be intoxicated or under the influence of controlled substances for this experience? On my second attendance of a Cirque du Soleil performance, and my initial visit to Las Vegas, I must admit that the ambiance was surreal and hallucinatory, albeit not necessarily in a euphemistic manner. The acrobatic feats performed by the actors were undoubtedly impressive, and the elaborate stage design further enhanced the overall visual spectacle. However, I must confess that certain aspects of the production, specifically the infantile laughter and the disembodied cranium, struck me as eerie and unsettling. While Cirque du Soleil consistently delivers aesthetically pleasing performances, I cannot help but feel that this particular show did not quite meet the elevated standards that I have come to expect from their productions in Las Vegas."

The modified text is: We placed an order for delivery through the online platform of http://www.youbuyandwefly.com, and we found the prices to be reasonable and the food to be delectable. Consequently, we will undoubtedly place future orders with them. However, due to the fact that we opted for delivery, we were unable to experience the ambiance of the physical establishment firsthand. Nonetheless, our meal consisted of a variety of dishes, including a flavorful hot and sour soup, succulent sweet and sour pork, savory orange chicken, and satisfying chicken chow mein, all of which met our expectations.

"This venue offers an enjoyable experience, owing to the presence of a live band performing in the evening, which creates an atmosphere akin to that of a wedding reception, thereby making it an ideal destination for those seeking to indulge in dancing and merriment. However, it is important to note that the bar operates on a cash-only basis, which may pose a problem for some individuals. Despite this, the tables fill up rapidly, yet the area remains accessible from the casino, allowing patrons to spectate and enjoy the performance while sipping on their beverages. Additionally, slot machines are situated within close proximity, further enhancing the overall experience. This lounge evokes a sense of nostalgia for 'Old Vegas,' as it embodies the traditional spirit of Las Vegas's entertainment scene, characterized by live music and a relaxed ambiance, devoid of the glitz and glamour associated with modern-day nightclubs and VIP lists. Thus, it is refreshing to witness such an authentic representation of Vegas culture."

I initiated my patronage of Spice Island when it initially commenced its operations. At that time, I was in my early twenties, thereby signifying that this establishment has now been a fixture within the culinary landscape of Pittsburgh for an extended period. Despite some minor adjustments to the menu, including the addition of alcoholic beverages, the fundamental essence of the eatery has remained unaltered, a testament to the adage "if it ain't broke, don't fix it." Among my preferred selections on the menu are plant-based options, specifically the tempura-battered tofu, which can be savored with either of the two available sauces, and the trio of vegetable curries. For an additional fee, the coconut rice is an absolute must-have accompaniment, ensuring that I will perpetually return to partake in this very same meal repeatedly.

The Mecklenburg ABC store here is decent.

Selections - They have all your spirits and liquids that you need.  They don't have my favorite cognac here, but that is okay. 

Service - nice. I know you were eyeing at me, because of my age!! But rest assured, I am beyond old enough to drink. I will take that as a compliment.

Price - as any other ABC stores, just a tad bit pricier than I am used to. Just a 'tad' bit.

Their scones are divine and it is a nice little place with fine coffee.  I only wish they would not let dogs in.  I am allergic to them and it rather spoils my meal.  If they had a sign on the door -- no dogs, except service dogs it would be fine.  The ones brought in are not service ones.  Their scones are delicious and made daily.  Go there!

Upon entering this refurbished edifice and advancing into the grand foyer, one cannot help but be struck by the meticulous attention to detail in the murals and portraits adorning the walls, which exude an air of mystique and aesthetic sophistication that is nothing short of breathtaking. Boasting a sleek, modern ambiance, this establishment is decidedly more subdued than its museum counterparts, yet compensates for its relatively diminutive stature with an abundance of visual and historical richness that more than justifies the considerable sum of Â£80,000 invested in its restoration. Those with an appreciation for settings imbued with a medieval charm, as well as enthusiasts of Scottish history, medicine, warfare, and the chroniclers of momentous historical occurrences, would be remiss not to partake in a visit to this captivating venue. Furthermore, the bustling gift shop and packed dining area serve as testament to the allure of this destination, making it an ideal setting in which to spend a leisurely afternoon engaging in both intellectual and cultural pursuits. Whether your interests lie in Glasgow Gorbals, the confluence of art and science, naval history, infamous criminal death masks, or migrational patterns and their impact on Scottish society, a visit to this institution promises to be a rewarding and enriching experience. Ultimately, it is the profound cultural significance and cerebral stimulation that this locale offers that truly renders it a must-see attraction.

I have been visiting this Cheesecake Factory long before I moved to Las Vegas. The multiple levels is a architectural design element not seen in other restaurants, but is necessary because they get so much traffic. It is located at the very end of The Forum Shops commected to Caesars Palace.

Having to wait to get in and the long journey it takes to get to this location from the casino, are the only two drawbacks. Everything else, including the staff and food have always been good.

It is near a large aquarium and an animatronic show with fire and water, so those help to pass the time. If you are walking around Las Vegas and want to enjoy a nice dinner from a restaurant you know, try this one out.

Well hello Cafe Zupas, I'm glad to meet you! Welcome to the neighborhood, I hope you will stick around.  The bbq chicken salad you created was delicious, and I especially loved the fun drink bar, which let me make my own Italian soda.  My husband liked his summer chicken salad and turkey bacon panini. And that free chocolate covered strawberry at the end? Awesome! I was very satisfied after eating at Cafe Zupas. Not too full but just right. I appreciate new restaurants that are quick, healthy and not too expensive!

Siam Terrace is one of my preferred Thai restaurants in Urbana, and it stands out as one of the few establishments where I have a singular favorite dish, specifically due to their exceptional preparation of red curry. However, this should not dissuade you from exploring other options on the menu, as the rad nar, pad thai, and diverse alternatives are equally impressive selections. My predilection for their red curry is merely an expression of my individualized preferences. While the restaurant's ambiance may feel slightly constrained when accommodating groups of four or more patrons, and the arrangement of tables appears somewhat awkward, Siam Terrace warrants a rating above four stars. Their appetizers are unremarkable yet reliable, with the standard fare being a judicious choice, while the shrimp appetizer is particularly commendable and worth recommending. Although I categorize Siam Terrace as a $$ establishment, its prices are, in reality, around $1.50, making it an economical option. Their delectable red curry dishes start at a reasonable $8.99 for vegetarian, chicken, or tofu variations, while meat entrees generally cost no more than $12, with seafood options being the priciest.

I first was introduced to this restaurant when living in Fort Worth Texas for a year. I loved this place! It's a Brazilian churrascaria  which really means it's a Brazilian cowboy barbecue. Sounds simple enough but it's better!!! \nThis is an all you can eat monster meat bonanza like nothing you have experienced before unless you've eaten here.\nIt's an all you can eat buffet but here's the twist... servers walk around with sword like skewers full of the best cuts of meat cooked to perfection. You have a little disk you flip over from red for no I'm good to green which is load me up with meat. This is the highlight of this wonderful place to eat. That isn't to take away from the salad bar which has many great items itself such as the prosciutto or the awesome cheeses. Did I also mention that yes they also have a full service bar that is spot on!

This place is a trip to morocco! Try the tea and the date shake. The bread is awesome. The owner is a gracious host and gave us a bunch of stuff to try. I love the decorations in the place too! A fun trip out

We experimented with an array of tacos at this establishment (three for ten dollars), and our culinary exploration yielded a diverse assortment of singular and delectable creations. Among these gastronomic delights, the Suadero Azteca (the queen's special) proved to be the undisputed showstopper. Its unparalleled tenderness and rich flavors, complemented by an assortment of fresh, tantalizing vegetables, made it a veritable epicurean indulgence. If you are inclined to share your dining experience with others, it is imperative that you procure an individual portion of this particular taco, lest you relinquish your claim to its sublime taste. The fried fish and fried shrimp variations, while not as transcendent as their Suadero Azteca counterpart, still managed to delight our palates with their distinctive zest and savory charm. This venue offers an exceptional opportunity to sample innovative and scrumptious tacos, although the cost may rise slightly above the norm. A request for chips and salsa is advisable, as their presentation, though flavorsome, was contingent upon our explicit petition.

The name is as good as the food. You can go in and take out, you can sit down and get served, and if your close enough they will deliver. It a mom and pop Asian food place with all or your favorite taste liker teriyaki and orange chicken! worth a stop and food is always great!

Fine place for any-time beakfast (certainly a step up from Dennys or IHOP). Good omlettes and if you can take the heart-clogging properties, biscuits & gravy. Also serves sandwiches, salads and smoothies.

After hearing wonderful things about Il Pizzaiolo for years - literally years - I finally had the opportunity to try this restaurant last week with a group of co-workers. I had a wonderful time! 

First, we ordered wine. The wine list was insanely long and confusing, so we asked the waitress for her recommendation. She told us that there were three house wines, conveniently called the #1, #2, and #3. I believe they were Pinot Grigio, Pinot Noir, and Merlot. I shared two carafes of the Pinot Noir with a co-worker and thought it was very tasty.

The team shared two appetizers, Panzarotti and Fiori de Zucca. The Fiori de Zucca was fried zucchini slices that were good but not my favorite thing ever. I loved the Panzarotti. It kind of tasted like a fried risotto and mozzarella ball. So yummy. Even at the risk of potentially embarrassing myself for taking too much food, I snagged the last one. For my entree, I ordered the Ravioli alla Caprese. The entree was very simple but superbly executed.

I hope to come back to Il Pizzaiolo very soon!

DH was getting pizza at #1 Brothers so I originally tried to order from the Japanese restaurant in the same plaza, but they failed to answer the phone after we called FOUR times!  Thank goodness.  Went to Ari and got the usual excellent service and good sushi.  What made me feel good---I was explaining to the girl who answered the phone that I had ordered the spicy tuna handroll before and had been disappointed in its consistency and our server had suggested a order it more coarsely chopped.  The young lady on the phone said: \"Oh, yes, that was me---I was your server and I remember.  I know exactly what you want!\"  And she did.  My spicy tuna handroll was exactly what I wanted and I felt good that she had remembered such a trivial incident when she deals with hundreds of customers.  Also, when I explained to her what my favorite specialty roll had been back at my old sushi joint, she was able to suggest a roll that very nearly the same and very good.  Actually, wait.  This was a Four star rather than a three star experience---let me go change my rating.  I feel like I have found my forever sushi place!  Thank you, Ari, for making me feel like a valued customer and not a faceless diner.

"I am reluctant to articulate my thoughts regarding this establishment, as I fear that an influx of patrons may compromise the tranquility and exceptional service I have grown accustomed to experiencing during my frequent visits. Notwithstanding my reservations, I must confess that the ambiance and attention to detail exhibited by the staff, particularly Julie and Tammy, have consistently surpassed my expectations. Although a solitary occurrence of an overly zealous pedicure left me feeling somewhat uncomfortable, Julie promptly adjusted her technique upon my request, thereby exemplifying the salon's commitment to client satisfaction. Additionally, the spotlessness of the facilities and the cordial demeanor of the staff have fostered a sense of comfort and loyalty, leading me to frequent the salon on a regular basis. While the cost of a pedicure has recently increased to $22, a nominal fee considering the quality of service provided, I remain steadfast in my belief that this venue offers an unparalleled value. My consistent patronage and appreciation for the salon's excellence are reflected in the $5 gratuity I customarily offer in addition to the standard $20 fee."

I had great service when I went in to buy paint for my house. The employee working the paint section helped me out a lot. I have never really bought paint for a house before so I needed a little guidance. She helped me get the right type and mixed it for me. I had all my questions answered and was out of there pretty quickly. I had great service and was happy with the price I paid.

I profoundly appreciate the proximity of this establishment to my domicile, as it enables me to conveniently acquire an array of fundamental items that cater to my occasional culinary inclinations towards Asian-inspired dishes. Furthermore, I must commend the staff members who work at this location, as they consistently display cordial demeanors and are eager to extend their assistance whenever I am unable to locate specific items within the store. However, I must express some reservations regarding the quality of the fresh produce, meat, and fish available for purchase, which, regrettably, does not meet my expectations. Nonetheless, I generally endorse this business due to its overall satisfactory performance.

"An amicable and relaxed ambiance prevails at this eatery, complemented by the delectable pizza offerings that boast an impressive array of toppings and a flavorful olive oil foundation. While the pies adorned with tomato sauce may lack a certain je ne sais quoi, the remaining selections have consistently delighted my palate with their bold and savory essence. Furthermore, the salads served here are generously portioned and bursting with freshness, making them an excellent accompaniment to the culinary experience."

My family and I have eaten here for years, as it is close to our house.  Restaurant has a nice local following, and many of their diners are Take Out diners.  Their menu is limited but the items served is hot, fresh and flavorful.  My husband loves their sushi.

When you arrive, you are immediately greeted and seated.  Be sure to check the specials listed on the chalk board near the entrance.  I like the decor, and facility, dining plates, utensils and glasses are clean.

Staff is efficient and accommodating.  The menu is concise but has enough available for almost anyone.  Prices are reasonable and portions are above average.  Definitely will return.

"A remarkable eatery with an ambiance that exudes a sense of relaxed sophistication, serving burgers that are meticulously prepared using only the freshest ingredients, thereby ensuring an unparalleled gastronomical experience that is devoid of the typically overpowering flavor associated with establishments of a similar ilk, such as Five Guys; however, it must be noted that the prices charged for these delectable culinary creations tend to be slightly elevated in comparison to those of other esteemed purveyors of fine burgers, specifically In-N-Out, whose offerings, while undoubtedly delicious, possess an unmatched combination of quality and affordability."

"It is patently unnecessary to proffer a critique of Dairy Queen, as its unparalleled excellence in the realm of frozen confections renders any such endeavour futile. Indeed, the only establishments capable of surpassing the pinnacle of quality embodied by this esteemed institution are those quaint, family-owned and operated enterprises that have managed to maintain their traditional charm and authenticity. Upon entering the premises, one cannot help but be struck by the fastidious attention to detail evident in the meticulous upkeep of the facilities, which exudes an aura of pristine cleanliness that is positively riveting. Furthermore, the staff's prompt and efficacious service, even in the absence of a sizeable clientele, serves as a testament to their unwavering commitment to efficiency and customer satisfaction. However, it must be noted that the tariff of $7.80 for a solitary waffle cone and a single serving of ice cream does seem somewhat elevated, bordering on the exorbitant."

"I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at this establishment, as the ambiance was remarkably pleasant and the culinary offerings were of exceptional quality. This dining venue deviated significantly from the conventional diner format, which made it an refreshing alternative. Due to its popularity, I strongly advise making a reservation prior to visiting, especially if you intend to bring a large group of children, as securing a suitable table may prove challenging. The menu catered well to diverse tastes, offering an array of delectable options that garnered widespread approval from both adults and youth. Additionally, the service we received was truly impressive, as the staff demonstrated remarkable proficiency and attentiveness throughout our visit. Overall, this restaurant proved to be an ideal setting for introducing our Cleveland-based acquaintances to the unique essence of Montreal, while also providing a welcoming environment for families."
Just as good the one in Scottsdale, AZ. Great bartenders, lots of TV and lots of great beer on tap.

"This particular retail establishment serves as my primary source of groceries and household essentials, and I frequent it on a weekly basis, specifically on Mondays. However, I have some reservations regarding the layout and inventory of this store, as approximately half of the store's space is dedicated to non-food items, which, in my opinion, undermines the fundamental purpose of a supermarket. It appears that the store's management has opted to prioritize the sale of electronics and other non-essential items over the provision of a diverse range of edible products, resulting in a noticeable limitation of options within the freezer section, which is particularly problematic for a frugal student such as myself. Furthermore, I have noticed a dearth of alternative brands, specifically private label products, which are often more affordable and comparable in quality to their branded counterparts. While I do appreciate the existence of the 'Oops!' section, which offers reduced prices on various items, including meat products, I cannot help but feel that the store's overall selection of foodstuffs leaves much to be desired. Despite these criticisms, I must commend the staff at this location for their cordial and friendly demeanor, which is a refreshing change from the typically stoic and unengaged attitude exhibited by many supermarket employees."

The assortment of products available is truly extensive, encompassing a diverse range of high-end European and specialty brands, with prices reaching up to $24 for a mere 3 oz bar, in addition to an array of bulk malt balls offered in three distinct flavors that are simply delightful, complemented by a premium house-brand hot chocolate mix and numerous other options, thereby providing a truly enjoyable and satisfying experience for customers who take pleasure in exploring and becoming acquainted with the vast array of choices available.

I've had pets my whole life and my observation has been that when the 's front desk staff is nice and proffesional , the doctors are not and when the doctors are great, the front desk leaves much to be desired.  This was not the case at Alta Vista.  First off, there hours are great.  Secondly. the front desk people (Sam), the techs and the doctor (Dr. Sean Penn), very friendly and courteous.  And finally, the price was reasonable. That, along with the place being clean and not smelling like wet dog when you walk in made having to take my dog in on a Sunday afternoon as pleasant as could be.  So far so good.

The view here is amazing. Can't comment on the food but I'm sure it's good. Just sat down at the bar and conversed with our man, Harold?, who served up a few dirty martinis with a twist. Amazing service even after one in our party lost a bit of balance and drink in the process.\n\nJust be nice to the doorman at the elevator and you'll get upstairs to enjoy the view and drinks.

My husband and I loved this place. The staff was very helpful with ordering and allowed us to sample six of their most popular items. We had enough food for leftovers the next day for under $25. It was great to see everything from ties to tatoos having a good time. My only complaint is that the restaurant could be a little cleaner.

"Ambient luminosity prevails, fostering an agreeable ambiance within the establishment, which I find particularly appealing when seated at the bar, whereupon I relish the opportunity to partake in delectable fare such as nachos or enchiladas in the company of my spouse; the attentive and hospitable service complemented by the culinary offerings' quality."

"Three stars for their Bun Bo Hue, indeed. Upon entering this establishment, my expectations were set rather high, considering the positive reviews I had perused prior to my visit. However, upon partaking in their signature dish, I must admit that I was left feeling somewhat underwhelmed. The broth lacked the depth of flavor and spicy kick that I had anticipated, and the pork blood, though sparse in quantity, was surprisingly dry and chalky in texture. Nevertheless, my companion's rice dish proved to be relatively satisfying, and the coffee, with its subtle hint of coconut flavoring, was truly delectable and well worth the price of admission. A Yelp check-in, incidentally, afforded us the opportunity to indulge in said coffee at a discounted rate of two dollars."

Great restaurant located inside the Golden Nugget hotel. Service was excellent- and we had a party of 14 people. The food was pretty good all around. I ordered a "caprese" salad to start and it was delicious. My main course was the Scallops, Brussel sprouts with grits. Fantastic. Hubby ordered the Maine lobster which he thoroughly enjoyed and finished. The king crab legs were amazing.. My nephew had six legs to himself. That 3 year old is one expensive date! 

As for desserts, not amazing but good. We tried the pecan ball, which was a huge ball of vanilla ice cream with pecan nuts on the outside. Nothing special. The bread pudding was better, it came with caramel ice cream on top. I think there's slight rum in the pudding, it was good but nothing blow your mind.

Minus one star because my pineapple juice cup had lipstick stains all over the cup... That's extremely unappetizing and unsanitary. overall, for such a large party- I think the waiters did a fantastic job serving and our food was great overall. Recommend!

"This particular Target store boasts an advantageous geographical positioning, rendering it easily accessible for patrons seeking a wide range of products and services within a convenient setting. During my residency in the surrounding area, I had the pleasure of visiting this Target location on multiple occasions and was consistently satisfied with the quality of customer service and breadth of merchandise available. Its placement within the Surprise Town Center shopping district, surrounded by numerous other esteemed retail establishments, further enhances its appeal to potential customers."

Love the location on 7th st. I passed by it after 5pm and saw that it was closed so I went to this one instead. Ordered an XL bean and cheese burrito America's way! So good. Don't know why this spot only has a 2 star review.

Mama-Mia-American-Pizzeria constitutes a suitable dining establishment for Jungleboy, owing to its vibrant, multilevel structure, replete with alcoves and indoor window openings. The proprietors have embellished the walls with a surrealistic mural, depicting flying mushrooms, chili-pepper butterflies, and a heroic Pepperoni-Man, engaged in a valiant endeavor. Upon entering, we opted for a table designated for two individuals and proceeded to peruse the menu. We elected to order a nine-inch pizza, adorned with three toppings of our choice - specifically, pepperoni, mushrooms, and chili-peppers. Notably, the pizza was generously portioned and boasted an assortment of flavors. Furthermore, the crust was palatable, which is not typically my preference. Our server exhibited a relaxed yet attentive demeanor, ensuring our satisfaction and inquiring about our well-being. Additionally, they offered prompt beverage service and accommodated our request to take leftover slices with us upon departure. Although I experienced a slight chill near the entrance, I observed numerous curious onlookers gazing inside, piqued by their curiosity. In an attempt to convey the quality of the establishment, I smiled and waved at these individuals, only to notice their hasty retreat from the windows. Despite this, I would recommend Mama-Mia-American-Pizzeria for either a brief visit or a leisurely afternoon meal/snack with a group of acquaintances or loved ones, given the availability of a sizeable cartwheel pizza designed to cater to larger gatherings.
Nice little place with a wide variety of food on the menu. Sitting on the patio was awesome. The sliders were amazing and I would defiantly come back again.

"I decided to visit this establishment in order to reconnect with a familiar acquaintance and indulge in some alcoholic beverages.  Although their assortment of beers may not be particularly extensive, the selection they do offer is impressive.  This eliminates the need for me to spend an excessive amount of time perusing the menu and aimlessly choosing a beverage.  Moving on to the ambiance, the interior of the venue exudes a dim and traditional pub-like atmosphere, while the exterior boasts a more vibrant and lively setting that evokes the feeling of attending a casual backyard gathering.  Patrons can enjoy an array of recreational activities, including oversized Jenga blocks (which resemble 2x4s), a life-size chess set, cornhole, and numerous ping pong tables.  Upon initial observation, I was inclined to believe that the proprietors had merely appropriated someone's outdoor space and juxtaposed a bar alongside it.  However, after engaging in several rounds of games, I came to realize that this unconventional approach actually serves as a unique selling point for the establishment.  All things considered, this venue is an excellent choice, particularly during the afternoon hours."

"We indulged in an exceptional midday repast on a weekend, savoring delectable victuals complemented by an unparalleled selection of fermented beverages, while engaging in convivial conversation with our server, who demonstrated an encyclopedic knowledge of brews. Following a tantalizing tasting experience, we bemused ourselves by exchanging pleasantries centered around the realm of ale. Notwithstanding the ambiance, which could be described as somewhat faded, we were thoroughly entertained, and we anticipate that their nocturnal beer-pairing events would be equally enjoyable."

"I am utterly thrilled about this enhancement to my neighborhood! A stunning refurbishment of a formerly disregarded structurally distinct edifice on Central Avenue has been undertaken. This development signals a positive transformation for our community. Our dining experience at this establishment was nothing short of delightful, with a table originally intended for seven individuals transforming into an impromptu gathering of eight, then nine, all on the auspicious occasion of First Friday. The staff demonstrated exceptional hospitality, warmth, and joviality, ensuring that we felt welcome and well cared for throughout our visit. The proprietor, Dana, graciously took the time to interact with us, guaranteeing that our experience was satisfactory. The culinary offerings were indeed impressive, and we eagerly shared an assortment of dishes among ourselves. Furthermore, the weather conditions were ideally suited for alfresco dining on the patio, contributing to an overall ambiance that was thoroughly enjoyable. These moments serve as a testament to the reasons behind our decision to reside in this captivating locality."

bit of a wait (~40 min) even though it was 9 pm on a Tues; a bit pricy, but it's vegas

we did a late lighter dinner for 5 with about 2 tapas plates per person

really loved the gin and tonic - if you like G&Ts, order one: super smooth, delightful presentation and super nerdy-cool ice (yes, ice). 

marinated mussels (they come in a little tin!) and steamed mussels (yum! order with bread to sop up the juice for both of these dishes next time), meat platter (really liked the house cured meat the best), Brussels sprout salad (delish!!), sauteed shrimp (good), skirt steak with grilled bell pepper (tasty!!), asparagus (good but 10 very young - read tiny - asparagus for $12+...? really good sauce to also pair with bread) quail (tiny yummy bird), tomato bread (oh yummy!)

great service, nice relaxing atmosphere. 

lovely evening!

I came to this Lenscrafters after not being able to find what I wanted at the Chandler Mall location. As soon as I came in, i was greeted by Donna, who was very helpful. I tried on many pairs, taking a break in between to give my baby a bottle. Donna called to verify my insurance and noticed there was a proble. Due to the optometrust where  got my eye exam, my insurance indicated I wasn't eligible fir frames. donna called to rectify the situation, but wasn't able to because the optometrist was closed. Donna let me know that I would have to wait until the next day so my insurance could void the issue at the optometrist. We went back the next day, and Donna had already taken care of the situation. I got my glasses, and am happy with the service I received. Donna and Heather were the wo shinih stars at this location!

This venue serves as my preferred destination for luncheon meetings and occasional dinners with my spouse, boasting an authentic local ambiance that permeates the atmosphere. The staff exudes cordiality and hospitality, while maintaining a spotless environment, complemented by delectable culinary offerings. My palate particularly relishes the tangy flavors of the green tomatillo salsa, which pairs excellently with the restaurant's signature dishes, such as the salmon and shrimp tacos. Although the service may be somewhat slow due to the inexperienced nature of the youthful servers, this factor contributes to the eatery's charm as a unique local hotspot.

"Culinary excellence, hospitable ambiance, and contemporary design are the defining characteristics of Switch, a restaurant that has garnered widespread acclaim for its delectable offerings and convivial atmosphere. My spouse and I had been eager to experience the establishment's celebrated brunch menu, particularly given the effusive praise it had received from various sources. Regrettably, our schedules did not align until recently, at which point we visited Switch on a Sunday, unfortunately missing the opportunity to partake in the brunch selection and the $3 carafes of Bloody Marys available during that time frame. 

Despite this setback, we opted to order a carafe regardless, and while the taste was unremarkable, the price of $6 for approximately four generous servings was undeniably reasonable. Furthermore, the quality of the drink was consistent with my expectations, given the affordable cost. Moving on to the main course, I had the pleasure of savoring an exceptionally delicious burger, distinguished by the addition of guacamole, salsa, and jalapenos. Notably, each dish was accompanied by a modest house-made ceasar salad, a thoughtful touch that augmented the overall dining experience. Our server exhibited attentive and cordial behavior throughout our visit, ensuring that our needs were met with expediency and warmth. 

In conclusion, Switch has secured a place among my preferred establishments for a delectable meal, specifically brunch, and I eagerly anticipate my impending return."

"Although my affinity for MadHouse remains unwavering, I must bring attention to an anomaly pertaining to their digital presence; specifically, whenever I attempt to access their website, my browser invariably issues a trojan warning, suggesting that the site may be compromised by malicious software. I felt compelled to voice my concern in the hopes that the proprietors of MadHouse will take cognizance of this issue and address it expeditiously."

"Star Nursery is the epitome of excellence in the realm of plant nurseries within the Las Vegas area, offering a wide array of superior quality plants and landscaping materials that cater to the diverse needs of both residential and commercial clients. My personal experience working at a plant nursery during my formative years has instilled in me a profound appreciation for the intrinsic value of such establishments, which has culminated in my pursuit of a degree in landscape architecture and subsequent ownership of a successful landscape company. Upon perambulating the premises of Star Nursery, I am overcome with nostalgia for my former profession, as the verdant splendor of the flora and the meticulous attention to detail accorded to each plant specimen serve as a testament to the exceptional standards upheld by this esteemed institution. The inventory of plants and landscaping supplies available at Star Nursery is truly impressive, encompassing everything from ornamental bedding plants to majestic trees, all of which are fastidiously maintained and presented in a manner that showcases their inherent beauty. Furthermore, the staff at Star Nursery possesses a depth of knowledge and friendliness that is unparalleled, making them an invaluable resource for anyone seeking expert advice and guidance in selecting the most appropriate plants and materials for their specific landscaping needs. Thus, if you are engaged in any sort of landscaping endeavor at your residence or place of business, it would be tremendously beneficial to patronize Star Nursery, as their exceptional quality and commitment to excellence are unmatched by the likes of Walmart and Lowes."

When in Las Vegas, consider partaking in the following activities to initiate an unforgettable evening of entertainment:

1) Acquire a delectable, alcoholic beverage, commonly referred to as an "adult slurpee," in a flavor of your preference, conveniently located outside the esteemed Imperial Palace.
2) Transport the aforementioned beverage into the Imperial Palace Karaoke Club, ensuring its safekeeping and accessibility throughout the duration of your visit.
3) Engage in the act of singing, or if inclined, feigning musical proficiency through the medium of karaoke, accompanied by the optional participation of others, fostering an atmosphere of camaraderie and lighthearted amusement.
4) Experience enjoyment, derived from the combination of the previous activities, culminating in a state of contentment and eagerness for the forthcoming events of the evening.
5) Consider the preliminary phase of your nocturnal exploits to be comprehensive, thereby permitting you to proceed with the main component of your evening's diversion, armed with an enhanced sense of exhilaration and anticipation.

Love this place but giving it a 4 star as it can be somewhat slow and few healthier options to select from. Yeah I know, penalizing them for not "healthy" is probably silly as you know when going to let's say a fast food joint you are not eating so good. That being said the food at Defalco's is very high quality - almost as if you are in Italy and am not comparing it to fast food.

I suggest you wait to try out Defalco's when not in a rush as its worth the wait. There order system is very similar to local places back east (basically avoiding technology) and that probably ties into part of the slower process of ordering and getting your food. I am from back east (NY area) and finding a good Italian deli / grocery store in the Phoenix area is not an easy task. A friend introduced me to Defalco's and anytime I am headed south on Scottsdale road (which is often) and after passing Thomas my stomach seems to pick up we are near Defalco's as it starts giving me the rumble noise.

I have tried many things on the menu such as Eggplant Parmigiana, Chicken Parmigiana, and Cheese steak and three of those are worth a shot. I recommend to bring a friend and each get a different large sandwich and share.

We had the Travel Zoo coupon which gives you the app/entree/dessert. Ordered the combo app of course. Alligator was tough and so were the frog's legs. Crabcake was great. Gumbo is good. jambayala was great...Not quite New Orleans but pretty tasty. Atmosphere was nice and New Orleans looking. Large portions for the money.

Classy, quiet restaurant. You'll see some white haired Montreal politicians every time. The place you'd go for a special birthday or anniversary. The waiters are polite, pleasant, and funny if you get them going. The food is downright perfect, french cuisine. Be sure to get the Escargot.

Usually come here on Friday nights with my friends who are regulars.

Food is pretty solid the lamb meatballs and Johnny's nachos are very popular with our group. Even their ranch dressing is really good and I am not a big ranch fan. I also like the Guinness stew.

The only thing keeping this place from being a full 5 stars is that it's probably a bit on the pricy side for what it is. Beers start at $6 (i think I haven't had one cheaper) and pretty much any food item is $10+ with sandwiches at $12. Shave a couple bucks off and they would be in solid 5 star contention.

The service here is also good as all the servers are friendly, keep up well with groups and splitting checks (always hard since our group can be anywhere from 4-12), and they are willing to joke around with us and not throw us out (always a possibility with our non-pc humor and discussions).

"A bowl of rice and an extremely reasonable price point coupled with an abundance of spices is what attracts me to this establishment. Specifically, I can acquire a salmon bowl accompanied by brown rice and an ample amount of fiery seasoning for a mere $7 or less. Upon entering the premises, I noticed a queue leading up to several cash registers and a menu displayed prominently on the wall, featuring an array of traditional Japanese dishes such as chicken teriyaki bowls, providing options for a diverse group of patrons. For my part, I opted for the aforementioned salmon bowl at a cost of $5.99, which represents an excellent value considering it includes fish that has not been deep-fried, thereby making it a suitable choice for a midday repast. However, I must confess that I find the teriyaki sauce to be somewhat overpowering, so I requested that it be applied sparingly. Furthermore, for an additional $0.25, I was able to enhance the nutritional value of my meal by selecting brown rice instead of the standard white variety. After receiving my bowl, I made my way to the condiment station, whereupon I discovered a variety of hot chili powders, sauces, and sliced green onions. The latter particularly caught my attention and appreciation. It is worth mentioning that the negative assessments of this eatery may stem from the fact that Japanese cuisine generally lacks the potent flavors associated with Chinese and Thai culinary traditions."

Since this venue enjoys immense patronage, it is customary for patrons to experience a prolonged waiting period prior to being seated, an unavoidable circumstance, sadly. Notwithstanding, the hosts exhibited commendable attentiveness in clearing our dishes, albeit with a minor drawback. Specifically, they had a tendency to position the cutlery directly on the table surface, a practice I prefer to circumvent due to my inclination to utilize napkins for placement. It would be considerate of them to proffer alternative utensil options, thereby precluding the need for excessive H2O consumption. Moving forward, a diverse array of culinary offerings presented themselves, rendering the $40 per capita cost reasonable. Their selection included decadent delights such as crab legs, lobster ravioli, prime rib, and creme brulee. Additionally, complementary beverages like raspberry iced tea and soda were available.

This establishment constitutes an exceptional destination for a visit, boasting reasonable prices and an accommodating staff, including some tenders of beverages who possess an alluring demeanor, thereby fostering an atmosphere conducive to conviviality and merriment; indeed, the incorporation of screens and the culinary offerings herein are also worthy of commendation.
This place is wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Fat free - new, clean place, plenty of parking - nice staff - and did I say fat free?  Great spot!

Marquee is an utter debacle, albeit an aesthetically pleasing one, characterized by an air of bedlam and disarray, yet, quite paradoxically, the doormen and bouncers manage to maintain a semblance of order amidst the chaos, deftly orchestrating the entrance process with aplomb; there exists no stringent dress code policy, which, rather unfortunately, leads to a somewhat lackluster ambiance, as some patrons opt for decidedly casual attire, such as flat shoes and leggings, while others sport athletic footwear and plain t-shirts, rendering the overall atmosphere somewhat less than glamorous; navigating the club's interior can prove to be a somewhat arduous task, as the stairs can be quite treacherous, and the dance floor tends to become oppressively congested, giving the impression of being packed into a small, confined space, much like sardines in a can, but these drawbacks can be readily overlooked; the disc jockey and other performers are truly exceptional, the sound system is impressive, and the bartenders are not only visually appealing but also quite affable.

I think this is one and only Indo-chinese restaurant in Phoenix area. Nice and clean place. Food was really good. We went on a Thu with reservation and was not crowded. \n\nTry the Manchurian Chicken ... Tasty

"Prior to purchasing tickets, it is imperative that you are cognizant of the fact that the performance will consist of a scathing critique of the audience, with the majority of the jokes relying heavily on stereotypes pertaining to race, gender, sexual orientation, age, and physical characteristics. Therefore, if you are easily offended, it would be advisable to avoid this production altogether. While the material presented is largely novel, there may be some instances of repetition, such as the quip regarding the notion of pondering one's mother's lips performing fellatio on one's father during a familial greeting. As an ardent devotee of comedic entertainment, I have had the privilege of exposure to a vast array of standup routines broadcasted on various platforms, including Comic View, Comedy Central, HBO, and Showtime, thereby increasing the likelihood that I have already encountered such humor. Nonetheless, the show promises to be an amusing experience, albeit not suitable for juvenile audiences due to its explicit nature (rated NC-17/R).\n\nThe venue's intimate setting is reminiscent of academic institutions, wherein attendees will be subject to unwavering scrutiny, analogous to the atmosphere of a high school or college environment. Consequently, it is essential to acknowledge that participation in the performance is mandatory, and individuals must be prepared to assume an active role in the show, as there are no hiding places."

The crab cake is the best in town. If you order the Caesar salad with salmon, request it to be blackened. Game changer. If you are into beef, go for the marinated flank steak. Heaven on a fork. 

The bar is very good sized and has full service for food and lots of TV's. 

Bon apatite.

Decent mocha. Hipster heaven. Loud and angry music. Brought me back to my youth.

The culinary offerings appeared visually appealing, and the beverages were economically priced. I aspire to revisit the establishment for the "remedy," a potion consisting of ginger and whiskey.

The best thing about the Excalibur is that it's more economical than other hotels on the strip. The cost of the hotel room was $27 (booked through Expedia). Of course, with all the vegas hotels these days, resort fee of $15 which gets you amenities, including wired internet in your room. The deal also included $20 food and beverage credit, which can be used at mostly bars, and the one restaurant I saw on there, which was the steakhouse (which is on the pricier side. Look up my review of the steak house at camelot for more info on the coupon there). Also included was a free play at the Dungeon, aka the midway arcade. The coupon book didn't include any match plays, unfortunately.

The room itself was nice. Spacious enough. The tv is large. There is an ethernet cable for you to plug into your computer for wired internet service. The internet was a bit slow. 

The beds were fine. They give you 3 pillows, so you get some extra fluff. 

The elevators were separated floors 1-18 and 18 and up. So if you want a fast elevator service and a high floor, book Floor 18 or so. 

As for the casino, it was stingy. Many of the blackjack tables use continuous shuffler machines, which I am not a fan of. Most minimums were around $10 for most table games.
First time going to this restaurant.  The service was great. The staff is very friendly.  Will definitely come back. I would recommend this place to anyone.

I had a reservation at another noted steakhouse near the strip and wasn't in the mood to follow through. So I started at the south end of the strip and thought I'd walk until I found something to suit my mood. Stepped into a few spots and kept walking. I swung through Cosmopolitan and an irresistible steakhouse aroma clutched me. I asked a hotel concierge to tell me the source and in a short walk I was sliding on to a stool at the STK bar- fine for a solo. I liked the atmosphere which was lively and busy with a great DJ mix as a backdrop. The volume issues that I've read from others was not an issue for me because I wasn't engaged in any challenging conversations. 

I had the foie gras french toast, bone-in rib and a moscow mule. I enjoyed everything about them. 

I will say that I can't appreciate the rest room format. Get in line outside? Wait your turn? Follow the attendant's commands? Sir, may I use the bathroom? NO! What? Fix that.

I'll be visiting Vegas again soon to celebrate my son's birthday and I'm pretty sure he'd like it as much as I, so I'll be back.

I haven't had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by Nello's in an extended period of time.  A acquaintance recommended it for lunch.  Upon arriving, the establishment was bustling with activity, and we were promptly seated.  It is customary to indulge in their renowned pizza when dining at this establishment, thus we placed an order for a large pie with a robust crust, succulent bacon, fragrant basil, savory mushrooms, and half of it adorned with savory sausage.  Alas, our delight was slightly tarnished as the basil was regrettably absent from the dish.  Nonetheless, the delectable garlic bread made up for the oversight.  The attentive and aesthetically pleasing server provided exceptional service, which further enhanced our dining experience.

"WOW!! What an undiscovered treasure in Las Vegas! We visited the Rio to attend a performance and opted to have a meal prior to the show. Unfortunately, we failed to make reservations (which I highly recommend), but the hostess kindly offered us a charming spot at the bar. We gladly accepted the offer and were seated at the bar. We had the pleasure of savoring a delectable meatball appetizer, which was enthusiastically endorsed by a fellow patron. Indeed, it was an exquisite culinary delight that warranted a return visit! We also sampled the daily specials, with one scallop dish and a sea bass entrÃ©e for my companion. Both dishes were brimming with flavor, had an exceptionally fresh taste, and were, on the whole, outstanding culinary creations! I would unhesitatingly return to this establishment! As a side note, locals who possess a T.Rewards card and a Nevada ID can enjoy a 25% discount. Additionally, if you are attending a performance, presenting your ticket stubs will grant you a 20% discount. This is truly an incredible bargain for a remarkable dining experience!"

I was going to downtown Las Vegas last night for a show, so I decided to stop for dinner at the Bar + Bistro.  I made one error in that it was First Friday in the Arts District and the restaurant has an abbreviated menu for that evening.

I went with two of their tapas plates and a dessert.  I started with their roasted tomate soup.  It was excellent.  The second dish was their 5 cheese mac and cheese a combination of smoked gouda, sharp cheddar, fontina, Manchego, roasted tomato, piquillo peppers, and parmesan crisp.  The pasta was gigli.  The mac and cheese was very tasty, too!

I rounded out my dinner with a warm chocolate ganache cake.  It, too, was excellent.  It was served with a small scoop of sorbet and it was a perfect ending.

All things considered, I'd rather have come here on a night when I could have ordered from the full menu, but I had the chance to taste some of their good cuisine.  I think it's a bit pricey for what you get.  I enjoyed the decor a lot.  The tables shaped like artists' palettes with a metal well in many.  One thing that got me several times was the thought that I had dripped something onto the table.  When I looked, it was merely some spattered paint when they were decorating the tables.  Every time I looked down, it was a "gotcha."

Its been said before, but they deliver until 3 AM.  We were not in the state of mind to drive and have been getting a little sick of hungry howies.  It took a solid hour for our food to arrive, but that seems pretty normal for late night Tempe. Everyone raved about the food.  It was very good for late night delivery.  The chicken bruchetta pita was excellent although a little small.  I recommend 2 pitas for anyone with any kind of appetite.  You might not get through both, but the one was just a little too small to satisfy.  My only complaint, and the reason for 4 starts instead of 5 was the traditional hummus.  I didnt not think it was very good at all.  Many places in Tempe have much better.

"This eatery exudes an ambiance of sophistication, boasting lofty ceilings that contribute to its aesthetically pleasing atmosphere. The coffee served here is of exceptional quality, and the staff members are cordial and welcoming, fostering a sense of hospitality that makes patrons feel at ease. Conveniently located near my workplace, I opt to partake in luncheon at this establishment on occasion, indulging in their delectable open-faced sandwiches adorned with an array of savory toppings such as Russian egg salad, tuna, smoked salmon, and diverse meat options. While the pastries appear visually stunning, sadly, my appetite is often satiated, precluding me from indulging in their sweet offerings. Although the prices may be considered somewhat elevated, the culinary quality compensates for the cost, rendering the dining experience satisfying overall."

We attended a celebratory gathering in honor of a friend's birthday, and I must say that the cozy ambiance of the venue was particularly appealing to me. Generally speaking, I am not one to indulge in comedic performances, but on this occasion, I found myself being humorously entertained by three out of the four comedians who graced the stage. Furthermore, there was an adjacent event taking place, which initially perplexed me due to the unconventional attire of some attendees, characterized by leather masks and nipple clamps; however, upon closer inspection, I noticed a small, illuminated sign reading "Comedy Spot," which promptly clarified the situation. In conclusion, I would highly recommend visiting this establishment on a weekend, although it is worth noting that the donning of assless chaps is purely optional.

Absolutely delicious Thai food offered by a pleasant server.  Ordered green curry with extra veggies and tofu and it was so yummy I ate the rest for dinner. My friend had the broccoli chicken and spring roll and she was really impressed. Ambiance is very hole-in-the-wall and kitschy, but that's not why you go. You go for the delicious food and good service, and you won't be disappointed.

"I have been thoroughly delighted with the exceptional care my canine companion has received at Squaw Peak Animal Hospital, as the staff has consistently displayed a profound dedication to ensuring the well-being of my diminutive pug. The personnel are unwaveringly kind, accommodating, and efficient in their scheduling practices, allowing for convenient, last-minute appointments without any considerable delay. It is patently evident that the staff treats my dog with the utmost care and compassion, as if he were their own cherished pet, as numerous individuals have attested to. 

In a particularly trying circumstance, a puppy was discovered at my place of employment, and upon bringing him to Squaw Peak for examination, it was determined that he was afflicted with distemper, necessitating euthanasia as the most humane course of action. In a gesture of remarkable generosity, the veterinarian absorbed the cost of this procedure without hesitation. 

Furthermore, in times of financial hardship, the hospital has exhibited great understanding and flexibility by offering the option to billed me for essential veterinary services and permitting me to make installment payments. However, I did experience a brief instance of dissatisfaction upon receiving a collection notice from the office following a payment that substantially covered the outstanding balance. Upon speaking with the billing manager, I was informed that I could make an additional payment of $70 this month, thereby settling the remaining amount owed, and that arrangements for this could be easily made over the phone. Considering the numerous positive experiences I have had with Squaw Peak Animal Hospital, I am inclined to believe that this minor inconvenience was merely an isolated oversight."

After arriving at this culinary establishment following repeated recommendations from my associates, I must say that my expectations were surpassed by the gastronomical experience provided by the proprietors of this eatery. The fare served was of considerable quality, and the ambiance, though unconventional in its deviation from traditional Japanese restaurants, was nevertheless conducive to an enjoyable dining experience. I shall indeed return to partake in their offerings once more, as my satisfaction with the meal consumed here has rendered any subsequent visits an absolute certainty. In conclusion, my gratification with this dining excursion has been copious, and I would highly recommend this venue to any individual seeking a delectable repast.

"Remarkable! I thoroughly enjoyed the captivating atmosphere of this eatery, particularly the strategic placement of our table adjacent to a panoramic window offering an unobstructed view of the spectacular fountain display. The delectable fare served at this establishment did not disappoint; specifically, the foie gras and hamachi were culinary masterpieces. However, my main course, the duck, was unfortunately lacking in both flavor and texture, as it was not adequately seasoned and displayed an unpleasant chewiness. Nonetheless, our attentive server, cognizant of my dissatisfaction, graciously offered to replace the dish with a succulent sea bass, which proved to be an inspired choice."

On June 22nd, we arrived with a considerable assemblage during the evening hours and were accommodated at a spacious table that featured the option of engaging in recreational activities such as checkers and scrabble while awaiting the culinary offerings, which we thoroughly relished. My spouse opted for the miso salmon, while I selected a burger and fries, both of which proved to be satisfactory in terms of gastronomical quality and service efficiency, until the presentation of the bill, that is. Although the bill was meticulously itemized for each individual party, much to my appreciation, a cursory examination revealed an unsolicited inclusion of a gratuity charge, which, while not necessarily problematic in and of itself, did strike me as somewhat dubious, particularly given the lack of transparent communication regarding its addition, leading to the possibility of unwitting duplication of tips by certain patrons, which, in turn, prompted me to bring it to the attention of those seated nearby, who expressed gratitude for the heads-up. While it is conceivable that this practice may not have been the intentional policy of the eatery per se, but rather that of the server, it remains, in my estimation, a questionable custom that warrants scrutiny.

Probably one of the best steaks in Las Vegas. Comfortable seating and busy. Very busy. Lobster appetizer was a bit pricey for the little, but delicious amount you got. For a new restuarant the staff was very well trained. Looking forward to next visit, minus lobster app.

3.75 stars\n\nOther than the outlet LV store in Japan, this is probably the first lv store i went into.  The security guards were a little bit intimidating, staring at you and looking bored out of their minds.  In other nice stores at caesars, they at least smile or say have a good nite.  Anyway, like Fern mentioned, the purse bar was kind of interesting and fun.  Once the associate found out my aunt might get something, she pulled out 7-10 bags for us to see and took off the protection tape on each.  I forgot her name, but she was very patient and very helpful.  She disappeared for a long while after we decided, but I would still recommend it if you are seriously looking, and even though they would probably ignore me if I was by myself!

They boast an extensive array of delectable offerings for their midday repast, encompassing both vegetarian and carnivorous selections, which are presented in a format that allows patrons to sample a variety of flavors and textures, all of which are carefully crafted to satiate one's hunger and delight one's taste buds. Furthermore, their assortment of sweet treats and yeast-based flatbread infused with the pungent essence of garlic consistently impresses and satisfies those who partake of them. Additionally, the personnel who attend to the needs of guests display a high level of cordiality and hospitality, ensuring that each individual feels welcome and valued during their dining experience.
Great atmosphere, good food, a nice choice of lunch sandwiches, not too many so it won't take forever to choose. Raspberry Soda is delicious.

I've always been a happy camper leaving this place. 
They have a very cool looking bar with their bottles lit up and colorful. I like sitting at the tables around it even though the lighting is bad. It's like the flashlight under your face effect. Not cute!
I prefer the Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna for the appetizer. The tuna comes out on a slaw that tastes amazing with a soy dressing and a side of wasabi you can mix in. This isn't a fish restaurant but I get on a fish-kick and LOVE their Blacked Fish Sandwich. It's always cooked perfectly and really like the sauce. The steamed broccoli are big pieces and always fresh. I wouldn't recommend the honey roasted carrots - they are soaked in whatever they are calling honey roasted and just tastes like carrots coated in sugar. Yuck. 
I like dessert and like chocolate but don't like anything from here. Maybe too much white chocolate for me.

"I would posit that this establishment represents the pinnacle of dining experiences within the boundaries of Sun Prairie. We have had the pleasure of partaking in their culinary offerings on numerous occasions, totaling six visits to date. Our orders have encompassed a diverse array of options, including steak, fried fish, and various entree selections. Each dish has demonstrated consistent quality, leaving us thoroughly satiated. Additionally, the restaurant's commitment to catering to younger patrons is evident in the well-portioned kids' meals, which have proven tantalizing enough to entice even the most discerning of youthful palates. Furthermore, the establishment's practice of regularly rotating both their menu and selection of beers on tap serves to enhance the appeal of repeat visits. It is worth noting, however, that the venue tends to bustle with activity, particularly on Fridays, underscoring its popularity among local diners."

The Filet Mignon was absolutely delicious and I couldn't get enough of the sauce. I did not even need steak sauce to enhance the taste. The service was wonderful, my boyfriend and I had a nice conversation with the waiter. Our waters were constantly refilled, which is always a plus for me because I drink my water like a whale. The price wasn't to shabby either, especially for a good steak. The only complaint  that I have are the frites (i think that is what they are called). It is way too salty. All in all, its a great place to have lunch on a beautiful day.

"An exceptional lodging experience can be had at this establishment, boasting capacious and immaculate accommodations. The tariff, reasonable and competitive, provides an excellent value for the quality and location. Strategically positioned at the conclusion of the famed Las Vegas Strip, this hotel enjoys reduced pedestrian activity, resulting in a serene atmosphere and improved air quality compared to other nearby hospitality venues. A diverse array of on-site amenities and activities, including a private beach, shopping center, various drinking establishments, nightclubs, a spa, and numerous others, offers guests a multitude of options for entertainment and relaxation."

Although we were compelled to wait 30 minutes for a table, it proved to be well worth the delay. We opted to sit outside, which offered a picturesque setting and an excellent vantage point for observing passersby. I selected a caesar salad and was delighted when it arrived promptly, within a mere five minutes. The flavors were exquisite, with the cheese and dressing being particularly noteworthy. Additionally, I chose to sample the traditional quiche lorraine. As a child, my grandmother frequently prepared quiche for me, instilling a deep affection for it that has endured to this day. This quiche Lorraine transported me back to those halcyon days, evoking fond memories of my youth. It was truly exceptional, possessing a rich, creamy texture that was both satisfying and filling. In fact, I found it so delectable that I was unable to consume all of it! \n\nOur server was extremely personable and attentive throughout our visit. The culinary creations emerged from the kitchen with remarkable celerity, allowing me only a brief interval to savor my caesar salad before the arrival of my main course. My companion opted for the warm chicken and brie sandwich, which featured paper-thin slices of apple and caramelized onions atop a bed of crispy bread. It was an unmitigated success, boasting flavors that were at once complementary and contrasting. In summary, our experience at this esteemed establishment was nothing short of magnificent, characterized by superlative fare and an ambiance that was both refined and welcoming. We shall undoubtedly return to partake in their gastronomic delights once again upon our next visit to Las Vegas.

This is a pretty cool store to shop in! They have a ton of interesting, high end kitchen appliances available. It seems like everything is chrome, very high end, and awesome looking. Plus, they will give you a coffee while you're shopping when they are demonstrating their high end coffee maker. It's a fun experience for sure.

Maybe I prefer my clothes a little more urban than the average white guy but, I liked this spot and love the idea of being able to look fly on a budget.\n\nIts HUGE!  Lots of variety.  Urban wear to suits and everything in between.  Accessories too.  My only complaint is that there wasn't much service outside of the fitting rooms.  But at these prices, that was expected.

Union Pig & Chicken possesses an exceptional proficiency in the culinary art of barbecue, boasting a remarkable array of delectable dishes that have captivated my gastronomical inclinations on multiple occasions. Specifically, their brisket exemplifies a masterful balance between tenderness and richness, as each bite disintegrates effortlessly upon contact with a utensil, although certain portions may contain an excessive amount of adipose tissue. Furthermore, while the hospitality at this establishment has consistently met my expectations, the pace of service has occasionally been somewhat lethargic. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, Union Pig & Chicken also offers an unexpected yet welcome reprieve from the standard lunchtime fare, presenting a diverse selection of savory sandwiches that cater to a wide range of palates. Of particular note is the macaroni and cheese, a culinary masterpiece that transcends the mundane and enters the realm of the sublime; it is an absolute must-try item for any gourmand seeking a truly satisfying dining experience.

Went here with the husband and our 2 teens and we all get something different so we could share. Everyone enjoyed their smoothie and the employees here were very friendly. \n\nI just wish these dang things were a little less pricey...and i would eat em more often, they are like having a meal.

Walnut Grill represents an establishment that I hold in high esteem, particularly for its provision of an ambient setting conducive to enjoying a post-work libation or a rapid, delectable repast. The menu showcases an inventive fusion of traditional American cuisine with subtle contemporary nuances, while the wine list boasts an impressive array of vintages carefully curated to complement the culinary offerings. The recent expansion of the bar area has not only augmented the seating capacity but also introduced plush, inviting booths that enhance the overall convivial ambiance.
