The service staff, recognizing devoted patrons like myself, display remarkable proficiency and warmth, ensuring a seamless dining experience. Furthermore, Walnut Grill occasionally features live musical performances, adding another layer of enjoyment to an already delightful dining excursion. My patronage of this eatery shall persist with unwavering regularity.

After perusing my review, the manager reached out to me and extended an apology; however, I have yet to revisit the establishment, although the manager guaranteed that my subsequent experience would be vastly different from the previous one. Interestingly, the server who attended to me during my initial visit was subsequently terminated, thus piquing my curiosity and making me eager to revisit the premises in the near future.

It's about time that Steak N Shake came to the valley. I LOVE the frisco melt, it's crazy greasy deliciousness. The place is clean and the service is friendly, which to be honest, feels weird when I'm used to a surly waitress giving me the stink eye when I order my food at this chain.  \n\nI wish they'd stay open 24 hours like standard Steak N Shakes, but ah well. I don't mind the smaller menu, but I do mind that they do not have the peppers. They are missing some key elements that dispite the smaller menu they could do better.  I agree with a fellow reviewer that the milkshakes are not Steak N Shake quality. However, I'm willing to overlook all of that for my Frisco melt with fries and a side of cheese sauce.

I know it is a McDonald's. I get it. But as far as a fast food chain goes, this particualr McDonald's has my loyalty. \n\nTalk about your fast friendly service. Whether I am ordering just coffee or a couple hash browns for my boy and I on the way into school I know I will be through the drive-thru in 5 minutes tops!

"This esteemed eatery, nestled within the California Hotel, offers an exceptional culinary experience, particularly for devotees of oxtail soup. The latter is exclusively available during late-night hours, and the menu boasts a fusion of Hawaiian and Filipino flavors. Such is the establishment's renown for its oxtail soup that a Facebook check-in will proudly proclaim it the 'HOME OF THE OXTAIL SOUP.' To optimize your visit, heed these tips: 1) Prepare for a potential queue; 2) Request your oxtail soup sans peanuts; and 3) Don't neglect to validate your parking ticket."
The location is nice and the food is delicious! I got the market fish, which was very good. The meat was so tender. Other yummy dishes were duck and pork.

Great hotel. The rooms are super clean, there's water in the fridge, and the gym is decent. My only critique is that you have to refresh the Internet connection every 24 hours (and must pay $10 bucks per device - iPhone included), the breakfast is not very good (unless you get it made to order), and they left my previous nights room service tray outside my door until the next afternoon. Besides that, everything else was fantastic. The location is convenient, service attentive, and overall experience pleasant.

A guy from a liquor store recommended this place to me a couple of years ago. Since then, I've been to this place every time I'm in Vegas. I've only tried the pizza & wings. Both are GREAT for those late night drunken munchies! Right down the street from the Stratosphere.\n\nYou can easily tell that this is where the locals go for pizza.

"My culinary inclinations were pleasantly aroused by the delectable crab legs proffered by the establishment in question. As I patiently awaited my turn in a considerable queue, I couldn't help but notice that the crustaceans in question were already cracked, thus obviating any requisite preparatory efforts on my part. Additionally, the sushi available was remarkably fresh, which further contributed to my gastronomical satisfaction. It's worth mentioning that the eatery boasted an array of adorable bite-sized desserts, allowing me to sample a variety of sweet treats without committing to a single large portion. Furthermore, the dessert section was discreetly tucked away from the main dining area, leading me to surmise that many patrons might unintentionally overlook it. They offered gelato in an assortment of flavors, including an unconventional yet tantalizing sour cherry variety. The assortment of sweets was undeniably charming, and I must admit that I was unable to identify the specific type of confection I consumed, though it did feature a captivating combination of white chocolate, edible silver balls, and a soft center. Despite my discerning palate, I found myself pleased with the abundance of suitable options available. However, when considering the cost, my preference leaned towards the offerings of Bellagio. Of note, there exists a buffet situated on the strip, complete with circular aquariums showcasing exotic desserts that truly defy description. Unfortunately, the name escapes me, but I recall that accessing the buffet requires descending via escalator. For devotees of sushi, Todai presents a superlative fish and sushi buffet at reasonable prices, supplemented by chicken and beef selections."

Quality 24/7 food in vegas. Pit stop, fill up, drink up, back at the strip!\n\nIf you want good portion sizes, a meal thatll keep you full, and want to pass up on mickey Ds and Dennys, hit this place up.

"Consequently, we arrived at XS subsequent to being unsuccessful in gaining admittance to Hakkansan, and let me assure you that we did not experience any sense of disappointment! The interior of this establishment was truly breathtaking, while the exterior provided an ideal setting for deriving pleasure from the musical offerings and indulging in some fresh air. \n\nDuring our visit, we had the privilege of witnessing a performance by Rusko, which was accompanied by an evening of vigorous dancing that proved to be an utterly enjoyable experience. Based on my personal experience, I would unhesitatingly advocate paying a visit to this venue."

"Indubitably, this particular eatery stands out as a premier buffet establishment among a plethora of other dining options within the numerous casinos in Las Vegas, offering an exceptional culinary experience at a remarkably affordable price point. I would unhesitatingly return to partake in their delectable offerings once again, as the quality of the fare and the reasonable cost create a truly satisfying and value-for-money experience that is difficult to surpass in the realm of Vegas buffets."
I thought that I could only get some good noodles here on the East Coast but boy was I wrong! I cant stop thinking about how good it was. Next time I am in town, Im heading straight there!

"I have an immense fondness for the culinary offerings at this establishment, oh my goodness, and the price of 12.45 for three beverages consisting of vodka and cola is quite reasonable, in my opinion. The server who attended to our table, a blonde woman whose name escaped me, possessed a certain je ne sais quoi that made her particularly pleasant to interact with."
Not bad, service was on the slower side, but then again it was lunch time 12-1pm but very friendly and quick cashier

"Upon perusing a selection of Yelp reviews, I opted to engage the services of Ingleside Grooming, despite my initial reservations regarding the proprietor's demeanor during our initial interaction. My subsequent visit with my canine companion proved to be a transformative experience, as the groomer exhibited remarkable patience and understanding in the face of my tardiness and concerns regarding my pet's anxiety. Indeed, the groomer's warmth and proficiency put me at ease, and the end result was nothing short of magnificent. Not only was my dog's new appearance meticulously groomed, but the cost was eminently reasonable, considering the comprehensive nature of the services provided. It is with great enthusiasm that I recommend this establishment to any individual seeking exceptional pet grooming services."

"Serendipitously discovered this eatery owing to the efficaciousness of Yelp's algorithmic recommendations, and my culinary escapades have been considerably enriched thereby. The gastronomical offerings, specifically their delectable Sonoran hot dogs, have proven to be an unmitigated delight, satiating my hunger with a superfluity of flavors and textures. My initial visit was marred by a minor inconvenience pertaining to the communication skills of the staff, which, however, was swiftly rectified during my subsequent visit, whereupon I was greeted with an abundance of hospitality and attentive service. It is worth noting that the establishment's physical surroundings, while not exactly opulent, do not detract from the overall dining experience, and one can readily overlook such trivialities in light of the superior quality of the cuisine. A veritable gustatory gem, nestled within a less than affluent neighborhood, yet well worth the excursion."

We were not inclined to pay a visit to this particular location, however, our plans were drastically altered upon encountering an advertisement in the form of a billboard promoting a performance by none other than the renowned comedian, Jerry Seinfeld, which we deemed an opportunity not to be missed, compelling us to procure tickets for the event despite the less-than-ideal seating arrangement towards the rear of the auditorium; yet, much to our satisfaction, the perspective afforded by our vantage point remained quite pleasant, complemented by the superior quality of the acoustics, rendering it an optimal setting for experiencing live performances.

"I thoroughly appreciated this performance. Although there were a few segments that could be considered slightly tacky, I thought it was superb overall. It caters to a diverse audience and is executed with great finesse and artistry. 

The twins' comedic timing was impressive, and it was refreshing to witness two confident women embracing their curves and showcasing their talents unapologetically. Additionally, the other performers had lean, athletic physiques, which added to the visual appeal of the production. Notably, the dance routines were inventive, tasteful, and occasionally moving. They effectively conveyed a range of emotions and themes, including passion, desire, playfulness, and melancholy. The performances captured the full spectrum of human experience, seamlessly blending the physical and emotional aspects. 

Some standout acts for me included the African dancer's dynamic routine, the captivating suspended bondage performance, the water gymnasts' graceful movements, the transvestite torch singer's soulful voice, and, of course, the breathtaking red cape that majestically enveloped the entire stage â?truly awe-inspiring. 

In my opinion, this show is a must-see, and I would eagerly return to experience its magic again. I relished every moment of it."

Time: 10am. Place: Poppy's. Impulse purchase: Bagels, doz. Intent: I get to play Bagel Fairy all day with a dozen of the best bagels in Charlotte.

I distributed my cache of carb thoughtfully, but thoroughly. And not before eating two in one sitting. Bagelbloat, yeesh.

Coffee was just OK but I honestly don't think they care much about anything except the bagatorial arts up in Poppy's and in that distinguished category, they get an A+. Sad to me that Bore's Head is what they have for slices and cheeses since that stuff is just nasty, but hey.

No more Bruegger's for me. No more terrorizing Owen. I get Poppy bagels, I eat Poppy bagels, I love Poppy bagels.

note - these suckers are such globs of gluten that they don't age very well - freeze 'em, if you must, instead of sitting 'em in the breadbox.

"An exceptionally hip drinking establishment, characterized by an ambiance that exudes a relaxed and welcoming demeanor, courtesy of the affable personnel who tend to patrons' needs with alacrity and cordiality. The menu boasts an array of delectable edibles and potables, available at prices that are eminently reasonable and pocket-friendly, ensuring that indulging in the epicurean delights on offer will not exact an unreasonable toll on one's financial resources. Additionally, the venue offers a diverse selection of libations at reduced prices during the euphemistically designated 'happy hour,' a time when the already convivial atmosphere becomes even more festive and jovial. Despite its diminutive size, which may result in a capacity crowd on occasion, the bar remains an unwaveringly enjoyable destination for those seeking a gratifying and memorable experience."

I did something here that I don't normally do, let alone when visiting Las Vegas. Because I have, like, friends and family:

I ate dinner out by myself.

Solo diner. Party of one. The Japanese call this "ohitori-sama" - the honored single guest.

And it was great!

* Booking was easy - 7pm weekday reservation arranged a couple of days in advance.
* Warmly welcomed by the hostess.
* Incredibly friendly, low-key service. Somewhere in between an American bar and a French bistro.
* Outstanding food, which needs no further discussion here. For this Californian, though, foie gras (illegal back home, gah) was a standout with crispy seared surface.
* Surprisingly reasonably priced, considering Las Vegas. 4-course + amuse menu was $78; before 6:30pm there's also the quick pre-theatre menu for $48.
* Got half-bottles of Champagne & Chateauneuf du Pape for $88, which turned out better than ordering by the (relatively pricey) glasses. The fellow next to me ordered a whole Sancerre bottle for $40, well done.

Which reminds me about this fellow seated next to me -- French-speaking Jason Statham assassin-looking guy also eating solo. I was about to happily drown in the French bistro atmospheric cool, until he turned out to be from Ottawa, hockey talk and all, and that rather killed the romanticism.
Every time I go to Whataburger, I get chicken strips. It is the only place I can think of that gives you a piece of toast with your meal.

"The quality of service was exceptional, and the ambiance of the dining area was thoroughly clean and well-maintained. Our culinary selections encompassed both the alloush and June's special (mushroom melt), which were undoubtedly delectable and were presented in a timely manner. However, a few minor drawbacks prevented us from giving the establishment a perfect five-star rating. Specifically, the bread was unpleasantly soggy and lacking in texture, contradicting the crunchy appearance suggested by the toasted marks. Additionally, the spinach used in the sandwich was underwhelming, lacking the freshness and crispness one would expect from such a component. Nonetheless, we wholeheartedly endorse this eatery while acknowledging these minor imperfections, allowing patrons to make informed decisions and potentially enhance their dining experience."

We have had the privilege of partaking in the captivating experience of attending two operatic performances in recent years, specifically Simon Boccanegra and Madame Butterfly, and our enjoyment of these productions has been thoroughly unwavering. However, due to the constraints of our travel arrangements and accommodation options (including the utilization of Jerry's lodging facilities), we have found ourselves confined to the more economical seating options, which, while sufficient for the purpose of observing the performance, do not offer the same level of comfort and intimacy as those seats located in closer proximity to the stage. Therefore, it may be advisable to consider expanding our budgetary allocation for future visits to ensure that we can fully immerse ourselves in the splendor of the opera, perhaps even indulging in the opportunity to attend a pre-performance lecture, which would not only enhance our understanding and appreciation of the production but also potentially provide us with preferential parking arrangements in the adjacent garage, thereby obviating the need for an extended search for suitable parking facilities.

This particular venue serves as an exemplary illustration of what a Starbucks establishment ought to embody, boasting a consistently efficient and timely service, even during peak hours in the late afternoon, albeit the quality of the wireless internet connection may fluctuate depending on the number of patrons utilizing it. However, it is important to note that this location, like many other State Street and campus areas, faces challenges in effectively managing the presence of transient individuals, which can result in the occupation of tables by personal belongings or solicitation activities, thereby creating an uninviting ambiance for customers. While it is not necessarily the responsibility of Starbucks to address this issue, it remains a pressing concern for the city of Madison to tackle.

"An entertainment venue of considerable appeal, located in close proximity to the central thoroughfare, affords patrons the opportunity to engage in people-watching activities while partaking in alcoholic beverages and basking in the ambiance of an outdoor gathering space, with the prospect of a DJ booth slated to arrive in the near future, thereby solidifying its status as a highly recommended destination during the warmest season of the year."

"I have an unwavering fondness for this establishment, which was initially precipitated by my inaugural visit in 1996. The eatery's commitment to catering to vegan patrons is laudable and undoubtedly contributes to its enduring appeal. My most recent dining experience at this venue was marked by the consumption of two delectable dishes: a flavorful papaya salad and an assortment of fresh spring rolls, the latter of which boasted an uncommon mintiness that, while unexpected, did not detract from their inherent palatability. Furthermore, I sampled their 'Dinner #3,' a platter comprising a singularly scrumptious fried roll, a bowl of coconut soup replete with an array of mushrooms and crowned with a pungent garlicky oil (the Thai terminology for which escapes me), and a serving of pad thai that, regrettably, proved too piquant even when solicited with a request for mitigated seasoning. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the quality of the culinary offerings and the attentive, cordial service I received during my visit left an indelible impression, ensuring that I shall return in the near future to partake in one of their tantalizing lunch specials."

"Ikea for President." The notion itself prompts a consideration of what governance would be like if it adopted the efficiency, affordability, and utility characteristic of the renowned furniture retailer. Indeed, Ikea presents an array of options for home furnishing across various price points, rendering it accessible to diverse consumers. The quality of assistance provided by Ikea staff fluctuates between adequate and exceptional, and the company thoughtfully supplies an assortment of supplementary items, such as rope, large bags or carts, measuring tools, writing utensils, and note-taking implements. As a personal preference, I highly esteem the Hemnes collection, which features authentic wood, and have successfully incorporated it into both my master bedroom and living area, yielding satisfactory results. Previously, I have invested in the Malm range, which, while modest in cost, delivered durable and long-lasting furnishings. The sole drawback of Ikea lies in the instruction manuals accompanying their products, which rely solely on illustrations, thereby necessitating considerable patience and unwavering focus during the assembly process, particularly when tackling more intricate items. Consequently, I tend to delegate the task of construction to my partner, as my own threshold for frustration is surpassed within a brief span of five minutes.

"As a proximate resident, I have had the privilege of traversing the surrounding vicinity on numerous occasions, thereby affording me the opportunity to peruse the local culinary establishments. However, it was not until my spouse conveyed her desire for sustenance via telephonic communication that I opted to partake in the edible offerings of this particular eatery. I must confess that my expectations were not only met but indeed surpassed by the delectable gyros, characterized by an abundance of flavorsome meat artfully arranged upon a crisp pita, accompanied by a judicious application of sauce. In conclusion, my gastronomical experience was thoroughly enjoyable and left me feeling satiated."

"In our household, we tend to engage in activities multiple times, as evidenced by our current celebration of our anniversary weekend. I suggested dining at DW Bistro, a culinary establishment that had previously impressed me during my birthday weekend with my friends. Upon entering the restaurant, my husband was immediately struck by the aromatic ambiance, which was a testament to the quality of the cuisine. As a former restaurateur himself, it was challenging to impress him. We opted to share a house salad, which was a delectable medley of mixed greens, fruit, cheese, and nuts that was truly a highlight of the meal. Additionally, I savored the short rib sandwich, while my spouse enjoyed the salmon entrÃ©e; both dishes were expertly prepared and bursting with flavor. Our server was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu offerings, further enhancing our dining experience. Needless to say, we are eager to return and sample their brunch fare."

The acts were great...the type of stuff that you would find making it onto the further rounds of America's Got Talent altogether in one show...with a good variety...good character cast and some stuff I've never seen before. 

Paid $23 (tip included) for a mojito in a thin glass. It was a good mojito and if I wasn't a local but just here on vacation I wouldn't mind, but being a local, I think of all the food that could buy. =p

Overall the entertainment exceeded my expectations, I wasn't sure what to expect.

"Capriotti's 'Bobby' has resorted to the utilization of anabolic steroids in order to enhance his physical appearance, resulting in a significant increase in muscle mass, which he has opted to showcase at Eddie D's. He has adopted the moniker 'Sir Robert' in conjunction with this transformation, yet despite his outwardly rugged demeanor, he remains fundamentally unchanged in terms of his inherent nature, retaining the endearing qualities of softness and sweetness that have been integral to his character. In an effort to augment his appeal to the opposite sex, Robert has begun to partake in regular gravy baths, thereby enhancing his already impressive physique. It is worth noting that while the majority of females are likely to be drawn to Robert's six-inch stature, he is capable of expanding to twice that size in order to accommodate the preferences of those with more voluminous builds. Thus, it is recommended that those seeking companionship during mealtime consider visiting Eddie D's, whereupon they may encounter Robert in a state of eager anticipation."

I really like Paradise Bakery, I was at this location every morning for about 2 years. The staff was always friendly but sometimes the line can get long if a lot of people come in at once. It can be a long wait to get served. Being a big muffin fan I always loved the apple cinnamon and blueberry muffins and they are consistently good.

The Paradise rewards are a nice perk, compared to other coffee shops it is easy to earn free drinks and food if you are a regular and would spend the money anyway.

The only reason this location looses one star is the sometimes pushy home business folk that take over every available booth and camp with their laptops. This is during the week. On weekends you get whole families with screaming kids. This does not seem to happen at the other locations in the area, could be the proximity to the hotel next door.

it's already been said in every other review, but the Mattress Factory is pretty amazing.  They have installations that are extremely unique and orginal.  You won't find art like this anywhere else in the city.

I was a huge fan of the Avalon in Oakland a couple years so when I passed this in Mt Lebo I had to stop! 

Design: Eye catching, funky clothes in the windows, neon sign

Organization: Typical layout of most buy trade sell shops. Pants. Shirts. Dresses...yada yada.  Nice area upfront with bags and jewelry. There is also a higher end selection( Prada, Gucci, Jimmy Cho) for the desperate housewives of Mt. Lebo. 

Selection: Pretty good. Buffalo Exchange has a more stylish/funky selection though. Wide Shoe Selection. 

Price: Affordable 

Service: Cashier was nice. We briefly chatted about our favorite stores. 


Pros: Doesn't smell like cat pee which most resell shops tend to. Very Organized and great design. Very Affordable ( Tank $8.00 and Dress $8.00) 

Cons: Could use to clear out some inventory ( old Hollister tanks, plaid short short from '98). Whiney mid-aged women shop here. 

Overall: Great place to stop when you have no money but still have the itch to spend and need a break from the Urban Outfitters circuit. Definitely plan on making this a constant in my shopping rounds.  

Check it out!
Very upset this place has closed. Please come back! One of the few places in town where you can get healthy take-out.

"A truly exceptional hospitality establishment, this hotel offered a plethora of contemporary amenities and facilities, including an impressive 29th floor vantage point with expansive views, automated shading systems in each guestroom, a spacious showering area, a rapid and whisper-quiet commode, and, most notably, a luxurious bathtub experience. While the prices at the on-site market cafe were somewhat elevated, the convenience and quality of the offerings made it a worthwhile indulgence for us, particularly in the mornings when we enjoyed their expertly crafted lattes. Furthermore, the complimentary valet parking service was staffed by friendly and proficient attendants who ensured the efficient handling of our vehicle, and we were delighted by the unexpected opportunity to check in ahead of schedule, a welcome surprise indeed."

The culinary offerings were of a satisfactory nature, albeit the absence of embellishments upon my "smash fries" rendered them comparable to their conventional counterparts. Furthermore, the demeanor of the young woman responsible for delivering our victuals to our table was perceived as discourteous, specifically when my significant other requested an additional quantity of mayonnaise.

This hotel has secured a preferential position among my numerous sojourns in Las Vegas, surpassing ten diverse establishments that I have had the pleasure of experiencing. The generous hospitality and commodious accommodations have contributed significantly to my gratification, particularly when complemented by the perks and discounts afforded by the M Life card. The genial staff members have consistently demonstrated a high level of proficiency in their duties, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable stay. The resort's pool area, replete with a wave pool and beach-inspired ambiance, offers an idyllic retreat during the sweltering summer months. Furthermore, the culinary offerings at the Burger Bar have proven to be exceptional, with the Kobe burger being a personal favorite of mine. Notwithstanding these favorable aspects, a couple of drawbacks have prevented me from conferring a perfect five-star rating upon this establishment. Specifically, the hotel's recent transformation into a family-oriented destination, while not inherently detrimental, does not align with my personal preferences for a Las Vegas experience. Additionally, the antiquated television sets, lacking in both modernity and high definition quality, have been a source of minor dissatisfaction during my stays.

I have had the pleasure of visiting Vanguard on multiple occasions, and I must say, it is an exceptional establishment for those seeking a unique and expertly crafted cocktail experience. Upon entering the premises, one cannot help but notice the fastidious attention to detail in the maintenance of the bar area, which contributes to a welcoming ambiance that exudes sophistication and elegance. Furthermore, the staff has consistently demonstrated proficiency in efficiently accommodating patrons, even during peak hours, ensuring that imbibers can readily partake in their desired potations without undue delay.

Personally, I possess a penchant for exploring diverse beverages at various drinking establishments; however, when patronizing Vanguard, my preferences become decidedly narrowed, as I invariably opt for the Jack Rose cocktail, composed of apple brandy, maple syrup, and black cherry. The mere mental reflection upon its delectable flavors evokes an intense yearning within me for a glass of this sublime elixir. It is worth noting that the assorted beverages offered by Vanguard are indeed delectable, and following a couple of libations, a brief respite may be advisable to allow for proper digestion and appreciation of their intricate flavor profiles.

While Vanguard presents itself admirably, there are occasional drawbacks, specifically pertaining to the weekend evenings, when the atmosphere transforms into a more boisterous and vibrant setting, complemented by the presence of a disc jockey. Additionally, it is not uncommon for individuals hailing from Fremont to enter the establishment, engaging in eccentric behavior, such as aimlessly meandering or performing brief, impromptu dance sequences before departing. Despite these minor shortcomings, Vanguard remains an exceptional destination for those seeking a refined drinking experience.

We came here for dinner and the food was excellent!  All of our steaks and fish were cooked perfectly!  BUT the service was very slow...we waited a little over an hour for our food.  Since we were celebrating my grandpa's birthday, they gave him a box of truffles and a $25 gift card.  

Food rating= 4.5 
Service rating=3

"The Bamboo Club offered an exceptional dining experience, characterized by delectable cuisine, comfortable seating, and an ambiance that exuded a sense of refinement and sophistication. However, our server's behavior was subpar, bordering on unacceptable, and his actions detracted significantly from our overall enjoyment of the evening. Despite his efforts to mar the experience, we cannot help but reflect upon the evening with fondness, appreciative of the establishment's unique charm and appeal. We arrived fashionably late, at approximately 9:00 PM, and were seated alfresco, surrounded by tasteful decor that expertly blended elements of Asian culture with modern flair. The restaurant's interior design was equally impressive, boasting dark wood accents, strategic lighting, and an atmosphere that struck the perfect balance between vibrancy and intimacy. The culinary offerings did not disappoint, with the Pad Thai and various appetizers showcasing the kitchen's proficiency in creating flavorful, well-executed dishes. Regrettably, our order of seared ahi tuna fell short of expectations, owing to its unfortunate state of being frozen, which rendered it unpalatable. While personal responsibility must be acknowledged, rumors persist that the restaurant could potentially source fresher, never frozen seafood options, thereby elevating the dining experience for patrons with discerning tastes. In conclusion, a visit to the Bamboo Club is worth considering, provided one avoids the seafood menu and maintains a healthy distance from the surly server in question."

The bad: the bar closes at 10pm.  It seems like the western, country, wagon-wheel themed bar that you'd like to close down one night while playing some good tunes on the juke box and eating peanuts.  And also the french fries, file those under bad.

The good: the hamburgers are pretty much delicious.  Definitely go for guacamole, and add whatever you want from the topping wagon.

I didn't try one myself, but I hear the cookies are good.

"ShooGoo exemplified a quintessential template for a 4-star eatery, boasting an impressive array of delectable fare, generous portion sizes, and a hospitable ambiance, albeit lacking that ineffable je ne sais quoi requisite for a 5-star rating. My filet, complemented by a rich B\u00e9arnaise sauce, proved utterly satisfying, while the culinary piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance of our repast arrived in the form of a delectable mushroom dish, artfully paired with the creamy, tangy flavors of Gorgonzola cheese. Moreover, the establishment's picturesque panorama, though ubiquitous throughout Sedona's sun-kissed landscape, added an unquantifiable element of charm to our dining experience."

"While it may be challenging to categorize doughnuts within the traditional food pyramid or seamlessly integrate them into any meal without raising culinary eyebrows, Krispy Kreme remains an unparalleled gift from the realm of sugary indulgence. Should you chance upon this establishment during your travels and catch a glimpse of that alluring, illuminated Hot & Now sign, consider it a momentous occasion worthy of celebration. 

Having had the privilege of partaking in numerous doughnut excursions, I can confidently attest that this particular emporium of warm, gooey delights has never failed to impress. The staff exudes efficiency, effortlessly dispensing a dozen or more melt-in-your-mouth glazed treats with remarkable speed. 

The interior of the shop itself is equally captivating, boasting an entertaining conveyor belt that delightfully mesmerizes younger patrons as it produces a steady stream of freshly crafted doughnuts. This setting transcends mere breakfast or snack time; it is, in essence, a temple dedicated to unadulterated bliss. 

My sole grievance pertains to the somewhat limited accessibility, as the store's placement along Independence Boulevard presents challenges when attempting to enter and exit via the rear or utilizing the nearby drive-thru. Additionally, securing a parking spot within the adjacent lot can prove arduous due to the notorious reputation of road congestion in the area. However, such minor inconveniences are readily offset by the sheer joy that Krispy Kreme's offerings bring. 

Despite my unwavering admiration for this esteemed doughnut purveyor, I must confess that their idiosyncratic spelling choices occasionally raise an eyebrow. Nonetheless, my adoration for Krispy Kreme and its sublime creations persists unabated. Now, as I eagerly anticipate my next visit, I shall continue to extol the virtues of these delectable, hot, and now doughnuts."

This place is another great dive bar on the strip in Pittsburgh.
The Penn Pumpkin Roll is Amazing, but Make sure you ask for the cinnamon and sugar around the rim.
Also they have a beer called Sprecher, Hard root beer, And it tastes  just like Root Beer, awesome.
There is also an Upstairs for extra room and a great View.

"What a phenomenal manner in which to expend an evening, this being our maiden visit to this particular venue. The seating arrangement, encircling the stage 360 degrees, facilitates a captivating experience for all attendees. The vocal renditions surpassed my expectations, while the wigs adorning the thespians were somewhat kitsch; nonetheless, the evening's merriment prevailed. The sole drawback, alas, pertained to the demographic composition of the audience, primarily senior citizens, whose whispers, despite their efforts to remain discreet, proved rather vociferous and, thus, mildly detracted from the overall enjoyment. Notwithstanding, it was evident that they, too, were thoroughly enjoying themselves. To avoid inconvenience, it is advisable to arrive prematurely, as parking spaces become rapidly depleted. Additionally, numerous eateries in close proximity to the theatre provide an excellent opportunity to partake in a culinary excursion prior to the performance."

"Kelly's represents an optimal venue for socializing with acquaintances while consuming beverages, and perhaps indulging in a delectable meal. Personally, I find this establishment appealing. The ambiance offers numerous opportunities to relax and engage in conversation with companions, whether it be in the spacious outdoor seating area or within the intimate interior setting. Although, one may encounter a few drawbacks, such as a potentially lengthy wait for a table or a slightly sluggish pace of service, these minor inconveniences are more than compensated by the superior quality of the culinary offerings. Furthermore, the presence of a velvet rope does not detract from the overall experience, as it simply adds to the exclusive nature of the establishment. In conclusion, Kelly's embodies the quintessential gathering spot for those seeking a refined and enjoyable dining experience, and I highly recommend the short ribs, which truly epitomize gastronomic excellence."

I have perpetually traversed past this eatery and had never halted my steps within its premises until an exigency arose and my companion desired to sample their culinary offerings, and, oh boy, was I elated that we did! Upon entering, one cannot help but feel transported from the frenetic ambiance of South Boulevard and into a distinct realm. The interior design is quite tasteful and sophisticated. Admittedly, the prices may be considered a tad elevated, yet, in my estimation, they were thoroughly worthwhile investments, particularly considering the generous proportions that could easily satiate two individuals. The staff members are exceptionally hospitable and display an unwavering commitment to ensuring a satisfying dining experience, as evidenced by their willingness to go above and beyond to cater to patrons' needs. During our visit, the proprietor was present and magnanimously extended complimentary beverages, which, needless to say, I eagerly accepted with alacrity. In conclusion, I would assign a rating of four out of five stars to this establishment.

I have developed an enhanced fondness for this establishment subsequent to experiencing its interior. Ladies are extended complimentary admission accompanied by gratis beverages from 10-12 pm!! There exists no queue, allowing for a seamless ingress and egress. The personnel, including the exotic dancers, display amicability and courtesy. The potent potables further enhance the overall experience. Although compact, the venue surpasses my initial expectations in terms of capacity, and it offers a relaxation area that can be accessed without incurring any charges. The DJ's performance was not entirely satisfactory, as he committed a few errors or perhaps selected melodies that did not align with my preferences. This locality is highly suitable for gatherings with acquaintances, where one can indulge in complimentary refreshments and unwind in a welcoming atmosphere. Observing the clientele, it appears that certain individuals opted for a more relaxed attire, including males donning only a tee and cap, partnered with females sporting denim and a stylish upper garment. The age demographic of the patrons tends towards maturity.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of exceptional quality, with generous portion sizes that obviate the need for supplementary orders. Moreover, the hospitality demonstrated by the staff is truly commendable. However, there is a caveat that precludes me from frequenting this restaurant: a $20 minimum requirement for the usage of credit cards, which poses an inconvenience for an individual such as myself who often dines alone and does not habitually carry paper currency. Consequently, I shall seek alternative dining options that offer comparable gastronomic experiences and do not impose such restrictions on payment methods, located merely a short distance away."

"Deconstructing the culinary experience:  the Samosas were a mediocre 2.5 stars, with questionable ingredients such as Potatoes and cilantro; however, the wrapping was satisfactory.  The Naan was unremarkable, with a rating of 3 stars, exhibiting adequate baking techniques but lacking in distinctive flavor or texture.  In contrast, the Kashmiri Dum Aloo was a delightful surprise, garnering a perfect 5-star rating due to its well-balanced spicing (a nuanced 6 out of 10), luscious creaminess, and expertly cooked potatoes that avoided both mushiness and excessive firmness.  Unfortunately, the Vegetable Jalfrezi was marred by an overindulgence in cooking oil, resulting in a deduction of one star; nonetheless, it remained a skillfully prepared dish.  Notably, the rice was impeccable, and the attentive service ensured my water glass remained consistently replenished.  Moreover, I derived enjoyment from the Bollywood videos displayed on the restaurant's televisions.  Ultimately, I shall return to explore further offerings from their extensive menu."

"I have an immense fondness for this culinary establishment, particularly in relation to its geographical location on the western portion of the island. Within the confines of the town, it may not be considered particularly exceptional. However, I am grateful that someone has had the foresight to open a reputable BYOB in this area, thereby rendering it my preferred destination for dining experiences when my father expresses a desire to partake in an evening meal. 

The pizzas served at this establishment are undoubtedly delectable, and I have thoroughly enjoyed the diverse array of pasta dishes that I have had the pleasure of sampling. 

It is advisable to make a reservation in advance, as this venue tends to experience a high volume of patrons, thereby ensuring an optimal dining experience for all parties involved."

Guys must wear shirts with sleeves, even when the weather is ridiculously hot in Vegas.  Pricy, but the food and interior make up for it.  Lots and different choices of things to be put on the your plate. Their desserts are actually good compared to other buffets. Their corn on the cob is super delicious!!!

"The spinach artichoke dip is an absolute culinary masterpiece, its delectable flavors tantalizing my taste buds with each successive bite, although I must admit that its portion size has diminished somewhat over time, a circumstance that, while slightly disappointing, does not detract from the dish's overall gastronomic excellence; the potency of the drinks served here is also quite impressive, providing a most satisfying experience for those who partake of them; our server, Matt, is an exceptionally attentive and knowledgeable individual whose recommendations and assistance greatly enhanced our dining experience, facilitating our decision-making process and contributing to a most enjoyable evening out; furthermore, my companion particularly appreciates the menu's inclusion of health-conscious options, such as the two for $20 deal, which affords us the opportunity to sample a variety of dishes without compromising our dietary goals."

JD and I wanted a super casual place for lunch on Saturday after a workout and he suggested here and it was the perfect spot. The chips and salsa were exceptionally good, or I had just worked up a voracious appetite at the gym, probably some of both. 

JD ordered a cheese crisp and I made fun of him by asking if he was on a diet. Then I ate my words when the behemoth greasy cheesy large pizza sized crisp actually came to the table. It was HUGE! A thin crispy tortilla topped with tons of melty fantastic-ness! It was cut in squares like some pizza's too which made it easy to eat. I had the Mexican Flag enchiladas and they were fine, but lackluster in comparison to the giant wheel of melted cheese across the table. 

All in all it was a great meal and definitely reversed any good I had just done at the gym, but that's life and I'm fine with it!

Rito's unquestionably boasts the most delectable red chile and beans in the world, perhaps even surpassing intergalactic culinary standards, now that Pluto's planetary status has been revoked. Don't allow yourself to be intimidated by the timid assertions of those who claim the surrounding area is daunting; after all, the contrast between the urban and suburban environments can be jarring, especially for those residing in Sun City. On any given day, the restaurant will be teeming with diverse patrons, including city workers, certified public accountants, medical personnel from Good Samaritan Hospital, educators, and, on occasion, an enigmatic individual or two. This family-owned eatery serves up exquisite cuisine that is simply unparalleled. Although the menu may be limited, it is abundant in gastronomic excellence, rendering the prices eminently reasonable. For those seeking bland, mass-produced fare, a visit to Taco Bell on McDowell Road may be more suitable. If, however, you crave flavorful, artisanal dishes imbued with passion, Rito's is the superior choice. Indulge in their exceptional guacamole tacos, which are truly sublime. These delectable morsels are so addictive that, were they to become scarce, I would resort to unconventional means, even targeting unsuspecting senior citizens, to sustain my fix. Alas, if only Rito's would elevate their beverage options by offering fountain drinks, it would be a welcome enhancement. Unfortunately, relying solely on canned soda proves insufficient during sweltering summer months.

This fitness facility is utterly remarkable! Upon entering Gold's Gym Elite, I experienced a sensation akin to checking into an upscale hotel, such as The W, owing to its contemporary, stylish, and immaculate ambiance. My decision to join was unequivocal, as I was exceedingly delighted about the prospect of being a member of such a distinguished establishment. The premises are meticulously maintained, which is a crucial aspect of any fitness center. The personnel are exceptionally friendly and helpful, eager to assist patrons in any manner they can. The cardio equipment is truly impressive, boasting state-of-the-art features such as personal televisions and connectivity options for iPods. Although the absence of a swimming pool may be considered a minor drawback by some, the breathtaking vistas from the gym's location compensate for this trifling shortcoming. While engaging in my customary cardiovascular routine, I had the privilege of observing numerous aircraft descending upon Sky Harbor, rendering the experience even more captivating. Unlike many other well-attended gyms in the area, Gold's Gym Elite in Phoenix maintains a comfortable level of occupancy, ensuring that exercising there is a genuinely pleasurable experience. In fact, I opted to terminate my membership with a previous gym due to its excessive congestion and unhygienic restrooms, choosing instead to join this superior establishment.

As much as my gastronomical inclinations would relish the indulgence of a buffet, my stomach often rebels against such gluttonous indulgences, particularly when it comes to mass-produced cuisine that has been subjected to the dubious fate of being placed under heat lamps for extended periods of time. However, I am pleased to report that Studio B is one of the rare exceptions to this rule, as it offers a veritable cornucopia of delectable delights that prioritize quality over quantity, thereby rendering it a culinary excursion well worth embarking upon.

Dinner at this esteemed establishment typically ranges in price from $25 on Mondays through Thursdays, with the addition of seafood options on weekends resulting in a slight increase of approximately $10. When considering that a single entree and beverage at establishments such as Cheesecake Factory can cost comparably, it becomes apparent that the value offered by Studio B's buffet format is indeed quite reasonable. Furthermore, the unlimited beer and wine available at the buffet serve to enhance the overall experience, featuring an impressive selection of craft draft beers, ciders, and a variety of wines to choose from.

In terms of the edible offerings themselves, Studio B boasts an impressive array of culinary delights that cater to a diverse range of tastes and dietary preferences. Sushi, multiple carving stations, and an abundance of vegetarian and health-conscious options ensure that there is something for everyone to enjoy. The dessert station, in particular, is a veritable paradise for those with a sweet tooth, featuring an assortment of delectable treats that include gelato and milkshakes, among other tempting choices.

The ambiance of the buffet itself is also worthy of note, as it exudes a modern aesthetic, complete with comfortable seating and unobstructed views of the famed Las Vegas Strip. Moreover, the open kitchen layout serves to emphasize the importance of cleanliness and hygiene, further enhancing the overall dining experience.

While the lines may grow lengthy on busier days, it is essential to arrive prepared for such eventualities. Additionally, patrons are advised to investigate the M Players Club, as it offers complimentary buffets for players, thereby providing an additional incentive to partake in the pleasures offered by Studio B.

I recently signed up at this gym an really love it. All the staff at front counter have been nice an you get friendly greetings each time. I've been at various times during the day an there are always machines to use. There are numerous different machines for working same muscles.  You can always find a machine to use. Juice bar is great an friendly staffed.  Brent signed me up an did great job explaining everything. Never have problems finding parking. Its really nice an well maintained. I would recommend it!

Last night, a trio of us partook of a culinary excursion at this establishment, and I can unequivocally state that I shall return. The hospitality we received was exceptional, with Emily providing sterling service and Daryl, the proprietor, exhibiting great benevolence by visiting our table post-meal to ensure our satisfaction. My sole suggestion for enhancement would be to augment the portion size of the introductory courses, as their modest dimensions prompted us to order multiple servings, which, in turn, rendered them relatively pricey. However, the primary dishes proved to be delectable, with my selection of curried tofu earning high praise, Martha's jerk chicken eliciting a passionate response, and Binnie's chicken and dumplings offering a singular and savory experience. Unanimously, we agreed that a future visit would be in order.

One of the classic hotels of Las Vegas...due to the BUFFETS :p

  It's a great, simple hotel nothing too over the top but definitely worth the stay here. Despite the age of the Rio they did a great job updating the furniture, making it contemporary and very comfortable.

  There was a long line at check in but what do you expect? It's the weekend, everyone goes to Vegas on the weekends. But once we got to the front of the line the staff was very helpful and cordial.

  Personally if I had to deal with all those people, I would lose my mind haha, so kudos to the staff of the Rio for keeping their cool. Obviously it's a little far from the strip so bring extra money for cabs.

Still a great place to stay after all these years, keep it going Rio :D

"This eatery boasts an impressive array of delectable pizzas, a welcoming atmosphere, and exceptional customer service. Located adjacent to the renowned Poisoned Pen Bookstore in historic Old Town Scottsdale, this culinary gem did not disappoint. Upon the suggestion of the proprietor, we opted for a shared Emiliana salad, followed by a mouth-watering Italian Sausage and mushroom pizza. Both dishes showcased impeccable taste and presentation, complemented by an extensive wine list. In pursuit of a light, refreshing beverage suitable for the midday meal, I requested a Sangiovese. The accommodating staff graciously offered samples of three distinct varieties, ultimately leading us to select a superb Tuscan Cabernet blend. This establishment has undoubtedly earned a place on our esteemed list of'must-visit' venues in Scottsdale, meriting high praise for its exceptional fare, hospitable ambiance, and attentive service."

"My culinary exploits were rather limited on this particular occasion, as I opted to sample merely a pair of items from the extensive menu; specifically, the green chili burro and beef taco. Furthermore, my dining experience was somewhat compromised by the fact that I elected to procure my meal via takeout, which undoubtedly diminished the overall quality of the fare in comparison to the traditional in-house dining format. However, I must confess that the green chili component of the burro was indeed a notable highlight, striking an impressive balance between piquancy and mildness that elevated it to a position of gastronomic prominence. Additionally, the tortillas accompanying the taco were quite satisfactory, exhibiting a pleasing texture and flavor profile that complemented the savory contents within. While the beef taco itself was certainly palatable, I cannot help but feel that the full potential of its gustatory delight remained unrealized due to my decision to consume it outside the establishment; thus, I shall endeavor to partake of it within the restaurant's welcoming confines at some point in the future."

"The ambiance of this particular location served as an optimal setting for my maiden musical performance at the Joint, whereupon I had the privilege of witnessing an extraordinary display of artistic virtuosity courtesy of none other than the inimitable Prince, whose captivating spectacle I was able to appreciate both from the vantage point of the floor, as well as from the comfort of an exclusive suite; truly, a most unforgettable experience."

We customarily opt for the LaQuinta in Scottsdale during our sojourns in the area. However, due to the necessity of arriving at the courthouse bright and early, I reserved accommodations for my mother and myself at the LaQuinta on Thomas. This proved to be an unwise decision, as the ambiance of the establishment resembled a seedy, illicit venue, hardly suitable for a reputable lodging experience. We promptly vacated the premises, eager to avoid any unsavory associations. 
  Following a brief excursion up the 17, we encountered the Residence Inn, which piqued our interest and alleviated our concerns regarding a comfortable and secure abode. Our AAA membership afforded us a substantial discount of 40 dollars, while the LaQuinta's discount amounted to a mere 10 dollars, still totaling a cost of approximately $99 for a subpar lodging experience. 
  The Residence Inn boasted an inviting atmosphere, complete with white picket fences surrounding the exterior of each room, imparting a quaint and charming quality to the surroundings. Each studio was equipped with a fully functional kitchen, and the staff even offered to procure groceries on our behalf. The breakfast buffet was comprehensive and satisfying, featuring an assortment of delectable items such as sausage, waffles, scrambled eggs, and fresh fruit. No skimpy, continental breakfast offerings here! 
  The combination of a welcoming environment, snug accommodations, and a restful night's slumber prior to a stressful day made for a truly gratifying experience. Our heartfelt appreciation extends to the Residence Inn for their hospitality. As an added bonus, our judicial proceedings culminated in a successful outcome, much to our delight!

This culinary establishment, strategically positioned in close proximity to McGill University, constitutes a valuable enhancement to the urban landscape. The beverages, particularly the coffee, exhibit exceptional quality, while the proprietor, Jason, and his associates, offer hospitable and attentive customer service. The assortment of pastries, sourced from a modest bakery located in the eastern sector, boast delectable flavors reminiscent of those expertly crafted by maternal figures. I frequent this eatery with considerable regularity, deriving immense pleasure from its offerings.

"I am an immense devotee of Re Salon & Med Spa, and my ardent admiration for their exceptional services has only augmented over time. The entire team at the salon is remarkably talented, and the personalized attention they lavish upon each client creates an unparalleled experience. Having visited the salon on numerous occasions over the past six months, I have had the pleasure of indulging in a variety of treatments, ranging from intricate cuts and colors to meticulous manicures and pedicures. Furthermore, if you seek the expertise of a master colorist and stylist, I highly recommend scheduling an appointment with Bethany, whose proficiency in her craft is truly remarkable and unmatched."

The experience was great, smooth ride, great views and info, and tasty sandwich plus champagne - just as promised in the tour brochure. However there were 6 passengers in our helicopter, and  I felt crushed with hardly an inch to move.  I must add that we were all of average size. Otherwise I would have given this  5 stars.

"A culinary excursion to the Bellagio buffet, characterized by a diverse array of delectable offerings, including succulent snow and king crabs, savory prime rib, and an assortment of other gastronomic delights, all presented in an elegant yet unpretentious atmosphere, with prices set at a reasonable $29.95 per person on Thursday evenings, and service that is both attentive and accommodating, ensuring a seamless dining experience for patrons, makes for a veritable gustatory indulgence that is not to be missed."

I would have probably given this 3 stars if not for the awesome green chili stew and the variety of dessert frybreads that rock my world.

The various frybread tacos are solid, but nothing that exceptional. I like the chorizo one with lots of hot sauce. 

It's a good neighborhood spot when you're in the mood for something a little different, or especially if you've got a sweet tooth! :)

"It is our considered opinion that this barbecue establishment offers a culinary experience of considerable quality, substantiated by our personal encounter with their extensive sampler platter, which we found to be thoroughly enjoyable in its entirety. The tender and flavorful meat literally slid off the bones of the ribs, while the pulled pork exhibited an exceptional degree of taste and texture. Furthermore, the ambiance and diverse array of comestibles available contributed to an atmosphere reminiscent of a familial gathering, specifically that of a visit to one's grandparents. Consequently, we shall unquestionably revisit this eatery in the future."

After an array of dining establishments, including Planet Dailies and Trader Vic's, I experienced an immense sense of satisfaction upon arriving at P F Chang's, owing to its provision of delectable culinary offerings, relatively prompt and attentive service, and prices that were reasonable and aligning with my expectations. Although there were a few minor drawbacks, they were largely eclipsed by my overall positive experience at P F Chang's, which I significantly preferred in comparison to other dining options.

Buzzberry may not be the best coffee joint out there but it does the trick and it never hurts to support local. The staff is generally friendly and pretty quick. If you like a large drink make sure you get the \"secret menu\" large.

Well I've stayed at a few hotels since I've been in Vegas for a couple of months and the Downtown Grand isn't bad at all. It has a very retro feel to it with the ocean scenic colors. It also has some very modern furniture that I would not expect for the cost of the room. Flat screen tv, full size closet/cabinet and dresser draws. Basically everything you need except for a refrigerator...

The biggest dislikes I have is all those hidden fees. They say free internet but I believe that's part of the hidden $12 daily hotel fee that they failed to mention. Also there's a $50 a day hold for damages if need be. Also if you opt to park across the street at the self parking, be prepared to look over your shoulder in that spooky garage.  

All in all not bad for it to be downtown Vegas. The restaurants in the lobby are what I consider on par with the rest of the Grand experience.

"My ignorance regarding the whereabouts of others notwithstanding, I must say that this diminutive establishment has an undeniable charm to it. The victuals served here are of considerable quality, and the prices for the beverages, particularly those of the fermented variety, are eminently reasonable. Furthermore, the employees have exhibited a remarkable level of cordiality during my visit, which has greatly enhanced my overall experience."

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are invariably of a consistent quality, rendering it aptly denominated as 'The Cheesecake Factory' due to the homogeneous flavor profile permeating their diverse menu items. My associates and I frequently indulge in frugality-driven dining excursions to this venue, under the guise of economical pricing; however, our aggregated expenditures for a mere meal, excluding beverages, often surpass $20 per individual, eliciting mirth and irony. While the prices may be considered reasonable in comparison to other Las Vegas eateries, the cumulative cost of daily late-night consumption, typically around 3 am, can become substantial over time, particularly for individuals whose gastronomical preferences lean towards the more inebriated end of the spectrum. To optimize efficiency in the face of time constraints, it is advisable to preemptively place an order by telephone, as the service tempo is not particularly expedient."

"The culinary experience we indulged in during our recent visit was utterly delectable, and the exemplary service we received from our server, Christopher, was truly exceptional. His proficiency and dedication to ensuring that we had a memorable dining experience were palpable throughout the evening, as he demonstrated an unwavering commitment to attentive and personalized customer care. We are eagerly looking forward to our next visit, whereupon we can relish another sublime gastronomical adventure and bask in the warmth of Christopher's hospitable attention once again."

Not gonna lie, I never eat the food here because I know it's just okay. I don't really crave hot dogs! (But sometimes the funnel cake when I have a sweet tooth!!) 

The ONLY thing I buy from here is LEMONADE. Ohhhh..lemonade. It makes me thirsty just thinking about it! It comes in three flavors: regular, lime, and cherry. I don't get frozen because it doesn't give me a full blast of the flavor! Every. Single. Time. I get food from another restaurant in the mall, I will never order a drink. I always buy lemonade from Hot Dog on a Stick, because it's so tasty and sweet! It just makes you feel good and satisfied on the inside :) 

My favorite flavors are lime and cherry! The taste can be a bit sweet if you're not really into sugary drinks. And it is a bit expensive, but I feel like its worth it when you're washing down whatever food you ordered in the mall!

Also, I suggest not to sit near Hot Dog on a Stick while you're eating because when the workers are smashing lemons from time to time, it's a really off-putting sound! It actually scared me at first haha!
This in my opinion is the best gourmet food in all of Vegas!  The menu is ever changing and the drinks outta of this world.. Hidden gem. I had the short rib  gorgonzola polenta it was amazing.

"Upon our initial visit, we opted to sample the diverse tapas offerings on their happy hour menu, but unfortunately, our expectations were not entirely fulfilled. However, we decided to give the establishment another chance during our return visit last Sunday, as I was particularly hankering for a delectable Paella dish. To our delight, the culinary experience was drastically different this time around, with each dish showcasing notable improvements in taste and presentation. Our order consisted of Paella, Camarones Al Ajillo, and Brochettas De Pollo, all of which proved to be satisfying selections. In particular, the Camarones Al Ajillo was an undeniable standout, prompting my companion to nearly clean his plate with relish. Consequently, we are eagerly anticipating our next visit."

As an epicurean, I was utterly thrilled to partake in a culinary excursion at the esteemed eatery of none other than the illustrious Gordon Ramsay. While indulging in a weekend sojourn in the city of Las Vegas, my companion and I opted to treat ourselves to an unforgettable gastronomical experience.

Upon perusing the menu, I settled upon the delectable lamb dish, which, to my delight, proved to be an unmitigated success. Each bite dissolved effortlessly in my mouth, leaving an indelible impression of pure gustatory rapture. In addition, I requested a side dish of mashed potatoes, which, much to my satisfaction, lived up to their reputation as a quintessential complement to the main course.

Regrettably, my spouse and our mutual acquaintance did not share in the euphoria of my dining experience. My better half, having harbored a deep-seated desire to sample Ramsay's innovative interpretation of the traditional shepherd's pie, was sadly disillusioned by the dish's unfortunate presentation. Arriving at our table in a state akin to a broth, my husband's meal elicited an air of disappointment, prompting him to regard his food with a mixture of dismay and chagrin.

Muster ing up the resolve to communicate our dissatisfaction to the attentive wait staff, I eventually mustered the courage to convey our displeasure. Following the return and subsequent re preparation of my spouse's meal, we were presented with a gratuitous dessert, a magnanimous gesture that served as a fitting conclusion to our evening's culinary exploits.

In closing, I cannot help but express a fervent desire to partake in such lavish dining experiences with greater regularity, as the mere thought of savoring the sublime flavors and textures of Ramsay's creations evokes within me an unwavering sense of gastronomical bliss.
Great deal for breakfast/lunch. The food was amazing and there were lots of lighter delicious options so you weren't eating straight heavy fat. GO HERE!

Ambience is lacking inside and out  ... I pulled up in a cab to a deserted looking mall and wondered whether I wanted to keep my lunch reservation ... I'm glad I did.

I had the black pepper garlic chicken wings.  They were not greasy, yet crispy and flavorful.  I loved the salty, slightly sweet garlic spice rub they put on the wings prior to frying.

The pork fried rice was initially just okay -- but after doctoring it up, it was great.  They initiallly got my order wrong, but even on the second try it was lacking in flavor so I asked for some of the spice rub for the wings and I mixed it in along with some of the thai bird chili and fish sauce (from the chili cart you need to ask for).  Pork is cut into  larger, thinish squares ... I prefer thicker and longer slices (typically a bit moister).

Service was prompt and friendly.

Mulligan's Border is one of numerous taverns in the vicinity of Las Vegas; however, it stands out from its contemporaries due to its delectable cuisine and exceptional customer service. While it possesses the customary bar and video poker, the eatery elevates the quality of its bar food by meticulously preparing and presenting it. 
  Personal culinary preferences notwithstanding, I have sampled a considerable portion of the menu and have yet to encounter a dish that failed to impress. A medium-rare burger, my benchmark for gastronomic satisfaction, arrives succulent and flavorful, complemented by a perfectly toasted bun that refrains from disintegrating. Such a satisfying dining experience keeps me and my spouse returning to the establishment frequently, earning it the endearing nickname of our "Cheers." 
  Although the menu may not encompass an extensive range of options, the items listed are executed proficiently, and the staff gladly accommodates special requests with minimal fuss. In fact, servers often consult with the chef to ensure the feasibility of modifications, contributing to the overall pleasurable dining experience. 
  Unwavering supporters of Mulligan's Border, my wife and I frequent the restaurant multiple times per week. Thus, I wholeheartedly recommend giving it a try.

This establishment exudes an ambiance that is simultaneously eccentric and practical, catering to the needs and preferences of the Arizona State University community with remarkable efficiency. I wholeheartedly endorse this venue as a budget-friendly destination for libations and a diverse array of vegetarian culinary options. The interior decor boasts an impressive collection of artwork, while the selection of promotional materials available is unparalleled west of the Mississippi River. Additionally, I had the pleasure of attending a craft fair organized by local, independent artisans this weekend, an event that is expected to recur on a regular basis, specifically on the second Saturday of each month.
The park is probably better known for its 6.5 miles of single track mountain biking trails.  It has a little something for all skill levels, but it's very rooty.

We have had the pleasure of dining at Biaggio's on two separate occasions this week, with the first visit taking place on Monday and the second on Thursday; however, both experiences were of a take-out nature. During our initial visit, my fiancÃ© opted for a pizza and a set of chicken wings, the latter of which can best be described as utterly delectable and dangerously addictive. The wings possess a delightful crunchiness on the exterior, complemented by an interior that is remarkably moist, and when paired with a tangy ranch or hot sauce, the result is nothing short of culinary perfection. In contrast, the pizza, while certainly enjoyable, did not quite live up to the lofty standards set by the wings. Our order consisted of a straightforward pepperoni pizza, with the remaining half being divided between mushrooms and sausage.  
On our second visit, we decided to sample one of Biaggio's renowned stromboli, and we were pleasantly surprised by its generous size. Our selection featured chicken accompanied by artichokes and red peppers, and while the inclusion of artichokes was undoubtedly a welcome touch, it is our belief that the more affordable 6.99 stromboli options are superior to the pricier specialty variety, which carried a hefty price tag of 12.99. Although both meals tallied approximately thirty dollars, we cannot help but feel that such a sum is somewhat excessive for a mere pie and wings. Nonetheless, the wings at Biaggio's possess an unparalleled quality that ensures our future patronage.

Since my previous assessment, Devil's Diner has experienced a shift in proprietorship and a transformation in culinary expertise, resulting in a marked enhancement in the preparation of their delectable offerings, which are now not only flavorsome but also obtainable at a reasonable tariff. Additionally, the ambiance of the establishment has become considerably more welcoming and congenial, fostering an atmosphere of warmth and hospitality that is sure to delight patrons.

"Whenever I find myself in the city of Las Vegas, I invariably prioritize visiting Serendipity, as it offers an unparalleled culinary experience that I eagerly anticipate each time I'm in town. Specifically, their sublime Frrrrozen hot chocolate and delectable nachos have become a staple of my dining excursions, and I unwaveringly adhere to this ritualistic tradition with unyielding dedication. Notwithstanding the prolonged waiting period that often accompanies such gastronomical indulgence, I remain undeterred in my pursuit of these epicurean delights, even willing to endure the inconvenience of a lengthy queue. Moreover, for those seeking a more expedited experience, Serendipity conveniently provides a to-go window on its periphery, thereby allowing patrons to circumvent the primary dining area's potentially protracted delay."

Cozy atmosphere in the inside and lovely patio. Food and service was great both at lunch and dinner. I highly recommend saving room for dessert. I would have given it 5 stars but I just wasn't a fan of their cocktails.

Re: Grooming Salon. Specifically, Katie, the cat handler.

It is near to impossible to find cat groomers in this town. Some vets offer the service but after today's visit to Petsmart I won't go anywhere else. So the deal is I have a demon cat. Well, she's lovely and adorable with me, but for some reason fears all pet workers. No clue why, nothing bad has ever happened to her. 

Katie works Tuesday through Friday and starts at 7am, which I can appreciate because no one else should have to witness the dramatics my cat puts on. I arrived after calling ahead to see if Katie could shave Josie's haunches, so as to avoid bits clinging to her backside (gross.)  Katie got an E-collar on Josie and told me she was going to have to scruff her while she worked, which was just fine with me because the cat was screaming like a murder victim and otherwise being embarrassing. In less than ten minutes the job was done (for only $6!) and Josie was back in her carrier like nothing happened. 

Look, I had a veterinarian tell me that if I brought Josie in for any grooming they would SEDATE her, and she also recommended I get her declawed, which I believe is inhumane. Maybe Katie considers what she does completely normal and reasonable, but she's the first professional who has worked with Josie...professionally. 

I know my cat is a total freak but I can't shave her ass myself, so thank god Katie is at Petsmart. Seriously.

I've come here on and off a bunch of times over the years and never had a less than solid meal.  The food is \"b+\" Asian cuisine and the service is always rock solid.  For a quick, tasty and convenient meal if you are nearby, this a very good choice.
I was pleasantly surprised by poutine. They have a nice variety of choices. The House Special poutine was my favorite. The service was good and plenty of room for our party of six.

"This culinary establishment boasts an affordable pricing structure, rendering it accessible to a wide range of patrons. Furthermore, they offer an extensive array of delectable dishes, including the Satay Chicken, which unfortunately possessed an excessive degree of desiccation, thereby rendering it arduous to consume. However, the Pineapple Fried Rice proved to be a notable exception, as its flavorsome and savory qualities piqued my interest, prompting me to partake in multiple servings. Additionally, their Thai Tea, with its pronounced sweetness, complemented the meal nicely, while the Phat Thai, a traditional Thai noodle dish, also garnered praise for its palatable execution. Notably, the Green Curry Paste Fried Rice, with its potent spiciness, served as a testament to the kitchen's proficiency in crafting dishes that cater to diverse taste buds."

Okay, so maybe the styrofoam coming off the building sometimes was weird or the tapping from the construction, but this place is great.

I've stayed at timeshares before, so it wasn't a surprise that we didn't have someone picking up our crap every morning.  The unit was big, comfortable, and a welcome home for our 6 day trip.  I agree with Lorraine that the washer/dryer was rude though, making us wait until it felt ready to open up.  The trick with the towels is the pool.  While they give you only enough for what seems like 2 people when you check-in, there is a never ending supply for pool guests.  A few here, a few there, and before you know it, we had about 100 towels left for housekeeping when we checked out.

Everyone who worked there was helpful and accommodating, especially our new friend Gauge, the valet guy, who was always around at 4am to say hi; except for the head of security who wouldn't give my sick friend a key to our room even after talking to me on the phone.

The pool left a bit to be desired in terms of size, but with the hot tub and bar right there, we quickly got over it (damn you Vegas and you're law against deep pools).

All-in-all the location was awesome, the rooms were clean and new, and having a kitchen for your group when you get home late is a whole new experience.  I'd definitely stay again.

"Check this one off the bucket list! I can now expire a contented camper subsequent to visiting the Mustard Museum! 

The subterranean region serves as the minuscule yet aptly named "museum" space, which, granted, may not be particularly spacious, but one must acknowledge that the extent of a museum dedicated to mustard can only be so vast. My expectations were admittedly centered around the presence of antiquated mustard-related relics hailing from ancient civilizations such as Egypt, Rome, or Greece; however, my hopes in this regard remained unfulfilled. Nonetheless, the establishment compensated for this deficiency by showcasing an extensive array of mustard samples from across the globe, which I found quite enjoyable! 

The upper level serves as the sampling area and point of purchase for the various mustard varieties. It is worth mentioning that I did not depart the premises without relinquishing $25.00, a sum I deemed reasonable considering the exceptional quality of the products and the hospitable demeanor of the staff. 

In conclusion, I would advise those who do not harbor an affinity for mustard to refrain from visiting the Mustard Museum, as their experience is unlikely to be optimal."

Considering its location within the Hard Rock Hotel, the ambiance was not as boisterous as the floor, while the lighting was idyllic, complemented by an upscale decor that exuded modernity. Now, pertaining to the cuisine, as it was my maiden visit, the server advised me to sample their specialty dishes, which I did, and was utterly captivated by the gastronomical experience, commencing with the yellow tail sashimi accompanied by JalapeÃ±o, followed by the black cod miso. However, I digressed from the server's suggestion and opted for the Chef's sashimi, which was merely average. On future visits, I shall unquestionably adhere to the server's counsel and strongly advocate for indulging in their hallmark dishes. The somewhat lackluster sashimi was compensated for by the delectable dessert offerings, presenting an array of options, culminating in my selection of the Vanilla Tapioca. Although the sake was slightly more expensive than customary, it was undoubtedly worth the expenditure. The service was deliberate, yet ideal for savoring a leisurely dinner, allowing for a relaxed conversation with one's companion while relishing the evening's events. In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly return to sample their Beef Wagyu Beef or other iconic dishes, cognizant of the fact that this is by no means an economical dining establishment, with an expected expenditure of at least $150 per individual, but thoroughly worthwhile for the atmosphere and the overall experience.

"As a habitual patron of this establishment, I can confidently attest to the fact that their Thursday night trivia sessions are an absolute delight. Moreover, their culinary offerings extend beyond the customary bar fare, boasting an array of fresh salads, assorted wraps, and pizzas that are moderately satisfying. However, it is important to note that the venue's propensity for crowding is a direct result of its limited capacity and popularity among sports enthusiasts in the South Main (SoMo) area.
