On one particularly eventful Sunday evening, I had the privilege of witnessing a heavily intoxicated individual unleash a physical altercation upon one of the expansive windows situated at the forefront of the building, resulting in an exhilarating display of shattered glass."

Located in close proximity to the culinary establishment, Metro Pizza, this particular retail outlet has been in operation for an extensive period of time. Due to the absence of a Fresh & Easy store in my immediate vicinity, I have been compelled to seek out an alternative source for acquiring fresh produce. This specific location is extremely convenient in relation to my place of employment, thereby making it an ideal option for me to purchase the items I require. The frequency of customers at this store is relatively low, which makes parking and checking out a straightforward process. Recently, I purchased several items including packages of kiwi, peaches, a package of celery, a three-pound bag of apples, and a bunch of bananas for a total cost of $12.05. In light of the fact that F & E is currently closed, I have been frequenting this store more often as of late, although the quality of the products available can be somewhat unpredictable, much like the 99 cents only store. During my most recent visit, I observed two employees working, one serving as a cashier and the other responsible for restocking inventory.

This appraisal pertains exclusively to the sushi bar facet of AJ's culinary establishment. My patronage of this eatery's sushi bar commenced in 2006, at which time the sushi artisans exhibited exceptional skill and proficiency, thereby warranting a four-star rating. However, in the ensuing years, AJ's sushi bar has undergone significant changes, including a high turnover rate among its staff, abbreviated operating hours, and a noticeable decline in the quality of its seafood and overall value relative to the cost. Lamentably, I shall be compelled to seek an alternative venue for my sushi take-out needs, as AJ's sushi bar no longer fulfills my expectations.

Update 2013: AJ's sushi bar has reinstated several of its former sushi chefs, resulting in a marked improvement in the quality of its offerings. Consequently, this eatery has once again become one of my preferred destinations for take-out sushi, and I am delighted by their return to form.

Great locals casino.  I think this is where they filmed 21.  Anyway, craps tables here are really good.  The circle bar is ok, you get a lot of cougars that come through.  It's about 15 mins off the strip and you get your money's worth.  Rooms are great, very modernized which is always a plus.  Pool area is very nice, my ex-roommate used to be a bartender here.  The good thing about it is that at times, it's a great place to come and chill when you're not in the mood to run on the strip since it's very laid back.  Everyone comes here for their massive Bingo Room or if they want to go bowling.  The theatre here is also really good but stay away on weekends as it overpopulates with a mass amount of local teenie boppers and high school kids loitering, but security does a good job to kick them out past 10.\n\nIt's right across the street from a small shopping center (Best Buy, Marshalls, Gas stations, COSTCO, etc) which is convenient.  If you like Green Valley casino, you'll definitely love this place as it's under the same ownership/design.

yum!!!  i actually ordered cran-slam club... it was good, but i did find the turkey a bit dry...  but my cousins ordered capastrami and the bobbie... so of course i had to take a bite of their sandwiches... the bobbie was soooo yummy!!!!  having tasted my sandwich, i have to say that it's the stuffing that makes the bobbie so yummy and not so dry!!!!  and capastrami was also very good!!!\n\njust found out there's a capriottis in beverly hills...i can't wait to go there and order the bobbie!!!

"Although my dining experience at Ramen Sora was undoubtedly satisfying, it failed to elicit a profoundly jaw-dropping response from me, unlike the unparalleled culinary masterpiece that I had the pleasure of savoring at Monta. Notwithstanding, the assortment of flavors showcased an unmistakable originality, while the ingredients exhibited an unwavering commitment to freshness and meticulous preparation. However, the palette of flavors did not quite achieve the same level of subtle refinement that I had the privilege of experiencing at Monta. I opted for the spicy miso ramen, which, much to my surprise, did not live up to its promised fiery intensity. Nevertheless, I would not hesitate to order it again, and if I were a resident of Las Vegas, I could envision myself frequenting this establishment with unwavering regularity."

This particular establishment exudes an undeniable charm and appeal, albeit in an unconventional manner, which may initially deceive patrons, but ultimately, its eccentricities prove to be a captivating aspect of its character. The theme revolves around the iconic music group, The Beatles, and the menu boasts an array of playful and whimsical offerings that are sure to elicit amusement and curiosity. Specifically, the delectable fried cheese curds and jalapeno popper burger are highly recommended, while the turkey swiss and slaw sandwich earns high praise as well. To fully immerse oneself in the unique ambiance and indulge in an exceptional experience, consider visiting on a Tuesday evening, when the trivia night takes center stage, presided over by the effervescent and humorous Kim, who serves as the trivia reader. The attentive and personable waitstaff contribute significantly to the welcoming atmosphere, and a diverse selection of beverages rounds out the establishment's offerings.

"As an individual who regularly utilizes the B concourse at this aerodrome, I can confidently attest to the superior quality of the pizza proffered by this establishment. While it may not be the most exceptional specimen I have had the pleasure of consuming, it is undoubtedly a refreshing departure from the exorbitant prices ubiquitous at all airport vendors. This eatery offers a thoroughly satisfying and reasonable dining experience, which, I would venture to guess, is a popular destination for aircrew members; such an endorsement speaks volumes about the venue's culinary prowess."

"We had the pleasure of indulging in the Dynamite Sandwich, which, according to the establishment's website, boasts an intriguing medley of sliced brisket, peppers, chilis, onions, and jalapeÃ±os, all sautÃ©ed with Red Diamond sauce and served atop a jalapeÃ±o roll, accompanied by melted pepperjack cheese. Our experience with this dish was nothing short of delightful, as it lived up to its name and delivered a satisfyingly spicy flavor profile. However, we did find ourselves yearning for more substantial portions, as the serving size was somewhat diminutive.  

Notwithstanding this minor drawback, our dining experience was further enhanced by the exceptional quality of the Fried Onion Strings. These delectable morsels, characterized by a delicate crust and a judicious balance of flavors, showcased the culinary prowess of the kitchen. The onions were cooked to perfection, offering a subtle sweetness that complemented the dish without overpowering it. Moreover, the absence of excessive grease was a welcome surprise, making each bite a delightful explosion of flavors.  

While we would have preferred larger portions, the reasonable price point of $1.95 made the dish an excellent value. Furthermore, we were thrilled to discover that the restaurant offers a $12.95 all-you-can-eat lunch buffet on the first Wednesday of every month, providing an opportunity to sample a variety of their offerings without breaking the bank.  

Our sole grievance lies with the limited operating hours, as the establishment is only open for lunch from 10:30 am to 3:00 pm, Monday through Friday. Were they to extend their hours and augment their portion sizes, we would unhesitatingly award them a perfect five stars."

This establishment serves as our family's preferred grocery store, and we frequent it on a weekly basis, particularly when my mother is in the mood to prepare Asian cuisine at home. The store offers an extensive selection of Asian products, encompassing a range of Chinese, Filipino, and other cultures, which is advantageous as it obviates the need to visit multiple locations. Prior to our relocation to the western part of town, we would often shop at 99 Ranch; however, this store has become a more practical option due to its proximity.  

I derive immense pleasure from exploring the various aisles, seeking out novel items to sample. The store offers a diverse array of products, including hair care merchandise, snack foods, and an assortment of teas. When I was in the process of preparing pho from scratch, I was able to acquire all the necessary ingredients in a single location. The store maintains a comprehensive inventory of herbs, spices, sauces, and powders, ensuring that I could easily locate everything required for the dish. The premises are well-maintained, and in the event of a language barrier with an employee, it is unlikely to encounter difficulty in finding someone proficient in English. It is likely that the majority of employees possess proficiency in English.  

Furthermore, their bakery and deli offerings are a significant aspect of their appeal. I frequently purchase pastries to bring to work for lunch, and when I have a hankering for dim sum, I prefer to place an order from their deli rather than venturing out to Orchid's Garden or Chang's by myself. Their deli items are reasonably priced and of high quality. Instead of patronizing Panda Express, I would recommend paying a visit to this establishment. Not only is the food authentic, but it is also quite affordable, costing around $5 for a combination meal, and the portions are generous.  

Additionally, they provide a complimentary fish-frying service, which serves as an added benefit.

"The gastronomical experience afforded by the consumption of these delectable burgers is truly sublime, with each bite showcasing an unparalleled proficiency in culinary artistry. My personal preference has been to indulge in the BBQ variety, which boasts an impressive array of flavors derived from the synergistic combination of tender brisket and savory bacon. However, my most recent visit introduced me to the I Love Bacon Burger, whose tantalizing essence proved irresistible; this delightful creation unites succulent brisket and crispy bacon, thereby elevating the humble tater tot to an unprecedented level of gustatory sophistication. Furthermore, the specialized beverage offerings present an unmatched opportunity for libational exploration, particularly the 32-ounce Sam Adams, which not only delights the palate but also serves as a keepsake, commemorating the occasion with a tangible memento. In conclusion, my affection for I Love Burgers knows no bounds."
I really like the convenience of drive thru Starbucks, but this one has a traditional vibe that makes me want to get out of my car. They are friendly and always get my drink right.

"For the paltry sum of $7.77, one can indulge in a delectable repast consisting of a sizable cut of meat, accompanied by an assortment of succulent shrimp, all served with a side of flavorsome mashed potatoes and a fresh, verdant salad, with the option to upgrade to a Caesar salad, boasting an array of piquant greens. It is advisable to partake in this culinary experience with minimal delay and without undue focus on extraneous factors such as service, ambiance, or table settings, as this establishment operates on a 24-hour basis and is primarily concerned with providing unpretentious, satisfying nourishment. Following a successful craps game during which I managed to hit the coveted hard eight twice, resulting in a substantial payout of $100, I decided to conclude my evening with a visit to this restaurant, savoring every bite of their offerings and relishing the unbridled joy of triumph. Until our next encounter, I bid you adieu, and may your future dining experiences be as gratifying as mine."

I assign a rating of 4.5 stars to this establishment, as I was thoroughly delighted by the vast array of dining options available within the premises, including both sit-down restaurants and fast food establishments, as well as the diverse selection of novel and classic slot machines, multiple bars, an inviting pool area, a superb children's play area on the upper level, and generally friendly and accommodating servers. However, I have deducted a half star due to certain deficiencies in the cleanliness and maintenance of our deluxe room, specifically noting the presence of food stains on table seats and the absence of complimentary Wi-Fi access, as well as the malfunctioning of the in-room internet connectivity option provided via a physical wire, which unfortunately detracted from an otherwise exceptional experience. Notwithstanding these minor drawbacks, I would unhesitatingly opt to stay here again in the future.

Great restaurant...not a fan of the sushi tho. I'm a huge sushi eater and could try every sushi place in the city if I could. With the number of sushi places around Vegas, this is good, but not my number 1 choice for sushi. 

Garlic Chicken and Hamburger Steak is definitely what I go there for! And their Hawaii breakfasts for Portuguese Sausage, Eggs, & Rice...yummm! haha!

Not a Sushi place for big sushi eaters..other than that...it's a taste of 808 in the 702.

Oh Grand Lux.  When will you move to the Bay Area?  Yes, it is very Cheesecake Factory-ish.  I love the variety here and the food is actually pretty darn good.  We came here for lunch after a very long crazy night.  Amongst five girls, we ordered a bunch of different items:

1. Stacked chicken quesadilla
2. Seared rare ahi
3. Asian Noodle bowl (I can't remember the exact name)
4. Tomato bisque

Do not go for the noodle!   It's a very very poor attempt at rice noodles.  I think I'm gonna give up eating noodles at non-Asian places.  I am always hugely disappointed.  The ahi and the quesadilla were good tho.  Tomato soup was a nice large bowl and tasty too.  Portions are very big so always a good idea to share because it's very unlikely you can finish it.  Prices are great.  Service is down to earth and quick.  You will definitely leave full and happy spending about $20!

I brought my visiting acquaintances to this establishment, capitalizing on a complementary gaming opportunity publicized on their digital platform, as it presented itself as an idyllic setting for a relaxed gathering, replete with a picturesque miniature water cascade and thematic Polynesian embellishments. The prospect of a financial equivalent in gameplay was sufficient motivation for me to consider this venue as a viable option, despite the absence of culinary exploration. Furthermore, the hospitable barkeep extended an offer to combine the Belgian-style witbier with a glass of orange juice, thereby enhancing its flavor profile. Additionally, this sports bar boasts a dedicated fan base of the Pittsburgh Steelers, manifesting in various promotional events and prize giveaways throughout the season.

I visited that establishment in the company of several acquaintances, and we all shared a positive sentiment towards the culinary offerings presented by the eatery. My spouse and I opted for a plant-based meal, specifically a Caprese sandwich, while my offspring selected an Italian dish and our companion chose the Montagu option. Despite the reasonable pricing for the location, I experienced hunger pangs subsequent to consuming my sandwich.
We travel to Mexico a lot.  Just got back from the tip of Baja.  These tacos taste like Baja tacos.  Great stuff!  Very clean and staff is nice.  Went 2 nights in a row.

"The exterior and interior cleansing process was indeed satisfactory; I experienced immense gratification upon beholding my aged automobile's luminous appearance. The team accomplished the task within a reasonable duration, and I was particularly delighted to observe all glass surfaces thoroughly cleaned and floor coverings meticulously vacuumed. However, I must admit that the initial female representative who approached me to gather my vehicle's cleaning requirements exhibited a somewhat brusque demeanor, articulated her words at an excessively rapid pace, and displayed visible annoyance upon being requested to reiterate her statements. Nonetheless, the remaining personnel who participated in the vehicular detailing process demonstrated amiable and courteous behavior, manifesting a genuine desire to provide excellent customer service."

This facility is exceptional for an extensive gathering! We celebrated a friend's birthday here a fortnight ago, and it was quite pleasant. Its location is behind the MGM hotel and adjacent to Hooters hotel, providing convenient accessibility. We leased a two-bedroom villa, which offered ample space. Additionally, it featured a completely outfitted kitchen, containing all necessary utensils and appliances for food preparation. The villa boasted two full bathrooms, supplemented with extra pillows and blankets. Although it specified a capacity of six individuals, it could comfortably accommodate approximately ten people. The price was reasonable, and the atmosphere was tranquil. The continental breakfast was truly impressive, presenting an abundance of diversity and options catering to various preferences. In conclusion, this establishment is a suitable choice for lodging, provided you do not mind a slight distance from the primary entertainment district.

"In Las Vegas, it's not uncommon to find establishments that cater to vegan palates, and this particular pizzeria is no exception. Although they don't openly promote their plant-based offerings, upon request, they are more than happy to present their comprehensive vegan menu. The selection is indeed vast, and I was particularly intrigued by the tofu parmesan sub; however, my dining companion had their heart set on sharing a pizza. We opted for the meal deal, which included a side dish, a salad, and a 12-inch pizza for $24.95, and beverages for an additional $3.75 (thankfully, refillable). While not the most economical option, it's a reasonable price point for both the Wynn and pizza in general. Interestingly, they utilize Follow Your Heart products instead of Daiya, which some individuals swear by; personally, I find Follow Your Heart to be satisfactory, although I'm not convinced it surpasses Daiya in terms of quality. The pizza we received was topped with an assortment of kalamata olives, onions, and roasted red peppers, making for a unique flavor combination that, while not necessarily my first choice, was still enjoyable. My primary criticism of the pizza would be that the exterior crust was somewhat rigid; the salad was unremarkable but adequate; and the fries, remarkably crunchy and delicious. I am already looking forward to my next visit and will certainly return to this establishment."

Great place to go on a Monday afternoon. There were probably less than 20 cars in the parking lot. I was kind of leery at first because the mall here is sketchy at best, but this was a nice clean theater with friendly staff.

The enigmatic composition of the processed meat incorporated into those extensively wrinkled, oversized hot dogs arouses curiosity regarding its origin and substance, although a certain reluctance to become cognizant of the specifics pertaining to this culinary conundrum prevails; meanwhile, the gratification derived from the consumption of such an economical fare, amounting to a mere $2, serves as a fleeting source of sustenance. Furthermore, a pertinent admonition extends towards those individuals who persistently opt for the strategy of doubling down when the dealer's display includes a 10, while their own hand consists of a similar quantity, as such actions may potentially elicit a violent response, tantamount to asphyxiation, due to the sheer frustration engendered by their unwavering adherence to this questionable tactic.

I would definitely recommend this place.  Great place to get your breakfast, especially if you're tired of eating on the Stripe.  When I went on Sunday for brunch (arrived around 10:30), the wait was 40 minutes. Server was nice. \n\nRecommendation: Chorizo Hash, Andy's Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles, Tractor Driver Combo.

"My affection for this establishment is rooted in its inconspicuous ingress, which evokes the sense of exclusivity and secrecy reminiscent of a clandestine speakeasy. Upon entering, I was struck by the warm ambiance created by the fireplace and the dim illumination, which complemented the venerable bar. While the interior space appeared somewhat expansive and airy, it lacked the quintessential intimacy customarily associated with a wine bar, a characteristic that, in my opinion, was attributable to its generous proportions and the fact that it did not conform to the conventional template of a cramped, dimly lit watering hole. However, it is worth noting that my basis for comparison is derived from my experiences in Los Angeles and New York City, where the prevalence of diminutive bars is significantly higher. The venue's wine list was exhaustive, and the staff demonstrated an unwavering commitment to providing expert counsel and guidance in selecting the ideal vintage. Furthermore, the demographic diversity among patrons was notable, with a blend of couples, groups of women, and solo revelers gathered at the bar, all of whom exuded a convivial demeanor. This atmosphere was a welcome departure from the raucous and frenetic environment that permeates many establishments in Old Town, leading me to conclude that this locale has earned a well-deserved spot among my preferred haunts in Scottsdale."
Every time I visit Pittsburgh I have to stop here. I've ordered a few sandwiches but just like everyone says... Everything is good! Only down side is that service is a little slow.

"The pinnacle of airport experiences for inebriation enthusiasts can be found at the following terminals:  
1) Narita/Tokyo- A glass structure that facilitates an approximate three-hour ride on the monorail, with the added benefit of polite fellow passengers who refrain from prompting one to disembark.  
2) Chicago O'Hare- A captivating neon tunnel that, when coupled with the musical masterpiece that is Pink Floyd's 'The Dark Side of the Moon,' elevates the experience to an even higher level of enjoyment.  
3) McCarran- Las Vegas. An airport that seamlessly integrates the ambiance of the city's vibrant nightlife, providing an opportunity to imbibe copious amounts of alcohol, thus rendering the wait for one's return flight an afterthought. The presence of a stone lizard and snake, as well as the hypnotic allure of the slot machines, serve as ideal diversions during this interlude. Bitches, indeed.  
\n\nA shiny quarter! Deposit. Pull. \nCherry, Cherry! Cherry!!!.....Lemon  =(\n Oh fuck. Well, at least it's time to board."

"Myriad pecuniary challenges plague my existence, yet the Tuesday promotion proffered by Popeyes does not rank among them. For a mere $0.99, I can indulge in a duo of delectable poultry pieces that satiate my hunger and provide a fleeting respite from my financial tribulations. Although I do not frequent this establishment with great regularity, the allure of this offer proves difficult to resist. Moreover, their biscuits possess an unparalleled degree of culinary excellence, which further reinforces my inclination to partake in this affordable gastronomic experience. Notwithstanding the occasional lapses in service quality, Popeyes generally maintains a passable level of efficiency in their drive-thru operations."

Overall, a delectable culinary experience, coupled with an admirable social mission, renders King's Kitchen an eatery where one can indulge in a satisfying meal while concurrently contributing to the betterment of the local community. The novel concept behind this not-for-profit restaurant, where 100% of the profits generated from sales are utilized to provide sustenance for those in need, is truly laudable. Moreover, the edibles served at this establishment are not only flavorsome but also fresh, thereby ensuring a gratifying dining experience for all patrons.  During a recent group interview in Uptown, a few of us were seeking a nearby luncheon venue, and given the inclement weather conditions, we opted to dine at King's Kitchen, situated conveniently at the corner of the block. Upon perusing the menu, we were pleased with the variety of options available and thus requested seating. I personally relished the chicken salad croissant sandwich, accompanied by a side of mixed greens salad with balsamic dressing. The sandwich was indeed scrumptious, boasting fresh ingredients and a generous portion size. The side salad, though unpretentious, was likewise fresh and satisfying. The other dishes ordered by my companions appeared equally appetizing. The prices, ranging from $9 to $13 for the lunch menu, were reasonable and reflected the superior quality of the cuisine. Furthermore, the service was attentive, and the staff members were courteous and friendly, further enhancing our dining experience. In conclusion, King's Kitchen offers an exceptional culinary encounter that simultaneously supports a worthy cause, and thus, I am eager to revisit this establishment to sample their dinner offerings.

I enjoyed a lovely brunch on the patio here with some GREAT companions for great conversation.  The eggs were great.  All the pastries I tried were divine.  The bacon was merely satisfactory.  The jelly with the \nmini donuts was AMAZING.  But, they need to stop calling those things beignets.   They were donuts, and by misnaming them I expected something different in terms of fluffiness of the pastry.  The Bellinis were awesome.  Wish they served coffee in bigger cups.

"The tacos possessed an inherent quality that rendered them palatable and uncomplicated, thereby facilitating their consumption in copious quantities. Their diminutive size and affordable price point further contributed to their appeal, rendering it advisable to place an order for multiple units. The horchata, a beverage concocted from rice, exhibited a distinctive flavor profile that was both refreshing and satisfying. However, the beans, devoid of any embellishments or enhancements, lacked a certain je ne sais quoi that might have elevated them to a more rarefied status among their culinary peers. Despite this shortcoming, the establishment still merited a revisit, owing to the overall satisfaction engendered by the aforementioned comestibles."

Funk yeah! This place is the sheet for chilling downtown without the frown. Where else are you going to swamp yourself in artisan suds as well as the classic Shlitz? Rhetorical question--no where.

Just the Tips:
- Roast beef sandwich is mostly awesome.
- They have AZ wines if your man-meter doesn't sink to skunky beers.
- If you want to talk to your pretty lady and retain your voice, sit outside.
- For you veggies and squirrels, the mixed nuts and olives are well portioned.

"This venue offers remarkable French fries, possessing an optimal size, shape, and texture that is unparalleled in terms of crispiness. It appears that all dining establishments within the Mandalay Bay resort share this exceptional quality in their French fries. My memory of the other menu items is somewhat impaired due to the extraordinary nature of these fries. While this eatery may not conform to the stereotypical notion of an upscale Las Vegas dining experience, it nevertheless serves as an ideal setting for a casual midday meal."

Needs to turn on their fans for lunch dining area because its super hot in Tempe area. Overall, i like the music atmosphere is amazing. Customer service was okay but lunch rush hour was busy. Love the burgers! :)

"Effectuate a prior reservation to ensure availability, as we habitually dine at this establishment during our frequent sojourns in Las Vegas, whereupon we have reliably savored the culinary offerings, which have consistently met our expectations. The gastronomical selections we have sampled include, but are not limited to, the sesame-infused poultry, the Mongolian-style beef, and the staple fried rice. Additionally, we have indulged in the delectable dessert option featuring bananas, which has proven to be an unmitigated delight. However, it is advisable to monitor your alcoholic beverage consumption, as the cost of such libations can rapidly accumulate, such as the $9 margarita, although its quality is undeniable."

Went here for my 3rd time. This place is great specially if you're wondering the fashion show mall and you suddenly realize you starving, and you just know the food court isn't what you had in mind...

Today I got both of the specials- swordfish and the lamb (both awesome) I say,...always order the specials at a tapa place- rarely will they let you down!

FYI if you want the happy hour half off tapas you have to be sitting at the bar in order to do so. Which is kind of stupid, but that's just how it goes.... the menu is smaller but hey if you want to save some that's an idea.

"The Manager exhibited an unwavering commitment to ensuring that we felt welcome and that our cycling excursion to the eatery was transformed into an indelible memory, courtesy of his exceptional hospitality. The staff members were incredibly cordial, fostering a warm and inviting ambiance that greatly contributed to our overall satisfaction. It is my conviction that this modest, newly established restaurant possesses considerable potential for development and expansion, ultimately evolving into a premier destination for indulging in both morning and midday repasts."

Vietnamese food made by (lovely!) Vietnamese family. They value fresh ingredients and snappy service.

Established in 2011, this restaurant serves many traditional Vietnamese dishes as well as a few popular 'East Asian' dishes. Plates are heartily-sized and reasonably priced.

My Tom Xao Ca Ri ($12.50) was full of fresh vegetables (not overcooked -- a rarity for this neighborhood's Asian restaurants!) and jumbo shrimp. The original house specialties include Banh Tom Ho Tay (lightly friend shrimp and sweet potato cake, $13) and Ca Kho To (caramelized fish, $10). Their curries pack a welcomed spicy punch. The Canh Chua ($8) are all made with a homemade broth (cooked daily).  

The chef is forthright in sharing his values. MSG disgusts him and so does the 'watery salty stock' that other restaurants use. He also said too many cooks substitute natural ingredient flavor with copious amounts of oil. 

Petite Tonkinoise's only downfall? The decor isn't much to write about. It looks like a confused zen kitsch mini banquet hall.

Last minute dinner plans with my family led us to dine at Puck's, located in the upscale Crystals Mall on the renowned Las Vegas Strip, adjacent to the luxurious Aria resort. Despite the prime location and the fact that it was a Friday evening, we were pleasantly surprised to only have to wait a mere ten minutes before being seated at around 9 PM. The ambiance of the restaurant was characterized by a bright, semi-open space, complemented by a cozy bar area, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere for patrons. \
The attentiveness of the staff was satisfactory, as they ensured that our dining experience was enjoyable and hassle-free. The culinary offerings at Puck's were impressive, particularly the grilled ribeye steak, which was undoubtedly the most expensive item on the menu at $40. However, the flawless preparation of the dish, cooked to perfection at medium rare, accompanied by a rich and velvety reduction sauce that I wished could have been more abundant, made it a worthwhile indulgence. Furthermore, the dish was thoughtfully garnished with a stem of sautÃ©ed mushrooms and blackened green chiles, adding a delightful touch of fieriness to the dish. Overall, the meal was a satisfying start to our culinary adventures in Las Vegas, providing a perfect blend of quality and value. \
Additionally, we sampled their delectable tiramisu dessert, which was adorned with chocolate beads dispersed throughout the creamy layer, offering a delightful contrast of textures and flavors. While Puck's primarily specializes in pasta, pizza, and seafood, their grilled ribeye steak is undoubtedly a commendable option, worthy of recommendation to those seeking a satisfying dining experience.

In search of authentic chicken and waffles I stumble upon LoLo's. The waffles were outstanding, the chicken was amazing and my two friends and I hardly spoke a word as we devoured each bite. The place was clean and the service was warm and friendly. Do yourself a favor and check it out. I know I will again.

The family went last night after visiting North Lake Mall. You order at the counter and they bring you the food. Service was quick. Place was very busy.  I had the half-chicken plate and wife had the pulled pork plate. The plates come with two sides and garlic bread  Children had pork sandwich and chicken fingers. The chicken fingers can be ordered grilled which is healthier than fried  Everyone enjoyed their meals. Portions are good sized.  The BBQ sauces came in three varieties and were tasty. The sweet tea was also good.  Drinks are self-service.  The place was clean and staff was very friendly and helpful  I gave it four stars because the place was much better than average in all aspects and we will return when we are in the area.

"I indulged in the delectable fish tacos, my spouse opted for a succulent bacon cheeseburger, while our offspring delighted in savory corn dogs, and I must say, the culinary experience was nothing short of satisfaction personified."

Update: french fries and hash browns recipes changed. They were better when they first opened. I can't seem to get an answer on the change. Not as good. \n\nGreat place. Great atmosphere. With open indoor and patio dining. Just had their grand opening and the service is getting to match the good good they serve. A must try if you live in the PV/Scottsdale area. Love the San tan hefe!

"In order to accommodate the copious amounts of delectable fare provided by this establishment, it would be advisable to procure supplementary receptacles, such as additional bowls or a container designed for transporting food. The gargantuan proportions of the servings, which are undoubtedly a significant factor in the culinary experience offered by this restaurant, are complemented by the exceptional quality of the cuisine itself. Although it may not conform to traditional Japanese culinary norms, the satisfaction derived from consuming the dishes served here is undeniable. The unadorned udon noodles, available at an affordable price point of less than seven dollars following taxation, constitute the most economical and arguably most satisfying option on the menu. The noodles themselves possess an unusually substantial texture, rendering the inclusion of meat unnecessary. Furthermore, the flavorful broth accompanying the noodles is enhanced by the addition of a cup of chili oil, transforming the dish into a truly delightful and gratifying experience. Additionally, the ambiance of the establishment contributes to its appeal, boasting a welcoming and well-maintained environment that invites patrons to linger and savor their meals in comfort, making it an ideal setting for a leisurely repast."

"While I cannot attest to the veracity of the assertion that my coiffure necessitated an augmented level of effort due to its inherent density, I must confess that I harbor a certain degree of incredulity towards the notion that such a factor should serve as the basis for an exorbitant increase in remuneration. My previous experiences at this establishment had been marked by a hitherto unwavering satisfaction with the quality of service rendered, and it was not until my fourth visit that I encountered this anomalous instance of fiscal discrepancy. It is worth noting, however, that subsequent interactions with the proprietor, Ernie, served to assuage my concerns and ultimately resulted in a gratuitous haircut during my subsequent visit, thereby obviating any further pecuniary disagreements."

"An exceptional lodging experience was had at this establishment, as evidenced by our arrival later than anticipated due to an unforeseen flight delay, which resulted in the relinquishment of our originally assigned accommodations. However, the courteous receptionist offered her sincerest apologies and subsequently upgraded our accommodations to a more spacious room with a superior view of the strip, considered by yours truly to be the most optimal vantage point. 

The aquatic facilities served as the primary motivation for our selection of this hotel, and we were not let down. Two diminutive pools, a tranquil river, and a sizable wave pool (with only one wave every five or ten minutes, it must be noted) collectively contributed to a poolside ambiance that was noticeably more subdued than anticipated. It is worth mentioning that while the daytime pool party, known as 'Daylight,' was in full swing, a substantial cover charge was enforced. 

Numerous dining options surrounding the casino catered well to our culinary needs. Although the prices charged at the bars located within the casino proper were somewhat elevated, such expenses are customarily expected in establishments of this nature. In conclusion, this venue provided an exceptional sojourn, and we would unhesitatingly consider returning in the future."

"Pros: Extremely delectable and scrumptious pastries, frozen desserts, and confectionaries. \n\nCons: A tad excessive saccharinity, resulting in a sensation of surfeit subsequent to a few bites. \n\nThe Red Velvet cake constitutes a definitive preference of mine, concurrently with the establishment's lavatory - ubiquitous mirrors and immaculate cleanness."

"I thoroughly enjoy dining at this establishment, as the culinary offerings are consistently of high quality. The piquant salsa is a particular highlight, complementing the delectable fare served by the attentive staff. Its welcoming ambiance makes it an ideal venue for familial gatherings. \n\nMy usual preference is the flavorful chicken fajitas, which are expertly prepared and presented. Additionally, I appreciate the thoughtful gesture of providing a complimentary bowl of soup accompanied by the customary chips and salsa. A delightful touch, indeed! My offspring also relish the experience."

"I believe this establishment may perhaps rank among the superior wing venues within the valley, in my humble opinion. The wings served here are of considerable size and proportions, and I appreciate that they are not excessively battered, resulting in a satisfying crispiness. Additionally, I find it pleasing that the sauces are not overly applied, allowing the natural flavors of the dish to shine through. Although they may not offer an extensive array of flavors akin to some other establishments, their selection is diverse and well-suited to my taste. Furthermore, the service is prompt, efficient, and delivered with a welcoming demeanor. I must say, I am particularly fond of the rolled paper towels positioned on each table, as well as the provision of wet wipes for post-meal cleanliness. Lastly, their boneless 'wings,' which are substantial in size, deserve mention and praise."

"My excursion to Quaker Steak & Lube commenced with the Atomic Wing Challenge, an endeavor entailing the consumption of six of their piquant atomic wings. Although the quantity may seem paltry, the fiery nature of these wings necessitates a liability waiver prior to indulgence (a gesture primarily intended for dramatic effect). While undoubtedly scorching, the wings remain endurable for individuals possessing a sufficient threshold for pungent cuisine. Those who regularly partake in dishes incorporating habaneros will likely find the atomic wings tolerable. As a helpful suggestion, when ordering the atomic wings, request a pair of food-handling gloves to prevent the sauce from staining your hands, thereby enabling you to touch your eyes or utilize the restroom without inflicting discomfort upon yourself. Following the completion of the challenge, I sampled additional wing varieties, including Louisiana Lickers, Arizona Ranch, and Golden Garlic. Impressed by their flavors, I found the wings to be satisfyingly meaty, a welcome departure from the common practice of serving wings with minimal meat. My sole grievance lies in the slightly exorbitant pricing of $5 for a half dozen wings, equating to $0.83 per wing, which strikes me as somewhat steep. Nonetheless, the superior quality of these wings potentially justifies the cost."

I really like this place. We used to come here often and then didn't for a long time just because we weren't in the hood when they were open. The las two weeks I've been by and had a late lunch. The people that t=run this place are so genuinely nice. The ensalada drink is refreshing in this heat. I usually get a veg papusa and fried plantain. My husband had the chicken soup and loved it and then the chicken special and loved it. I'm so glad we went back.

This marked the culmination of our utilization of the LALALA ramen pass, and it was utterly magnificent to terminate our two-week Los Angeles ramen excursion with such a delectable ramen dish in Las Vegas.

The pork incorporated into our soup bowl exuded a smoky and sultry essence, accented by a faint hint of wood-fired barbecue char, which endowed the flavor with a profound intensity and singularity. The subtlety of the smokiness effectively withstood the multifaceted flavors of the ramen broth, creating a harmonious balance of tastes. Our server displayed exceptional attentiveness, ensuring that we thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience. She persistently lingered near us and even extended her well wishes as we departed.

Ramen Misoya Tomi strives to differentiate itself by introducing unconventional elements to their recipes while maintaining the customary meticulous attention to detail. Although the ambiance could benefit from enhancements, specifically the removal of oversized posters promoting the advantages of miso, the spaciousness of the establishment makes it an ideal setting for gatherings. Despite the prevalence of small, crowded ramen establishments, this venue offers ample space for groups, rendering it a suitable choice for those seeking to accommodate larger parties.

"Culinary offerings possess a marginal propensity towards excessive saltiness, yet the quality of service proffered by this establishment remains laudable. For individuals seeking an experience beyond the standard buffet format, Stratta may serve as a suitable alternative. Notably, the tata beef appetizer earns my highest endorsement."

I love Songbird. I work close by, and it's so nice to have a great coffee house so close. The pastries, which the buy fresh from local makers, are divine. Go for the brioche cinnamon roll and thank me later. The coffee is stellar. I can't even put a finger on what's different, but I'm guessing it's the utmost attention to quality and detail of their product. \n\nSeating is a little sparse, and prices are a little high, but the goods received are worth it.

Tried the lamb kubideh. It was very reasonable pricing, for $7.99 I got a healthy serving of kubideh with rice, and bread. They make the bread at the location! Everything tasted wonderful. And we ended our meal with a Baklava. Do try it!

"SanTan is one of my preferred local brews to procure at the market, ergo, it stands to reason that I would be an ardent devotee of their eatery!  Alas, my lone quibble lies in the fact that there are not an copious amount of vegetarian options available on the menu.  During my most recent visit, I opted for the fish tacos, which, while palatable, did not exactly bowl me over with their extraordinary flavor.  The veggie burger, though adequate, does not particularly distinguish itself from others of its ilk.  Nonetheless, what I hold in highest esteem about SanTan is their assortment of hors d'oeuvres (the pretzel, in particular!) accompanied by their artisanal brews.  It has come to my attention that certain of their burgers have garnered favorable reviews, alas, I cannot personally attest to their quality.  A commendable local establishment - only regret is that it is not more proximal to my domicile!"

I happened upon this establishment a few months ago, when I was seeking to indulge in some self-care and pampering. I must say, I have been thoroughly impressed by the exceptional quality of their services, which are offered at an unbeatably affordable price of $30 for a manicure and pedicure combination. The pedicure itself encompasses a range of luxurious treatments, including a relaxing hot stone massage, warm lotion application, and an invigorating leg massage. Notably, I have visited this salon on multiple occasions, and each time, I have been greeted promptly and accommodated without an appointment. In fact, the staff has consistently demonstrated their proficiency in efficiently ushering me into a massage chair to initiate my pedicure experience.  

However, I must admit that I was taken aback during my most recent visit, when my boyfriend requested the paraffin treatment for his hands. To my surprise, the attendant brought out two plastic bags containing warm wax and instructed him to insert his hands while she secured them around his wrists with a tie. While this method appeared somewhat unrefined, the outcome was indeed impressive, as it left his skin feeling noticeably smoother.  

In light of the exceptional service and value offered by this salon, I am eagerly looking forward to returning this Friday, in preparation for the upcoming sandal season.

I have been an ardent devotee of Villa Deli for a considerable number of years, and my affection for this establishment has yet to waver. In point of fact, I paid a visit to this beloved eatery at midday today, and I was delighted to discover that they have recently introduced pizza to their menu, which is now under new proprietorship. It is worth noting that the quality of their sandwiches remains unwavering and of the highest standard, which is a testament to their commitment to culinary excellence. Furthermore, I must admit that the pizza I sampled was quite satisfactory, although I do wish they would consider offering individual slices for sale instead of requiring customers to purchase two at a time. However, I must express some disappointment regarding the level of service provided by the new ownership, which, while not necessarily poor, lacked the warmth and personal touch that characterized the tenure of the previous proprietors. Specifically, I recall the former owner's customary practice of socializing with patrons, engaging in conversation, and fostering a welcoming ambiance that greatly enhanced the overall dining experience. In light of this, I humbly suggest that the current management endeavor to emulate this aspect of their predecessors' approach, as I am convinced that cultivating a rapport with clientele is crucial to ensuring their continued loyalty and patronage. Notwithstanding this observation, I extend my congratulations on their efforts thus far and wish them continued success in their endeavors.

"Gastronomical excellence and exceptional customer service were the hallmarks of our recent dining experience at this esteemed eatery, specifically on the momentous occasion of my spouse's natal day, which coincided with the nation's celebration of independence on July 4th; and as an added touch of elegance, the wait staff presented a delectable dessert, replete with a sparkling candle, thereby enhancing the overall ambiance and making for a truly unforgettable evening that we would highly recommend to any discerning patron."

We ended up here purely by accident and loved it! We were looking for a place to go dance and as we were walking by Caesar's a guy was outside handing out passes for no cover before midnight. We took the passes and headed into the Casino. Right in front of Pure was another guy handing out the same passes and he told us to get into the Guest List line which was shorter,even though we weren't on the guest list. We were inside the club within 5 minutes of entering the hotel. \n\nPure is pretty much a rooftop club overlooking the strip. I danced for hours just looking at the Eiffel Tower. Can't complain about that, now can you? The DJ was awesome and I wish I can remember his name because I loved pretty much everything he played. The drinks were pretty pricey but I guess you can expect that in Vegas. I'd definitely come back!

"This culinary establishment proved to be exceptional in its offerings, with the pizza exhibiting a minuscule amount of oiliness while simultaneously boasting an abundance of flavor. Furthermore, the accompanying side salad was of considerable quality, allowing us to partake in a satiating experience that spanned across three meals. Additionally, the venue demonstrated impressive efficiency in their delivery service, transporting our order directly to our lodging without delay. Unquestionably, this eatery merits consideration for those seeking a convenient and satisfying dining experience, delivered right to their doorstep."

"This establishment represents the third iteration of the Springs Cafe that I am familiar with, and it appears to have maintained a consistent level of quality. In my opinion, the panoramic vistas and convenient location are the primary factors contributing to its appeal, as the culinary offerings, while satisfactory, do not necessarily excel in terms of originality or exceptional flavors. The menu features a variety of standard fare, such as burgers, wraps, and pizzas, as well as some intriguing specials. However, it is important to note that the food is somewhat overshadowed by the natural beauty of the surroundings. Despite this, I would unhesitatingly recommend paying a visit to this eatery if you find yourself in the vicinity, particularly during favorable weather conditions that allow for outdoor seating on the expansive balcony."

Great addition to Shadyside! I love the massive beer list, big menu, and bottomless mimosa and Bloody Mary option with the brunch. I had the chicken and waffles today and it was the perfect balance of southern diner meets gourmet gravy with bacon maple syrup. I live around the corner... looking forward to going back.

"This establishment may potentially be classified as a sushi restaurant, located in Henderson, Nevada. I had the pleasure of dining here with a colleague, whom I met during my lunch break, as she suggested this venue due to its proximity to our place of employment. They offer an assortment of culinary options, including cooked dishes and an array of sushi selections, accompanied by a beverage menu that features a variety of refreshments, such as green iced tea. Upon perusing their menu, I noticed they offer several lunch specials, which include a combination of six pieces of sushi or sashimi, one roll from a predetermined list, and miso soup complemented by a salad, all for the reasonable price of $12.50. Additionally, they provide patrons with the option to choose two items from a list, known as lunch bentos. However, it is worth noting that all of the lunch bento options are cooked dishes. My preference was to indulge in sushi, primarily to sample the quality of their rice. Following the soup and salad course, I was presented with a visually appealing plate, boasting generous portions of nigiri and a roll. The selection included two pieces each of maguro, distinguished by its profound red hue, nama sake, and hamachi. The presentation was artfully arranged, creating a colorful pattern. Furthermore, I opted for the spicy yellowtail roll as my roll choice. To my surprise, the quality of the food was quite satisfactory, especially considering our landlocked location. The rice was also well-prepared. Our server was both friendly and efficient, ensuring a seamless dining experience. The ambiance within the establishment is tranquil, enhanced by a painting of a cherry blossom on the rear wall. Overall, this eatery is a suitable choice for a quick, satisfying meal on this side of town."

"Culinary excellence abounds at this vegetarian eatery, as evidenced by the fact that even my carnivorous companions expressed a desire to return. Every dish we ordered was brimming with flavor and presented in generous portions, making the exceptionally reasonable prices even more remarkable. It's truly a testament to the establishment's value that I, a voracious eater, could leave feeling thoroughly satiated for a mere $10. However, it's advisable to avoid the Friday night dinner rush, as the restaurant was quite busy and my significant other had to wait approximately 20 minutes after placing her order for her beverage to arrive."

Craving a slice of NY pizza and you live in Vegas? I think we all agree, this place is IT!  Some may complain it's too far from the strip or from Summerlin. Trust me, it's worth the drive. Why didn't I give it a 5 star? Because, I've had NY pizza and nothing comes close to that. Go get yourself a slice.\n\nAnd if you don't care what your thighs will say after you've devoured a pint of creamy ice cream then head on over next door...(I don't remember the name). They have great lucious creamy ice cream. yum!

"Consequently, this particular establishment boasts an exceptionally spotless ambiance, complete with accommodating seating arrangements and a team of personnel who exhibit remarkable proficiency and warmth in their interactions with patrons. Indeed, the management and operation of this Subway franchise serve as a paradigm for others within the industry to emulate, and it is undeniable that we shall eagerly return to partake in their offerings once again."

How have I never reviewed this place before? It's close by so I do come here. Like once a month I show up. 

It has that great dimly lit dive bar feel. You know you could get laid if you wanted to.  The drinks are cheap and the bartenders are cool. 

I like the people most.... you get such a fun variety the normal alcoholics, people in their work clothes, people hoping not to run into anyone they know, and plenty of stoners. Being a semi attractive girl the mostly male patrons treat you like you are family.... the creepy kind they want to kiss... but still family.   You can be relaxed and grab a few beers or get good and drunk either way you will fit  fit in just fine. 

It's worth a trip and when the drunk people get kicked out of Santisi Brothers they walk to the other side if the parking lot and come here.  If nothing else grab a beer and watch the people that come here. 

Also I might note that they only have 1 stall for women but there is often no line and MOST the time it does not smell like farts and coochie.

Such a cool space! The outdoor patio is absolutely beautiful & would be the perfect spot for a group dinner. We sat inside for lunch & started with chips and guac. For my entree I ordered the special of the day, the blackened mahi spinach salad. Huge portion - essentially there was an entire piece of fish on top of a bed of spinach. Definitely couldn't eat the entire thing.\n\nTheir happy hour deals look amazing - I'm sure I'll be back!

It is my unequivocal conviction that diminutive eateries specializing in barbecue and Southern cuisine should be accorded their unique set of patrons' expectations regarding hospitality...I have noticed that smaller establishments tend to operate at their own tempo, forget or modify orders mid-stream, and frequently treat customers as if they were guests in their domicile rather than a commercial dining establishment. Memphis embodies this ambiance; we arrived promptly at the onset of trading hours, which generated minor impediments, including the process of settling accounts, placing tables and chairs, and preparing edibles not yet ready...nonetheless, the positive aspect is that this eatery offers delectable victuals in my estimation. Following the resolution of our order's intricacies, I relished tender, juicy beef ribs boasting a lovely pink circumference that resounded with the unmistakable essence of smoking; the accompanying coleslaw was unusual, yet its distinctive flavor captivated my palate, attributed to the judicious blend of tangy, sweet elements within the dressing, complemented by a subtle hint of mustard. My spouse opted for the pulled pork, though unfortunately, it did not quite measure up to my ribs' culinary excellence, primarily due to the overly saccharine barbecue sauce featuring a piquant aftertaste; however, this minor drawback did not detract from our overall satisfaction. Thus, I wholeheartedly recommend paying a visit to this establishment when in Buckeye and savoring their mouthwatering offerings for yourself.

"Occasionally, benevolent entities manifest themselves in diminutive formats, and such is the case with this inaugural gaming establishment in Las Vegas, erected in 1906. Despite its modest proportions, this boutique hotel and casino exude an air of refinement and elegance, replete with a captivating ambiance that permeates the interior. A distinctive feature that arrests one's attention is the array of vintage slot machines, reminiscent of a bygone era, which serve as a testament to the property's rich history. Furthermore, the meticulous maintenance of the casino floor and immaculate restrooms underscores the management's commitment to providing an exceptional patron experience. During nocturnal hours, the dealers assume the guise of flappers, imbuing the atmosphere with a playful and festive quality. Enrolling in Club 1906 proved a judicious decision, as minimal gambling activities (predominantly engaging in joker poker at the bar while indulging in complimentary beverages) precipitated the receipt of gratis lodging offers via post. The possibility of capitalizing on these accommodations for a future downtown staycation holds considerable appeal. If your itinerary includes a visit to the primary gambling mecca, consider halting at this pioneering casino for a libation or a spirited game of craps; the atmosphere is undeniably convivial."

I'm not in the business of enjoying many buffets these days. My girlfriend doesn't appreciate my ever expanding waste line and my new found squishy qualities as much as I do. So where's the first place I go on a weekend away with the dudes? Buffet.

Nope, the food isn't spectacular, the service isn't worth raving about, and the atmosphere is pretty reminiscent of a fancy high school cafeteria. But, it's a buffet. You pay a small, small price for an endless supply of food. Best part? I had steak, New Orleans chicken, gobs of rice, heaps of ice cream, and some other stuff I can't remember because of the food coma, AND all of it was either respectably OK or even fairly enjoyable. 

Golden Corral will forever have a spot in my heart and a gaping hole in my stomach to fill.

"I thoroughly enjoy this establishment and the diverse array of flavors they offer! They consistently possess an inventory of red velvet cupcakes, which distinguishes them from other eateries that periodically alternate their flavors (a subtle jab at MoJo and Yogurtology, perhaps?). Their most recent additions to the menu, specifically the banana-based and Hawaiian-inspired flavors, have garnered my utmost approval. However, I must deduct a star from my rating due to a glaring omission in their beverage selection; specifically, the absence of juice poppers. It is truly perplexing that a business would fail to recognize the widespread popularity of these refreshing drinks."

"We opted for a brunch excursion, yet our culinary inclinations led us to select items from the grilled cheese menu instead. I relished in the 'wake and bake,' an unparalleled delight that harmoniously combined the richness of cheddar, the savory essence of maple bacon, and the velvety texture of maple mayo. It was utterly sublime, transcending mere mortal taste buds. My companion had the 'blarney stoner,' an open-faced creation that juxtaposed mashed potatoes, beer cheese, and stout gravy atop a foundation of bread, accompanied by fries and hash browns. While not strictly adhering to the definition of grilled cheese, it was undeniably delectable. All grilled cheese dishes are served with tomato soup and fries; the latter were substantial, sporting a crispy exterior and fluffy interior, and offered in various flavors such as old bay - an unimpeachable choice. The tomato soup presented an interesting dichotomy - while not unpalatable, its viscosity verged on excessive, rendering it impractical as a standalone dish, but nevertheless fulfilling its role as a dip for the fries. Our server exhibited commendable proficiency and promptness, leaving no room for dissatisfaction. Moreover, the establishment boasts an impressive array of beers, ensuring our future patronage."

Just to the left of Atria's on the Roberto Clemente Bridge side of PNC Park is where you'll find The Diamond Pizza. 

Not only do they have really good pizza, the cheese is especially good, but you can enter the park there as well. Never a line.  Friendly ticket taker and bag search person greet you at the door, scan your ticket and provide a program along with any promotional items for the game.

Once inside, order by the slice, grab a beer if that's your pleasure and watch the game on either of the TVs before going to your seats. Another bonus, restrooms are just outside the restaurant as you enter the left field corridor. 

Like most pizza/sandwich shops, this one can be hopping. No frills in the service, mustard working folks trying to make good food for the money. And they do.

Well I went in here looking for gifts for others, but only came out with stuff for myself....hummmm something is wrong with this picture! \nI love Ross stores, I shouldn't have even started looking for stuff for me, it get's me every time!

Old-fashioned convivial ambiance and exceptional deals are hallmarks of this establishment, where the prime rib and lobster dishes are served with an abundance of vegetables and a generously sized baked potato, thereby providing patrons with an unparalleled epicurean experience.

"Holly's endorsement is spot on! As a seasoned participant, this marks my second year engaging in this celebrated event. In the previous year, I opted for the cycling segment, which unfortunately encountered organizational challenges, leading to its absence in the current edition. However, I partake in the 5K walk with great enthusiasm, accompanied by my trusty beard, ensuring a seamless experience. My preferred parking location is the north lot, allowing for a swift departure via Sunset. It is worth mentioning that the burgeoning canine population attending annually raises concerns for me. Nonetheless, I must commend the organizers for maintaining a clean environment by encouraging responsible pet ownership. The pre-event entertainment, featuring renowned performers such as Jabbawockeez from the Monte Carlo, dancers from Fantasy at the Luxor, and even five parachuting Santas descending from a helicopter above the boulevard, contributes significantly to the festive atmosphere. Moreover, the unique opportunity to traverse the Sunset freeway by foot, an experience not commonly had, adds to the appeal of this occasion. Most importantly, this event serves as the primary fundraiser for Opportunity Village, a deserving charity in Southern Nevada. Needless to say, I eagerly anticipate my participation in the forthcoming edition, dressed in my finest attire, of course!"

"Yet another triumphant transplant from the culinary melting pot of New York City, this establishment exudes an ambiance of contemporary sophistication, while its menu boasts an array of delectable options sure to cater to diverse gastronomic inclinations. However, navigating the extensive selection may prove daunting for larger groups, as certain dishes lend themselves more readily to sharing than others; in such cases, the assistance of an accommodating server can prove invaluable in ensuring a harmonious dining experience for all parties involved. Furthermore, the atmosphere within the restaurant is vibrant and energetic, with an infectious buzz generated by the confluence of stylish decor, convivial staff, and an eclectic clientele. Ultimately, this venue offers a veritable cornucopia of epicurean delights, rendering it an ideal destination for repeat visits."

"Concealed from plain sight, the eatery's whereabouts had escaped my cognizance, as I had allowed myself to be chauffeured by acquaintances, thus, my inattention to the route traversed rendered me oblivious to its precise location. The restaurant's interior, replete with eccentric, dimly lit ambiance, and diminutive dimensions, augmented by lustrous copper countertops, contributed to an air of uniqueness. My gastronomical inclinations led me to sample the pork enchiladas (of uncertain nomenclature), in addition to partaking in a shared portion of sautÃ©ed garlic dish (the specific appellation of which escapes me). The culinary indulgences proved most satisfying, bequeathing upon my palate an unremitting craving for further exploration of their flavors. However, an unforeseen consequence of my gustatory exploits manifested in the form of an enduring garlic-infused odor, permeating my very being, leaving me with an unshakable sensation of being imbued with the pungent essence for an extended period. Despite this drawback, my patronage of this establishment remains a worthwhile recommendation."

I undertook a personal culinary excursion to this establishment several months ago, and I must say that I am thoroughly delighted that I did, for the consumables served here are indeed delectable. Specifically, I indulged in their spicy meat taco, which proved to be a flavorsome and satisfying experience. Subsequently, I revisited this venue a few weeks later and opted for their burrito, which not only met but exceeded my expectations, surpassing the quality of a similar dish offered by Chipotle. However, I do lament the lack of clarity regarding the nature of the meats utilized in their dishes, as the majority of them are unfamiliar to me, and perhaps a more diverse selection of carbonated beverages or the inclusion of tea would enhance the overall dining experience. Nonetheless, this establishment earns high marks for providing an economical and satisfying dining option, serving scrumptious tacos, burritos, and street corn late into the evening hours.
i really want to give it 5 stars but my carne adovada sometimes is kinda fatty. i love this dish but hate sometimes picking through fat. they do have the best chipotle ranch ever!!!

"The most exceptional Chai Latte within the vicinity. Consumed a chocolate twist and a quiche Lorraine; both possessed an ethereal quality in terms of taste and texture, with the latter boasting an unparalleled lightness that belied its delectability. Procured a ciabatta boule for domestic consumption, which, despite its unconventional moisture level, excelled in its flavorsome presentation."

"Delectable culinary offerings, complemented by exceptional customer service, have solidified this establishment as a recurring destination for our gastronomical indulgences. We unreservedly endorse the sesame tofu, a dish that showcases the pinnacle of flavorsome tofu preparation within the realm of restaurants."

I had to take a star away.  I ordered the Teriyaki Chicken rice bowl and was very disappointed, it tasted really strange and really soggy.  My co-worker said it best, he said it tasted like a frozen meal heated. \n\nI'll stick with the 5 star wraps and salads and leave the 2.5 star bowls for them to keep.

Great performances and acts! The main guy was hilarious and the space was intimate. I only wish Angel had a larger part, but it was fun seeing her doing something out of her element. \n\nP.S. The absinthe is a great gimmick but nothing like what you find overseas. I appreciate that they had it though.

I went back a second time and they have changed the way they make the Wellington.  It now only comes one way you cannot order it medium well or any other way.  Just thought it was funny after my initial review.  Still very good though!

"Jennifer C.'s assessment resonates profoundly. As a native Pittsburgher, partaking in an excursion of my hometown initially seemed counterintuitive, but this particular venture offered a distinctive mode of transportation. However, my enthusiasm for this escapade was somewhat tempered due to the preponderance of emphasis on the Segway experience rather than the educational aspect of the tour. While the Segway ride itself was undoubtedly enjoyable, particularly when the speed restriction was lifted, I had anticipated a more comprehensive and informative guided experience. The guide did highlight a few intriguing tidbits along the way, but ultimately, my expectations remained unfulfilled."

Make certain that your stomach is suitably prepared for an influx of copious amounts of delectable sustenance, lest you risk experiencing a state of culinary satiation bordering on somnolence, should you opt to partake in a dining experience at this establishment; for the servings, far from being modest in their magnitude, are truly enormous and will undoubtedly engender a sensation of lethargy, rendering any subsequent physical activity decidedly challenging. Furthermore, the fries accompanying the various sandwich options are likewise of exceptional quality and will assuredly contribute to your overall sense of gastronomic satisfaction.

"It appears that certain establishments within the culinary industry have been experiencing a dearth of hospitable hosts, as of late. Specifically, the front-of-house staff seem to lack a certain je ne sais quoi, a certain... panache, if you will, that is customarily associated with the profession. However, allow me to digress; our server, Carol, proved to be an absolute delight, her exceptional customer service skills and warm demeanor serving as a remarkable contrast to the initial impression wrought by the podium sentinels. Now, let us proceed to the culinary aspects of our visit. We opted for the tomato caprese appetizer, which, I must say, was truly exceptional. A novel twist on a time-honored classic, the dish featured tomatoes artfully arranged upon the plate, complemented by a sprinkling of chopped tomatoes and a judicious application of fresh red onion. Additionally, a balsamic reduction and a sprinkling of fresh basil added a depth of flavor that elevated the dish to a truly gastronomic experience. While I could easily have consumed this appetizer as a main course, my self-control proved insufficient to resist the allure of the pasta franco. Suffice it to say, the dish did not disappoint; the harmonious union of olives, artichoke hearts, and sun-dried tomatoes resulted in a culinary symphony that, while slightly salty towards the conclusion, was by no means unexpected. In point of fact, I would unhesitatingly order it again. Carol's attentiveness, albeit never overbearing, only further enhanced our dining experience. It is our fervent hope to rectify our regrettable lack of visits to this establishment, and we eagerly anticipate future opportunities to partake in their gustatory offerings."
Come for the coffee, stay (or come back) for the excellent fresh soup, sandwiches and smoothies!  Would be 5 stars if the service was more consistent.
Fast, polite and the food was good.  The Thai Tacos and fried Mac&Cheese was yummy.  Great burgers as well. This is no culinary stop but good fast food.

Great place!  Pretty slow, as you might expect on a Monday night.  Had nice Malbec, great marinaded olives and a perfect-sized sausage and mushroom pizza.  

Decor is very spiffy.  Rather hard to find the place if you're not a local.  Little strip mall right behind the tire store.  Look Arden, as it's worth searching for.

Get in here!!

"Prior to this culinary excursion, my acquaintance with this Chinese restaurant was limited to their midday buffet, which shall serve as the exclusive focus of this assessment. \n\nSubsequently, we have begun to frequent this establishment with increased regularity, and the buffet has consistently demonstrated an impressive profusion of options, ensuring that there is almost always an adequate supply of each dish. My personal preferences within this gastronomic paradise are the 'eight treasures' and the chicken in curry sauce. Summary: A satisfying repast at a reasonable price, devoid of protracted waiting periods."

"Dickey's provided a pivotal salvation to my Thanksgiving festivities by offering a pair of turkey options, specifically the Cajun Fried Turkey and Smoked Turkey, priced at $49.99 apiece, albeit the latter was the sole remaining variety given the dearth of availability at other establishments such as Hash House a Go Go, Mimi's Cafe, Lucilles, and Famous Daves, which had depleted their inventory of turkeys, thereby necessitating a prompt acquisition of the former; fortunately, Dickey's still had one smoked turkey available, which I swiftly secured, much to my relief. The procedure for retrieving the culinary item was remarkably efficient, as I was able to rapidly collect my purchase within a span of five minutes, although it is worth noting that the venue is closed on Thanksgiving Day itself, thus necessitating a pre-holiday collection; furthermore, the packaging was well-designed, as the turkey arrived wrapped in foil and positioned within an oven-safe aluminum pan, facilitating a hassle-free heating process that required approximately two hours to attain an optimal temperature for consumption, much to my satisfaction, given that my companion had recently relocated to Las Vegas and possessed limited cooking utensils, rendering low-maintenance fare a paramount concern; ultimately, the gustatory experience afforded by the turkey was quite enjoyable, with apprehensions regarding the potential lack of traditional Thanksgiving flavors assuaged by its delectable taste, although admittedly inferior to the most exceptional examples I have sampled, yet still meriting appreciation. Moreover, the convenience afforded by Dickey's offerings allowed me to focus on engaging in recreational activities, such as Settlers of Catan and Wii Tennis, rather than devoting extensive time and effort to preparing a substantial avian dish."

We casually sauntered into the eatery subsequent to an exhaustive day, only to discover that a particular dish we had been craving was no longer available on the menu. However, the attentive server accommodated our request by placing an order for a customized surf and turf dish, consisting of an eight-ounce filet mignon and a lobster tail, accompanied by mashed potatoes and a salad. Unfortunately, the mixed greens appeared to be hastily assembled, resembling a haphazard arrangement of shredded iceberg lettuce carelessly dumped into a bowl. Moreover, the lobster tail was slightly overcooked, resulting in an unpleasant rubbery texture. Nonetheless, the filet mignon and mashed potatoes proved to be delectable, catering to my personal penchant for rich, savory flavors. Despite the inconsistencies in the cuisine, the restaurant's cozy ambiance and sophisticated atmosphere remained appealing, leading me to conclude that our unfavorable dining experience may have been attributed to the late hour of our arrival. Thus, I am willing to grant them another opportunity to demonstrate their culinary prowess.

Great old fashioned ice cream parlor!

They have a ton of toppings to create your own or special unique creations. It's a fun place and we had good service. Ice cream was great too. 

It will definitely be a stop of mine next year during spring training.

This place is a whole lot better than you would think. Although it is a chain restaurant the stewed meat they use seems homemade and they give you a giant amount on their tacos. If you want some great cheap Mexican food in a hurry you could do a lot worse. The burritos are beyond huge and everything is very tasty. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Also, choice of a free cookie or small ice cream for dessert.

Short wait.  Television available in news or sport channel. Bring reading material or tablet to pass the time. Mammography technicians were good. Office personnel really nice but a little disorganized. They really try to accommodate patients in.

"A culinary establishment offering an innovative fusion of Asian gastronomic traditions, which has provided me with an exemplary dining experience on three separate occasions, characterized by the serving of delectable dishes such as garlic crab and salt and pepper calamari, albeit with an emphasis on the utilization of sodium chloride and black peppercorns in the latter dish, thereby rendering it advisable for patrons to possess a predilection for savory flavors; furthermore, the ambiance of this eatery exudes an air of sophistication, courtesy of a live jazz ensemble performing ambient melodies, rendering it an ideal setting for either a romantic evening or social gathering with acquaintances, although it may not be suitable for young children due to the complexity of the menu offerings and the potential for prolonged waiting periods between courses, and, owing to my personal preference for convenience, I typically opt for hired transportation rather than risking the unpredictability of parking facilities in the vicinity."

"The culinary delight known as Cheese Ravioli, accompanied by an Alfredo sauce of unparalleled quality, transcended my gastronomical expectations. For the modest sum of $7, I was presented with an adequate quantity of six ravioli, enrobed in a rich, velvety sauce that was complemented by a warm, soft breadstick. The dish was not only satisfying but also possessed an ideal portion size, which satiated my hunger without inducing discomfort. As an aficionado of Alfredo sauce, I can unequivocally attest that this particular rendition is among the finest I have had the pleasure of consuming, boasting an impressive depth of flavor that was neither diluted nor insipid. Although the pizza offerings at this establishment may be somewhat prohibitive in terms of cost, I am eagerly anticipating my next visit, when I shall indulge in additional servings of their delectable pasta."

"The palpable influence of Dogfish Head and Founders on NoDa Brewing Company is evident in the distinctive flavors of their beers, such as the Hop, Drop 'n Roll IPA, which boasts a pungent and zesty character, and the Woody & Wilcox IPA, whose earthy undertones provide a subtle contrast. The Coco Loco, my introduction to NoDa's offerings, masterfully balances boldness and subtlety, making it an ideal alternative to traditional campfire treats. The rest of the brews I've sampled have demonstrated robust complexity and an ability to hold their own when paired with others.

The interior of NoDa BC exudes a familiar taproom ambiance, complete with a bar and assorted seating options. The diverse clientele, consisting of beer enthusiasts and those who appreciate the cultural significance of the establishment, contribute to the lively atmosphere.
