While there may not be any singular aspect that elevates NoDa above other breweries, its welcoming environment and quality beverages ensure its status as a place worth revisiting.

My recommendations include sampling the Coco Loco, despite any reservations about its unconventional style, and taking advantage of the covered outdoor seating area during inclement weather."

"Love my pizza Naked! Let's initiate by stating that I'm simply thrilled to acquire something within the community that doesn't seem like the identical old, same old that permeates each road corner in Phoenix. Subsequently, I eagerly anticipated Naked Pizza. 

I predicted it to be busy on a Friday night once I pulled in. I found a parking spot right at the forefront. I used to be shocked to find out that there was no seating and it had been takeout/delivery solely. However, that is okay if it is tasty! We requested suggestions and were given a couple of recommendations. We ordered a 10" Superbiotic and a 10" BBQ chicken, both on an authentic crust. 

There have been a few folks within the lobby and ordering. It had been clear that they were buzzing around like bees within the back, keeping up with orders, and also the warming oven was full to the brim with boxes of pizza, so they were clearly terribly busy. I waited roughly seven minutes for the pizza, and we were on our thanks to being very happy with the in-store service. 

Once we got the pizza home, I used to be even more impressed. I found the crust to be utterly scrumptious. The Superbiotic was as yummy as any $19 smaller pizza in any wood-fired joint. The crust was tasty and good...Now I am not an enormous pizza eater. My favorite is a White pizza....but this I ate every single solitary morsel of. None left for the dogs or anyone else! 

I was back Sunday and Wednesday. 

Welcome to the neighborhood Naked Pizza!!"

I have been twice since it opened, the first time we went they made a couple mistakes on our order, but they were quickly rectified and it was understandable since everyone there is new. The food has been excellent with good pricing. It's clean with a fun atmosphere. If you simply compare to Baja Fresh and their pricing it's easy to see how much more you get for your money at Wahoos.

I visited this establishment in the company of six other individuals on a Saturday evening, and upon our arrival, we discovered that our table was already prepared and awaiting our presence, which was indeed gratifying. This venue, with its venerable age and abundant charm, was bustling with activity, and it was patently obvious that the wait staff, servers, and busboys were overburdened with work. Following a ten-minute interval, during which we were compelled to hail someone's attention in order to procure bread and place an appetizer order, we encountered considerable difficulty in securing additional menu items or refreshments for our beverages, as our server was noticeably scarce, making appearances only at twenty-minute intervals. Despite the lackluster quality of the service, the culinary offerings were truly exceptional, with each dish I sampled demonstrating meticulous preparation and unparalleled flavor, particularly the gnocchi, which ranked among the most delectable examples of Italian cuisine I have had the pleasure of consuming. Notwithstanding the aforementioned reservations pertaining to the service, I would unhesitatingly revisit this establishment in the future.

"My culinary exploration has reached its zenith, as I have discovered an eatery that serves delectable tacos, which have elevated my gustatory senses to unprecedented heights. I indulged in a triad of street tacos, each featuring a distinct protein; namely, chicken, asada, and pork. The porcine variety boasted a subtle sweetness and a smoky essence, while the asada showcased a proficient use of spices and a smoldering quality. Although the avian iteration did not disappoint, it lacked the same depth of flavor as its counterparts. My spouse allowed me a taste of the Bombero burrito, which elicited an expletive from me due to the presence of a rich, tangy Mexican barbecue sauce. The entire dining experience was well worth the brief journey of 30 minutes. I would enthusiastically partake in every item on the menu, as my epicurean inclinations have been thoroughly satiated by this establishment."

My sibling and I partook of a culinary experience at this establishment, subsequent to our exposure to an advertisement that portrayed the venue as a popular gathering place among celebrities. The advertisement featured images of notable personalities such as Rachel Bilson and Paris Hilton participating in festive events at the restaurant, thus we inferred that the quality of the cuisine must be exceptional. The eatery was characterized as offering gourmet "college food," which resonated with our nostalgia for the convenience foods we indulged in during our academic tenure, when time constraints precluded the preparation of nutritious meals. We sampled the Mini Kobe Burger sliders and the renowned Buffalo Chicken wings, as well as a portion of fries presented in an aesthetically pleasing spiral container. The culinary offerings we consumed were indeed palatable. Although the prices may be considered slightly elevated, the ambiance and gastronomical quality justify the expense, particularly for patrons who appreciate the appeal of a stylish, trendy dining environment within the Bellagio. If given the opportunity, I would recommend indulging in the steak, as it is purported to be among the finest in Las Vegas, according to various critics and gastronomical aficionados.

If had breakfast at this Ahwatukee spot three days in a row. Weekends are busy but the hostess offered seating at the bar. We waited for a table. The chiliquilas were better than expected. The El Jefe was as advertised.  When I ordered the huevos rancheros I got a pancake on the side. The pancake was fantastic and the ranchero is salsa was great. Service was mentioned in previous posts it was good. Busy restaurants have longer ticket times for your meals on way a busy Saturday morning.

I am a huge fan of the Penn Brewery and if you don't know me I am a bit of a booze hound. I love beer! All types, all colors, all ABV's. So I ran in here today for lunch but I  am not allowed to imbibe during work hours. Woe is me....the world is not fair! My point is if you enjoy a beer, just about any type...this is the place to start. I have been here 10+ times and this was my only non-drinking visit. \n\nI enjoyed the Braumeister Steak Sandwich with fries. The food, service and atmosphere were great. Try to find the time to visit this place. Well worth the stop.

Fantastic food! Had drinks & apps at the bar with a friend. A couple great IPA offerings. I am not a big calamari person, but the stewed calamari was outstanding, definitely recommend! Also had a mozzarella caprese which was good. It's a quiet bar, the Sunday night NFL game was playing on the TVs so wouldn't recommend it for game watching, but great place for a date.

My closest acquaintance and I decided to partake in a culinary excursion to Zinburger on a weeknight, and upon our arrival, we discovered that the establishment was teeming with patrons. Despite the fact that we could have secured a table without incurring any delay, we chose to situate ourselves at the bar, which offered us an unobstructed view of the interior of the restaurant. The strategic placement of the bar proved to be a brilliant design element, as it enabled us to observe the vibrant ambiance and simultaneously savor the delectable cuisine.

The fare at Zinburger was indeed costly, but the quality of the dishes we sampled more than compensated for the expense. We elected to divide a Kobe burger, accompanied by double truffle fries and zucchini fries, and complemented our meal with a bottle of wine. The quantity of food we consumed was precisely adequate to satiate our hunger, leaving us both feeling gratified and content (although it is worth mentioning that the wine may have contributed to our enhanced sense of satisfaction).

Based on my exceptionally pleasant dining experience at Zinburger, I am eager to return and indulge in another sumptuous meal. The restaurant's excellence was truly impressive, and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a refined culinary adventure.

"Optimizing your dining experience at Benihana necessitates certain prerequisites, including financial prosperity, a considerable assemblage of companions, and a substantial amount of time to allocate for the culinary excursion. It is an activity best relished on an annual or biennial basis, depending on your social circle's preferences and availability. Upon entering the establishment, you will be greeted by affable staff members who will guide you through the process of selecting your delectable choices. The chef's performance, which incorporates theatrical flames, may potentially cause ocular discomfort, but it undoubtedly enhances the overall dining experience. Although sushi is not their specialty, the hibachi options are highly recommended, particularly for those who appear youthful and can capitalize on the children's menu selections, if available. Additionally, their fried rice is unparalleled and warrants recognition."

"Having perused both the favorable and unfavorable assessments of this boarding establishment, I am inclined to lean towards the former, as my experience with my jack russell terrier at this facility was largely satisfactory. Despite the pricing being slightly higher than I would have preferred, the expansive nature of the facility, reminiscent of Pet Smart's hotel, coupled with the constant socialization and playtime afforded to the canine inhabitants, served to mitigate any reservations I may have harbored regarding the cost. My diminutive dog was accommodated in a cozy pen, complete with its own cot, and I was pleased to observe that there were televisions strategically positioned throughout the premises, broadcasting dog-themed programming and cartoons. The play areas, which catered to dogs of varying sizes, were impressively spacious, with some visible from the check-in desk. Although I did notice minor accidents on the floor during both check-in and check-out, the sheer volume of dogs present made such occurrences appear inevitable. The staff members exhibited remarkable friendliness and hospitality, and I would unhesitatingly reserve space at this establishment again in the future. While it may not be the most ideal location, it is certainly progressing in that direction, and I would have no qualms about recommending it to others."
Great atmosphere, good food and good service. If you are in the Belmont area, a must stop. I had a burger which was great in this little hometown Irish pub.

"This culinary haven, nestled within the luxurious confines of the MGM Grand, offers a welcome respite for those seeking a brief hiatus from the arduous task of slot machine gambling.  The fare served here far surpasses expectations, boasting an elevated standard of gastronomic excellence.  A personal sampling of their delectable pork belly sandwich and caesar salad yielded a truly remarkable dining experience, with both dishes showcasing unparalleled flavors that are simply sublime.  While the pizza, adorned with an assortment of meats tailored to satiate even the most discerning palate, proved to be tantalizingly delicious, its crispness fell short of my expectations, owing perhaps to my inherent bias as a native of the Bronx, where pizza is a staple.  Nonetheless, this establishment earns my highest recommendation."

"The tortillas, boasting an unparalleled quality, had the potential to establish this eatery as a premier dining destination. Upon arriving at 12:30 pm, I was promptly accommodated with both sustenance and seating. The bean and cheese burrito, augmented by a side of guacamole, showcased impeccable taste and freshness. However, the true masterpiece of the meal proved to be the tortillas themselves, which seemed to be handcrafted with care and dedication. Such exceptional quality was not only evident in their taste but also in their texture, leaving a lasting impression on my palate. While the menu may have been somewhat limited, the prices remained reasonable and did not detract from the overall dining experience. Furthermore, the quaint and welcoming ambiance of the establishment, housed within a charming building, only added to its appeal. My appreciation for this restaurant was further solidified upon discovering that America, the proprietor, had opted for a namesake that exuded authenticity rather than resorting to a contrived moniker."

"It is utterly astonishing that in this era of unparalleled economic prosperity, a behemoth of an entertainment company such as Cirque du Soleil would struggle to fill a stadium on a Saturday evening, particularly in the premium seating section. Our decision to attend the performance was rather impromptu, motivated by the fervent desire of my youthful companion to experience the production once more. Upon entering the venue, we were fortunate enough to secure prime front-center seats, which afforded us an unobstructed view of the captivating spectacle that unfolded before our eyes. As I watched the performance for the second time, I was struck by the sheer depth and complexity of the artistic vision that permeated every aspect of the show, from the intricate costumes to the elaborate choreography, all of which combined to create a truly immersive experience for the audience."

At the Waverley Train Station, there are limited options for dining prior to embarking on your journey, and the selection is somewhat restricted, particularly during the evening hours when the inventory of edible items tends to deplete, resulting in an absence of numerous staff members responsible for replenishing the shelves, thereby creating a sense of congestion within the compact retail space.

"Oh dear, it appears we have a novel contestant vying for the accolade of supreme Thai cuisine in Las Vegas. While everyone is familiar with one rival, it seems there is another entry in the commercial area aiming to seize the crown. Prior to this unplanned luncheon excursion, I was oblivious to the reality that Komol presents truly delectable Thai fare. Thus, I found myself venturing beyond my customary boundaries, sampling unfamiliar and intriguing dishes that I would never have considered previously. My reluctance was overcome not once but twice - initially, to visit this establishment, and subsequently, to indulge in a tofu-based entree. What?! No meat?! It turns out, I have been missing out on something extraordinary. The culinary experience unfolded as follows: fresh spring rolls, delightful and remarkably non-greasy; pad kee mow with tofu, a flavorful and slightly spicy (level 3, given my novice taste buds) dish that I initially approached with trepidation but eventually devoured without sharing; and lastly, Panang curry with chicken, a welcome respite for my carnivorous inclinations, albeit still at a relatively mild level 3. Apologies to seasoned Thai gourmands, my nascent palate cannot currently tolerate the fiery intensity; however, with time, I shall gradually elevate my spice threshold to a 10, and undoubtedly, subsequent visits will warrant an updated review to a 5."

I have had the pleasure of visiting this esteemed establishment on two separate occasions, specifically on April 20th, 2013 and January 10th, 2014. On both instances, I must say that the ambiance was quite vibrant and electric, particularly during the latter visit, where the venue was brimming with an animated crowd, resulting in a prolonged wait to access the rooftop area. However, I must admit that the experience was somewhat marred by the excessive density of patrons, which made dancing a rather arduous task. Nevertheless, the first visit proved to be more enjoyable, as the crowd was less congested, thereby allowing us to relish the nocturnal festivities with greater ease. Furthermore, I must commend the bartenders for their proficiency in concocting delectable beverages, especially their rendition of a cosmopolitan, which my girlfriend thoroughly enjoyed. Notwithstanding the occasional overcrowding, I would still highly recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a unique and exhilarating nightlife experience.

"On this occasion, which marks my second visit to this establishment, I must say that I am thoroughly impressed with the efficient manner in which they coordinate their efforts to address the various aspects of my vehicle's maintenance needs, particularly when they have an abundance of personnel at their disposal. Moreover, I must commend them on the expeditious nature of their work, which enables them to complete the task in a timely fashion. Of course, as a cognizant consumer, I am mindful of the potential risks associated with utilizing high-pressure hoses on my recently painted automobile, and thus, I appreciate their willingness to employ the standard hose instead, thereby ensuring that my vehicle remains in pristine condition. Additionally, I was pleased to note that they offered to bundle their services, thereby affording me the opportunity to realize significant savings on the interior detailing of my car."

The beau and I stopped by on a whim whilest exploring our new city and it's probably the best find so far. 

Walking in for a late dinner we were happily greeted and easily seated. Service was prompt and pleasant. We ordered some garlic naan, chicken tikka masala and chicken vidaloo. All came out within 10 minutes and boy was it amazing! The tikka masala was creamy and fresh. My beau ordered his vidaloo spicy, and it was the perfect amount of spicy.  We've been back at least 8x since and always end up happily full. (ITIS!)

I can't wait to try the lunch buffet!

"Culinary excellence is the primary draw of this establishment, as the ambiance and clientele fail to impress. Despite the diminutive dimensions of the venue and the unremarkable character of its patrons, the gastronomical delights available here are truly exceptional and competitively priced. As such, I have no qualms about frequenting this eatery solely for the purpose of savoring its delectable offerings, even if it means tolerating an environment that falls short of my expectations in terms of both aesthetics and social appeal. While I would readily bestow a perfect rating upon this restaurant were it not for its physical constraints and unsatisfactory patronage, I must deduct a star from my overall assessment due to these factors."

If you are serious about looking like a pimp, this is absolutely your destination.  There are a mix of consignment items and new pimp-gear.  I drooled over the three ties painted with Vargas girls ($100 each).  Oddly, almost everything I looked at was priced at $85.  The woman working there did not get off the phone or offer to help me the entire time I was there.

"I derive immense pleasure from meandering through this establishment, as they possess an extensive array of vibrant ornamental items, encompassing furniture, sculptures, and an assortment of other decorative pieces, including, but not limited to, oscillating turtles. Furthermore, I acquired several decorative tiles at a remarkably affordable price point of $1 apiece. These distinctive and economical gift items are ideal for presenting to individuals as a means of expressing appreciation or commemorating a special occasion, particularly when seeking to bestow upon them a token of Arizona-inspired culture."

Came on a Saturday morning at 9:30am and we were seated immediately, service was very nice.  I greatly enjoyed my Brunch Des Cantons, perfectly cooked beans and various pork.  My fiance liked her Brunch Sucre, but wasn't blown away by it.  Solid Coffee and OJ included with brunch.  All in all a very pleasant experience.

"I had the dubious distinction of experiencing an unforeseen health crisis during my sojourn at this esteemed medical facility in September of 2007, which necessitated two separate visits within a brief period. Upon reflection, it appears that a confluence of factors, including an allergic response and a virulent pathogen, precipitated a rather harrowing episode characterized by a near-asphyxiating sensation and an alarming diminution of consciousness. Following a judicious assessment of my symptoms, the attending nursing staff, whose proficiency and expertise were manifestly evident, elected to admit me for observation and appropriate treatment. My sincere appreciation is extended to these consummate professionals, whose solicitude and empathy greatly alleviated my anxiety and discomfort. Furthermore, I must commend the hospital's commitment to providing comfortable and well-appointed accommodations, as my spacious private quarters were furnished with all the amenities one could reasonably expect. Notably, the staff demonstrated an admirable willingness to heed my concerns regarding the peculiarities of my vasculature, and their judicious deployment of a butterfly needle facilitated the administration of necessary medicaments with minimal discomfort. Additionally, my family members, including my partner, parents, and daughter, were afforded the opportunity to visit me and express their support, and they too were impressed by the exceptional quality of care I received. In the event that fate should conspire against me once again, I would unhesitatingly opt to seek treatment at this institution, as my trust in its capacity to provide exemplary medical attention remains steadfast."

It is gratifying to observe that the standard of excellence upheld by Panera remains consistent across diverse geographic locations, including the Madison, WI branch. The culinary offerings at this establishment are of superior quality, and the staff exhibits a commendable level of professionalism and dedication to providing exceptional customer service. Although this particular location experiences a high volume of patrons, the efficient and well-organized service ensures that customers are served in a timely manner, minimizing delays and optimizing the dining experience for all involved.

"For gastronomical aficionados seeking delectable burger culinary experiences, the eatery under scrutiny provided an adequate, albeit unremarkable, dining adventure. Our server, Dominic, exhibited exceptional hospitality and proficiency in his role, contributing positively to the ambiance of the venue. Although this critique may seem tardy, allow me to emphasize that my recollection of the edibles availed at this establishment remains somewhat limited, with the exception of the boundless french fry offering, which proved a delightful accompaniment to my primary dish. Unfortunately, my memory fails to recall the specific designation of the burger I ordered, which, to my dismay, displayed a conspicuous lack of moisture. In spite of this minor drawback, I remain willing to accord the restaurant another opportunity to demonstrate its culinary prowess, should fate guide me to its vicinity once more."

The first time i had Burrito Boyz, I was at a meeting where the food was catered. I had no idea where my mystery burrito fell from. 

My first impression? It was the best burrito I've ever had. Brain: "Wow there like avocado in here too". What else can i say? They put everything you could possible want (and things you didn't know you wanted) in your burrito. 

I've been to the Toronto location a few times the food tastes the same. The quality, service, and price at this location however is not up to par.

But whatever, you came for the burrito.

Hubby and I indulged in an evening of epicurean delight at this establishment, savoring the delectable sushi and beverages that the venue had to offer. We opted to visit on a Saturday evening, which proved to be a pulsating and vibrant experience, courtesy of the resident disc jockey who orchestrated an atmosphere that was lively yet not overpowering. The ambiance afforded us the opportunity to engage in fervent people-watching, adding to the overall enjoyment of our culinary adventure. Our server, a charming and erudite individual, provided exceptional service, demonstrating a profound familiarity with the menu and its offerings. Suffice it to say, we shall indeed revisit this eatery in the future.

"I indulged in a delectable luncheon at this establishment in the company of my significant other, whereupon we opted to utilize alternative modes of transportation, specifically cycling and walking, thereby granting us an additional 20% discount. Furthermore, we took advantage of the Foursquare check-in promotion, which offered an additional $5 discount when using our American Express card. The ambiance was tranquil, fostering a relaxed atmosphere during our visit. We relished the flavorsome trout and happy hour fish and chips, both of which were cooked to perfection. Notwithstanding, I did feel a tad pressed for time throughout the meal, yet the culinary offerings and beverages were undeniably impressive. The fish and chips were remarkably fresh, boasting a satisfying crunchiness, while the trout dish was adorned with a medley of green beans and peanuts. Additionally, I requested a side of mashed potatoes, which were skillfully prepared, maintaining a delightful firmness without succumbing to sogginess. In conclusion, my experience at this eatery was thoroughly enjoyable, and I look forward to future visits."

"It was indeed a thoroughly enjoyable experience that we had the pleasure of indulging in. My palate tends to be rather discerning when it comes to wine, but that proved to be no obstacle for this establishment, as they were able to proffer an alternative that perfectly met my expectations. The crustacean delicacies, specifically the lobster and crab legs, were utterly delectable and left me in a state of gastronomic nirvana. Moreover, the staff was accommodating enough to allow me to tailor my own unique dessert creation, which further enhanced the overall dining experience. It is worth mentioning that securing an outdoor table during the reservation process is highly recommended, as the accompanying view of the lake, complemented by the captivating light display, serves as the proverbial 'icing on the cake.'"

"For a weekend breakfast excursion, Toast offers an optimal dining experience, boasting brisk and attentive service delivered by a cohesive team of waitstaff who collectively ensure that all patrons' needs are met expeditiously, including timely coffee refills and prompt attention to any other necessities that may arise. Moreover, the eatery's pricing strategy is eminently reasonable, with the vast majority of breakfast entrÃ©es priced at an affordable $8 or lower, while still showcasing a marked superiority in terms of culinary quality relative to other establishments within the same price range, particularly with regard to their eggs, coffee, cornbread, fruit, and other breakfast staples. In addition, the fruit salad served at Toast is of exceptional quality, rivaled only by homemade preparations crafted in a well-stocked kitchen. Furthermore, the restaurant's welcoming atmosphere makes it an ideal destination for families with young children, as the speedy service and moderate prices create an environment conducive to stress-free dining experiences for all generations, including grandparents who will appreciate the familiar tunes playing in the background. If, however, one's gastronomic expectations extend beyond Toast's offerings, alternative options such as The Gallery, CafÃ© Monte, or Zebras provide comparable breakfast fare at roughly double the cost; nonetheless, for those seeking a judicious balance between gustatory satisfaction and economic feasibility, Toast emerges as the optimal choice."

"Unexpectedly delighted by the diverse culinary options presented at this seemingly unassuming establishment, which initially appeared to be yet another quaint delicatessen, I was compelled to express my satisfaction and note that the menu boasted an impressive array of delectable selections catering to diverse tastes and dietary preferences, thereby eliciting my desire to return and indulge in a more comprehensive gastronomical experience."

"If you are an ardent aficionado of Hip Hop and R/B, then this establishment serves as an ideal venue for your indulgence. My personal experience at this locale was nothing short of exceptional, as I relished the delectable fare offered by their menu, specifically the fire pit, which, although priced at a premium of $50, proved to be a worthwhile investment. Unbeknownst to me at the time, the Rum Jungle undergoes a metamorphosis post-restaurant hours, transforming into a pulsating club, thereby precluding the need to migrate to an alternative venue. My subsequent visit in November of 2009 reaffirmed my initial impression, as the ambiance remained consistent, characterized by an unwavering adherence to Hip Hop and R/B, complemented by potent libations and an array of diverse rum offerings. The verdict, therefore, is unequivocal: a resounding endorsement of the Rum Jungle, owing to its captivating ambiance, robust beverages, and strict allegiance to the aforementioned musical genres."

Prices are good and portions are great. I almost couldn't finish all my food. I've been here for breakfast and dinner and was satisfied with both my visits! The staff was very friendly and you don't have to wait very long for your food. Will most likely return in the future.

"Appearances can be misleading! We have repeatedly traversed this establishment's vicinity, dismissing it as a run-of-the-mill drinking establishment nestled within a nondescript strip mall. How erroneous our assumptions proved to be! Upon entering, our initial trepidation quickly dissipated, replaced by an atmosphere that exuded both warmth and sophistication. The interior design, adorned with tasteful embellishments, effectively created an ambiance conducive to a gratifying dining experience. Our culinary expectations were not only met but exceeded, as the fare served was of superior quality, rivalling that of esteemed restaurants. However, a minor quibble prevented me from conferring a perfect rating. On Fridays, the customary fish fry takes center stage in Wisconsin, compelling me to indulge in the all-you-can-eat variation. Although the initial serving was generous and adequately prepared, its prolonged arrival time and the absence of any inquiry regarding additional helpings slightly tarnished my overall satisfaction. Notwithstanding this, our eagerness to revisit this establishment remains undiminished."

The parking and long wait, mentioned by many, is worth your time if you love Texas style BBQ. The resemblance to Franklin BBQ in Austin is uncanny in quality and concept. Only suckers show up at the longest line at 11:00am, come after the rush at 1:30pm to wait in a shorter line.

"It is my fervent desire that we had allocated a greater amount of time to exploring Fremont Street during our visit to Las Vegas, as I found the atmosphere there to be significantly more welcoming and comforting than the overwhelming extravagance of the Strip. The eclectic blend of street performers, historically significant landmarks, and cutting-edge technology created a unique and captivating ambiance that, while slightly tinged with seediness, was still markedly distinct from the comparatively sanitized and commercialized environment of the Strip. Furthermore, utilizing public transportation to reach Fremont Street resulted in a lengthy and arduous journey, whereas opting for a taxi cab provided a vastly superior experience. \n\nMy appreciation for the assorted dining establishments and watering holes situated along Fremont Street was considerable, as they exuded a palpable sense of nostalgia and offered prices that were considerably more reasonable than their counterparts on the Strip. The laid-back demeanor of the patrons and staff, coupled with the absence of pretentiousness, contributed to an unpretentious and convivial atmosphere that was refreshingly reminiscent of a bygone era. Moreover, the plethora of exceptional eateries and the impressive video screen only served to enhance the overall appeal of this historic district."

"Cleanliness was exemplary, with an immaculate ambiance that exuded a sense of refinement and sophistication. Prices were reasonable and proportionate to the high-quality culinary offerings, ensuring a satisfying dining experience without breaking the bank. The menu was uncomplicated and straightforward, allowing patrons to easily navigate and choose from a variety of delectable options. Particularly noteworthy were the mouthwatering cheesesteaks and crispy fries, the latter of which were cooked to perfection and infused with a generous amount of genuine cheese that added a rich, creamy texture. However, it is worth mentioning that the cheese fries may have been excessively indulgent for some palates, bordering on overwhelming due to their intense flavor profile. Nonetheless, this did not detract from the overall exceptional quality of the restaurant, which warrants a future visit."

I love the furniture here! We went in looking for a coffee table and a large ottoman.  Pricey but all of the pieces are unique. Place was not busy and sales people did not circle you like road kill. They also didnt say hello, so I took a star. We were able to browse through and didnt have any questions so it didn't bother me that they didnt greet us. Large and small pieces to go in any room. Looked like they had a design center. Didn't find the perfect piece today.

"Arrived at this establishment in the company of an individual hailing from the land down under, with the intention of partaking in the quintessential American dining experience, and, indeed, our expectations were surpassed by the hospitable reception we received. As a British national and an Australian, we effortlessly established a rapport with the staff, engaging in amicable banter and hilarity. The culinary offerings were of exceptional quality, particularly the chilli cheese fries, a delicacy that is both challenging to locate and savour in my native land; the Chicken Philly cheese steak was equally impressive, with its flavours expertly balanced and presented with commendable expediency. The prices were remarkably reasonable, and the service we received was both attentive and cordial. I would unquestionably relish the opportunity to return for a midday repast."

A small legit Irish bar, with wood paneling throughout the interior makes for an intimate neighborhood feel. Monterey pub is a great place to spend a late weekend afternoon or wolf down comfort food with friends. A perfect place to stop by after a visit to the museums in the North End, as well.  The pints are well-poured and the drinks are good and cheap. The food is super-hearty. All of the beef seems to be marinated in Guinness (which is excellent). Try the boxty's if you're feeling adventurous.\n\nThis may be obvious, but if you're looking for the pub, it's on Monterey street (look for the YMCA at the end).

"The pinnacle of cheese curds, an unparalleled culinary experience that transcends the mundane and enters the realm of gastronomic nirvana. A veritable cornucopia of dairy delight, each bite a symphony of flavors and textures that will leave even the most discerning palate satiated. Pair it with a stein of frothy brew, and the resulting fusion of taste and aroma will transport you to a realm of pure, unadulterated bliss. But be warned, dear gourmand, for such pleasures come at a price; the portion sizes, while generous, may prove to be a challenge for those of lesser appetites, and the prices, while eminently reasonable, may induce a state of financial euphoria that could lead to reckless indulgence. And, of course, we must not forget the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance, the cheese curds themselves, a golden, crispy delight that will leave you craving for more. In short, a dining experience that defies all conventions and redefines the very notion of culinary excellence."

Although they possess an establishment at the Beverly Center in California, I have indulged in culinary delights at this particular venue on the last two occasions that I have visited Las Vegas. I believe that if one is seeking a pleasant, adequate, comfortable, and economical dining experience subsequent to expending a considerable amount of currency gambling, then this restaurant would be an ideal selection. The portions are copious, and we were all unable to consume all of our food! I had the salmon that was prepared in three diverse manners, and I thoroughly enjoyed it! Additionally, we requested the beignets (sp?) for dessert, and it was significantly superior to those offered at Disneyland. I highly recommend this establishment if one does not feel inclined to dine at any of the other upscale restaurants in Las Vegas. However, it is worth noting that our server made an error on our bill by charging us twice for gratuity or something (my companion astutely observed this, while I was oblivious to it), and he only briefly returned to attend to us or replenish our beverages. Furthermore, we consumed our meal on a Sunday evening around 10 o'clock, which rendered the atmosphere relatively tranquil.

I wanted to give their coffee a shout out.  I received two cups of coffee today from a student of mine unexpectedly.  Once was Creme Brulee and the other was Sugar N Spice.  He said to try one or both and spread the love about them.  I gave the other cup to my co-worker and they enjoyed it!  I don't live in that part of town, but thought this was the least I could do.  I'm a big supporter of buying local and spending local.  Tasty coffee with a twist! Hopefully one day I will be in that part of town and will drop by!

I am thoroughly enamored with this establishment, having had the fortuitous opportunity to encounter it serendipitously; however, my familiarity with it has since transcended that of a novice. My spouse, who had previously been unacquainted with such indulgences, capitalized on their special Valentine's Day package designed for couples, thereby inaugurating his initiation into the experience; subsequently, he accompanies me on each subsequent visit. Following our therapeutic session, we both experience a profound sense of well-being; the tariff, a mere $30 for a sixty-minute duration, is truly reasonable, particularly given the exceptional quality of their massage therapy. In my previous residence of Yakima, Washington, such a facility was nonexistent.

"Having been intrigued by this establishment for an extended period of time, I recently had the chance to experience it firsthand alongside a few colleagues. Following a training session in Phoenix, we found ourselves in pursuit of a suitable venue for lunch, which led me to utilize my GPS device to search for nearby dining options. Upon discovering Chino Bandino, I enthusiastically shared my desire to visit this restaurant with my fellow coworkers, who were equally eager to partake in this culinary adventure. \n\nUpon arriving at the eatery during the peak lunch hour, we were immediately struck by the bustling atmosphere and diverse clientele. However, our confusion quickly dissipated as a friendly staff member approached us and offered assistance, prompting us to explain our status as newcomers. In response, he graciously escorted us to a cozy side bar, where we were treated to samples of various delectable dishes, including the signature Jade Chicken, savory Carnitas, flavorful black beans, and expertly prepared fried rice. Needless to say, we were thoroughly impressed and eagerly placed our orders, settling in for a satisfying feast. As the afternoon progressed, we found ourselves suitably satiated, with the delightful Snickerdoodle serving as a welcome complement to our late-day snack. Unanimously, we agreed that this excursion was a resounding success, and we look forward to revisiting this culinary gem in the future."

"Viv B., an atelier of unparalleled taste and refinement, boasts an array of exquisite adornments, artwork, and olfactory delights that cater to the discerning patron seeking a unique and sophisticated shopping experience. Although the boutique's apparel selection may be limited in scope, its carefully curated assortment showcases an unwavering commitment to elegance and style, much like the proprietor's revered grandmother, whose likeness graces the premises with a sense of regal benevolence."

(New patient)Got here at 545, waited til 6 when they opened. Got put into a room right away, waited 20ish mins to see the vet. Told her the issue, she took her back for a full exam. Exam costs $42 (she's a chihuahua so it might vary by size). Clipped her nails (I'm a horrible parent, they were very long, $10).\nShe ended up needing a ton more done (xrays, blood tests, went home w/2 meds) bill was $700 and no diagnosis.. no broken paw or anything abnormal in tests, she's just in horrible pain and can barely use her left front paw/leg.Sent home with pain meds and anti inflammatory. Back a month later for same thing. Super nice doctors, staff can seem a bit in a hurry/rushed/not concerned. but all in all good =] we're back a few times a month for nail clipping
This place is fun and the food is delicious, great service and location! Try it before or after catching a movie!

"Wow, this cinematic establishment exudes an aura of exceptional quality, surpassing my expectations with its pristine facilities and impressive amenities. Despite my initial unfamiliarity with this particular cinema, my first-time visit has yielded a profoundly positive experience, underscored by the spotless and contemporary restrooms, an optimal theatre size, and an extensive array of delectable offerings at the snack bar. My inclination to return to this venue in the future is unequivocal, ensuring that my cinematic exploits will continue to be satisfied by this theatre's superior standards."

Firstly, permit me to express my utter satisfaction with the culinary experience offered by this esteemed eatery! The gastronomical delights presented before us boasted an impressive array of flavors, undoubtedly tantalizing our taste buds. Nonetheless, a caveat emerges in the form of a pecuniary concern, prompting a natural inclination to draw comparisons with other establishments offering similar fare at a relatively more reasonable cost. To elucidate, the delectable appetizers proffered by Halcyon, while unquestionably delightful, carried a price tag that some might consider exorbitant, amounting to a whopping fourteen dollars! This observation compels me to juxtapose the former with the Harvest Moon Grille, a dining destination renowned for its superior quality and comparatively greater value. Indeed, a cursory examination of their menu reveals a striking discrepancy in pricing, with the latter offering arguably more generous portions at a lower cost. Furthermore, my personal experience with the Ribeye Spackle served as a prime exemplar of this phenomenon; although the dish itself proved satisfying, the cooking method employed by the chef deviated somewhat from my expectations, specifically regarding the degree of doneness. Admittedly, such inconsistencies may be attributable to isolated incidents or momentary lapses in execution. Be that as it may, the desserts, though undeniably delectable, seemed to carry an inflated price tag, exceeding twenty dollars apiece! In light of these observations, I feel compelled to recommend that ardent devotees of Halcyon consider a comparative analysis between this establishment and its neighboring counterpart, Harvest Moon Grille, in pursuit of a more comprehensive and satisfying dining experience.

After hearing several people Rave about Pho Kim Long, I decided to check it out; and I can say I was not disappointed.

The place is fairly big and we were seated immediatley (there can be a wait but they burn and turn pretty fast). The staff was attentive and we had several people swing by the table to make sure we were doing OK.

The menu is impressive, I was just expecting your average Pho place, but they menu covers much more, apps, Pho, entrees, smoothies, and much much more.

I decided on the #11 Rare Steak and Brisket Pho. I also got an order of the Chinese Doughnuts to start.

My only complaint is that the doughnuts were plain, when I usually order them they're covered in sugar, but a little quick thinking and I was using the remaining Peanut Sauce from my companion's spring rolls for a great dish.

The Food came out insanely fast, the apps were good, but the Pho stole the show. The Steak and Brisket were both tender and delicious. The noodles were plentiful, and the broth was rich.

I will be going back without a doubt!

True to the City of Sin ... this airport is dirty and seedy ... Love it!\n\nGot through security pretty quick ... nothing out of the ordinary.  I don't know what people expect from airport security personnel ... they hear people bitch & moan all day long ... so it's expected that they'd be pissed off all the time, too.  Grab your crap and move on ... cause it just doesn't matter in the grand scheme of life!!!

"Have had the pleasure of experiencing the exceptional hospitality of this esteemed establishment on two separate occasions, and must say that the level of service has been consistently impressive. Furthermore, I must note that this hotel is an ideal venue for conventions, as it boasts an expansive and well-appointed convention area. The accommodations are nothing short of luxurious, providing an oasis of tranquility after a day filled with training, networking, and socializing. The spaciousness of the rooms allows one to fully unwind and recharge, making it the perfect retreat for business travelers such as myself. While I cannot comment on the cost, as my employer graciously covered the expense, I would like to extend my gratitude for their generosity. In conclusion, I would eagerly return to this hotel for future conventions and leisure stays, as it embodies the essence of the Las Vegas experience."

"The establishment boasts an exceptionally robust quality, offering an impressive array of expertly crafted cocktails, particularly those featuring tequila, which garner immense appreciation from connoisseurs. The menu showcases a harmonious fusion of traditional Latin American flavors with contemporary twists, resulting in delectable dishes such as duck empanadas that surpass expectations. The ambiance exudes a refined yet relaxed atmosphere, fostering an enjoyable experience further enhanced by the attentive and knowledgeable bar staff. Overall, this venue offers an unforgettable sojourn for those seeking a sophisticated, indulgent escape."

Overall i thought that this buffet was one of the best buffets that i have ever been to. They had many different variety of meats such as lamb and primb rib (which were cooked really well). I am usually very picky with slider but the one at this buffet was amazing. The ramen was decent and so were the crab legs. This buffet had a giant variety of many different types of food and they all hit a good level of satisfaction. Not a big fan of buffets but this one is an exception for me.
Great work day gym to hit during lunch.  Just wish they would stop playing teeny bopper estrogen music in the men's locker room. ... Damn!!!

My go to cheap Chinese lunch spot on Harris Blvd.  The price is right.

Its a great cheap lunch special($5-6 with eggroll) but sometimes the free tea tastes a little funky, so I don't drink it a lot of the time.  The chicken is real meat, the sauces aren't too salty and, there plenty of veggies with every dish.

That said, don't expect to be wowed by some 100% traditional Cantonese or Szechuan food.  This is Americanized Chinese and it gets the 4 stars because of food per $.

This is a cool bar. It's relatively small inside, but it's a cool environment and there's a variety of places to sit - high top tables, bar seating, cushy chairs and couches, etc. \n\nI can only speak for the beverage selection, and it's pretty solid. Typical impressive beer selection evident in most Madison bars and decent drinks. I've heard great things about the food, especially the sandwiches and wraps... looking forward to eating here sometime soon!

"I visited this establishment for the inaugural time and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The cost of approximately nine dollars for lunch was undoubtedly a reasonable price to pay. Although, there were some minor drawbacks, such as a moderate delay and congested pathways teeming with children exhibiting boisterous behavior. Nonetheless, these aspects contribute to the ambiance of a buffet. Equipped with a chocolate fountain bar and a cotton candy machine, I would unhesitatingly recommend this venue to any individual possessing a penchant for sweets. Furthermore, the assortment of cuisine was diverse and satisfactory, with no particularly sophisticated options but neither were there any unpalatable dishes. Considering the cost, I would unquestionably suggest giving it a try."

"Excellent culinary discovery in the northern region! 

Fried Chicken - most delectable deep-fried poultry dish I have had the pleasure of consuming, with a generous serving size ideal for two individuals. 

Catfish - quite satisfying, albeit slightly lacking in quantity. 

Burgers - merely adequate, with a flavor profile reminiscent of a standard beef patty. The moniker 'Hamburger Hut' seems somewhat misleading, given the unremarkable quality of their burger offerings. Haha

This establishment functions as both a convenience store and an eatery, with a primary focus on the latter. Judging by the persistent bustle and consistent customer demand for their fried chicken, it appears that this venue has gained considerable popularity. 

Please note that parking facilities are restricted, accommodating only a maximum of seven vehicles."

It was an utter delight to witness your critique of this Eat'n Park, Darren, albeit not entirely unexpected given its propinquity to my former domicile and preferred watering hole, Wilkie's Inn, which unfortunately has ceased operations. Despite the prevalence of unsavory recollections stemming from inebriated acquaintances engaging in physical altercations and heated disputes within its confines, this eatery remains unparalleled in the aftermath of an evening spent imbibing at the aforementioned establishment. Mental images of scrambled eggs, French toast, and delectable burgers accompanied by a side of pickles continue to tantalize my taste buds, not to mention the irresistible Eat'n Park smiley face cookies that have captured my heart. I implore those unfamiliar with Pittsburgh's culinary treasures to indulge in a visit to this Eat'n Park or any other branch, as it is bound to leave an indelible mark on one's gastronomical experiences.

"An indulgent lodging establishment boasting an expansive recreational facility situated atop its structure, providing an unparalleled experience for thrill-seekers! My kin and I acquired accommodations at a remarkably reasonable rate (sub-$100), which, while not lavish, offered a diverse array of amenities. Although not a luxury establishment, it possessed a certain je ne sais quoi. The edifice featured multiple dining establishments and a rooftop aquatic venue (during my visit). The elevated swimming pool presented an unique opportunity for aquatic volleyball enthusiasts, while the observation deck afforded breathtaking vistas of the adjoining amusement park's pinnacle attraction. As guests of the hotel, we enjoyed complimentary access to this exclusive area, strategically positioned in close proximity to the renowned Las Vegas Strip."

This establishment boasts an ambiance that exudes a sense of cleanliness and welcoming charm, rendering it an ideal destination for both family and friend gatherings. My culinary exploits have led me to discover that the pizza served here is of remarkable quality, albeit not quite on par with the gastronomical masterpieces offered by renowned establishments such as Spinato's or Grimaldi's. Nonetheless, the thin crust and innovative topping of ground hamburger elevate it to a level that surpasses the standard fare typically associated with bars. Additionally, the premises are equipped with an array of entertainment options, including pool tables, shuffleboard, and numerous televisions, thereby creating an atmosphere conducive to lively social interactions. Aside from the delectable pizza, my affinity for focaccias has been gratified by the impressive offerings presented by this venue. Weekends, in particular, prove to be an optimal time to visit, as the excitement of sports games permeates the air.

To transported a second-generation iPad from my place of employment to their establishment for the purpose of rectifying an issue, specifically, the device was in need of a new protective glass surface, which was successfully replaced within a time frame of approximately six hours, at a total cost of one hundred twenty-nine dollars, inclusive of taxes, and although the ambiance of the store could be improved, I was generally content with the quality of the service and repair provided, furthermore, they offer a ninety-day guarantee on their work, which served as an additional source of assurance, and the location of the shop, situated directly off Mill Avenue, enabled me to easily park and quickly enter and exit the premises to deposit and collect the device.

If you have been to some of the Asian buffets in AZ, and you've liked them, I'd say you must try Jasmine Tokyo. 

I'm 6'4" and I get "Do you play for the Cardinals?" a lot, so I'm sure that when the proprietors see me darken the door of their establishment they're all like "ohsh*t." Fear not, lil Asian lady, for I am not a glutton. I'm here for the seafood and the sushi and some green tea.

As far as the sushi selection goes, it beats anything AYCE in the Valley that I've seen. There were at least 20 types of rolls and it wasn't just surimi crab and tempura, either. The tuna and salmon and snapper nigiri were really good, too.

If you have room for some fried rice, this one is delicious and so are the Chinese sausages and grilled chicken. Even the raw oysters were good, and that has never happened to me in AZ before.

Service was pleasant, and from the way it's decorated, I'm guessing this was once a Claim Jumper. Anyhow, it's a huge restaurant with a huge selection of items and if you're a vegetarian, you will be in heaven here with more vegetarian offerings than I've ever seen at a buffet. 

Seaweed is a vegetable, isn't it?

ah, Bouchon.  So many people talk about this place but I had never been.  First, it's in a ridiculous location as others have noted.  Everyone else's reviews are very poor in their direction.  I think someone said that it's in the southwest area of the Venetian.  Ok. Who the F**k  has a compass in the F**king casino???    It's by the registration lobby.  That simple.  Take the elevators up and you are there.

There was a small wait for the brunch.  The brunch menu is basically the same as the breakfast (with a few additions).  So. . . .

Chicken and Waffles.  - Glorious.  The waffles have bits of bacon in them and they are amazing.  The Chicken is roasted and not fried.  I have to think that it is better this way because I can't imagine this dish being beat by any restaurant.  You must get this.

French Toast - Looks great but it's not that impressive.  You should try something else.  

Ambiance - I think the restaurant loses a star here.  The decor is dated and the tables too crowded.  There were a couple of single old men sitting by themselves on the small tables and whenever they coughed, I cringed.  Who knows what germs they caught from their respective escorts last night?  

I still highly recommend, even just for the chicken and waffles.

"The superior quality of their coffee notwithstanding, my experience at this establishment was further enhanced by the welcoming demeanor of the staff and the inviting ambiance within. While I must admit that the cost of their offerings is somewhat prohibitive, my primary grievance lies in the absence of elevated seating options for young children. Notwithstanding this oversight, I am content to patronize this business and shall unquestionably return in the future."

"A symposium of culinary indulgence ensued at this esteemed eatery, whereupon we partook in a delectable morning repast, characterized by an ambiance of refined sophistication and unwavering attention to detail. Strategically positioned near a panoramic window, our table afforded a picturesque view of the surrounding landscape, further enhancing the gastronomical experience. A thoughtful touch, indeed, was the presence of a diminutive stool designed specifically for housing feminine accessories, its charm and whimsy serving as a testament to the establishment's commitment to excellence in all aspects of hospitality. My gustatory inclinations leaned toward the savory duck hash and eggs, a dish that did not disappoint in terms of flavor or presentation, although the fluffy pancakes beckoned seductively from their nearby perch. In essence, Tableau epitomizes a harmonious blend of elegance, sophistication, and relaxed conviviality, fostering an atmosphere conducive to both formal and informal gatherings alike."

Was staying at NY NY while in Vegas and what can I say about the hotel but that it looks like they built a mini city inside the hotel.  

It's one of the bigger casino's in vegas with plenty of tables and slot machines.  Probably one of the advantages of NYNY is the food options.  You can get something reasonably price here (like under $10) or you can go to one of their high end restaurants for a night out.

I stayed in the Century Tower and I believe it was like the 32nd floor.  Of all the places I've been to in Las Vegas, this room had the best view.  We had a great view of the strip and the mountains and the strip looked great all lit up at night.

Besides the view, the room was nice.  Had plenty of room for 3 guys without being in each others way.  Things are a little dated in the room so no flat screen TV and some of the stuff here while in good condition was old.  The sinks were in a separate room from the toilet and shower which is always nice.  The shower was definitely high end and hot water was there quickly.

Overall, was impressed with my stay here at NYNY especially with the view in the upper levels of the Century Tower and would recommend it to anyone.
Never had a bad eating experience at Cheba Hut! The food is Delicious, and the subs are TOASTED... Yummm!!! a must-try if you are new to Mesa or if you've just never been to Cheba Hut before!

first spot me and my gf decided to go when we arrived in vegas.  i was really dressed down, as a matter of fact the only person in the place dressed down.  But still, did the hostess have to look at me like i was a scrub?  cmon, you're a hostess in vegas, probably hoping some rich guy knocks you up.  anyways, the place was crackin, like most spots in vegas.  very nice, upscale place.  the food was great, the best salmon sashimi ive ever had.  i couldnt stop thinking about it 2 days later.  they set a new standard for myself when it comes to salmon.  id also reccomend the baked lobster.  prices are really steep, so if your taking someone here, i hope you get some action afterwards.  minus the snobby hostess, and i would have gave this place 5 stars.

"In terms of culinary offerings within the confines of the aforementioned eatery, it is our considered opinion that the so-called 'blueplate specials' merit unreserved endorsement, particularly when considering their pecuniary appeal; these delectable delights are available at a most reasonable tariff of eight dollars per person, an amount which includes access to both the soup and salad bar, the latter of which boasts an array of fresh fruits, thereby rendering it a veritable cornucopia of gastronomic delight; furthermore, we have found it advisable to partake of the soup and salad bar in moderation, given the generous proportions thereof, and subsequently transport the entree to one's domicile for consumption at a later juncture; it is important to note, however, that the ambiance of the establishment in question does not necessarily conform to the standards of high-end resorts such as the Wynn, owing to its status as a humble, albeit well-frequented, locals' casino with somewhat dated decor; nevertheless, the staff maintains a warm and welcoming demeanor, and patrons may rest assured that the quality of the comestibles served will remain consistently high, while the prices remain refreshingly affordable; incidentally, it is worth mentioning that a diverse selection of desserts is offered at a special price of two dollars per portion on a monthly basis."

"The culinary experience was satisfactory, but the service was somewhat eccentric. Specifically, the protocol for placing orders was unconventional, as we were required to do so through the waitstaff rather than directly communicating with the sushi artisan. Furthermore, upon ordering three rolls and additional sushi items, we anticipated that the latter would arrive prior to the former; however, the rolls were served first, and the sushi was inadvertently overlooked until we brought it to the attention of the staff. Notwithstanding this oversight, the quality of the seafood was impressive, as each dish demonstrated freshness and lacked any discernible trace of fishiness. We shall return, and their all-you-can-eat option, featuring an extensive array of choices, presents an excellent value."

When the admission is complimentary, every aspect of the experience appears significantly enhanced. We had the opportunity to partake in one of the evenings featuring LMFAO, and it was truly remarkable. What an exceptional manner in which to conclude a Las Vegas excursion. I thoroughly enjoyed the distinct ambiance of each chamber, particularly the bibliotheca where one can savor a beverage without the inconvenience of jostling elbows. Although my preference remains with the layout of XS, it is invariably fascinating to witness the creators of these opulent nightclubs stretch the limits of inventiveness and, above all, furnish revelers with an exceptional festive environment.

If you have an inclination towards seafood, then an excursion to Boardwalk Billy's is imperative. My preference from their extensive menu is the steampot, which boasts a delectable broth, and I request additional shrimp in lieu of oysters. The portion is generous and includes potatoes and corn, rendering it a comprehensive meal. Additionally, I have sampled their clam chowder, which is utterly delightful! We opt to visit on Thursday evenings, as it coincides with their trivia night and offers a plethora of beverages at a mere $2. Even the most exceptional local drafts are available for this nominal price. The service at the Galleria location is consistently efficient and cordial. However, I must deduct a star due to the subpar quality of their burgers. It is advisable to adhere to their seafood and wing offerings to avoid disappointment.

"Savory culinary delights and hospitable personnel have been the hallmark of this establishment for several years, and I have had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable offerings within my financial means, despite a recent upward trend in pricing."

We found this little hole in the wall by accident. We were in the area looking for something to eat and saw the sign Chicago Gyros. It is a small restaurant that is family run. I had my standard order of a Gyro and fries. The gyro was delicious. It was overstuffed with meat and fillings. They generally don't fill me up but this one did. The fries were your standard fast food type of fries, they were hot and they were crispy. I don't go for gyros worrying about the fries. The owner and I believe his daughter were very friendly and helpful with the orders. The food was served quickly and was the right temperature. I enjoy dealing with locally owned places and this is one I will be returning to.

I was surprised by the generous portions of lettuce with that came with my order of spring rolls.  Attentive and quick service.  Never had a problem flagging down one of the 4 servers on duty.  An all around good experience.  The first pho I've had in Vegas.  While not the best broth I've ever tasted, it wasn't disappointing.

I use to be a regular at this place when it was a Starbucks. To see it reopened as a bakery had my curiousity running wild. I tried to visit this place numerous times, but they have strange hours. They are closed certain days, and then open at noon on certain days. I'd call first, regardless of what yelp says before taking a drive here. 
We went in on my nieces birthday. As soon as I seen "stuffed cookies" I was SOLD! 
Then to find out they are stuffed with things like oreos and cheesecake, snickers, and butterscotch. OMG HEAVEN!! 
They also had a huge selection of cake pops. Cool unique flavors like Nerds Rainbow, orange cream, cheesecake, and red velvet. 
There were a few carmel and candy apples, as well as HUGE chocolate dipped marshmallows.  The service was good and so were the prices. 
My only complaint was their odd schedule. Can't wait to return!

"I am cognizant of the fact that this establishment falls within the category of a chain; however, I must admit that my experience here was thoroughly enjoyable, despite my initial reservations. The beverage selection, specifically the craft beer, was of exceptional quality, and the service provided by the staff was commendable, as they were attentive, courteous, and conversant in English. On my first visit, I opted for a flammekuchen, which was served with a generous portion of Gruyere cheese and smoked meat, complemented by a slice of dill pickle on each quadrant. I must say, it was truly delicious! My spouse, who is a vegetarian, enjoyed her meal immensely as well, as she savored a delectable array of fresh vegetables. Upon my return, I decided to sample their meat-based dish, which featured a medley of ham, pork knuckle, sausage, and a tangy sauerkraut accompaniment. It was, without a doubt, extremely satisfying. Following our repast, we indulged in the entertainment offered at the bar, where we watched a thrilling hockey match featuring the Montreal Canadiens. In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly endorse this establishment, and advocate at least one visit to partake in their superior beverages and culinary offerings."

"Amidst an ambiance characterized by a subtle and understated elegance, patrons can indulge in a culinary experience that is both tantalizing and affordable on Mondays, whereupon the purchase of a $3 beverage, they may obtain a delectable burger for the remarkably reasonable sum of $5, constituting a veritable bargain that is unlikely to be encountered elsewhere."

"My deficiency in proficiently distinguishing authentic Indian cuisine becomes conspicuous when consuming fiery dishes that leave an unrelenting, scorching sensation, rendering my taste buds incapacitated for the remainder of the meal, thereby precluding me from thoroughly appreciating the intricacies of the culinary experience. 

Determined to enhance my familiarity with Indian gastronomy, I elected to sample the BBC's Kashmiri curry, complemented by a generous serving of Cobra beer. To my astonishment, I was able to discern each flavor without allowing the spices to overwhelm my palate, thereby enabling me to relish the meal. 

Given its reasonable price point and captivating moniker, I anticipate returning to partake in this establishment's offerings once again."

"Savor succulent sashimi and an abundance of rolls infused with piquant flavors, as I possess an unwavering predilection for rolls imbued with fiery heat, and Sushi Fever boasts an impressive array of such dishes showcasing a harmonious fusion of tuna and salmon. Furthermore, the establishment features a spacious and stylish sitting area to the left of the entrance, complete with a colossal high-definition television, providing a welcome diversion for patrons who, like myself, derive pleasure from diversions beyond ceramic felines and traditional Japanese ornamentation."

"Aaron, your proficiency in customer service is truly commendable, and I must say that the brunette bartender also demonstrated an impressive level of hospitality. Although the colossal portion of nachos presented a formidable challenge that momentarily undermined my confidence, I shall assuredly bring reinforcements on my subsequent visit. Furthermore, I had the pleasure of encountering a few friendly individuals, including Greg and Mariam from California, and Mark from New Mexico. I sincerely hope that you will reciprocate by bestowing a favorable evaluation upon this establishment."

Yummo!

Very good authentic Cuban sandwiches and pastries.  Fantastic breakfast and really liked that the omelet was not greasy.  It was so tasty, filling, and budget friendly as well.  

It's hard to find Ironbeer and Materva unless you're at a Cuban place and it was so exciting to get some. Om nom nom.

Since we were driving back to LA we picked up some great pastries for the ride home.  

They do compare themselves to Portos (they even have a sign out front that says it), however they are not Portos.  Don't expect the crazy lines (yay).  The selection of pastries is not as large but they are just as good!

I have had the privilege of inhabiting this resplendent abode for a trifling three years, during which time I have been continually impressed by its unwavering ability to captivate my senses and inspire my spirit. Despite certain drawbacks, such as an occasionally problematic parking situation and an aural assault perpetrated by the raucous revelry of rowdy revellers, I remain steadfast in my decision to designate this magnificent edifice as my humble domicile. The aesthetic appeal of this structure is simply stunning, with each carefully crafted aspect serving to enhance the overall visual experience. Moreover, the ambiance fostered by the harmonious convergence of sleek lines, tasteful colour schemes, and strategically placed greenery, serves to create an atmosphere that is at once both tranquil and invigorating. It is little wonder, then, that I have been able to establish lasting connections with a diverse array of similarly discerning individuals who share my appreciation for the finer things in life. In light of these factors, I felt compelled to bestow upon this esteemed residence a rating of four stars, as it falls ever so slightly short of perfection. Nonetheless, I would highly recommend Optima to anyone seeking a truly exceptional place to call home, as it embodies the very essence of luxury living. My enthusiasm for this magnificent complex is further fueled by the impending completion of Optima Sonoran Village, a sister property that promises to offer an identical standard of excellence.

The occurrence of my presence at a gathering transpired within the parameters of Caesars Palace during the month of May, precipitating my attendance at said event. Preceding this particular visit, I had indulged in numerous excursions to the aforementioned establishment, yet had not availed myself of the opportunity to partake in the hospitality extended by the hotel's accommodations. Subsequently, we were assigned lodgings in the Octavius Tower, which afforded us commodious quarters, characterized by plush sleeping surfaces, well-appointed bathing facilities, and panoramic vistas that proved to be truly captivating.

Only on a singular occasion have I had the privilege of partaking in a culinary excursion to this esteemed establishment, yet it is safe to assert that my experience was indeed superior to the average patron's. My order consisted of a half pound JalapeÃ±o Jack burger, complemented by a side of onion rings. The burger itself boasted a flawless synergy of spices, utilizing premium quality meat sourced from Midwestern pastures, and a flavorful cheese that harmonized seamlessly with the other ingredients. The onion rings, though perhaps not the primary focus of my repast, were equally impressive in both texture and taste. While the portion sizes were generous, leaving me thoroughly satiated, I must admit that the total cost of my meal, amounting to $11 and change, seemed somewhat excessive for an unpretentious, no-frills eatery catering primarily to those seeking a hasty, post-work or post-event nourishment. This minor drawback, however, did not detract significantly from my overall satisfaction with the burger, which I would unhesitatingly recommend to others.

This establishment evokes memories of the Italian eatery, Pompeii, located in Chicago, where my roommate and I frequently partook in their culinary offerings via carry-out orders. Interestingly, my visit to Phoenix coincided with my acquaintance's inclination to procure sustenance from this very venue, prompting me to diverge from our customary selections and sample their Salami, Turkey, Ham, and Mozzarella panini, which was complemented by a delectable red wine vinaigrette that greatly enhanced its flavor profile. A cursory examination of the ingredients revealed an emphasis on freshness and meticulous preparation, while the prices, though comparable to those in Chicago, remained uncertain in relation to local standards. My curiosity piqued, I would eagerly explore additional menu options at this venue.

"Savor the delectable experience of creating your personalized gourmet burgers, complemented by copious portions of crispy, golden fries that are invariably served at an optimal temperature and meticulously prepared according to your precise specifications."
I won't lie, I've been here once or twice.  Not on par with Canadian clubs but much better than the other clubs in the valley.

This eatery boasts an array of delectable Asian delights, with their Thai Spicy Noodles being a particular standout dish that never fails to satiate my gastronomical cravings. Despite its unassuming name, this culinary masterpiece consists of an amalgamation of flavorsome ingredients, including tender woked chicken and succulent shrimp, complemented by the subtle crunch of scallions and the satisfying texture of egg, all nestled atop a bed of Thai spice-infused noodles. Furthermore, the judicious application of a generous lemon wedge serves to elevate the dish to new heights of gustatory pleasure. Such is the versatility of this establishment that it caters to a diverse clientele, offering an assortment of appetizers that cater to varying dietary preferences and inclinations. Moreover, the welcoming ambiance and warm demeanor of the staff only serve to enhance the overall dining experience, making it an excellent choice for families seeking a casual yet satisfying repast.

"Hyde's ambiance aligns with its namesake, presenting an ideal setting for an intimate encounter with a significant other, although patrons would be wise to remain vigilant lest they become preoccupied with the captivating physical appearance of the establishment's servers, as the delectable offerings from the kitchen may momentarily take a backseat to the visually striking staff; the culinary selections, particularly the fried calamari, boast an unparalleled crispiness that nearly results in an explosive sensory experience upon consumption, and the meticulous seasoning enhances the flavors without overpowering the delicate palate; however, the wine list, while impressive in quality, comes at a premium price point, and the absence of complimentary refills for soft drinks results in a notable increase in cost, making it the most expensive soda option in Las Vegas."

"Wow, this establishment appears to be quite extensive in its layout, with numerous sections and areas that seem to stretch out endlessly, almost like a labyrinthine maze designed to tantalize and confound one's senses. It's truly impressive, and I must admit that I haven't had the pleasure of exploring every nook and cranny of this vast space, despite my best efforts to do so. There are multiple levels, each boasting its own unique charm and allure, with upstairs rooms that offer an air of exclusivity and privacy for those seeking a more intimate experience. The staff here is incredibly friendly and welcoming, and while some might attribute their warm demeanor to my gender, I would argue that it's simply a result of their inherent kindness and dedication to providing exceptional customer service. Indeed, the performers themselves exude an aura of warmth and approachability, making them feel less like'strippers' and more like gracious hosts who just happen to possess a certain je ne sais quoi that sets them apart from the average individual. They are, in short, a true delight to behold, and their pleasant scent only serves to enhance the overall ambiance of the club."

"I recently indulged in a two-night stay at the luxurious Aria hotel, courtesy of my company's generosity, which I must say, was greatly appreciated since the accommodation rates are rather exorbitant, and I wouldn't necessarily categorize it as an affordable indulgence. Furthermore, the beverages served at the pool area are quite costly, with one particular drink commanding a premium price that I am unable to disclose here, but rest assured, it's reputed to be among the priciest on the Las Vegas Strip. Despite not receiving the complimentary chocolates or turn-down service that some previous guests have reported, our stay was generally enjoyable. However, I must admit that the bathroom amenities left much to be desired, specifically the lower-end brand and quality of the products. The dining establishments within the hotel, particularly the Thai restaurant, impressed us with their exceptional culinary offerings, rivaling those of its stateside counterparts. The casino itself was well-maintained, relatively smoke-free, and the servers demonstrated impressive efficiency. The pool area offered several appealing options, including an adults-only section, ensuring a peaceful and relaxing experience without the presence of boisterous children. While I would have preferred more shaded areas or umbrellas, the overall pool experience was satisfactory. In conclusion, Aria undoubtedly offers a superb lodging experience, albeit at a premium price point, which is unsurprising given its reputation for excellence."

"As one of the contemporary establishments situated along the famed Las Vegas Strip, this hotel boasts a sleek, modernistic motif that permeates its entirety. 

PROS -
+ An atmosphere of tranquility and refinement pervades the resort, fostering a sense of relaxation and serenity for its patrons. 
+ Immaculately maintained facilities, including a pristine swimming pool, spotless guest rooms, and immaculate corridors, contribute to an overall ambiance of elegance. 
+ The accommodations themselves are equipped with a host of cutting-edge amenities, such as an electric mini-stove, refrigerator, microwave, dining table, supremely comfortable bed, et cetera, all of which serve to enhance the overall experience of the guests. 
+ The hospitality of the staff is unparalleled, as they exude warmth, cordiality, and a genuine desire to ensure the comfort and satisfaction of their clientele. 


CONS -
