- This particular lodging may not be the optimal choice for individuals celebrating a significant milestone, such as a 21st birthday, with a group of friends, as the atmosphere may not align with the anticipated level of revelry and joviality associated with such an occasion. (IE - minimalist attire, alcoholic beverages, and unsteady gait may elicit disapproving glances from other guests.)"

"Culinary-wise, this establishment merits a rating of 2.5 to 3 stars at most; however, the ambiance and coffee compensate for the fourth star. Allow me to initiate my critique with the culinary offerings. For those unfamiliar with genuine Spanish cuisine, the dishes will likely impress; otherwise, seasoned aficionados may find them lacking. 

The olives presented an agreeable taste sensation. 

The shrimp dish, specifically the gambas al pil pil, proved satisfactory. 

The traditional paella, while flavorsome, deviated from the customary preparation method, featuring an unusual rice texture and an overpowering creaminess. Nonetheless, the subtle saffron undertones and the presence of chorizo contributed a gratifying experience. 

The tortilla, though slightly burnt and dry, maintained an acceptable level of quality. 

The wine list, regrettably, does not showcase an adequate representation of Spanish varieties, which seems incongruous considering the restaurant's Iberian theme. Only two options, a Rivera del Duero and a Rioja, are available. Surely, a greater emphasis on Spanish wines would enhance the overall experience. 

However, the coffee selection boasts an impressive array, including both cold brew and kopi luwak. Their coffee-related accessories also deserve mention as a unique highlight. Just be aware that potent coffee blends may pose a challenge for the caffeine-sensitive patron. 

In conclusion, while the food did not fully meet expectations, the atmosphere and coffee redeem the establishment, warranting a return visit to sample their coffee and potentially discover 'cafe bombon,' a Spanish classic, on the menu."

When I think of Richardson's, I feel warm and cozy inside.  I've been on several occasions and I love the atmosphere... I always have a good time at this hidden little gem of the city.

The 'Cuisine of New Mexico' is unique... they are known for their green chile potato as well as several other pork dishes.  I usually go for the fish or seafood specials... they have a standard menu and then specials posted on chalk boards around the restaurant.

Most recently I enjoyed the blackened scallop appetizer as my entree along with a huge house salad.  The scallops were a little bit salty but cooked just right.  They were served on a tortilla with rice, beans, and a yummy spicy sauce.  Their salads are really tasty, and many of the entree specials come with a starter salad.  I went with a group of 4 and we had a couple of bottles of wine and a plain pizza as an appetizer to share.  Needless to say, none of us had room for dessert!

Be prepared for a crowd whenever you go, but enjoy your company and the people around you.  Call ahead and make a reservation if you can...  if you do have to wait, sit at the bar or by the fireplace; you can't complain once you have a drink in hand and the scent of the fire mixed with hot food and good energy.  I'll be back again soon, Richardson's!

If you're not looking for this place, you just might miss it. It's tucked away in a strip mall and worth the hunt. I went with Elite Emily as we explored Henderson more, and we were practically the only people in the spot. The orders were HUGE. It takes a lot for me to wave the white flag, but I had to ask for a box. All the food is fresh and pretty dern tasty. There's really nothing you can go wrong with here, so I'm looking forward to my next trip to try something else!

Normally the boy does not enjoy museums, but he had a lot of fun in this one.

Lots of historic sex toys and insane sex toys. Video clips, films, demonstrations. Lots and lots of sexually intense items here!

Bondage and pictures, and a relatively in depth visual view of sexual evolution. Incredibly interesting. I would actually come again. Everyone that works there is also sweet and unobtrusive.

I arrived at this esteemed establishment on a Sunday, thereby obviating the necessity for a prior reservation. And let me tell you, this place truly is the apogee of culinary excellence, exuding an ambiance that is at once both convivial and sophisticated. The olfactory sensations that permeate the air are nothing short of captivating, while the visually appealing decor and well-appointed furnishings lend an air of elegance to the proceedings. The waiting staff, too, are deserving of commendation, their proficiency and hospitality being of the highest order. Upon divulging my dietary restrictions, the chef de cuisine himself kindly took the time to expound upon the various dishes that were already suitable for a vegan palate, in addition to those that could be easily adapted to meet my requirements. It transpired that a considerable number of sauces employed in the culinary process contained fish or oyster sauce, a fact that had hitherto escaped my notice. Suffice it to say that I wholeheartedly endorse this restaurant, and eagerly anticipate my next visit, when I shall most certainly indulge in the delectable green curry accompanied by tofu - a veritable gustatory delight, I have no doubt.

I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say that each visit has been a truly gratifying experience. Most recently, I had the privilege of dining here in the company of some visiting family and friends, and suffice it to say that everyone in attendance left feeling thoroughly satiated. 
  For those seeking uniquely crafted, expertly mixed beverages, this venue is an absolute must-visit destination. The drinks menu boasts an impressive array of libations, each one thoughtfully categorized by historical era and accompanied by a brief description elucidating the origins of its name. 
  During our visit, nearly all members of our party opted to take advantage of the happy hour special, which featured steaks at half price. While one of the filets was unfortunately slightly undercooked, the remainder of the dishes were cooked to perfection. Furthermore, the assortment of side dishes we ordered were, without exception, utterly delectable, with the truffle macaroni and cheese emerging as a clear favorite among our group. I would be remiss if I did not give special mention to the "Farmer" flatbread pizza, whose ingredients included bacon, spinach, and a perfectly cooked egg; this dish is nothing short of a gastronomic masterpiece, and I implore you to sample it for yourself in order to fully appreciate its splendor. 
  As for dessert, while we initially harbored doubts about our ability to consume anything further, our server's vivid descriptions quickly dispelled such concerns. We opted to try both the pizooki (a delightful, crispy flatbread confection) and the homemade doughnuts, and I am pleased to report that both offerings met and indeed surpassed our loftiest expectations. The word "heavenly" does not even begin to do justice to the sublime experience that these desserts provided. In conclusion, I must reiterate my unwavering endorsement of this superlative eatery, whose ambiance, culinary prowess, and expertly crafted potions make it a true gem, tucked away from the frenetic activity of the Las Vegas Strip.

"An expansive outdoor area, ideal for socializing and engaging in convivial dialogue with acquaintances, complemented the interior's pristine condition and attentive hospitality. The assortment of baked goods displayed an irresistible appeal, exemplifying the establishment's commitment to culinary excellence. Kudos to the staff for their efforts."

During a sweltering spring day in Chinatown, I experienced an unrelenting sensation of hunger, which is not unusual given my accelerated metabolic rate. Having grown weary of my customary Thai cuisine, I opted to explore novel gastronomical options and discovered HSP through a cursory examination of Yelp.

Upon arriving at the establishment, located towards the conclusion of the Chinatown Plaza extension on Wynn Road and Spring Mountain, I encountered a hospitable female staff member who divulged that the restaurant had been in operation for five years, news that left me feeling utterly oblivious to my surroundings, much like a marine creature dwelling at the bottom of a pineapple.

My voracious appetite compelled me to advance toward the eatery, whereupon I beheld a modest storefront presenting a limited assortment of diverse poke varieties. The diminutive quantity of each poke served as a testament to the proprietors' commitment to preserving the freshness of their seafood offerings. As an individual without any significant experience with Hawaiian cuisine or coastal residency, I could still discern the absence of fishy odors in my Shoyu Limu Tuna bowl, substantiating my supposition that the poke was indeed fresh. This delightful culinary discovery, complemented by warm rice embellished with black sesame seeds and available at a mere $8, kindled within me an eagerness to revisit the establishment and sample additional menu items.

My pre-adolescent male progeny enjoyed themselves immensely, despite the somewhat exorbitant cost and the fact that the ambiance was not particularly conducive to tranquility. However, the Wi-Fi connectivity left much to be desired, and the culinary offerings were not only overpriced but also lacking in gastronomic quality. Specifically, a relatively diminutive iced latte commanded a price of nearly five dollars, which seemed rather steep considering its diminutive stature. Furthermore, the absence of any complimentary refreshments or amenities for adult patrons was a notable omission, especially given the already prohibitive cost of admission. On the other hand, all of the various diversions and amusements were in excellent working order, which was certainly a positive aspect of our visit.

I have been coming to this place since the mid-80s and it is definitely consistent. At face value this is a local curry house, no pretensions of fine dining but good, reasonably priced food with attentive service. There is little better on a winter's night with the freezing wind howling up Bruntsfield Place, than to battle through the double doors into a warm and inviting aroma of indian spices.  Beware when ordering the naan: they only do these in \"feed the 5,000\" size!

"It is imperative that I deduct a star due to the prolonged waiting period for the outdoor seating area, despite our repeated visits to this establishment, which has led me to infer that the patio does not accept reservations. A delay of one and a half hours at 5:30 PM is somewhat absurd, considering the reputation of this restaurant. However, it is worth noting that the culinary offerings are consistently exceptional, with my personal preference being a succulent steak, while my spouse favors either the skate or a hearty portion of slow-cooked short ribs. It is also worth mentioning that we have never encountered an unpleasant server or subpar dish during our visits. In conclusion, if you wish to partake in the ambiance of the patio, which offers unparalleled people-watching opportunities, it is advisable to anticipate a delay. Unfortunately, the current system in place does not allow for timely notification via text message when a table becomes available, which can be inconvenient given the limited range of the sensors within the casino. Nonetheless, the quality of the cuisine makes the wait worthwhile."

"Prior to this experience, my exposure to live performances had been limited, with neither a Cirque de Soleil production nor any other theatrical presentation in Las Vegas having been part of my repertoire. Consequently, my attendance at this particular show served as an inaugural encounter of its kind for me, which, to my delight, transpired to be a thoroughly captivating and enjoyable affair. The musicians' virtuosity was undeniably evident throughout the performance, while the dancers' vivacity and dynamism infused the production with an unmistakable vitality. Moreover, the acrobats' displays of physical prowess and artistry left me in a state of utter amazement. It is worth mentioning that our admission to the event was complimentary, which, needless to say, contributed significantly to the overall satisfaction we derived from the experience."

We placed an order for the delectable lobster and shrimp dip, but unfortunately, we were compelled to return it on two separate occasions due to an excessive amount of cheese, which rendered the dish unpleasantly rich and overpowering. The texture of the chips was compromised by the copious amount of cheese, causing them to break apart easily when submerged in the accompanying sauce. Consequently, the establishment graciously decided to remove the item from our bill. Subsequent to this, we opted to sample the parmesan chicken and baked potato, which proved to be a satisfying culinary experience, sufficient for two individuals to share.

"Remarkable discovery!  We, as temporary residents of Washington D.C., were thoroughly impressed by the distinctive approach taken in the creation of your menu.  Such an innovative and creative manner in which you have presented your culinary offerings has left us utterly fascinated.  It is undeniable that the gastronomical experience we had the pleasure of indulging in was truly exceptional!  Specifically, the pierogi sliders and the eggplant lasagna proved to be an unmitigated delight, leaving us in a state of unabashed satisfaction."

This gastronomical establishment boasts an extensive culinary repertoire, featuring an array of delectable items on its vast bill of fare, including a breakfast menu that deviates from the customary offerings typically associated with such an eatery, encompassing an assortment of scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, and hash browns, et cetera, which, though perhaps not entirely genuine, is undoubtedly a unique attribute of this particular venue. Furthermore, the presence of piping hot pastrami and corned beef underscores the superior quality of the comestibles served here. The hospitable and accommodating nature of the staff serves as a significant factor in determining my intentions to revisit this delightful deli, rendering it a veritable haven for epicureans seeking a satisfying repast.

My spouse and I indulged in an evening of artistic exploration, characterized by an unparalleled level of enjoyment, under the guidance of an individual named Melissa, whose vivacity and warmth permeated the atmosphere, albeit with a slight lack of clarity in her explanations, yet compensating for this deficiency by affording us ample time to execute each stage of the creative process. An exemplary work of art, suspended from the ceiling, served as a point of reference, allowing us to appreciate its beauty and complexity. Beverages, priced at five dollars for a glass of beer and seven dollars for a glass of wine, were available for purchase, with the added bonus of a fifty percent discount during the final hour of the session. As we had satiated our hunger prior to attending, I did not have the opportunity to sample the culinary offerings, although it appeared that many participants availed themselves of the brief respite afforded during the middle of the class to partake of various hors d'oeuvres. This unique experience, which I wholeheartedly endorse, is certain to be repeated in the future, and I would enthusiastically recommend it to any individual seeking an engaging and distinctive diversion.
If u come here on grave until 7am ask for Joy...great server....having saimin and Portuguese Sausage and scramble eggs....of course with rice... ono after a night out.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of an exceptionally high quality, boasting an authenticity that is unparalleled in its genre. The piquant flavors, as suggested by the moniker, are truly palpable and evoke a profound sense of satisfaction. So much so, that we felt compelled to partake in their delectable fare on two separate occasions during our brief sojourn in Las Vegas, and both experiences left us feeling utterly content."

It's about time Summerlin had a decent pub/bar/hang-out/tavern, whatever the hell you want to call it, it's good they have one. 
Super friendly staff, not overbearingly so, but attentive. Food was quite tasty, chicken sandwich is da bomb! The waitress said you can get it as a wrap (off the menu) , nice tip, thanks.
Few things:
1) For yelpers, if you check in you get a free shot of their house whisky. Bad thing is, it's horrible. Cinnamon / orange infused. Pretty much tasted like Triaminic cold and cough. Pass on it, trust me.
2) The bathroom sinks...I can't stand these things. Whoever thought a slightly tilted slab of tile would work as a sink...dude, you were waaaay wrong. Give me a basin and save my clothing from the splash back and the whopping 2 inches of space to place my hands under, please. 

Bottom line: Great place to hang, plenty of room to move, cool staff, great food. Just beware of the bathroom sinks....

"We have had the pleasure of dining at this esteemed establishment on three separate occasions, and we can confidently assert that it offers one of the most exceptional buffet experiences for both local patrons and visiting gastronomes alike. The prime rib, in particular, has consistently impressed us with its flawless preparation, and we highly recommend requesting a thicker cut from the accommodating staff. The succulent crab legs, which are freshly procured on each occasion, are also worthy of mention, as are the diverse varieties of shrimp available. While the Mexican cuisine may benefit from some refinement, the abundance of delectable Asian options and the unwavering quality of the American fare more than compensate for any perceived shortcomings. Furthermore, the assortment of sweet treats, including numerous sugar-free selections, is truly impressive. Lastly, we must commend the servers for their unwavering professionalism and warm hospitality, which has greatly enhanced our dining experience on each visit."

"This quaint, family-operated eatery boasts an impressive array of delectable bagels, complemented by exceptional customer service. The extensive breakfast and lunch menus cater to diverse palates, and the accommodating kitchen staff readily fulfills special dietary requests with alacrity."

With moving to the other side of town, it was nice to find a new sushi spot near by. Service and rolls are great. Plus, they have a great happy hour that has options of 4-8 pieces. It gives you the option to try a lot of different rolls. All in all, it's a nice little spot and I've loved everything I've tried. Nice place as my last one was I Love Sushi.

"Exquisite vino and delectable bruschetta, particularly the pomaceous variety. Enjoyed lively melodies performed by a talented musician during my visit. However, an outdoor fire pit would greatly enhance the ambiance of this otherwise exceptional wine bar, as the existing atmosphere is somewhat lacking in vivacity and necessitates further enlivenment."

They always take the time with my kids and are very good.  Sometimes they have a waiting list and often are booked up....so I recommend calling ahead to make an appointment.  But it is very worth it as the results speak for themselves.

"My sentiments regarding this pizza are ones of profound admiration, specifically pertaining to the judicious blend of mozzarella and provolone cheese, wherein the latter is incorporated in a manner that enhances, rather than overpowers, the former, thereby creating a culinary experience that is truly exceptional; additionally, the service we received was of an impressively high quality, such that it served to further elevate our dining experience; it is worth noting, however, that my previous experiences at this establishment have been somewhat inconsistent, with periods of disappointment interspersed among moments of satisfaction, but on this particular occasion, they demonstrated a commendable level of competence and dedication to their craft."

"An exceptional equestrian facility ideal for family outings, offering a seamless and efficient experience from initial reservation to conclusion, boasting a picturesque desert setting in North Scottsdale particularly breathtaking during the spring season, complemented by well-manicured grounds conducive to a leisurely horseback ride, further enhanced by a team of accommodating, polite, and knowledgeable staff members who guarantee a memorable visit, leaving a lasting impression that warrants future visits without hesitation."

I was sooooo excited to have the opportunity to ride a roller coaster in and around a casino/hotel. Yes, I realize that I may be getting a little old to ride roller coasters and hate to admit that it makes me sick as hell, but who the hell cares? You are only \"young\" once. The lines to pay were weirdly inefficient but maybe it was because everyone, including us, made a mad dash to get in 10 minutes before they closed (midnight on the weekend). \n\nThe ride was scary and hilarious at the same time (I didn't plan my shirt choice very well and I will leave it at that). My girlfriend and I laughed hysterically at our pictures. They were $15 a piece but $22 if you bought two. We decided to do that and split it. The employee gave me the most exasperated look when I asked him to charge two separate cards...really dude????? Be happy you got us to buy two and get over it. Besides that, this was a blast!

"Despite its unfavorable geographical positioning, Whiskey Dicks revels in its capacity to proffer an enjoyable drinking experience, courtesy of its impressive array of artfully-crafted brews and hospitable staff. Upon entering the establishment, we were warmly received by a congenial hostess clad in abbreviated attire, who expedited our seating process with alacrity. I opted for a Ranger IPA from their diverse selection of tap beverages, which, in my opinion, constitutes a commendable choice. The assortment of beers available at this everyday drinkery is indeed satisfactory. My culinary excursion began with an order of philly cheese accompanied by mesquite seasoned fries. The latter proved to be a gastronomic highlight, as the flavorful seasoning augmented the inherent deliciousness of the potatoes. However, the philly itself was not without its flaws, as the steak exhibited a tendency towards dryness and an excess of bread hindered the overall enjoyment of the dish. Nonetheless, the freshness of the onions and peppers provided a welcome contrast. Considering the aforementioned factors, I chose to elevate Whiskey Dicks by a star in my rating, primarily due to the establishment's commitment to offering a variety of palatable craft beers alongside its hospitable atmosphere. Although alternative pubs within close proximity may boast superior offerings, Whiskey Dicks' collection of New Belgian beers and Sam Adams seasonal brews renders it a worthy destination for those seeking a satisfying drinking experience."

"Having partaken of sustenance at this establishment on multiple occasions in the past, I must say that the culinary offerings have been consistently satisfactory. In fact, I have been fortunate enough to have had the pleasure of savoring their delectable dishes both via delivery and in-person, with the latter instance occurring in close proximity to my place of employment. My customary order consists of the Chicken Pita, which boasts an impressive array of flavors thanks to the grilled poultry, complemented by the nutritious whole wheat pita bread. Furthermore, I take great delight in augmenting my meal with a tangy cucumber sauce and a spicy hot garlic chili sauce, thus creating a veritable symphony of taste sensations. It is my conviction that this eatery merits unreserved endorsement, particularly given the reasonable price point of $8 for a complete pita."

"Having had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions, I must say that I have developed a profound fondness for it! The staff has consistently demonstrated exceptional friendliness and promptness, earning an A+ rating in my book. The ambiance, reminiscent of a Toby Keith's Jr., scores a respectable B+. The entertainment, in the form of live music, has been nothing short of spectacular, warranting an A+ grade. While the bar boasts an impressive selection, lacking only Norm, it still merits an A rating. Prices are average, but the food, with the exception of the steak, has been somewhat underwhelming, garnering a B score; however, the burgers and fries are highly recommended. In conclusion, taking into account the welcoming atmosphere, excellent staff, and top-notch entertainment, I award this establishment a solid A. I strongly advise paying a visit to this venue, as you are certain to appreciate the warmth and hospitality of the people and the surroundings. We eagerly anticipate our next visit, during which we undoubtedly will savor their delectable burgers."

I came here first time with an educated shooter that already had guns i could use. This was my second time ever shooting but first at a range. They sold us the bullets and targets gave us protective geer and off we went to an enclosed room to shoot very simple short breefing. Place is nicely set up central location, staff was nice. The other two people went to get certified not the paper test but shooting test i decided i needed more time to practice. The only thing i really did not like was how many tourist were there. I really hope they open another location more for locals. The prices are to high because its geared toward tourism. I like the fact classes are free though. I went on a monday around 9am not to busy but as the day progressed the place got packed so go during the week early otherwise you will be waiting. I will be back to practice more and test taking but i think im going to save some money and look for a cheaper place for bullets and targets.

The food is amazing.  If you've eaten at another Bianco restaurant, imagine that.... only better, with more options.

The service is not great.  Slow, they forget things, etc.

The portions are SMALL.

We went on a Saturday night and had our choice of inside or outside table with no waiting... so I think that issue is sort of hit or miss.

Vietnamese Sandwiches: The only thing I go here for, To be honest this is the best Vietnamese sandwiches in Las Vegas, trust me. Not like Lee's Sandwiches. Hue Thai bakes their bread fresh so when you get your sandwiches the breads soft and a little bit crunchy but still a little warm. I've tried a couple places and this place has to be the best. 

Other foods: They have a variety of Vietnamese dishes, Chinese, and even Thai. But nothing taste super Authentic. So that's why I never order anything there except the Vietnamese sandwiches and their boba (which is decent). Not a fan of their Pho

Price: Vietnamese Sandwiches here are dirt cheap, $3.50 a sandwich I believe. Only sucky thing is they require a minimum of $20 to charge a debit card. Which you should know by now, I'm a yelper who doesn't like to carry cash.

take out/eat there: To be honest dining there isn't so bad, other than the odd smell of cleaning products and food mixed together and the eye sore hallway to the bathroom the place is pretty alright. The design I guess is some kind of under the sea theme? I have no idea why its under the sea that has nothing to do with Vietnamese food. 

4/5 Stars for Price/Vietnamese Sandwiches/ Decent Boba
The barbecue was good but not great. They do have a nice selection of barbecue sauces. The complimentary kettle chips were a nice touch. On the plus side, the food came lightning fast.

"Remarkable! The culinary delight that was the Farm burger, coupled with the delectable sweet potato fries sprinkled with powdered sugar, was truly a gastronomical experience worthy of acclaim. However, it is unfortunate that the quality of service did not live up to the high standards set by the exquisite fare, as we encountered an inexplicable delay in receiving our fries, which ultimately arrived only after we had nearly completed our burgers."

I have been a loyal patron of this establishment for in excess of a decade, and despite my occasional forays into alternative venues, I invariably find myself returning to Nancy's salon, primarily due to the warm and welcoming ambiance, but also because of the exceptional quality of their nail care services and pedicures, which have consistently met, and indeed surpassed, my expectations.

This establishment offers an exceptional experience, as evidenced by the abundance of items I acquired for my son upon his birth, primarily consisting of gently used articles of clothing from my husband's extensive family and several of my close acquaintances, which rendered it impossible for him to don them all, even if I altered his attire five times daily. Consequently, I undertook a quest to locate a reputable consignment venue where I could procure novel apparel for him as he developed. Fortunately, numerous such establishments exist in my vicinity (specifically, central Phoenix), and after visiting two other locations prior to arriving at Smarty Pants (with the caveat being not to frequent Urban Baby, as it proved unsatisfactory), I encountered a warm and hospitable reception from the mother-daughter ownership duo. They accepted the majority of the items I presented and, despite my initial intention to merely deposit my goods, I found myself indulging in a shopping spree, resulting in the acquisition of three superior tops for a mere $15 in total. The shop boasted an incredible inventory, maintained a spotless environment, and offered amiable service, thereby rendering it a veritable haven for customers. Additionally, I learned of their impending expansion into the adjacent space, destined to accommodate furniture, while the current location would feature an increased selection of adult attire (although, it's possible that the new space would be designated for clothing, with the existing one being upgraded to accommodate more adult fashion). Consequently, I shall return shortly to invest my consignment funds. My gratitude extends to Smarty Pants.

After seeing Paul put his review up...I had to join in! This venue is almost perfect in design and the acoustics are amazing. I love outdoor concerts and yet the amphitheater gives you a club feel while being outside.

That being said...like my review of the Fillmore...you will see that catching a buzz will require a credit card or a well hidden flask (leave your bongs at home). The whole Music Factory complex begs for a keg party straight out of high school to explode in the parking lot. Wait...what? Oh...that's right...we DO tailgate before shows. Ten dollars can get you a 12 pack of PBR and a sammy...or one 24 ounce beer inside...and that's without a tip. My tip? Lower your freakin drink prices!

Like others have said though...this place is great and they're attracting better and more obscure acts all the time. I'm just happy to have some reputable venues around.

This establishment boasted such favorable critiques on Yelp that we traversed a considerable distance from Scottsdale during our vacation to experience the ambiance of this venue in Tempe. Our excursion proved to be worthwhile, as we were greeted by a courteous doorman who requested my identification, cognizant of my advanced age, and pronounced my name accurately while extending his well wishes for an enjoyable sojourn. The attentive bartenders periodically inquired about our welfare, ensuring that we savored every moment of our visit. Although I do not partake in beer consumption, my companion sampled their trio of brews and expressed immense satisfaction with each selection. The atmosphere of this eatery exuded a convivial, relaxed, and sporty vibe, complemented by delectable pub fare.

I drove by and there was a blank storefront with no signage or notice. Turns out it moved across the street and is now near the other furniture stores (At Home, Creative Leather, Spencer's Appliance) at 2711 S. San Tan Village Pkwy, Gilbert. The new store is brighter and has floor-to-ceiling windows on 2 sides.

"As I previously mentioned in my initial posting regarding Princess Nails, the ambiance leaves much to be desired, bordering on squalor, and can aptly be described as a veritable hole in the wall. However, allow me to reiterate that Michelle, the individual responsible for administering the eyebrow waxing treatment, is truly exceptional. My second visit proved to be just as satisfying as the initial encounter. It is imperative that you request her services explicitly. While I refrain from bestowing a perfect five-star rating due to the establishment's conspicuous lack of cleanliness, I cannot help but wonder how they would fare without Michelle's expertise. It is essential to note that my assessment is founded solely on my experiences with eyebrow waxing and does not take into account any other services offered at this location, such as nail care, which I have never availed myself of and have no intention of doing so in the future."

The initial perception of the hotel's age might deter one from considering its culinary offerings, particularly the buffet, as a primary attraction. However, our unplanned visit led to a gratifying experience, as the quality of the food, despite a limited selection, proved to be satisfactory. The pleasant surprise we encountered has kindled our inclination to revisit the establishment in the future.

After spending a few summers in Phoenix you learn to locate and love certain watering holes.  One of the best treats to cool off the perspiration of a long Phoenix afternoon is the date shake at Sphinx.  This place has a long history with Scottsdale and its shakes have been hydrating sweaty residents for several decades now.

We have been eagerly anticipating the inauguration of this novel eatery for an extended period of time, and our patience has finally been rewarded. Upon partaking in a culinary excursion to this establishment on the second evening of its operation, we were thoroughly delighted by the exceptional quality of the service, complementary chips and salsa, delectable fare, and refreshing beverages proffered. The meticulous renovation of the interior space has resulted in a visually stunning ambiance that enhances the overall dining experience. It is gratifying to have another superior dining option in the vicinity, which serves as a harmonious addition to the existing array of distinguished Mexican restaurants in the area.

We finally got a Jimmy John's and I had heard so much about it being great.  We tried two different sandwiches (the No 9 Italian Night Club on their great french roll and the No 12 Beach Club on  thick sliced 7 grain bread).  Great quality product, great bread, very competitive pricing.  It is a little noisy with the music and hard surfaces in this location thou.  They are a brand new location so that will probably change (hope) over time.

"It is rather amusing, to say the least, that we initially opted to dine at a burger establishment situated at Mandalay, only to be met with an utter lack of acknowledgement from the staff for a duration of five minutes, which, might I add, felt more like an eternity considering we had previously indulged in a ninety-minute extravaganza at the MJ One show and were thus ravenous beyond belief. Therefore, we decided to abandon our endeavors at said burger joint and venture forth to this esteemed eatery instead. Verily, the contrast was nothing short of stark. The service we received here was indeed impeccable, albeit not in the least bit haughty or pretentious. My companion and I elected to partake in distinct tasting menus, with mine being the Alain Ducasse four-course variety, sans wine, of course. The culinary journey began with a refreshing amuse-bouche of cold broccoli soup, followed by an absolutely delectable lobster curry, succeeded by a heavenly portion of foie gras atop a tender filet, and ultimately concluded with a sublime Armagnac dessert. I must confess that the presentation and flavors of each dish were, for the most part, truly captivating. In fact, the sole exception to this rule was the uninspired mashed potatoes that accompanied the filet, which, quite frankly, paled in comparison to the rest of the meal. Nonetheless, the ambiance of the establishment exuded an air of romance, while the breathtaking view from its vantage point only added to the overall experience, making it, in my opinion, an occasion worth every penny spent."

"A remarkably excellent minor coffee establishment, strategically positioned for an invigorating mid-shopping spree rejuvenation. Albeit slightly arduous to locate, diligent patrons can uncover this hidden gem by traversing the passageway nestled between Centre Eaton and Place Ville-Marie. It must be noted that this venue more closely resembles a counter than a traditional coffeehouse, as seating is scarce and the atmosphere is reminiscent of a hasty "fast food" establishment. However, rest assured that your order will be fulfilled with remarkable efficiency, taking no more than 5-10 minutes of your time, and the attentive customer service you receive will leave a lasting positive impression."

"Capacious servings! 

I had the pleasure of dining at this establishment during a recent luncheon excursion with my colleagues, conveniently located in close proximity to the Hilton hotel, where we were attending a seminar. Upon entering the restaurant, we were promptly accommodated and our server, a friendly and diligent individual, ensured that our dining experience was nothing short of exceptional. 

My culinary selection for the meal was a classic cheeseburger, accompanied by a side of fries. My fellow diners, Markus and Miyoko, opted for salads, specifically the steak and mushroom variety and a fruit-laden option, respectively. What struck us all was the enormity of the portions, truly generous servings that could easily have fed three individuals. Unfortunately, my well-done cheeseburger arrived slightly overcooked, with a noticeable charring that, while not detracting from its flavor, was aesthetically unappealing. 

In conclusion, this eatery offers satisfactory cuisine, particularly when considering the dearth of palatable dining options in the surrounding area. Would I return? Only if circumstances brought me to the vicinity once more. Nonetheless, it's comforting to be back in San Francisco, where a diverse array of gastronomic delights await my indulgence."

Following an excruciatingly monotonous experience at PURE, we meandered our way, with somewhat inebriated gaits, towards Poetry, whereupon the sonic ambiance of hip hop served as a refreshing respite from the tedium that had preceded it. Our initial visit transpired on a Thursday evening, or rather, in the early hours of Friday morning, specifically at 1:30 a.m., and we were able to gain entry without any financial obligation, thanks to certain...let's say, "diplomatic efforts." Ladies, it must be noted, were charged a nominal fee of $20, but this did not deter us from partaking in an evening replete with unadulterated jollity and merriment. The tempo of the drinks service was quite brisk, and everyone appeared to have an exceptional time, with the hip hop melodies serving as the perfect accompaniment to our revelry. It is unequivocally evident that Poetry is the optimal destination for anyone harboring an affinity for hip hop music, and we shall most certainly be revisiting this establishment on future occasions, as its ambiance and entertainment have secured an indelible place in our hearts. In fact, we returned the following night, and the enjoyment we experienced was equally as exhilarating! Thus, it is safe to assert that Poetry has become a staple of our Las Vegas itinerary.

Fish and Chips anyone? Had that and the quesadilla last night, both were delicious, but i'll admit I feel a little sluggish today. Place was clean, well kept, nice waitress. We went on a quiz or trivia night, so the mood was pretty mello. Tap beers seemed pretty standard for a pub. I will definitely go back for a nightcap as it is an easy walk from my house.

I indulged in the delectable flavors of the smoked salmon on a egg white omelet, savoring each bite while reveling in the hospitable atmosphere and appreciating the convenient parking facilities. Although my beverage was somewhat lacking in potency, I would unhesitatingly revisit this establishment, as the welcoming staff, impressive ambiance, and reasonable pricing comparable to that of downtown Scottsdale, all combined to create a truly enjoyable dining experience.

My review will strictly be on what I ordered:

White Pizza - Fantastic and straight to the point.  Cheesy without being overwhelming and heavy.  1 slice is all you really need to reach contentment unless you're someone with an over-sized appetite.  Pizza is always coming out fresh.  Huge globs of ricotta, total score.  I prefer my white pizzas a little on the creamier side, but this was good enough.  Can't complaint about a $5 slice if you're in Vegas.  Great for late night eats especially if you're staying at the hotel.

OVERALL:  Great people, love the man behind the counter.  Quick service as well.

Like I always say, YOU WON'T KNOW UNLESS YOU TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!

Summer's proficiency in haircutting and her exceptional customer service skills rendered an unforgettably satisfactory encounter, which left me reluctant to entrust my tresses to any other stylist. Her meticulous approach and commitment to catering to my preferences were evident throughout the process, ensuring a look that not only surpassed my expectations but also fostered a sense of loyalty towards her services. Such a remarkable experience has secured her a permanent client in me, and I shall unhesitatingly return to her expertise in the future.

This constitutes my second venture to Victoria, and it transpired during an organized Yelp gathering, thereby yielding an exceptional ambiance, yet it became patently evident from the demeanor of the bar personnel that this establishment remains a worthwhile destination even in the absence of a meticulously planned event, much gratitude is extended to Jody B for the coordination of this affair.

The mulled cider served here boasts an impressive quality, offering customers a choice between two distinct flavors, specifically Lingonberry and Pear, with the former being my personal preference and evoking memories of past excursions to a particular Swedish furniture retailer wherein meatballs are customarily offered. It is worth mentioning that Victoria's forms part of a broader assemblage of Swedish-themed bars scattered throughout Edinburgh, encompassing Hemma, Sofi's, and Joseph Pearce, thereby establishing a logical connection.

I shall unquestionably utilize this bar as a meeting spot in the future whenever my whereabouts fall within the vicinity of Leith Walk.

"On the second day of operations, all staff members were acutely cognizant of the heightened sense of urgency that permeated the atmosphere, as they assiduously endeavored to refine their culinary skills and provide an exceptional dining experience for their patrons. In light of this, we opted to sample the Buddy's Salumi & Cheese Board, a delectable ensemble of olives, pickled vegetables, grilled Italian bread, genoa salami, spicy capicola, proscuitto di parma, grana padano, tuscan pecorino, and gorgonzola. Upon savoring the assortment, we were struck by the unparalleled quality of the capicola and proscuitto, which were undoubtedly the most flavorsome we have had the pleasure of indulging in. Furthermore, the gorgonzola boasted an unforgettable combination of a pungent bleu cheese essence and the velvety texture of brie, thereby rendering it a true gastronomic masterpiece. In addition, our curiosity was piqued by the notion of consuming a cheeseburger within an Italian eatery, and thus, we decided to relish the Pat Lafrieda Burger, which featured a brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone cheese, and tuscan fries. To our delight, the burger proved to be remarkably scrumptious. Lastly, no culinary excursion would have been complete without partaking in the sublime pleasure of the establishment's signature tiramisu, which, much to our satisfaction, transcended our expectations and emerged as the most exquisite specimen we have had the privilege of sampling anywhere. For those seeking to enhance their dining experience, we recommend requesting a table situated along the outer perimeter windows, thereby affording breathtaking vistas of The Strip. Additionally, we suggest that you bring your camera, as the captivating entree cakes crafted by Buddy and his team are certain to evoke a desire to capture their splendor and serve as enduring mementos of your gastronomic adventure."

I love independent/art/documentary/not-mainstream movies, so consequently, Camelview is one of my favorite spots as they are one of the few theaters here in the valley that gets these films.

Positive things about the theater: 
*Great movies! 
*Friendly employees
*Reasonably sized drinks (movie theater "bucket-o-cola" drinks are a pet peeve of mine and their small is equivalent to a medium soda from a fast food restaurant, which is just perfect) 
*Yummy cinnamon almonds for sale at the concession stand
*A retro-y feel 

Negatives
*Older theater that feels a bit rundown
*No stadium seating
*Seats that are not particularly comfortable

Point of note (not positive or negative)
*because of the type of movies they show, it seems like it is often popular with an older crowd of moviegoers. This can make for a sortof unique moviegoing experience if you come from a different demographic.

It is a fun spot that we manage to visit every couple of months. I wish that there were more options for Art films here in the Valley, but for the moment I do love Camelview, because I don't really have a choice in the matter ;)

Thanks to the exhaustive and meticulous evaluations proffered by Yelp reviewers, I was able to identify and select this moving company with confidence. As an individual who resides solo, I experienced considerable apprehension regarding the prospect of contracting the services of a moving company. However, upon initiating contact with the organization, my trepidation was promptly alleviated due to their judicious and considerate approach. Prior to the move, they furnished me with a photograph and comprehensive biography of the estimator who would be communicating with me, thereby engendering a sense of security and trust. Punctuality being a paramount concern, I was gratified to observe that the team arrived at the designated hour, ready to commence their labors with alacrity. Although a minor inconvenience arose in connection with the reassembly of my trundle bed, which remains unresolved at present, the overall execution of the move was flawless. In light of my thoroughly satisfactory experience, I would unhesitatingly recommend this moving company to any individual seeking such services.

I possess limited familiarity with establishments specializing in the retail of alcoholic beverages; however, my experiences at this particular store have been overwhelmingly positive.  The employees consistently exhibit a high level of customer service, manifesting in a friendly, accommodating, and unobtrusive demeanor.  On one occasion, I visited the store accompanied by my romantic partner, who expressed interest in a specific type of fermented malt beverage that the store did not have in stock.  The gentleman behind the counter promptly assured us that they would place an order for it.  Much to our delight, the subsequent visit yielded the desired beverage, which we purchased in considerable quantities.  Subsequent events are somewhat indistinct in my memory.

The show was good! But not a spectacular show as what you'd expect from their ABCD competition. However, I did put into consideration that they perform two shows in one night that is 90 minutes long each. Putting that into consideration, it would make sense of the JBWKZ to not push themselves to the limit. SO, it wasn't a mind  blowing show, but they did add sparks to the show with the electrifying technology to make it look fun. Nice spin offs of different variation of music from... 40s, Disney's, Hip Hop, Punk, even some disco music haha. Fun.

"An establishment offering alcoholic beverages of superior quality, given its strategic positioning and capacious interior. Ideal venue to initiate nocturnal revelries. Unfortunately, my experience was marred by the bouncer's insistence on scrutinizing my age verification, despite my obvious maturity, when requesting an unpretentious beverage. The potations themselves were indeed delectable, and a minuscule area designated for dancing was available. The elevated platform situated above the bar featured live performances by talented artists, which enhanced the overall enjoyment of the evening, particularly owing to the captivating presence of an attractive female vocalist."
I loved the ice coffee and everything I've ordered here has been fantastic!\nIs my go to breakfast joint while in this area.

I was surprised to see that DSW is now carrying a bunch of running shoes!  Before it used to be just casual and formal shoes (for men) but I went here the other day and was pleasantly surprised.   Now it's not going to be a specialized as say a Run for your Life or TrySports store, but it was nice to find a store that carried Mizunos or Asics.\n\nNormally I just stick to the right hand side (2 aisles) where the men's shoes are at and the back clearance section.  My sister often goes here... sometimes for hours on end and I can see why since their selection is vastly greater on the women's side.

Instead of suffering an interminable delay adjacent, I opted to sample Waffallonia's delectable offerings for the first time. Upon perusing their menu, I settled upon a waffle adorned with Nutella, bananas, and strawberries, albeit initially, the serving size appeared somewhat diminutive relative to my voracious appetite. Nonetheless, I quickly realized that my concerns were unwarranted, as each bite yielded an unforeseen profusion of flavors that satiated my hunger and left me utterly content. The waffle itself was replete with sugary morsels that evoked memories of indulgent funnel cakes, while the freshness of the fruit infused each mouthful with a vitality that was further enhanced by the harmonious blend of ingredients. My gratification was further amplified by the cozy ambiance of the establishment, whose limited seating capacity only served to enhance the intimacy of the dining experience. Ultimately, my decision to patronize Waffallonia proved not only worthwhile but indeed fortuitous, as their exceptional waffles have secured a permanent place in my culinary affections.

"Exceedingly gratifying culinary escapade!!! Although I had yet to indulge in the gastronomical delights offered by the Mesa branch of this esteemed eatery, I opted to partake in a delectable bowl of pasta, which not only satiated my hunger but also left me feeling profoundly appreciative of the exceptional service provided by my affable and attentive server, Ashley. In the event that you decide to grace this establishment with your presence, I implore you to request Ashley's assistance, as her vivacity, familiarity with the regular clientele, and unwavering dedication to providing an optimal dining experience are certain to engender an atmosphere of conviviality and merriment. Unquestionably, this visit constituted the most enjoyable encounter I have had the pleasure of experiencing at Oregano's, and I eagerly anticipate my next opportunity to savor the delectable Big Rig and Ashley's warm hospitality."

I stopped in here with the owner's girlfriend after she cut my hair. She kindly treated me to anything I wanted to eat and drink. wooo hoo! I ordered a Grey Goose and cranberry and a Las Vegas roll (my all time favorite sushi- even if it is fried). Both were delicious. Thank you!!

Last week, on the way from the Airport to the Convention Center, me and my buddies decided it was time for some breakfast.   Fortunately, we came across this IHOP.   The place was pretty empty, I believe there were only two other parties there besides us.   The service was fast and friendly.   Our hostess / waitress (Shee was her name) was awesome.   The food was average for an IHOP.   You know what you will get.   As a bonus, this IHOP is close to the Pinball Hall of Fame.   \nThis is a good place for breakfast.   \nWill I be back?   Yeah, maybe.

This review is only for the Chippery, not the daiquiris. (Though I bet they are delicious!) 

I was wandering around the Forum Shops and I wanted just a little snack before heading home. My friends were getting daiquiris and I saw they have food in the back so I shoved my way through all those wanting frozen drinks and went back. I was pleasantly surprised at the chip selection. They had 6-8 flavored of homemade chips for really reasonable prices, $3 or $5 per bag depending on size. 

The only reason that it gets less than 5 stars is that the service wasn't great. Not cheery people this afternoon at Caesars! It is definitely a hidden gem for a cheap little snack.

"It's a labyrinthine array of playthings that one wouldn't typically discover at most retail establishments specializing in general merchandise. 

I must say, I rather appreciate the organizational scheme they've implemented here. It facilitates effortless navigation to the specific section one desires to peruse, with each item meticulously arranged within its designated category - Toddler toys, board games, plush toys, educational playthings, dolls, sports-related items, action figures, vehicles, et cetera. 

My apologies for the jest regarding the'maze' analogy; however, it does pose a challenge to maneuver through the store without getting lost, albeit in a delightful manner. Upon entering, customers are directed through a serpentine path flanked by shelves brimming with an assortment of toys, ultimately leading to the central aisle. 

My experience at the checkout counter was quite satisfactory, thanks to the attentive cashier who even took the initiative to discreetly scan an item my nieces had set their sights on, doubling the efficiency of the process while maintaining a cheerful demeanor. 

While prices may vary, the toys sold here generally tend to be more expensive than those found at department stores, but the diverse selection and unique shopping experience offered here justify the slightly higher cost."

"The diminutive dimensions of the eatery do not detract from its ambiance, which exudes a convivial and welcoming aura, while the judicious deployment of embellishments and accoutrements contributes to an overall sense of refinement and sophistication; the attentive and proficient service further enhances the culinary experience. The Pad See Ew, a stir-fried rice noodle dish imbued with a rich, complex flavor profile replete with a variety of spices, is somewhat let down by a modest serving size, which, though perhaps understandable given its placement on the lunch menu, leaves a tad bit to be desired. In contrast, the Pad Thai, a dish consisting of stir-fried rice noodles, chicken, and a flavorsome sauce, boasts an impressive quantity that complements its commendable quality, with each component displaying a satisfying texture and taste; indeed, the dish elicits unreserved praise and ensures that future visits to this establishment will be forthcoming."

This place is very very tasty. The drive thru is still there so you can enjoy that, it was fast and the person who took my order was very peppy and helpful which was awesome!

The wings were perfectly cooked and very large. The only draw-back is the sides. We got french-fries and potato salad. The fries were great (according to my girlfriend) the potato salad although good the portion was incredibly small. It came in a 2 oz little plastic cup and was definitely not what I expected for $1.89 worth of potato salad which is why only 4 stars.

Other than that this place is a smash hit, avoid the sides get the wings you can mix and match the flavors as well and you won't be disappointed at all.

Watch out other wing places this is a serious contender in my opinion!

This bar is now one of my favorite places in Las Vegas. 2 shots & a beer for $9?? Yes please! The crowd was so diverse and the karaoke was fabulous! We went there on a Saturday night and it was crowded, smokey and fun. If you can't handle smoke, then this is not the place for you! The bartenders have a stiff pour and the rest of the staff is very friendly. Please be advised that true to Dive Bar standards, there is only one toilet in the bathroom, so you WILL be waiting to take a pee, so don't break the seal ladies!

"Leith Links, situated in the northern precincts of Edinburgh, serves as a verdant oasis, offering a serene ambiance and myriad recreational opportunities for residents and visitors alike. This expansive green space, replete with winding pathways, play areas for children, and designated zones for canine companions, provides an idyllic setting for leisurely strolls, invigorating runs, or simply savoring the natural beauty of the surroundings. Although comparable to the Meadows in terms of its appeal as a popular gathering spot, Leith Links enjoys a more tranquil atmosphere, largely due to the absence of throngs of students converging upon the area for picnics. However, it's worth noting that the northeastern sector of the park may occasionally be subject to unpleasant olfactory sensations, courtesy of the proximate sewage facilities. \n\nDespite its peaceful ambiance, Leith Links hosts a diverse array of activities and events throughout the year. Within its borders, one can find allotments and a Children's Orchard, which serve as hubs of community engagement and sustainability. Additionally, the park plays host to various cultural celebrations, including the Leith Festival in June and the Edinburgh Mela in August, showcasing the rich tapestry of local and international talent. Furthermore, Leith Links lays claim to a unique distinction: it was here that the rules of golf were first codified, earning it the title of the true birthplace of golf, a fact that challenges the long-held notion that St Andrews holds this honor."

"Ubiquitous yet unremarkable, this establishment offers a diverse array of fresh and reasonably priced culinary options, rendering it a frequent destination for my midday repasts. The half-and-half combinations available for their soups, salads, and sandwiches are particularly appealing, as they afford me the opportunity to sample multiple offerings without committing to a single dish. The Fontana grilled cheese, tortellini Alfredo pasta, and Cesar salad are timeless classics, executed with varying degrees of success. However, the ambiance is occasionally marred by the intrusive sound of sweeping, as staff members persist in using a brush broom to clean the carpet in close proximity to my table, generating a substantial amount of dust and detracting from the overall dining experience. Despite these minor drawbacks, this venue remains a reliable choice for a hasty and satisfying meal."

"Culinary excellence and immaculate ambiance converge at this esteemed eatery. The chef emerges from the kitchen to engage with patrons and ensure a satisfactory dining experience. Although I do not subscribe to a plant-based diet, the vegan options tantalized my taste buds. In particular, the 'gardein beef', 'gardein fish', and 'gardein chicken' dishes showcased exceptional flavor and creativity. Additionally, the innovative 'Sweet Sour Scallops' (king oyster mushrooms sliced, breaded, and fried) offered a vegan twist on the classic sweet and sour pork dish, further solidifying the restaurant's commitment to gastronomic ingenuity. My plans to revisit this culinary gem are already underway, and I highly recommend that others follow suit."

Soi loved this place.

So I went to Purple Zebra and got a giant frozen drink that Vegas is known for. However my mom was hungry. After a nice host outside said it was cool to bring in my extra alcohol we were seated. 

I have to say the margarita, for being at a Mexican restaurant, was a major fail. It was just bad. Even though the waiter was really nice about taking it back and replacing it with a different margarita. The second margarita was bad too. So just avoid margaritas.

But everything else was amazing.

You know how you can eat something and taste love? Well the carnitas tacos I had tasted like love. Just ooey gooey flavorful love. And the guacamole with pomegranate seeds.. #idied So. Freaking. Good. I also had rice. Green rice. That kinda looked like throw up. But if you close your eyes and open your mouth you'll be taken on a journey. A journey into epic rice land full of love and yumminess.

Just yeah... Go there.
I quite enjoyed the dinner I had here and would definitely return. Friendly service, excellent food... Seems on a par quality wise with Bankok Balcony in Squirrel Hill. Fairly small inside.
Great food. Kind of pricy for the portions but it is great food!! Makes you feel good about what you are eating!!

This eatery, situated within the Fiesta Resort Conference Center, warrants its own review on this platform. Unfortunately, owing to the late hour and our unforeseen presence at this establishment due to a missed flight connection, we were unable to fully indulge in the culinary offerings of this restaurant. However, the service we received in the lounge area was truly commendable, with Jenn, our server, displaying an exceptional level of professionalism and warmth, despite the influx of famished patrons. My dining companion and I opted for a soup and salad, specifically the "Chef's Famous Chicken Tortilla Soup," which, to our delight, proved to be an unparalleled gastronomic experience. In fact, it was so delectable that I would venture to say it was the most flavorful tortilla soup I have had the pleasure of savoring. Thus, if anyone has the good fortune of obtaining the recipe, I implore them to share it with me.

If you've never been to Wildflower before, it's a cute, nice soup, sandwich, salad, bread, pastry place. This is a big, bright location. 

Lovely, savory food that always seems to be made with nice ingredients, and great bread - we often come in for a meal and treat ourselves to a loaf of something delicious to go - today, sourdough with rosemary and sea salt.  It's pretty reasonably priced, and the food is interesting. 

Try the spinach salad (I get it with no bacon), or the egg, tomato & feta breakfast sandwich on ciabatta.

I give this place a 4 because while they have a great (and tasty) selection of soups, sandwiches and wraps, they miss the mark on  the smoothies.  They put orange juice in almost everyone, so while I expect a raspberry flavored \"Raspberry Rage\" it usually takes like orange juice.  I have tried about 5-6 different flavors and most of them just taste like orange juice or whatever juice they use as their base.  I still get them, but Im always dissappointed.  \n\nBtw, IMO, the best smoothie is the Blue at Franktuary

great place, very clean and service was great.
the food, a ok. devil's egg. you can actually skip that, no flavor.
the short ribs was way too much salt for my taste, I wish they ease up a bit, because you can always add if you want it saltier.
Andouille sausage, shrimp, and grits. you have to ask them extra spicy, otherwise it would be too bland. we asked for extra spicy, now it taste just right. bold.
the grits, hm. I don't think it goes well with the dish. anyway,
then we order the donut as our appetizer. that was nice too.
great place for dinner.

"The cost of our midday repast at this esteemed hostelry was somewhat prohibitive, given the exorbitant tariff of forty dollars for a meal that, while undoubtedly delectable, did not seem to justify such an extravagant expenditure. However, as we awaited the preparation of our luxurious accommodations, we opted to kill some time by partaking of a light refreshment, which, much to our surprise, turned out to be a veritable culinary masterpiece! The chopped salad, replete with an array of fresh vegetables, including celery, peas, lettuce, and an assortment of other ingredients, was truly a gastronomic delight, with each component boasting unparalleled freshness and flavor. Furthermore, the dressing applied to this delectable dish was remarkably light and subtle, thereby enhancing the overall experience. Additionally, we were served a novel taco-like shell, reminiscent of Chinese shrimp chips, embellished with sesame seeds, which added a pleasing texture to the meal. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said for the French-sized grilled Mahi Mahi sandwich, served with a side of unimpressive, non-crispy fries that fell short of our expectations, particularly considering the hefty price tag of seventeen dollars. Nonetheless, the ambiance of the establishment, situated adjacent to the Wynn pool, was undeniably captivating, and we would highly recommend the aforementioned salad to any individual seeking a truly exceptional gustatory experience in the heart of Las Vegas."
The pizza is good, but the pasta is outstanding. Nice quaint family outing place, or a great place to take a date for a private dinner. They, also, offer some good salads.

"I thoroughly relish this establishment, as it exudes an understated yet refined ambiance that strikes the perfect balance between relaxation and sophistication. The beverages, while somewhat pricey, are skillfully crafted with generous pours, ensuring a potent and satisfying drinking experience. The culinary offerings are equally impressive, with each dish showcasing meticulous preparation and attention to detail, leaving me utterly delighted with each successive visit. Moreover, the atmosphere fosters an ideal setting for leisurely sipping on expertly mixed cocktails while engaging in lively discourse with companions. The clientele, primarily comprising adults aged 26 and older, contributes to an atmosphere of mature elegance. Consistently, my experiences at this venue have been overwhelmingly pleasant."

We executed a reservation via OpenTable for breakfast, which proved to be a judicious decision, as it precluded us from having to endure a thirty-minute wait in line. Upon entering the establishment, we observed numerous unoccupied tables, which rendered the prolonged queue somewhat perplexing. As we arrived at 10:30, we had the opportunity to sample both breakfast and lunch offerings.

My mother was particularly eager to indulge in their all-you-can-eat macarons, but unfortunately, they failed to meet her expectations, as they lacked the requisite texture of melting in one's mouth. However, several of their other dessert items, such as the creme brulee and fruit tart, were quite delectable. Their crepe offering, on the other hand, was disappointing - the batter was insipid, and the berries were too tart. Moreover, the candied nuts they utilized possessed an unpleasant refrigerated flavor.

In contrast, all the meat dishes I sampled were quite satisfying. The prime rib was cooked to perfection, and the pork apple dish was scrumptious - vastly superior to the parched, chewy offerings at The Bacchanal. Additionally, their hot cherries were palatable. It's amusing that they even offer sushi.

The service was adequate, given the nature of a buffet. However, our server visited our table so infrequently that we were compelled to place our finished dishes on a nearby table.

Ultimately, despite some inconsistencies, I found the food enjoyable, and I would likely return. An abundance of delectable desserts and meats is always an attractive feature for me.

I went out to Outback for a light snack. I was seated promptly without any delays. My server was very attentive and helpful with the menu. I ordered the side salad along with the soup for the day. The salad was fresh and crisp and I promise they have the best garlic croutons. The soup was better than I expected it was a creamy onion and cheese soup. And of course they brought out their famous bread and butter!

Great place for a quick, healthy bite, featuring flatbreads, wraps, panninis, salads, soups...even quesadillas!  No matter what you choose, you know exactly how many calories are in each (the calorie count is next to each menu item). 

I devoured the chipotle chicken wrap (380 calories). The veggies were plentiful and fresh, and the flatbread was the perfect thickness--soft but not flimsy. The chipotle sauce was flavorful, with just the right amount of heat.  My only complaint is the smaller portion of chicken--more is always better.  Try the peppadew hot sauce on your meal!  Wayyyyy better than Tabasco. 

It would be PERFECT if there was one located closer to Scottsdale...So many tasty options, all at very reasonable prices--$5 got me the wrap, a drink and my choice of chips, a cookie or a brownie.  Beat that, Subway!

They possess an incredibly prime location, situated adjacent to Arizona State University and a plethora of thriving businesses. Their seating arrangements are abundant, and parking is readily accessible, making it a veritable haven for patrons. This, coupled with the exceptional quality of the staff, elevates the establishment to a rating of four stars. The personnel are unwavering in their dedication to providing exemplary service, exhibiting utmost friendliness, proficiency, and helpfulness. They are meticulous in ensuring that each customer avails themselves of the full scope of amenities included in their purchase, such as the complimentary cream cheese that accompanies certain items. It is not uncommon for establishments to overlook particulars of this nature, allowing patrons to depart without realizing their oversight. However, the staff here takes the time to thoughtfully remind forgetful customers of their entitlements. While the culinary offerings may not be the most extraordinary aspect of this eatery, they are by no means subpar. The menu boasts an assortment of unremarkable yet satisfying selections, including bagels that, while unexceptional, remain a popular choice among regulars. Notably, the restaurant offers a unique option to enhance one's sandwich by upgrading the bagel to a wrap, artisanal bread, or even a "softwich," essentially a soft, square bagel. Ultimately, this dining establishment is a reliable choice, unlikely to disappoint, thanks largely to its exceptional staff and agreeable ambiance.

A superior drinking establishment that caters to local patrons, as evidenced by the presence of bartenders from neighboring establishments who frequent the premises for recreational purposes, such as gambling and socializing. The culinary offerings are of high quality, the gaming options are diverse and well-maintained, and the bartenders demonstrate proficiency in their roles. Personal financial successes have been experienced on multiple occasions, specifically, a total of $600 in winnings from Keno and video poker during two separate visits. An uncommon occurrence, wherein the author remains in the black, monetarily speaking, after visiting this particular watering hole. The interior layout features a sizable bar area with approximately a dozen seats devoid of gaming machines, allowing patrons to partake in beverages without engaging in wagering activities, accompanied by several booths positioned along one side and a few elevated tables situated on the opposite end.

"Although I have yet to indulge in a culinary experience at this establishment, I would unhesitatingly confer a rating of five stars, primarily due to the panoramic vista that it offers. My father and I visited the Duquesne Incline initially, and subsequently, we had a brief interval prior to his departure, which enabled us to halt momentarily at the adjacent Grandview Saloon and partake in a refreshing alcoholic beverage while basking in the ambiance. 

The outdoor seating area, also known as the patio, presented a spectacular scene, boasting an unobstructed view of the confluence of rivers, in addition to offering a unique vantage point from which to observe the incline in operation. Furthermore, the assortment of beverages available was quite satisfactory, albeit we opted for a more conventional selection, specifically Yuengling. Nonetheless, the prices were reasonable considering the prime location. Our server exhibited promptness and cordiality in their interactions with us. 

While there may exist more intriguing gastronomical options within the city center, I would unquestionably return to this venue for the sake of the view, particularly when entertaining guests."
I love this place, great food and atmosphere, but on my last visit wasn't impress with new addition to menu

This place is so mix fun. The food is great and the people here are a blast. The only negative is they don't have deserts. This place screams s'mores and twinkee's but all they have is fruit. Regardless... Amaze balls!

"We were thoroughly impressed by our recent dining experience at this new restaurant located within the luxurious SLS Las Vegas hotel; boasting an avant-garde and stylish ambiance reminiscent of tapas-style establishments, the venue's meticulously curated decor exuded an air of sophistication and refinement. Our server provided attentive and proficient service, ensuring that our culinary journey was nothing short of exceptional. Each dish was artfully presented in generous portions, bursting with flavors that delighted our taste buds; specifically, the fusion of watermelon and feta avocado, accompanied by spiced nuts and a cucumber salad, proved to be a standout creation worthy of high praise. Additionally, their diverse selection of hummus and freshly shucked oysters left us eager to sample more of their innovative offerings. Lastly, the warm pita bread, fresh from the oven, served as the perfect accompaniment to our meal, further solidifying our desire to return and recommend this gem to fellow gastronomes planning to visit the city."

Ryan J brought me out here and, yes, I brought my A game--went ahead and ordered the Bear: peanut butter, cracker jacks, bacon, gouda and BBQ sauce. It was state-fair-what-did-I-Just-Do? awesome. So good. 

The carneys selling overpriced knitting nearby were odd--but we liked the lamps the guys recreating Mad Men were pimping out there.

I don't know anything about these Short Leash Dogs people--but they clearly have something dialed in. The Bear dog was part of some contest put on by the Arizona Diamondbacks. They won, so now it's become a big deal for them.

Ryan J got a different dog. And as he reviewed nearly two years ago: you gotta "unleash your hot dog inhibitions" to get into this place.

Who has hot dog inhibitions? Dumb people, that's who.

"We have had the pleasure of dining at this establishment on two separate occasions, and both experiences have been thoroughly enjoyable. The all-you-can-eat dinner option for $27 is an excellent value, particularly given the quality of the culinary offerings. While the sushi may not be exceptional, it is certainly comparable to that found at other reputable establishments. The true delight lies in the ability to order numerous dishes and sample a wide variety of flavors and textures. The menu boasts an impressive array of options, including salmon belly, super white tuna, salmon, hamachi, scallop, conch, halibut, sweet shrimp, seaweed salad, and an assortment of delectable desserts. It is essential to note that while the sushi chefs are responsible for preparing your meal, you must place your orders with your waiter. However, if you opt to sit at the sushi counter, you will be treated to attentive service and the opportunity to request whatever you desire from the sushi chefs directly. The spicy tuna crackers, which have garnered significant praise, did not quite live up to our expectations. Nevertheless, we would still recommend trying them, as they are part of the inclusive package. The pork belly, another highly-regarded item, was merely satisfactory in our opinion. Nonetheless, we suggest giving it a try, as it forms part of the overall experience. The service we received was generally impressive, with friendly and accommodating staff enhancing the enjoyment of our meals. When given the choice, we would advocate sitting at the sushi bar, as it affords a more engaging and personalized dining experience, allowing you to interact with the sushi chefs and explore their vast repertoire of culinary delights."

"This establishment evokes immense affection within me due to its hospitable personnel, reasonable pricing, and prevalence of regular patrons, which creates a welcoming ambiance. Their diverse array of delectable pastries and cakes, including the sublime Red Velvet Cake, has never been subjected to the unfortunate process of freezing. Moreover, their recent introduction of DONUTS has further augmented my enthusiasm for this venue."

"My spouse and I have had the pleasure of lodging at Harrah's on multiple occasions. During our most recent visit, we opted to bring our offspring and reserved a 'classic' accommodation featuring two queen-sized beds. Interestingly, this particular room type proved to be more tranquil and spacious compared to their 'high roller' or 'premium' options, which we found somewhat perplexing. Although the room lacked a dedicated workspace, it did feature a small table accompanied by a pair of chairs. While the decor was not entirely up-to-date, it was by no means unpleasant. In fact, we would not hesitate to select this room again in the future if presented with the opportunity. However, we did encounter a minor drawback in the form of a persistently leaking bathtub, which, although not particularly bothersome, detracted from our overall satisfaction and thus warranted a rating of less than five stars."

"Ultimately, an ecstatic hour that culminated in my euphoria. If you seek delectable cuisine and potables within a constrained financial plan, the daily 5-7 happy hour may be a judicious selection for you. $5 specialty beverages, including a pomitini meticulously crafted at your table, are available. This particular cocktail was indeed impressive and, some might say, 'girly.' Additionally, $5 appetizers encompassing a superbly seared Ahi accompanied by a Jicama and carrot salad. The Ahi boasted adequate seasoning and reasonable quality. Other $5 options are accessible as well. For instance, a colossal $6 burger, inducing two onion rings and a challa roll as a bun. Furthermore, a $12 Ahi burger, reminiscent of a croquet style, accompanied by two onion rings or a portobello burger is also available. This happy hour can be savored in either the bar area or the more relaxed patio, which features heaters for the cooler evenings. With such affordable prices, we indulged in an excessive amount of food, leaving us feeling exceptionally satiated. I highly recommend adding a side of the sautÃ©ed mushrooms from the menu, as they significantly enhance any meal."
