So much so, in fact, that my diminutive roommate, who is notorious for her hearty appetite, indulged in a marathon three-hour feast, ultimately succumbing to a prolonged state of culinary-induced lethargy that persisted for a significant portion of the day."

We perused the midday repast menu, and our gastronomical expectations were thoroughly satiated by the delectable offerings presented thereupon. It is with utmost certainty that we shall revisit this culinary establishment on our subsequent visit to Las Vegas.

"Remarkable array of options! 

Arrived mere moments before the clock struck three on a Monday afternoon. There were a mere four patrons ahead of us, yet, for reasons unknown, the process of being seated required an agonizing ten minutes. Do not attempt to test your fortunes further! The queue grows at an exponential rate as the hours approach dinner time, and the intelligent diners are not going to vacate their tables promptly, as they, too, desire to peruse the evening's offerings. 

I must confess a twinge of disappointment with certain aspects: the eggs Benedict proved impossible to slice with the utensil provided, and upon attempting to bite into it, the texture was unpleasantly rubbery...I possess an immense fondness for meat, but the carving station offered a meager two options (top sirloin and flank steak?)...The confections were undeniably adorable, but a few were slightly awry, and none inspired within me an overwhelming desire for seconds. Moreover, I found it necessary to request milk, as some desserts exhibited an excessive richness or sweetness (a peculiar sensation, as I have never thought anything was too sugary)...Lastly, we departed approximately thirty minutes after the commencement of the evening meal, yet no discernible variation in the fare being served was apparent. Dishes were replenished, but that was the extent of it. 

Yes, the cuisine was satisfactory, but I harbored expectations of sampling dishes that are not part of my customary culinary experience and that would elicit an exceptional degree of delight. Thus, I subtract a star for the absence of any dish that compelled me to crave additional portions."

Great atmosphere & wonderful service. My only complaint was when ordering a cocktail I expect there to be a little kick. I had 2 drinks & got not even a buzz. The popcorn is good, albacore tuna was phenomenal, prime rib was fun with the presentation. Overall a fun place that I would love to take out of town guests & visit again to try more of the plates.

"Indulging in an extraordinary culinary experience on the occasion of one's annual celebration of life, surrounded by dear loved ones and partaking in a veritable feast of sushi delicacies that would inspire envy in even the most discerning deities."

They do take out and delivery! The pizza is tastier than most delivery places. The 10\" is a good size for an individual pizza. The staff was a lot of fun to chat with and answered any questions we had. We will definitely be getting food from them again.

EM Cafe, a culinary haven, launched two years prior and garnered immense popularity, principally owing to its unpretentious and airy ambiance. Boasting towering ceilings, pristine white walls that serve as an artistic canvas for local talents, and a spacious table in the center, ideal for communal feasting or sizable gatherings, the eatery exudes an inviting charm. While the fare may be deemed unremarkable, it has recently experienced a slight decline in quality, specifically regarding the potatoes, which have elicited criticism. Nonetheless, the likes of sandwiches, omelets, and French toast continue to impress, with generous portions that, though not excessively vast, satisfy the appetite. This cozy establishment has become a mainstay in the Mile End neighborhood, defying the notorious reputation of Parc Avenue, where many businesses struggle to survive beyond the initial six months.

"Although my predilection towards Aria and Cosmo is somewhat equivocal, I am unequivocally certain that my penchant for participating in poker games within the confines of Aria renders it a decidedly more practical and advantageous option for my lodging arrangements, thereby obviating the need for further deliberation on the matter."

"Culinary excellence! We thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience, particularly the carne asada platter special, which showcased an impressive array of flavors. Our companion's Killer Burrito, ordered from the menu's hidden gems, also garnered high praise. Although our server was attentive, we encountered minor lapses in service, including unrefilled drinks and an absence of follow-up attention. These shortcomings, while noteworthy, did not detract from our overall satisfaction. We eagerly anticipate our next visit."

I was impelled to visit this coffee shop due to the captivating nature of its name, which arrestingly caught my attention. Located in the Noda area, a region notorious for its chaotic parking conditions, this establishment boasts a unique advantage - its own private parking lot, an amenity that undoubtedly enhances its appeal. Additionally, it offers complimentary Wi-Fi, a feature that has become an indispensable requisite for contemporary patrons.

The interior of the shop exudes a warm and welcoming ambiance, characterized by approximately ten diminutive tables situated both within and outside the premises. Furthermore, it houses its own roasting machine, a facet that serves as a significant asset for ardent coffee connoisseurs. As a personal preference, I incline towards coffee with a robust and saccharine flavor profile, reminiscent of traditional Cuban coffee. Nonetheless, I inadvertently ordered a Hazelnut cold brew, which, although enjoyable, did not align with my penchant for sweeter coffee.

In pursuit of a suitable venue for academic pursuits, I elected to visit this coffee shop, dedicating three hours to productive endeavors. Following this duration, I opted to sample their Chai iced latte and lemon poppy muffin. While the latte exhibited commendable quality, it failed to leave an indelible impression on my palate as an unmissable beverage.

Notwithstanding, I am inclined to revisit this establishment, primarily owing to the exceptional amiability of its staff and an eagerness to experience their Cuban coffee during cooler climates.

I thoroughly relished myself. Despite the dearth of laudatory remarks proffered by numerous acquaintances. Her visage was more presentable than I had anticipated. The bottle service significantly contributed to an exceptional soiree. One bottle of ciroc for four females. We exhausted the entire contents and indulged in a rip-roaring time. The padded bench-style seating afforded comfort. The panorama visible from the bottle service sector was breathtaking. It's enjoyable to imbibe beverages, rise from one's seat, and engage in terpsichorean movements alongside one's companions. The stage accoutrements and performers substantially augmented the production's overall quality. I would unquestionably observe it once more.

Very loud and boisterous and bustling, and thankfully we had a reservation, but spent a great evening here!  The service was fantastic, the food and drinks came out in a timely manner, and there doesn't really seem to be a bad seat in the house.  I went simple and had the cheeseburger and I'm still dreaming about the next time I can go back and have another, it was fantastic.  And then I doubled down and had the brownie and thought I'd died and gone to heaven.  And the wine list was pretty big with some interesting options.  I would go back in a second, just really decent American cuisine well-prepared and served with style.

"This culinary establishment offers an exceptional dining experience at an affordable price point, featuring delectable Persian and Middle Eastern cuisine in a casual, fast-food setting. For a mere $8-$9, patrons can indulge in a satisfying meal accompanied by a beverage of their choice. The fare is prepared fresh daily, bursting with flavor and presented in generous portions. The Kubideh combo, comprising two skewers of one's choice between ground chicken or ground lamb, is a particularly popular option among regulars, providing ample sustenance for a remarkably reasonable tariff."

A rather unobtrusive coffee establishment situated directly beneath the esteemed Elizabeth Arden's Red Door Spa, offering a limited selection of baked goods, yet I opted for a refreshing iced coffee beverage priced at three dollars. Although the consistency proved somewhat diluted to my liking, its revitalizing properties were most welcome during a sweltering afternoon. Lamentably, no sugar water was apparent to enhance its flavor profile, a factor that might have elevated the overall experience.

"Culinary offerings are satisfactory, yet the hospitality experience is truly impressive. I frequent this establishment primarily to observe televised sports events and indulge in adult beverages. The numerous televisions positioned throughout the venue, coupled with the expansive outdoor screen, create an exceptional viewing environment that enhances the overall entertainment value."

"It is Saturday morning, and I am still on the road for another week; thus, it is imperative that I avail myself of the opportunity to engage in the process of laundering my garments at this establishment, which boasts of possessing easy accessibility and maintaining a high level of cleanliness. Furthermore, I have been informed by a courteous attendant that they offer an additional service known as fluff and fold, which costs $1.50 per pound. This laundromat appears well-equipped with numerous machines, complimentary Wi-Fi, a change machine, an assortment of soap products, television sets, air conditioning, ceiling fans, carts, folding tables, seating areas, and other amenities. Notably, its location on the corner provides convenient access for truck drivers, who can park their vehicles on the street adjacent to the premises. I shall unquestionably return to this laundromat in the future."

Love, love,  love the Cajun barbecue shrimp! Be sure to order extra bread so you can soak up all of the yumminess! Great service, great drinks, especially if you are here before all the crowds. And yes, you must like country music...it IS a country bar with awesome music and some amazing live bands wed-sun. Did I mention the amazing shrimp! :)

"Although I did not opt to lodge at this establishment during my recent visit, I did partake in the gaming facilities available on the premises. I must say that I had an enjoyable experience, culminating in a financial gain of a couple hundred dollars, which left me feeling content and satisfied. However, I must admit that the procurement of beverages did prove to be somewhat protracted, but I refrained from harboring any animosity towards the staff due to the delay. Furthermore, I have it on good authority that the roller coaster located within the confines of this hotel is truly remarkable, and although I did not have the opportunity to indulge in its thrills during my most recent visit, I have fond memories of my previous experiences with it. In fact, I am eagerly looking forward to my next visit, during which I intend to sample the accommodations offered by this esteemed hostelry."

Great concept! I loved the individual portions just for the novelty of it. It might be useful to go with a buddy and pick out things to share.

Highlights included the pesto mashed potatoes, prime rib, fried chicken, mushroom risotto, and truffled scalloped potatoes.

Lowlights: ramen (too salty), sushi (I didn't try any, but apparently it was the worst sushi ever), and some of the desserts were disappointing (rock hard red velvet cookies).

Cool idea with the mac and cheese bar, but one bowl can be shared with the table, as it's very rich and creamy, and the portions are pretty big. And you wanna save room for those king crab legs, right?

Maybe this place doesn't have the variety like other buffets, but they offer items that are different or use different ingredients, which makes it more interesting.

"The overall quality of the barbecue served at this establishment is truly commendable. In particular, their chipotle cheese-stuffed sausage is an absolute delight, with the cheese being particularly noteworthy for its rich, creamy texture and bold flavor profile. Additionally, their hushpuppies are also quite impressive, boasting a moist, fluffy interior that is reminiscent of a well-crafted conch fritter. Furthermore, their pulled pork, mac and cheese, and baked beans are all exceptional offerings, showcasing a masterful blend of flavors and textures. Patrons can choose from a diverse array of sauces, with their signature sauce being a personal favorite of mine - it skillfully balances the tanginess of a vinegar-based sauce with the richness of a tomato-based sauce, creating a truly unique and satisfying culinary experience. However, I must note that my experiences with their brisket and ribs have been somewhat inconsistent, with the former being less than desirable on one occasion and the latter being somewhat fatty and tough. Nevertheless, I remain optimistic that these instances were merely anomalies, and I look forward to continuing to support this local business, whose staff members consistently display a high level of professionalism and hospitality."

"My spouse and I had our inaugural dining experience at Presto today, and we thoroughly enjoyed it! We sampled their ahi tuna sliders, which were tantalizingly delicious, and their Greek pide, which was equally impressive. As someone who has never had pide previously, I was pleasantly surprised by the non-greasiness of the crust, which made for a refreshing change from the typical pizza experience that often leaves me feeling overwhelmed by excess oil. While I did note some dissatisfaction with the service in certain reviews, our server was quite attentive and efficient, alleviating any concerns I may have had regarding prolonged wait times. However, I must admit that my only criticism lies in their practice of pre-preparing all salads and storing them in a cooler, which led me to question the crispness and freshness of the ahi salad I initially intended to order, given that it had been sitting for several hours by the time I arrived to collect my food at 3 pm. Despite this minor reservation, I found the overall dining experience to be pleasant, and I am grateful to have a health-conscious eatery in such close proximity to my residence."

I can only give this hotel 4 stars because I didn't stay here and didn't get the full Cosmopolitan experience. I can imagine that it's worth all 5 stars, but I can't know for sure just yet. I did however visit the casino a few times during the day and night. It's gorgeous inside with strands of crystals hanging from the ceiling like you are actually inside a chandelier. OMG I loved it, sooo pretty. The clubs and shops inside were top notch and most probably out of my price range, but awesome none the less. I went to the Sports Book and got to watch my team kick butt for a little while on their screen of TV's. I had bet at my casino, but The Cosmopolitan's odds were better. This place is pretty much one of the nicest hotels on the Strip right now. I walked through almost every single hotel, and this one really stood out!

I was in North Phoenix for a friend's birthday.  This place was choose by one of our mutual friends.  This place is very authentic!!!  The help speaks Cantonese! (and English) and were very helpful in their recommendations.  I would go back if I lived up there.

Amidst the bedlam of the Las Vegas Strip, my companions and I opted to partake in a libation or two at this particular watering hole, seeking refuge from the pandemonium that permeated the surrounding area. Prior to attending a cinematic presentation at the South Point Theatre, we decided to indulge in a cursory repast at this establishment, cognizant of the fact that the casino would be teeming with people. My initial experience at this venue left much to be desired, but upon returning, I found the ambiance to be somewhat improved. We entered the premises at approximately 10 pm and seated ourselves in one of the side booths. Although the wait staff were initially sluggish in acknowledging our presence, they became more attentive once we had made it clear that we were indeed patrons.  

The menu offered an extensive array of culinary options, which, while impressive, also carried the potential to backfire. In my previous visit, I was less than enamored with their chili; however, I was pleasantly surprised by the diverse selection of salads available. On Thursdays, they offer a BBQ chicken dish served atop cold soba noodles, accompanied by a copious amount of vegetables. The marinade used for the chicken was reminiscent of Chinese-style BBQ, albeit with a more pronounced saltiness than sweetness. The half-portion, priced at $8.95, proved sufficient to satiate my hunger. Despite my attempts to maintain a healthy diet, I found myself succumbing to the allure of my companion's fries, which were cut generously and cooked to a golden brown perfection.  

Furthermore, the musical selection played during our visit was a welcome addition to the atmosphere, featuring an assortment of 90's alternative tracks that evoked memories of my youth. The likes of Smashing Pumpkins and Bush filled the air, transporting me back to a bygone era.

What I love about this location over the two that I am used to in Milwaukee is the basement used vinyl section. The two in Milwaukee run their vinyl on the floor, completely packed. I always have to sit on the floor, pull some out, and move like 20 at a time.\n\nThis location has 75% of the stuff in bins that I can stand and pick through...and the best part is that there is no one in the basement, so you don't feel weird if you want to sit there for two hours literally looking through every album. I don't feel welcome to do that at the one on 76th st in Milwaukee.

You will discover this culinary delight within the confines of an unpretentious watering hole referred to as Moon Doggies. I conveyed to Chris, proprietor of Naked City Pizza, my apprehension regarding the safety of visiting such an establishment after sunset. He assured me that it was primarily a gathering place for industry professionals and not to be concerned. 

In the company of my spouse and progenitor, I partook in a midday repast at this purported eatery. We opted against ordering their signature dish, pizza, and instead chose to sample their buffalo wings. Additionally, we requested the steak frites sub, a special dish inscribed on a blackboard within the premises. My parent had a chili cheese hot dog accompanied by a portion of french fried potatoes. 

The buffalo wings were thoroughly enjoyable, prepared precisely to my preference. We requested them to be served "hot," and they did not disappoint. My patriarch was quite taken by his chili cheese hot dog, adorned with an assortment of toppings including chili, cheese, pickles, onions, jalapenos, et cetera. Unfortunately, he did not express the same level of satisfaction with his fries. 

The steak frites sub was a colossal bread roll smothered in cheese and filled with beef that had been marinated in garlic, a creamy horseradish sauce, and shoestring fries. It was presented with a side of peppery gravy to be drizzled over the top. The quality of the sandwich was exceptional. The meat was copious and perfectly seasoned, thereby eliciting a positive response from my taste buds. 

The total cost of our meal for three individuals was twenty-five dollars, and we even took some leftovers home. I shall certainly return to this establishment in the near future to sample their pizza.

"We decided to partake in a midday repast at this eatery on an early Saturday afternoon, and upon our arrival, we observed that there was only a single additional table of patrons present, which did not come as a surprise given the novelty of the establishment. Our server, who appeared to be relatively new to her role, executed her duties proficiently. We opted for the Ma Po Tofu and the Baked Pork and Rice complemented by a Portuguese sauce, both of which exhibited palatable flavors. This restaurant offers a suitable venue for sampling Hong Kong-style western cuisine and serves as a commendable alternative to the abundance of Chinese eateries situated on Spring Mountain Road, particularly for those located on the eastern side of the city."

"While I do not frequent Dish for the purpose of indulging in an epicurean adventure, I must confess that I derive immense pleasure from the relaxed ambiance that permeates the establishment, particularly when seeking sustenance following a late night of revelry or as a salve for a lingering hangover. My preference is to place an order for a half grilled cheese sandwich, accompanied by a steaming cup of tomato bisque. I must say that I am quite enamored with the practice of serving a deviled egg as a complementary side dish, a thoughtful gesture that elevates the dining experience to a new level of sophistication. My unwavering fondness, however, lies with the black bean and rice burrito, a delectable entree that never fails to satiate my hunger. Furthermore, the musical selections played on the jukebox contribute to the overall convivial atmosphere, transforming Dish into a veritable haven for those seeking refuge from the mundane rigors of daily life."

I recently had the pleasure of visiting this quaint eatery twice within a 24-hour period during my excursion to Las Vegas. Their prices are extremely reasonable, and the culinary offerings are unexpectedly delectable. Upon sampling their garlic chicken wings, my spouse expressed satisfaction, whereas I found them to be slightly lacking in flavor, although the crispy garlic was quite palatable. I thoroughly enjoyed their salted fish and chicken fried rice, with a generous serving size that did not scrimp on the salted fish, a notable aspect that impressed me. Additionally, I purchased their jook for my father, who was indisposed, and he relished the salted pork accompanied by a thousand-year-old egg porridge; the flavors were adequately balanced, neither excessively salty nor overly watery. During our subsequent visit, my father opted for their curry beef, the quality of which I presumed to be satisfactory, given that he consumed the entire dish. We also indulged in their beef chow fun, which boasted an abundance of flavor derived from the intense heat of the stove. While there were other menu items we sampled, my overall impression of this modest yet charming restaurant, situated outside the Las Vegas Strip, is one of contentment. Furthermore, its location away from the strip ensures that dining here will not significantly impact your financial resources.

"Devoid of any frivolous or unnecessary expenses, the cost of services rendered by Dan, an individual in whom I have unwavering trust and with whom I have had the pleasure of acquaintance since his tenure at Chapman, was found to be eminently reasonable and altogether commensurate with the exceptional quality of workmanship and dedication evidenced in the maintenance and repair of my Audi vehicle, thereby precluding any potential grievances or dissatisfaction on my part."

Last night, in the company of some acquaintances, I visited this establishment and partook of their culinary offerings. The hospitality we received was quite impressive, as our server exhibited remarkable attentiveness, repeatedly refilling our beverages and even dividing the tab for us after we neglected to request it. My individual pizza, adorned with artichokes and sliced tomatoes, was truly exceptional, warranting the slightly elevated price due to the superior quality of its constituents. The other patrons at our table also expressed satisfaction with their meals, and by the conclusion of the evening, there remained no pizza uneaten. While I would advocate for a broader array of options, the overall experience was certainly worthy of repetition.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment surpass the customary fare found in traditional public houses, boasting an elevated level of sophistication and creativity that sets them apart from the standard menu items typically associated with such venues. My personal preferences inclined towards the savory tomato soup artfully crafted with the distinctive tang of goat cheese, the crispy goat cheese fritters, and the delectable butternut squash croquettes - each dish showcasing the kitchen's dedication to utilizing fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. Furthermore, the extensive selection of expertly curated, locally brewed beers available on tap complements the cozy, dimly lit ambiance that permeates the interior, creating a welcoming environment that invites patrons to linger and indulge in the rich flavors and aromas of the culinary delights on offer."

"I thoroughly enjoy the fact that this establishment consistently maintains a high level of patronage, yet still manages to provide exceptional service and culinary offerings. Upon each visit, I have been impressed by the proficiency and attentiveness of the staff, who have demonstrated an unwavering commitment to ensuring a satisfying dining experience. Furthermore, the menu boasts an array of delectable pasta dishes, which I have had the pleasure of sampling on multiple occasions. Notably, their flank steak salad has proven to be a flavorful and nutritious option when I am in the rare mood for a healthier selection. Additionally, their Italian sodas are a refreshing delight, with the Hurricane variety being my personal favorite. In conclusion, this venue has become my preferred destination for Italian cuisine and is unequivocally worthy of a visit."

Superb cafe right next to Concordia campus that's perfect for a quick lunch, a study area (especially downstairs), a quick delicious drink or a relaxing weekend with poetry readings on Saturday & Sunday. Basically, they have it all! The half panini + soup combo is under $10 which is a steal for a student like myself. The lavender, rosemary lemonade is deliciously tart and full of flavour, which is wonderful because many a-times lemonade is extremely watered down. Yes this may just be another \"artsy\" cafe that litters montreal, but the atmosphere and table arrangements create a comfortable stay, no matter what you're there for! Also, i read a past review that there used to be shisha and i'd love to see that return! It would be awesome!

Second time visiting this establishment, the culinary offerings were expedited with remarkable celerity during the peak lunch hour on a Saturday afternoon, exhibiting an impressive degree of gastronomical proficiency. The comestibles themselves were quite delectable, comprising a diverse array of flavorsome options such as Pa-nang curry, pineapple fried rice, and Mongolian beef, all of which were relished with great enthusiasm. Furthermore, the chicken pad Thai was also savored with immense pleasure. Notwithstanding the piquant nature of our meals, we yearned for even greater fieriness, thus prompting us to recommend that patrons who share our predilection for spirited Thai cuisine should consider requesting their dishes be prepared at an intensity level of 11, an increment above the standard 10, in order to experience the full gamut of flavors that these dishes have to offer.

"The culinary offerings were indeed delectable, however, the hospitality experience fell short of our expectations. Following a leisurely afternoon indulging in the therapeutic amenities of Qua Spa, we opted to partake in a late luncheon at this establishment. The pizza, boasting an abundance of toppings and a satisfying crunch, lived up to its reputation; regrettably, the same could not be said for the level of attentiveness displayed by our server, whose lackadaisical approach to refilling water glasses and monitoring our dining experience left much to be desired."

"It was brought to my attention that this particular buffet was considered the crÃ¨me de la crÃ¨me in Las Vegas, and upon perusing the extensive array of culinary offerings, I found it challenging to dispute such claims. The assortment of delicacies boasted an impressive diversity, ranging from the delectable snow crab and king crab, to the tender steak and savory prime rib, complemented by an abundance of shrimp and the usual suspects associated with a traditional buffet spread. While the prices may lean towards the higher end of the spectrum, a visit to this esteemed establishment is undoubtedly a requisite for any gastronomic excursion in Sin City. My personal experience involved a veritable feast of crab, the value of which would have been considerable at any other eatery, and I must confess that the taste and aroma of each dish left me thoroughly impressed. Furthermore, the presence of John Wall outside only served to enhance the ambiance, transforming the occasion into a truly unforgettable experience. In conclusion, I eagerly anticipate my next visit to this gastronomic haven."

Firstly, it's an exceptionally pleasant drinking establishment.  The barkeepers and support staff are truly remarkable!  If you possess an ardent affection for brewed beverages, we highly recommend indulging in their assorted sampling platter and experimenting with their diverse offerings; however, in our humble opinion, their crimson ale reigns supreme!

Having previously experienced the delectable tuna poke at Lulu's in Lahaina, Maui, BJ's faced formidable competition. Nonetheless, they managed to deliver a sublime interpretation of the dish. Additionally, the avocado egg rolls gratified my stomach immensely, and delightfully, they were utterly devoid of excessive oiliness.

The ambiance is convivial, boasting numerous televisions for viewing various athletic competitions, thereby ensuring a thoroughly enjoyable experience for patrons.

This establishment boasts an unparalleled dining experience, particularly in regards to their delectable chicken ceasar salad, which truly showcases a sublime harmony of flavors, with the dressing strikingly achieving a precise balance between tanginess and richness, thus catering to even the most fastidious palates; furthermore, their margarita pizza, prepared using a traditional wood-fired method, offers a delightful culinary excursion, although some patrons may prefer a slightly lighter crust, which can be readily addressed by requesting a brief cooking duration from the attentive servers, who, along with the captivating ambiance, contribute significantly to the overall enjoyment of one's repast.

HH is the kind of place you go to when you're low on cash, it's Monday night & you are willing to drive to pick up your food.  They used to offer a medium 1-topping pizza for $5.55 on Monday nights.  Last wk when I called to order the special, they said it changed to a large for $5.99.  The beauty of this offer is that you don't have to buy 3 pizzas to get that price like the other chains!!!!!  With the economy in the toilet, I was astounded that they increased the size thereby improving the value for my hard earned dollars.  \n\nAs for taste & quality--it's pretty good.  I like to order the thin crust and usually get sausage or pepperoni anything extra, I add on myself (e.g., red onion, black olives, etc).  They don't glop on the sauce or skimp on the cheese & I've never rec'd a burnt/nearly burnt pizza.  It's even pretty good reheated.

We entered this esteemed eatery with the intention of partaking in an evening meal, and our culinary experience was indeed gratifying. I have had the pleasure of consuming masala dishes at various establishments, but none have compare to the piquant, delectable chicken masala I was served here. The hospitality of the staff was also commendable, as they exhibited a high level of friendliness and attention to detail. It is worth mentioning that I possess a great fondness for Indian cuisine; indeed, my affection for it is so profound that I feel compelled to express it through the use of an emoticon.

Delicious Southern food!

The cornbread was so good. I got BBQ Beef Ribs, with Mac & Cheese, Collard Greens, and Yams. The ribs were full of yummy NC vinegary flavor, the mac was cheesy and good, the collard greens were tangy and flavorful, and the yams were savory and sweet. For my first dinner in Charlotte, I was def satisfied.

Prices are decent, and the service is good.

Parking can be a little tough. My best suggestion would be to park in one of the nearby structures, bc there really isn't street parking.

Arrgh, just when I kicked my Chipotle habit, this place comes along.  Some great tortilla soup, custom made enchiladas that come out of the oven piping hot.  Why didn't some one come up with this earlier?  My biggest gripe is the parking lot, not the easiest to negotiate a little parking lot on 7th street during prime rush hour but worth it.  Oh they have great snickerdoodle and Mexican wedding cookies for purchase right at the counter!

"I have an affinity for this diminutive establishment; it pales in comparison to the colossal store situated in North Scottsdale. Nonetheless, I prefer perusing the merchandise herein due to the relatively tranquil ambiance that prevails most of the time. Although they do not stock an exhaustive inventory of items nor feature a food court or bar, they nevertheless possess an abundance of superior quality goods. Following a visit to Trader Joe's, I customarily patronize this store."
I like the idea I like the simple menu been there several times the only downside is once in a while the chicken will be rubbery but that just depends on the chicken I guess

Sierra Gold invites you into a very comfortable atmosphere with good quality food & satisfying craves to enjoy whether one might be there for televised sports, video poker, or simple just sitting down at the bar or amusing seating area.

First thing to keep note: HAPPY HOUR everyday from 3pm-7pm & 12am-4am (50% off all drinks & pizza)

As for the food:
_Thin crust pizza (not a fan, but just got sold with the quality & outcome of the pizza that's served here)
_Bucket of wings (so many favors, garlic parmesan is a favorite)
_Bucket of curly fries (gotta love'em)
_ZOOKIE (too good to be true! The warm white chocolate macadamia nut cookie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, whip cream, & dizzled with chocolate/caramel just hits the spot to that sweet tooth crave)

Service could have been better, but what do you expect at midnigt: top noch service? (minus 1 star)

I have yet to try more & what's best: this local spot is open 24hours!!!

Came here frequently in college. Fell in love with the green curry. I had the chance to go to Thailand for myself and eat some of the dishes I learned to love at Thai Taste - and Thai Taste's versions of the dishes are amazing.

This elevated terrain, graced with an observation deck and an incomplete commemorative structure, offers a panoramic vista of the surrounding landscape on days when atmospheric conditions permit. During the summer solstice, the unobstructed solar radiation provides optimal conditions for photographers to capture breathtaking sunrises and sunsets from this vantage point. Throughout the year, this site serves as a platform for various artistic displays and live performances, such as the renowned Beltane Festival on April 30th, which celebrates the spring equinox. Additionally, on December 31st, it is one of seven hills that present spectacular pyrotechnic displays to usher in the new year. It is hoped that the natural beauty and accessibility of this hill will remain unaltered, as it provides a tranquil refuge for local inhabitants seeking respite from the bustling urban environment nearby. Personally, I find this location to be quite appealing and an excellent spot for a peaceful stroll, removed from the activity of the city mere meters away.

"The Great Wall presented itself as my inaugural dim sum experience, thereby transforming me into an untainted canvas, susceptible to the unrestricted influences of its gastronomical offerings. In light of my limited familiarity with the genre, my appraisal shall be founded upon my individualized, yet inherently biased, interpretation of the culinary establishment. Consequently, I shall articulate my impressions, while acknowledging the precedence established by Mr. K's comprehensive and perceptive analysis. His review serves as a succinct encapsulation of the restaurant's essence, thus rendering my supplementary remarks somewhat superfluous. Nonetheless, I shall proceed to offer my subjective assessment. The comestibles served at the Great Wall delighted my taste buds, conforming to my expectations of a satisfactory dining experience. The ambiance radiated liveliness and joviality, fostering an environment conducive to conviviality. Furthermore, the novelty of the eatery's presentation distinguished it from the customary venues populating Phoenix's gastronomic landscape, thereby providing a refreshing departure from the conventional. The convenience of its location along the highway also merits mention, as it facilitates accessibility for patrons. Geographically, the Great Wall occupies the initial shopping plaza positioned on the eastern side of 35th Avenue, situated just north of Camelback Road. For those afflicted with spatial difficulties, this description serves as a useful guide for navigating to the destination."

"Having been eager to visit this establishment for an extended period of time, I was finally able to fulfill my culinary desire during a recent business excursion. Having sampled numerous purported 'best pizza in the US' venues, including this one, I must admit that while it does not hold the title of the most scrumptious pizza I have had the pleasure of consuming â?a distinction reserved for the likes of Motorino in New York City and A16 in San Francisco â?it undoubtedly boasts an impressive gastronomical experience. The ambiance of the restaurant exudes a unique charm, further enhanced by the exceptional quality of the service provided. Needless to say, I would unhesitatingly return on my next visit to the area."

We visited Tamari on a Friday evening, and owing to the fact that our reservation was rather late (approximately nine o'clock), we were requested to wait for our table for approximately ten minutes due to the restaurant's considerable popularity. The hosts were incredibly cordial and hospitable, and during our brief wait, they kindly offered us drinks from the bar.  

Tamari boasts an extensive array of beverages, encompassing intriguing cocktails and a satisfactory selection of wine and beer.  

I was thoroughly impressed by the imaginative combinations of tapas presented. For the first time in my life, I didn't feel particularly famished. Hence, I opted to sample merely two tapas - specifically, the lamb lollipop and the red snapper. The lamb was remarkably tender and delectable. My fondness for the red snapper, which was served with mussels in a saffron broth, was immense. This dish was uniquely flavored and utterly delicious!  

My companion had the empanadas (which unfortunately did not meet his expectations), but he was thoroughly astounded by both the cost and the caliber of the hangar steak. We presumed the price of $2 to be a jest (or perhaps a typographical error intended to read $20). The steaks (or chicken, bacon, and quail egg, or salmon) come in relatively small portions, of course. Nonetheless, their quality compensates for their modest size!  

Although I have yet to taste the sushi, I am eager to return and experience it. Moreover, I must mention that we spotted Sam Worthington (known for his role in Avatar) at the establishment. My companion insisted that I disclose this information to you, and he further suggested that I augment the rating by half a star in light of Sam's presence. Regrettably, I cannot comply with that request.

"Arrive punctually and avail yourself of the opportunity to secure a seat, as the venue tends to reach capacity rapidly! I hold this cinema in high esteem, as it consistently showcases an array of films that are not commonly accessible elsewhere, thereby offering a unique viewing experience. Spaciousness and comfort are hallmarks of this establishment, but be prepared for a premium price point and a bustling atmosphere, particularly on weekends when parking can prove challenging."

As far as sports bars go, this might be my favorite. Fantastic atmosphere, more than enough high-quality screens. Truly not a bad seat in the house. Added benefit is the phenomenal patio -- one of the best bar patios in town for sure. I've been there twice in the past week to watch Suns playoff games. Food is very good for bar food. First night was just 5-6 shared appetizers (wings, potato skins, chicken quesadilla, etc. - you know the stuff for us health nuts). Everything was fantastic. The second night we had the prime rib, mashed potatoes and asparagus dinner. Only $12 and it was great. After we had the skillet cookie which was one of the best things I've ever tasted -- I will get that every time I go no matter what. ;-) The only drawback was the wait staff. Was hard to get a drink a few times. Other than that, fantastic experience and we will be back regularly.

"It is an unmitigated delight to partake in the consummate pleasure of savoring the unadulterated flavors of culinary fare that is both succulent and fresh, which this eatery proffer with alacrity. Furthermore, it is an unequivocal boon for any urban locale to be graced by the presence of such an establishment, the proprietors of which display an unwavering commitment to catering to the dietary inclinations of their clientele, specifically those who seek organic and healthier options."

Great place to get your drink on!  We were here for a private event but had a blast on the dance floor.  The appetizers and drinks were great.  Kudos to the bartenders for making the drinks fast.  I really love the lounge feel and the music was bumpin' the night we went.  Great place to hang if you're looking for something more intimate than XS or Tao.

"I am an unwavering devotee of the midday repast offered by Villa Antonio, principally due to its exceptional value. For a mere $9, one can indulge in a delectable spread of culinary delights, featuring an array of options that cater to diverse tastes and dietary preferences. The sheer variety of dishes available renders it an optimal destination for a speedy yet satisfying luncheon during working hours. Baked chicken, roasted vegetables, fresh salad, creamy mashed potatoes, cheese-filled ravioli, and an assortment of additional Italian specialties are all part of the extensive offering. In conclusion, the cost-to-value ratio is not only reasonable but also generously skewed in favor of the consumer, making it an unparalleled bargain."

My office typically orders Jason's to go, but if you feel like getting out, it's worth it.  Kind of a pain to get to but the salad bar is serious business.  For $7.99, you get unlimited trips to the small, but well-rounded offerings, fluorescent glow included free of charge.  It's not a huge salad bar, but it has everything you need to have a good lunch.  Added bonus:  Captain's Wafers!  Those crackers take me back to childhood!  I would suggest avoiding the patio though, as there is always some vagrant milling about.\n\nIf you are not looking for an excuse to be less productive, Jason's delivers ($3 charge I think) and I would recommend the turkey reuben.  Super good and under 550 calories with baked lays and a pickle.

Upon our return home following a four-day sojourn in Las Vegas, we felt compelled to express our profound satisfaction with the exceptional hospitality and culinary delights we experienced at Level 107 on two consecutive evenings, where we savored delectable appetizers and relished the unparalleled quality of their signature martinis, available at a generous two-for-one discount, complemented by a 50% reduction in price for the delectable hors d'oeuvres, which tantalized our taste buds and left us in a state of gastronomic nirvana, prompting us to enthusiastically recommend this esteemed establishment to any individual seeking an atmosphere of conviviality and refined indulgence, where they can indulge in superlative beverages and bask in the attentive and solicitous care of the friendly and competent staff.

A bright, pleasant breakfast spot close to our hotel.  We ate here several times during our 2 weeks in Brossard.  Come hungry.  They certainly fill your plate.  Crepes, waffles, pancakes, omelets, blintzes, they have it all.  They serve free coffee with your meals and always make sure it's topped off.

The weekday staff speak very little English.  However, a hostess and other staff show up for the weekend morning rush, most of which are competent English speakers.  Either way, we had no problem making understood what we wanted.

Can't account for the other negative reviews.  Maybe the people up here have higher standards than what I'm used to back in the States.

"While it is conceivable that alternative breakfast establishments may boast distinctive qualities, superior menu items, or captivating aspects that set them apart, this particular venue has reliably delivered scrumptious and nutritious meals, complemented by exceptional, rapid, and cordial service, over an extended period. My personal preference is the Chickichanga, although I have sampled a significant portion of the menu and found each item to be remarkably flavorful and satisfying. Furthermore, I appreciate that the culinary options available at this establishment do not leave me feeling bloated or weighed down by excessive amounts of dairy products and unhealthy fats, which enables me to thoroughly enjoy my dining experience without subsequent regret."

From scratch pastries, breads, breakfast, lunch, dinner options
Cozy coffee shop atmosphere, fireplace, plenty of tables.
Cash only. Pay at front and they will bring the food out to you.
Free refills on coffee.
Never dissapointed.

Having traveled to Peru numerous times, I must say that the food here is equal to or better that what is available in Peru. We went there for lunch and went back to have dinner. The owners and wait staff work very hard so that your dinning experience is well worth a visit. Enjoy!!

My offspring indulged my spouse and me with an excursion to a culinary establishment specializing in Sino-Asian cuisine, commemorating our conjugal union, during the previous month. I must aver that this particular edifice, purveying delectable comestibles of the Far Eastern persuasion, ranks among the more respectable establishments of its ilk within the territorial boundaries of Arizona, owing to my previous residency in the City by the Bay. Although the tariff may be slightly elevated, we did relish the ambient surroundings, proficient hospitality, and gastronomical delights. My quest for an autonomous, meritorious Chinese eatery continues, as I am particularly fond of the dim sum genre.

Awesome place for pho ! Special combination is good,  but there serving is  not consistent sometimes you get a big portion then next time you get a sad face\n :( but this is the only restaurant that serves pho in my area . Service is excellent ! Hope \nThis information is useful :)

"The Chuck Wagon serves as the sole purpose for visiting the Longhorn Casino, as it occupies a considerable area within the establishment, which is entirely justified given its delectable offerings and reasonable pricing. While the culinary selections are diverse, my personal preferences gravitate towards their breakfast menu, specifically The Stampede, comprising an assortment of scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, hash browns, and toast. However, the primary draw of this eatery lies in its exceptional S.O.S., which has garnered the approval of my father, a retired Marine, whose discerning palate serves as a benchmark for gauging the quality of such fare. Although the service at The Chuck Wagon is generally impressive, a single star must be deducted due to the necessity of navigating a smoke-filled casino environment, followed by an inevitable waiting period."

"Indubitably, my carnivorous inclinations shall no longer be satiated by the offerings of County Market, for I have discovered an establishment that not only caters to my gustatory desires, but also extends a token of gratitude in the form of a customer appreciation card, thereby ensuring a pecuniary reduction on future purchases. The aforementioned edifice, known as Old Time, boasts an array of delectable sausages, including the traditional bratwurst and an assortment of innovative flavors, such as applewursts, which I highly recommend indulging in. Additionally, their flank steak is a culinary delight, and their bulk Italian sausage is an ideal component for creating a homemade spaghetti sauce. My sole grievance pertains to the limited hours of operation and the inconvenient location of this gastronomic haven, yet the friendly and accommodating staff compensates for these shortcomings with their proficiency in procuring specialized meat cuts."

I have had the pleasure of visiting Fuzzy's Tacos multiple times, and my experiences have been overwhelmingly positive. My preferred option at this establishment is the Taco Plate, which offers an excellent value for the price. For a mere $6.49, one can indulge in two delectable tacos accompanied by two sides, constituting a satisfying meal. I have sampled both the vegetarian tacos and the tempura shrimp tacos, and I must say that they were exceptionally delicious. Notably, the chips and salsa provided are generously portioned, with no stinginess regarding the salsa. While the burritos are passable, I strongly advise adhering to the tacos, as they are undoubtedly the superior choice. Furthermore, the fiery sauce available is genuinely piquant, sure to satisfy those who crave a spicy kick. Unfortunately, I have occasionally encountered prolonged waits for my meal, leading me to suggest that Fuzzy's consider implementing a policy whereby patrons ordering chips receive them promptly, thereby mitigating the wait time for their primary dishes. In conclusion, Fuzzy's Tacos presents itself as a prime destination for taco and chip enthusiasts, boasting numerous televisions ideal for viewing sporting events. I wholeheartedly endorse paying this eatery a visit with a group of friends when feasible.

"Optimally priced at six dollars, this culinary establishment offers an exceptional gastronomical experience, featuring a delectable burger complemented by the eatery's signature smashed fries and fried pickles, all of which are served in a prompt and amicable manner, thereby providing an overall satisfaction that surpasses that of its competitors, including In N Out, albeit for a slightly higher price point."

"This diminutive wine store is truly remarkable! Despite my limited familiarity with wine consumption, I opted to visit this establishment for a Community Market Youth Employment (CMYE) event. Notably, all the wines sold at this venue are crafted using environmentally responsible and sustainable farming practices, which will undoubtedly appeal to patrons who prioritize ecological awareness. Conveniently situated within the Atherton Market, ample parking facilities are available; however, locating the Vin Master proved to be a bit of a challenge due to its seclusion behind a pizza restaurant and lack of visibility from the main street. Fortunately, conspicuous signs and GPS navigation facilitated its discovery, thereby averting an otherwise unfortunate situation. 

Upon entering the shop, one cannot help but notice the spacious interior, characterized by exposed brick walls, high ceilings, and pleasant illumination, which collectively create a relaxed ambiance. Additionally, the presence of a few chairs and tables allows customers to sample a glass of wine before making a purchase, thereby enhancing their overall experience. Chris, the proprietor, is an incredibly affable and knowledgeable sommelier who will gladly assist clients in selecting an ideal wine suited to their preferences. 

In conclusion, paying a visit to this charming wine store is certainly worthwhile, and it is likely that visitors will depart satisfied with both their encounter and their chosen wine."

Currently, our establishment is undergoing extensive refurbishment, having been closed for the past two weeks. The concept of value is inherently subjective; however, we believe that our patrons receive a satisfactory dining experience, particularly during the lunch hour, where they can indulge in a delectable array of flavors and spices, complemented by an agreeable ambiance, all for a comparable price point to that of a fast-food chain. Thus far, we have received favorable feedback regarding the quality of our service, despite the brief duration of the typical lunch period. While our culinary offerings may not be perfect, we take pride in the consistent preparation of our dishes, boasting fresh ingredients, such as our signature salsa, beans, rice, and vegetables, which elevate our menu items above those of our competitors. However, we acknowledge that our protein selections could benefit from additional seasoning to truly excel. Nonetheless, we remain confident that our patrons will appreciate the overall dining experience we provide, and we look forward to surpassing the expectations of even the most discerning palates, including those who may hold Macoa's in high regard.

"Love that the restaurant places its emphasis on utilizing fresh, locally-sourced ingredients as the foundation of its culinary creations. The ambiance and dÃ©cor are equally impressive, fostering a welcoming environment in which to enjoy a meal. The service we received was exceptional; our server ensured that our glasses remained consistently filled, never dipping below the halfway mark. We opted to begin our dining experience with the goat cheese appetizer, which proved to be a delicious choice, particularly when paired with the accompanying beets. My main course selection was the smokey burger, boasting an incredible depth of flavor; however, the texture of the patty was somewhat problematic, as it had a tendency to disintegrate upon handling, making it challenging to consume without a certain degree of dexterity. My spouse chose the sirloin steak, accompanied by sautÃ©ed mushrooms, and while he praised the rich, savory flavors, he did comment on the chewiness of the cut, as well as the presence of gristle throughout. For our final course, we indulged in the s'mores parfait, which delighted our taste buds with its sweet, chocolatey essence. All things considered, we would undoubtedly revisit this establishment, perhaps opting for the prime rib or a seafood entrÃ©e on our next visit."

I am compelled to convey my utter bewilderment regarding the events that transpired, as my cognitive faculties were unable to comprehend the unfolding sequence of events, precipitating a state of utter confusion and perplexity; however, I must admit that the visual spectacle presented itself in a manner that was aesthetically pleasing, although I would not consider it feasible to expend financial resources for a subsequent viewing.

"I have an immense fondness for this establishment, as it possesses a certain je ne sais quoi that sets it apart from its contemporaries. The interior ambiance is particularly noteworthy, boasting an impressive illumination that creates a warm and welcoming atmosphere. My associates and I frequently partake in the culinary delights offered by this esteemed establishment, specifically their pizza special, which is available at a discounted rate of fifty percent after the clock strikes twelve. The pizza itself is quite delectable, with a crust that is remarkably thin and flavorful. In addition to the edibles and potables, this venue features a designated area for recreational activities, complete with two pool tables and several televisions that are equipped with interactive games. Although I am unfamiliar with the specifics of these games, I can confidently attest to their entertainment value, as they seem to be a source of enjoyment for many patrons. For those who wish to contribute to the sonic ambiance, a substantial jukebox is available, allowing individuals to select two songs for every dollar inserted. Located in close proximity to Ann and Camino Al Norte, this establishment is conveniently situated across the street from Smith's. Furthermore, should one encounter locked doors after ten o'clock, fear not, for it is simply a security measure, and entry can be gained by means of a buzzer system."

I've never had a bad meal at Newk's!  Their soups are great, and it's kind of hard to find a good soup (that isn't Panera or greasy chicken noodle) in uptown.  Lobster bisque is money, and I had the Ultimate Lobster soup today (I hate lobster, obviously), and it was awesome.  Great caesar salad, fresh and crunchy, and they have a little toppings bar.  Can't go wrong with some roasted garlic on the side (also hot peppers, pickles, capers, parmesan cheese, and thin crispy breadsticks).\n\nAside from all this... you know what the best part is?  The giant plastic cups that they give you when you get a fountain drink.  We have about 40 of them in the cupboard at work, they are awesome cups for large quantities of water or tea, so you don't have to keep refilling every minute.  It's the little things, people.  The little things.

This place has awesome deals of two for $5 fro-yo or boba!!!  I always get the same, taro milk tea w/ pearls.  They give you a stamp card for everything too!!!  So, every time you buy waffles, crepes, fro-yo, or boba, you get stamped!  They each have their own stamp cards though.  I think its pretty cool how they double stamp you even if you get the two for $5.

I havent had their crepes, but the waffles are delish.  Only downside is that it does take a little while to come out, so if you're in a hurry i'd skip on the savory waffles, and grab something else.  Shaved ice is yum.  I always get the regular one with fro-yo, three toppings of your choice,  shaved ice, and condensed milk. 

I really enjoy coming here and everything i've tried so far is good.  Check it out if you're in the area.

"Indulge me with yet another delectable SinCity burger, if you would, my good fellow! Its gastronomical allure is simply unparalleled, boasting a mouthwatering medley of egg, bacon, and cheese that tantalizes my taste buds with unbridled fervor. While their signature Smash Fries are undoubtedly a culinary masterpiece, their quality can be somewhat capricious, depending on the frequency of our visits. However, their salads are by no means inferior, providing a fresh and crunchy experience that is only marginally marred by the excessive application of dressing, which, if not requested otherwise, has a propensity to transform the lettuce into a veritable sea of sauce. Notwithstanding these minor drawbacks, this establishment would have easily earned a perfect five stars, were it not for the occasional inconsistency in the quality of their fries and the rather soggy state of their salads, relegating it to a still respectable four-star rating."
I took my CCW class here and the instructor was very knowledgeable.  No complaints here and he made me a more accurate shooter.  What more could you ask for?

One Of my favorite bars in Pgh:) they have a wide variety of beers on tap and there is always specials running everyday of the week... Appetizers are delicious, burgers are well stacked and sum pretty yummy wings! you can buy the sacuses for the wings which is amazing!! I recomend the teriyaki or the honey BBQ wings!

"For me, Chick-fil-a represents the epitome of comfort fast food, and my affinity for their culinary offerings is unwavering. The original chicken sandwich, when augmented with a single packet of honey mustard, becomes an unparalleled gustatory experience. Moreover, the delectable waffle fries, which sadly are sometimes provided in meager quantities, are invariably accompanied by an additional honey mustard packet for dipping purposes. It is worth mentioning, however, that on certain Wednesday afternoons, I have had the privilege of witnessing the extraordinary talents of an exceptionally skilled balloon artist at this particular location. This individual's proficiency in creating intricate balloon sculptures has captivated my attention to such an extent that I have been oblivious to both the waiting time and the presence of numerous children, thereby enhancing my overall dining experience. Chick-fil-a's ability to cater to families is yet another aspect that sets them apart from their competitors, as their kids' meals often include educational toys designed to promote literacy."
nice and small family run restaurant with great food you can eat in or they have fast delivery everything we tried has been really good and with enough leftover for another meal
Just had steak, bacon & sweet potato tots (& hot sauce!!) for breakfast, Scott had the Hawaiian Breakfast - loved it!!! Soooo good!!

If you want to commit suicide by soda and sweets, come here and get your supplies.

Rocket Fizz is a great place to find odd sodas and candies that bring back childhood memories.  I visited a similar little store in St. George once, so finding one here that's bigger and better is awesome!  If they have the Jelly Belly Strawberry Jam soda, grab one.  They're goooooood.

Great prices, a plethora of soda to choose from and great candies.  I love the Fizz.

Got a coupon for a free glitter ball in my email yesterday..so off I go with my little man for a free toy!
Got there and plenty of glitter balls to choose from.
I highly recommend signing up with the email rewards club. They always have events for the kiddos and freebies and great coupons.
I also brought the little guy here when Ozzy Osbourne was signing his new book. it was hella crazy, line around the building. But I managed to take cuts right in front..no one questioned me since I had my baby. We met Ozzy and had a fun time. 
The staff was a bit overwhelmed by the crowd..but they did good.
I always stop here when Im at Town Square.

R.I.P.

Chocolate Swan 
[January 1983 - March 2009] 
Resident of Mandalay Bay

After a courageous 16 year battle with erratic consumer demand and developing trends, Chocolate Swan passed away peacefully at their home in the Mandalay Bay. CS was very popular amongst both its peers and clients for making some of the most delicious desserts on the Strip. Their eclairs were among the best in the resort, and their cakes so beautiful that brides often called in advance to place orders for their big day. CS reached out and touched the hearts of so many with their delicious treats. 

I will add, the minute I discovered they had passed (it was a little over three minutes ago) was a sad one for me. For the family and friends of Chocolate Swan, I shed a virtual tear.

Please forward all donations, warm wishes and condolences to: Mandalay Bay, 3950 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Las Vegas, NV, (877) 632-7800

I really like La Condesa.  What stands out is the variety of fresh salsas on their salsa bar, and the great variety of tacos to choose from. I've had the shrimp, and a couple of different versions of their steak tacos.  I've also had the mole chicken, which was great as well.\n\nService can be a little sketchy here, mostly because they're often very busy.  But if you're in the area, it's a great place to try.

Went here with some friends for the all you can eat dinner. Pretty cheap compare to other place and the food was good. We got seated as soon as there was a table available. We order our meats and our server was very attentive refilling our drinks and bring more meat as we ordered. Everything was great from the beginning. But beware of smelling like Korean food as you leave!

Over the past fortnight, I have been a regular patron at this specific PetSmart establishment, indulging in an array of canine delights, including delectable treats, premium dog food, and an assortment of playthings. My new puppy, Howie, has been relishing the gourmet BLUE BUFFALO cuisine, which boasts a unique blend of nutritious ingredients, excluding soy, gluten, corn, and meat byproducts. While the cost may be slightly elevated, I rationalize that investing in Howie's healthy sustenance is analogous to my own commitment to consuming wholesome fare. The toy selection, though adequate, could benefit from a more diverse array of options, catering to discerning pet owners who desire quality playthings for their furry companions. In terms of collars and leashes, I lament the limited variety available for male canines, and thus, I implore the management to consider expanding their inventory to accommodate a broader spectrum of stylish, coordinating accessories that complement the pooch's coat and enhance their overall appearance. The staff members have been courteous and helpful, offering valuable insights into canine behavior and providing tips on effective training methodologies. However, I must emphasize that bringing pets into the store poses a significant risk of exposure to various diseases, as not all pet owners adhere to rigorous vaccination schedules or proper animal care practices. Consequently, while the notion of shopping alongside one's furry friend may seem appealing, it is, in fact, wiser to leave them at home, ensuring their safety and wellbeing.

"A remarkable establishment specializing in expediently prepared gastronomical delights, my personal experiences at this venue have been varied, with the most recent visit falling short of my elevated expectations, despite the fact that the culinary offerings remained palatable and the service was relatively prompt, provided the queue was not excessively prolonged. My previous indulgences in their assorted sandwiches have been uniformly satisfying, although I must admit that the salads I have sampled have not quite met my lofty standards."

"Culinary excellence is exemplified by the consumption of a delectable green chile burger at this establishment, whereupon the savory flavors and textures of the dish elicit immense satisfaction. Notwithstanding the seeming incongruity of ordering a burger at a Mexican eatery, the culinary mastery of the chef negates any misgivings and renders the dish an absolute delight. Furthermore, the presentation of sopapillas subsequent to the meal serves to augment the dining experience, their sweet and fluffy texture providing a pleasing contrast to the savory fare that precedes them. However, it must be noted that the service at this venue can be somewhat sluggish, with an inordinate delay in the procurement of refills being a recurring issue, thereby detracting slightly from an otherwise enjoyable dining experience."

i went based on good to great recent reviews.and they didnt disappoint. i had machaca breakfast w/came w/rice n beans n tortillas. however, when asked for another order of tortillas i wasnt informed there was a charge. to my surprise it was $1.50 for 2 small flour tortillas. you can get a dozen  for .99........anyways food was good but lil things like that dont sit well w/me n im sure you can agree. like free refills or extra salsa come on guys...ill bring to their attention next time personally...

"It is not my customary practice to provide feedback on service due to its inherent variability contingent upon the individual server, however, I must express my unequivocal praise for our waitress' exceptional performance. Despite the fact that she appeared to be the sole staff member attending to the entire restaurant, her proficiency was unwavering, ensuring that my beverage was consistently replenished and her diligent efforts were undeniable. A supplementary star is warranted solely on the basis of her meritorious service. 

This unpretentious establishment, ostensibly a sports bar, boasts an impressive array of culinary offerings, encompassing dinner entrÃ©es, salads, burgers, sandwiches, appetizers, et cetera. Our expectations were surpassed by the diverse menu, as we anticipated a limited selection of pub fare. Both my spouse and I opted for the Western burger, a satisfying meal comprised of a slightly underseasoned patty, yet the BBQ sauce exhibited a pleasing flavor profile, rendering it an enjoyable consumable experience. 
The Frings, an order of both fries and onion rings, accompanied our meals, displaying commendable crispiness and judicious seasoning. 

This cozy eatery offers an ideal setting for viewing a sporting event while partaking in a satisfying repast. Its extensive selection renders it an excellent choice for a casual dining experience."

"While aimlessly meandering through the culinary domain in pursuit of a gastronomical delight, my gaze fell upon the remnants of a recent Amore pizza order, which had been artfully arranged within the confines of my refrigerator. Inspired by a sudden craving for a savory indulgence, I decided to sample a slice of the aforementioned deep-dish pizza, opting to consume it au naturel, without the benefit of thermal rejuvenation. To my utter astonishment, the unheated pizza proved to be remarkably delectable, with an array of subtle flavors that had hitherto remained imperceptible to my taste buds during its initial consumption. Consequently, I would enthusiastically endorse maintaining a chilled reserve of this culinary masterpiece for those unexpected visits from dear relatives, such as one's younger sibling or brother-in-law."

"An ideal location for a brief repast, appetizer, or dejeuner. Particularly suitable when uncertainty regarding the availability of other dining establishments on Christmas Day necessitates a temporary gastronomic solution, thereby warranting a visit to this eatery, especially given the two-hour waiting period at either Sam Woo or Dim Sum. 

The porcine buns, priced at $1.30 apiece, emerged fresh from the oven at 11:30 a.m., boasting an adequate size. However, the avian pot pies failed to justify their cost, unless one harbors an unwavering yearning for the quintessential American adaptation. In contrast, the shredded beef accompanied by green onion rolls proved satisfactory, primarily due to the latter's ability to withstand the rigors of time, thus rendering them suitable for consumption during the subsequent morning's hangover, albeit at a price point surpassing that of the aforementioned porcine buns. 

Honey, allow me to behold your porcine buns in Las Vegas, baby Las Vegas."

"Ample parking facilities were readily available, thus facilitating our vehicular ingress and egress. Prior to partaking in the culinary offerings of the establishment, we opted to sample the beverage selection. Unfortunately, our request for a Crown Royal was met with an apologetic dismissal, as the venue had ostensibly exhausted their supply of this particular libation. Suffice it to say, we were incredulous at this turn of events. 
Nevertheless, we persevered and elected to procure an alternative accompaniment for our breadsticks, which arrived promptly and in satisfactory condition. The attendant proffered oil and butter, and we must admit that the latter augmented the flavor profile of the breadsticks considerably. 
Pursuant to our investigation of the menu, we determined that the grilled shrimp on the rock appetizer and clams possessed an uncommon savory quality, further enhanced by the visually appealing presentation. 
Upon consummating the main course, which consisted of angel hair pasta accompanied by marinara and meatballs, we were pleasantly surprised by the gustatory satisfaction afforded by each item. Although the venue was bustling with activity, the attendants managed to maintain a respectable level of attentiveness and efficiency throughout the dining experience. 
Regrettably, our stomachs having reached satiation, we were unable to partake in the dessert offerings, specifically the bombalinos. However, we assure you that our patronage shall be renewed in the future, as we eagerly anticipate the opportunity to sample further delights from this establishment's culinary repertoire."

"My preferred pizza in Madison, WI, boasts an unparalleled combination of flavors and textures that render it a culinary masterpiece, obviating any concerns regarding the crust's quality or the cooking method employed. The pizza's toppings, an assortment of delectable ingredients carefully curated to maximize taste and aesthetics, serve as the primary focus of my enthusiasm, rendering me nearly speechless upon each encounter. My recent indulgence in this gastronomic delight, following a five-year hiatus, has only reaffirmed my unwavering admiration for its unrivaled excellence."

The club boasted an expansive interior, characterized by an open layout that afforded patrons ample space to engage in various recreational activities without experiencing a sense of claustrophobia or confinement, which was further accentuated by the novelty of dancing on the water; this unique feature not only added an extra layer of enjoyment to the overall experience but also fostered a convivial atmosphere that encouraged social interaction among the club's clientele.

This is my favorite boa location. Staff is helpful and friendly. It can get busy tho especially with all the retailers banking here. \nI don't mind it because after your done there is so many food places around that area!

A nice casual breakfast spot. Food was tasty and even though there was a line out the door, it moved fast. We did have to sit outside because the tables inside were full. Only disadvantages to note: it's serve yourself/cafeteria style. You have to get your own silverware, condiments and drinks. 2nd is they do not have any alcohol so you can't get your Sunday mimosa or Bloody Mary here.

"We revisited this establishment on July 5th to partake in their delectable birthday bowl, an annual tradition of mine. The corporate entity of GG has demonstrated remarkable hospitality and customer-centricity by accommodating my request to avail said bowl beyond its designated duration, thereby ensuring that I could relish it during our visit to the vicinity. Kudos to them for such magnanimity. It is worth mentioning that a waiting period has been a recurring phenomenon during our previous excursions to this eatery, yet on this particular occasion, the culinary staff excelled in preparing my vegetables to perfection, while my sauce, though slightly over-salted due to my own oversight, maintained an admirable level of flavorfulness, ultimately rendering the $16 expenditure for two individuals a thoroughly satisfying experience. My affection for GG remains unwavering."

The store here is laid out very well.  It is more of a custom baby store, but has quality items at all diffrent prices.  Some of them my husband and I were sticker shocked, but with having our third baby nine years after the last lots has changed.  The staff here was very helpful and we will be registering for some of our items for the baby shower.

This place is solid. It's not in the same league as Two Sisters Thai or Sala Thai in Phoenix (and I wouldn't call the flavors \"exceptional\" as other reviewers have - I would call them slightly above average), but I go there regularly since it's close to where I live. It's more authentic than a lot of the trendy Asian restaurants in Scottsdale, so that's a plus. One caveat: if you walk in and more than half of the tables are full, LEAVE. This place is not equipped to deal with a full house.

"Gourmet Burger. 

Visited on Memorial Day and unexpectedly, it was teeming with patrons, yet not overwhelmingly so. We managed to secure two seats at the bar. I was inclined to divide a boozy milkshake, but my companion was in the mood for a mixed drink. I opted for the Brown Cow Float. It was lighter, and my companion still needed to provide assistance in consuming it! The flavors were sublime. A true root beer aficionado, I relished the taste of the alcohol. 

Both of us chose to order burgers. My companion augmented his Steakhouse Burger with an egg. I selected the Funghi variety. Both were prepared to perfection. They were delectable. Generous servings. While the fries were unremarkable, the burger's immense size made up for it. The truffle essence was detectable, and the Gruyere cheese was melted to a golden, creamy brown. It was an elevated, sophisticated mushroom and Swiss burger. In a positive manner. The fries were average, but considering the caliber of the establishment, they should ideally serve impeccably cooked fries. Kudos to them, however, for including them in the burger's price. 

The bartenders provided adequate service, but the preparation of the shakes and burgers was leisurely. My companion expressed satisfaction with the mixed drink he had ordered. 

We shall return, and on our next visit, I will request that they ensure my fries are crisp."

I reside and am employed within a mere two blocks of the establishment, hence upon perceiving the pre-opening preparations through the windows, my excitement was palpable. Having an economical and delectable taco venue in such close proximity was nothing short of a culinary dream come true.

Having partaken in their offerings on at least fifteen occasions, I can confidently attest that while some menu items excel over others, the overall quality has yet to disappoint. The pork tacos, in particular, have recently transcended into the realm of the sublime, whereas the beef variants are merely satisfactory. The chicken option, though not necessarily the most scintillating, boasts the dual advantages of being both healthful and flavorful. However, the Carne Asada fails to impress, and the fish taco, regrettably, falls short of the exceptional standards I have experienced elsewhere. Notwithstanding these observations, the inclusion of organic cabbage and tomatoes constitutes a considerable merit in my estimation. Furthermore, their assorted flavored lemonades range from utterly captivating to merely adequate.

The most compelling aspect of this dining establishment lies in its unparalleled value, with three generously proportioned tacos available for the eminently reasonable sum of $4.50. Although authenticity may not be its strong suit, the combination of healthy, non-greasy ingredients, economical pricing, and a proprietor distinguished by his warm and welcoming demeanor render this eatery an irresistible draw, enticing me to partake in its delights on a weekly basis.
