While the quality of the fare is undeniably impressive, it is the exceptional level of customer service that truly sets it apart from its contemporaries. Arthur, the proprietor, displays an unparalleled dedication to ensuring that each patron who enters his domain feels welcome and valued, evincing a genuine interest in their individual experiences and preferences. This personalized approach is a refreshing departure from the impersonal nature of chain restaurants, and it serves as a testament to the eatery's commitment to fostering a sense of community among its clientele.  

My recent visit afforded me the opportunity to sample the Roasted Turkey sandwich, which exceeded my expectations with its flavorsome cold cuts and freshly baked bread. The Mozzarella sandwich, with its rich, velvety cheese, proved to be another highlight of the menu. Furthermore, the turkey chili warrants high praise for its satisfying, comforting qualities, particularly on days when the temperature drops. Patrons would be wise to note, however, that beverages are served in generously proportioned vessels, nearly rivaling the size of a small vat. Additionally, the restaurant offers half-sandwich and soup combinations as part of its lunch specials, providing customers with an economical alternative to the standard full-sandwich option.  

The extraordinary hospitality extended by Arthur during my final visit merits particular mention. As the lunch hour drew to a close and the dining area became relatively quiet, he took the time to engage me in a leisurely conversation, displaying a genuine interest in my occupation and thoughts on the local downtown area. Such personalized attention is a rarity in today's fast-paced, large-scale dining establishments, making this cafe a veritable gem in the midst of more impersonal chain eateries. Those seeking a welcoming atmosphere and delectable sustenance would do well to pay this eatery a visit and experience the warmth of Arthur's hospitality firsthand."

"Accessibility is a hallmark feature of this arena, boasting proximity to both a garage and street parking lot, rendering it effortless for patrons to arrive and depart. The dimensions of the arena are considerable, primarily accommodating hockey matches and local graduation ceremonies. Although the box office is situated at a slight remove from the arena, attendees can avail themselves of conveniently located restrooms and indulge in reasonably priced refreshments. The seating arrangements are designed for optimal comfort, while events conducted on the lower level are distinguished by a covering of opaque flooring that retains the subterranean chill of the underlying ice rink, imbuing the atmosphere with a gratifying tangible sensation."

Spent a few nights at the Palazzo, then came down to the Cosmo with a group of friends.  Completely different vibe than most other Vegas places.  The Cosmo is definitely a higher class (read pricier) place, but has a more edgy and trendy side to it.  No cheesy statue of Caesar or reproductions of ancient Eurozone here. Rooms are fresh and inviting, and the casino area even has a better feel to it.  This place is in the CItycenter area, so be prepared for a hike if you are wanting to see TI, Wynn, or other casinos on the north end of the strip.

"Their pancakes are by far the most exceptional I've ever had! Just the mere thought of initiating a description of them causes my salivary glands to become hyperactive. They possess an inherent warmth, fluffiness, and buttery texture on the interior, juxtaposed with a delicate crispness on the exterior, particularly when consumed from the edges. Yummmmm... The combination of that with their warm maple syrup renders them utterly delectable. Despite being satiated, I still crave more! Not only were their pancakes remarkable, but their eggs were also of exceptional quality. We opted for the Apple-smoked Bacon, avocado, and jack cheese omelet, albeit we chose to disassemble it. We extracted the cheese, supplanted it with unadulterated egg whites (not egg substitute), and requested that they scramble it thoroughly (I abhor runny eggs). Truly, one of the most satisfying breakfast experiences I've had in an extended period. Every aspect, including my OJ, was superb. The sole reason I refrained from awarding them 5-stars is due to the absence of high chairs, subpar service, and the establishment's dire need of aesthetic renovation."
Shared a small white pie and cheese steak w/onions & cheese whiz w/my bf for dinner last night. Both were deeeelish! I would highly recommend to try.

"My affection towards this establishment stems from the superior culinary offerings, specifically the delectable burgers, which are presented in an array of diverse styles that cater to discerning palates. Moreover, I appreciate the separation between the dining area and the bar, fostering a conducive ambiance for an enjoyable dining experience. During our visit, we were captivated by the live broadcast of a hockey game on the spacious screen situated within the dining room. For those seeking a more economical option, I recommend visiting on a Monday, when the burgers are available at a reduced price of $5. However, I must confess that I would not personally opt to pay the standard price range of $8-11 for a single burger, as I believe there are more affordable alternatives available."

Located within the confines of what can only be described as an indoor carnival-esque environment, reminiscent of a state fair, the venue in question boasts an ambiance that is nothing short of frenetic. However, upon entering this veritable mecca of culinary indulgence, we found that the fare offered was more than sufficient to satiate our hunger, despite the somewhat exorbitant cost. For a mere $200, three individuals were able to partake in a veritable feast consisting of copious amounts of meat, sides, and a selection of beverages. Furthermore, it is worth noting that the author of this review had previously engaged in a grueling athletic competition, specifically a half ironman triathlon, prior to consuming an entire ribeye and accompanying sides.

We had an amazing meal here...granted it was 3 years ago. Had a spicy shrimp dish and it was so delicious. Service was wonderful as was atmosphere. Both my husband and I still talk about the amazing Mexican meal we had here. Give it a try....

Typical SW. The staff is friendly. Sometimes, flights to/from here get really booked, especially when it's during snow season and everyone's trying to go eastward. I never had any issues with my flight, thank goodness. Their gates are super crowded though. So if you want to sit down and wait for you flight, get here early.

"I have an unwavering fondness for this establishment, particularly with regards to their breakfast offerings. Upon entering, I opted for a Fat Boy bloody mary, which was augmented with both bacon and string cheese, thereby elevating its flavor profile. Subsequently, I placed an order for the crab Benedict, which proved to be an exquisite culinary experience. My fellow diners chose the Denver scramble and prime rib hash, respectively, and both expressed unanimous satisfaction with their meals. As a conclusion to our repast, we indulged in cookie dough egg rolls, which, albeit sinful in nature, were undeniably delectable. It is worth mentioning, however, that their 6 layer carrot cake remains my perennial favorite among all their dessert options. A word of caution, though: on Sundays, anticipate a considerable delay before being seated, as the waiting list tends to be rather lengthy. To mitigate this inconvenience, the restaurant features a lounge area where patrons can enjoy beverages while awaiting their turn."

"I recently partook in a culinary excursion to Verrado Grille for the initial time, and I must remark that it was an exceptional encounter given the circumstances. They cease operations at 9 p.m., and we arrived at approximately 8:30, hence I was anticipating subpar service due to our tardiness. Nonetheless, our server was quite hospitable, and the service remained satisfactory despite the proximity to closing time. I sampled a pint of Verrado Ale, which is an offering from Four Peaks' 8th Street brewery, and opted for the Almond Encrusted Basa, a visually appealing white fish complemented by a delectable Orzo/Risotto accompaniment. The cost is comparable to the level of excellence provided, and I would not hesitate to offer a slight increase in remuneration for the culinary experience. Overall, it was a delightful escapade, and I would heartily endorse aiming for a sunset repast, as the panorama over the golf course and the White Tank Mountains is truly breathtaking during that timeframe."

The text is: "Open 24/7. I just have to say every time we come here the girls that work inside are very nice and if they get a chance they will talk with you. Since they see us at least once a week we talk more. It always is clean inside and they are usually stalked up on drinks and snacks etc. Of course, we will be back."

The modified text is: "Operating on a continuous basis throughout the entire day and night, this establishment's welcoming female staff members consistently display amicable demeanors and engage in cordial conversations with patrons, fostering an atmosphere of warmth and hospitality. Upon entering the premises, it becomes apparent that meticulous attention has been devoted to maintaining a spotless environment, with an abundance of refreshments and snacks available for consumption. Given the favorable impression garnered from our frequent visits, it is unquestionable that we shall return in the future."

"Hurray for exceptional Blockbusters! While there exists an alternative location in closer proximity to my domicile, its selection proves subpar, the staff appears unfriendly, and the overall ambiance resonates as uninviting. Conversely, this particular store boasts an expansive layout, harboring an impressive array of choices. In fact, I would venture to claim that their collection surpasses those of most competitors. Furthermore, the employees we have had the pleasure of encountering have consistently displayed cordial demeanors and possessed a keen sense of humor. Additionally, we have subscribed to the Blockbuster online service, which operates seamlessly and efficiently, mirroring the likes of Netflix. Whenever we opt to utilize one of our in-store exchange privileges, we experience prompt and hassle-free transactions. Unfortunately, the aforementioned secondary location seems to encounter difficulties in this regard. Nonetheless, this Blockbuster remains my preferred choice within the valley region. The sole reasons for deducting a single star pertain to the inconvenient parking facilities and my desire for a closer proximity to my residence."

We were promptly seated at our reservation time, bread was brought (really, one dinky little roll?!! with no options for more?) and the waiter went through a couple of things.  The spinach salad was great, as were the bbq shrimp, but 4 average size shrimp for $20?  Probably the worst value on the strip, yeah they were awesome with a great bbq sauce but way overpriced for just 4.  \nThe seabass was very good as was the lamb shank.  Coming with sides included made it a fair value. The blueberry cobbler for desert was great!  \nWill probably come back, maybe for lunch this time.

Why did I come here: It was close by which is a plus for a student who lives in Campustown and wants to support something local.

They are open at good hours and I have never had a problem with getting an appointment. 

For a GUYS haircut, it is the perfect price for what I get. I have gone to more expensive places in the NW for a similar quality haircut. It is quick too and I never wait long.

The stylists are nice and friendly. I love the joke one plays on me when they "That will be a million dollars, please." If you like deals and are willing to pay cash, you can get your 10th haircut free.

"Contrary to Chheng L.'s presumption, individuals residing in California are not the sole aficionados of Yoshinoya, as evidenced by the fact that my acquaintances and I frequently dined at various establishments of this particular chain during my tenure in New York City, which were consistently brimming with patrons. The culinary offerings of Yoshinoya are indeed delectable and affordable, while the staff proficiently expedites their duties. The sole drawback of this specific franchise in Arizona, in my opinion, is its physical distance from Phoenix; however, this minor inconvenience is largely negated by its close proximity to the Dysart Road exit of Interstate 10, merely a single minute away. Notwithstanding, I remain hopeful that Yoshinoya will eventually opt to inaugurate additional franchises within the confines of Phoenix itself. Furthermore, although Chheng L.'s suggestion of combining clam chowder with beef bowl may seem unconventional, I personally found it to be quite palatable upon attempting it. Nonetheless, for those who have yet to sample the beef bowl independently, I recommend indulging in it initially, prior to experimenting with novel combinations."

KICKASSSSS MARGARITAS!!

This is THE place to go for margaritas in the area (near downtown)!  Come grab a pitcher or 4 of the Kickass Margaritas with some friends and enjoy some delicious appetizers as well!  (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=2z1vI-CXPyMHEMntTszyWg&userid=F28n26ynklEioZDInyK__A) 

I came here with a few clients to unwind a bit after a long day of work and it was so relaxing that didn't want to leave!  We sat in the outside seating area -- cute, but full of random decor -- I thought I walked into Guadalajara, lol  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#_5myU5HjdcHdwvbDArXbZg) 

We ordered a couple appetizers/entree to share along with our margaritas:

(They serve complimentary chips and salsa-- I loveee the homemade salsa, especially because it is spicy! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#hJpJSd1U3xGYs927JX1wJg))

- Adovada Ribs: Country style pork ribs marinade in red chili, served with rice and flour tortilla.  This is SPICYYY!  If you can't handle spicy, you probably won't eat more than a couple bites of this.  I have a pretty high tolerance for spicy food and I even thought this was pretty hot.  The pork was fork tender and the homemade flour tortilla was delicious.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#AvtkP_Po96waiz-8dDgtUQ)

- Chorizo Pizza: This too, was VERY SPICY!  Delicious, but I was for sure sweating after a few bites!  I love how the pizza is thin, and the crust is nice and crispy!  I'd say this is more like a giant tostada with a generous amount of spicy chorizo.  I would order this again!  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#vLFuk2p51aFrxWaVH8gLpg)

Cheeeeerss!  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#v-Z8I01sReuCoVjK7d0R4Q)

"Rachel's culinary establishment boasts an unpretentious array of wrap sandwiches and burgers, the quality of which is rather satisfactory. However, it is in the realm of blended beverages that they truly showcase their proficiency. A strong recommendation for their smoothies is warranted."

"Elated to discover an exceptional gyro establishment in Chandler, Arizona; it appears that the proprietors hail from Chicago, a fact that only serves to enhance my culinary experience. Although I have yet to sample their Italian beef offerings, I am thoroughly enjoying their delectable gyros and plates. Having visited this eatery on more than twenty occasions, I remain steadfast in my admiration for their gastronomical prowess. It is unfortunate that their website does not accurately reflect the quality of their fare, but I assure you that their cuisine far surpasses any preconceived notions one might harbor based on their online presence."

Never would i have thought of doing this ...but my wife convinced me that it would be a decadent treat ...and a great bargain....and that it was. we enjoyed the 24 hour pass..starting with a late dinner at the paris..it was good, a huge line up till they closed it...and the next day we had lunch at planet hollywood..it was so good we had to go back for dinner...clean,  well managed, and freshly prepared.  i strongly recommend the buffet at PH. Its all about not pigging out....and not eating a taste of everything ..lol...hey its hard to get a salmon caesar  salad in vegas for less than 30 bucks..so $50. for 24 hours of  pretty much whatever  food you want is great...not something i would want to do often..but once in a blue moon why not?   enjoy

"I have had the privilege of being under the medical care and supervision of Dr. Johnnie Woodson for an extended period of time, during which he has consistently demonstrated a high level of professionalism, compassion, and dedication to his patients' well-being. His approachability and willingness to engage in thorough discussions regarding my health concerns have been particularly noteworthy, fostering an environment of trust and comfort that is essential for effective patient-physician communication. Furthermore, it is gratifying to observe that the office has undergone significant improvements since the advent of new management, which has enhanced the overall quality of care and efficiency of operations. While occasional delays in waiting times may occur, they are more than compensated by the exceptional quality of medical attention and expertise offered by Dr. Woodson."

I've had a few shoes fixed here.  One had a peeled off sole that was glued back on.  The other two had to get new soles affixed.  Boris, the son is a really nice guy.  Fast turnover for repairs!!!  A little pricier than my spot back home but fair and they do good quality work!!!  Thanks yelpers for the recommendation! :)

"Enormous Tostones of remarkable quality, accompanied by an exceptional hot sauce and mojo, garnered unanimous approval from every individual seated at my table, including two novice consumers of Cuban cuisine, who thoroughly relished and consumed every last morsel of their respective portions, evincing a profound satisfaction with their dining experience."

This gastronomical establishment offers an ideal setting for a visit during the cold winter months, whereupon one can partake in a delectable array of culinary delights that not only possess a piquant flavor profile but also provide a comforting warmth. As a preliminary course, I customarily opt for a bowl of what appears to be a complimentary miso soup, which serves as a precursor to the primary dishes. The kitchen utilizes high-quality meat for their spicy barbecue, ensuring that each dish is delivered to the table while still sizzling hot, accompanied by an assortment of kimchi and other traditional Korean side dishes. Although certain menu items may seem somewhat expensive, the majority are generously portioned, allowing for sharing between two individuals.

Great breakfast place inside Mandalay bay. The cafe over looks the walk way to the pool.

The corned beef hash is excellent and so are the waffles. 

Its too bad they don't have refills on juice. Great place none the less.

Had dinner here with my wife and 3 kids. We were all very pleased with the food and the service. There isn't much available for younger kids, but mine were able to share a drumstick appetizer which was really well done and included 6 drumsticks, so it was more than enough for a young child or 2.  A large, juicy burger was very good and a steak that was just ok round out the standard fare. The nachos appetizer was not great, but it was just an appetizer.  The real star was the pizza. The dough is buttery and flakey yet chewy which made for one of the best pizza crusts that I have ever had. The sauce and cheese were well balanced to make this a wonderful personal pizza. I would definitely order it again if I was dining here. But I would also dine outside as the interior needs some updating.

"The site's proximity to our dental healthcare provider is ideal, situated merely a stone's throw away from their esteemed establishment, and I must say that their poultry dishes, particularly the Spicy Honey Mustard and Asiago Parmesan varieties, are truly exceptional, warranting a mandatory taste experience for any epicurean enthusiast; furthermore, their artisanal Asiago Chips, carefully crafted in-house, are an absolute delight, worthy of high praise and acclaim."

"The pho served at this establishment was of exceptional quality, surpassing my expectations and rivaling those of previous experiences. Although I have had the pleasure of indulging in superior specimens, the culinary expertise demonstrated in the preparation of their pho was undeniably impressive. My order was for a spicy variation, yet I found it necessary to augment its piquancy with an additional condiment, specifically sriracha. Nonetheless, the dish proved satisfying and fulfilled my craving, especially after exposure to the inclement weather."

This critique pertains primarily to the culinary offerings of the food court, rather than the retail establishments themselves, which boast an impressive array of prominent brands such as Nike, Adidas, Oakley, Guess, D&G, et al. It is advisable to allocate a minimum of two hours to thoroughly explore the entirety of the outdoor premises, taking into account the seasonal weather conditions, particularly during the sweltering summer months. As for the gastronomic options within the food court, the selection is somewhat limited, comprising predominantly of Asian cuisine, including Japanese and Chinese fare, in addition to Subway and Italian choices. A personal culinary excursion resulted in a satisfactory pizza experience, complemented by samples of teriyaki chicken from the Japanese eatery and orange chicken from its Chinese counterpart, both of which demonstrated palatable flavors, yet leaving room for enhancement in terms of overall quality.

"I had the pleasure of partaking in a culinary excursion to this esteemed establishment in the company of my spouse, maternal figure, and infant offspring this past weekend.  Our group constituted the sole patrons present, thus obviating the potential for service-related tribulations as documented by previous visitors.  The gastronomical offerings conformed to traditional preparation methods, yet retained an unparalleled delectability.  We sampled an array of appetizers, complemented by three entrÃ©es selected from the specialized yellow menu, accompanied by a single mango lassi, the total cost of which, inclusive of tax, amounted to $43.  It is worth noting that while the restaurant does not provide alcoholic beverages, management graciously extended permission to procure such libations from the adjacent grocery store and consume them in conjunction with our meal.  Thus, we acquired a pair of beers.  Furthermore, we derived amusement from the ambient music and television programming, specifically, the Indian version of 'Who Wants to Be a Millionaire,' which preceded our departure and was succeeded by music videos, rendering the atmosphere decidedly captivating."

The sentiment of astonishment was palpable, yet the gustatory experience was indeed satisfactory, and one could posit that the confluence of factors, including the temporal context of 10:30 AM, rendered Pizza Hut an optimal venue for a delectable repast.

Since I penned an account of my experience at Tacone in Tustin, California, it would be unjust not to document my visit to its Las Vegas counterpart, particularly given that the delectable wraps I savored in Sin City served as the impetus behind my expedition to the former location. Equipped with a voucher obtained from a local Vegas tourism website, my entire family and I ventured to Tacone for a midday repast. Our expectations were not particularly elevated, owing to the fact that it qualifies as a fast-food establishment and is situated within the confines of the Aladdin; our primary objective was to consume a rapid and satisfying meal prior to visiting Build-A-Bear Workshop with my offspring. However, we were pleasantly taken aback by the culinary offerings presented by this seemingly unassuming eatery. A complimentary sauce bar, featuring an array of tantalizing options such as the universally adored honey mustard, BBQ, and even exotic creamy cilantro and balsamic-flavored dips, captivated the attention of my progeny, who reveled in the opportunity to sample each variety. The proportions of the wraps were generous, rendering it impossible for me to devour the entirety of mine, and thus, I opted to have it packaged for subsequent consumption. My selection, the Thai Cone, boasted a delightful union of peanut sauce complemented by a cucumber salad, both of which were carefully encased within a wrap comprised of soft, steaming jasmine rice. My spouse's Mambo wrap, showcasing a filet mignon of remarkable tenderness and juiciness, garnered his unequivocal approval. Similarly, my children expressed immense satisfaction with their Campfire chicken wraps, whose sweet BBQ sauce proved to be a notable component. While the cost of these delectable items may be perceived as somewhat prohibitive, warranting a rating of four stars, the distinctive and revitalizing nature of the dining experience provided by Tacone renders it a worthwhile indulgence. Each wrap carried a price tag of approximately $8.95.

The rooms are nice, a little dull but nice. The big bathroom even in entry level rooms are a massive plus and if you like to soak in a deep tub you will be very happy. The rest of the Casino is nice enough but I think next time I will head back to my usual hangout which is the Mirage.
Exceeding our expectations, this gastronomic haven has proven to be an ideal inclusion in our culinary compendium, commendable work, Vig McCormick Ranch.

"It is with immense pleasure that I express my gratification regarding the establishment of a Komex in my vicinity, providing a convenient venue for a rapid repast. Furthermore, I frequently bring guests from afar or those unfamiliar with the eatery to experience its distinctive culinary offerings, particularly the delectable fusion tacos, with the spicy pork variant being my utmost preference. While I have sampled other menu items, they fail to impress me with their innovative fusion elements or exceptional taste, in my humble opinion."

This place is interesting. It's strictly a take out spot and they open from 5-10pm. Definitely not your average Thai food joint. 

Overall the food is great and my personal favorite is the Mango Sticky Rice. They actually give you a bigger portion of sticky rice here than anywhere else I've been. 

cleanliness is key here. Seeing as to how they don't actually have tables here so you can eat, I'd be surprised if it was dirty. 

The lady is pretty friendly and straight to the point. It looked like if it was just her and another employee so probably family. 

Overall its small, quaint, cheap and fantastic! definitely recommend this for them nights that you want to stay home and watch a movie!

We indulged in a prolonged sojourn at this esteemed lodging establishment subsequent to securing an advantageous arrangement through Priceline for a mere $90 per night. Frankly, had we been obligated to compensate the full tariff, I might have experienced a modicum of discontentment owing to the somewhat diminutive proportions of our accommodations. Nevertheless, the space was well-appointed and offered an impressive panorama of Heinz Field, which served as a pleasant diversion. Moreover, the site itself was remarkably convenient, permitting us to traverse the city on foot with minimal effort, an aspect that I invariably find appealing while exploring an unfamiliar metropolis. 

The inn itself boasted an air of opulence, particularly within its grand lobby. The proprietors had successfully preserved the inherent charm of the original decor while judiciously incorporating contemporary touches. Regrettably, the on-site dining venue did not quite live up to expectations. As is often the case with hotel restaurants, the prices were exorbitant, and the morning repast we partook of there was forgettable, to put it mildly.

"An optimal culinary selection for the noontide or evening repast in the public square! The aforementioned dumplings are domestically fabricated and possess an exceptional tenderness. My personal preference was the combination of carrots and beef encased within said dumplings, which yielded a flavor profile that was indeed gratifying. Furthermore, the congee, available at a nominal cost of two dollars per bowl, serves as an affordable sustenance option for those who seek to satiate their hunger without incurring excessive financial burden. Thus, I recommend paying a visit to this establishment and partaking in their delectable offerings."

"It's Cirque du Soleil, ergo, one can infer that the production will be of exceptional quality. Notwithstanding, a certain vagueness permeates the narrative, but, admittedly, the visually stunning sets, costumes, and choreography more than compensate for this minor shortcoming. Following a few alcoholic beverages, an epiphany struck - the plot of KÃ bears a striking resemblance to the iconic space opera, Star Wars. By keeping this parallel in mind, the narrative's coherence becomes self-evident; the struggle between Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, and their adversaries, Darth Vader and the Emperor, serves as a facile analogy."

"Established by the visionary founder of the renowned Cheesecake Factory, Grand Lux Cafe embodies an elevated, sophisticated ambiance reminiscent of a refined European bistro, offering an extensive array of delectable culinary creations accessible 24 hours a day to cater to the diverse needs of its clientele. In the aftermath of a vibrant nocturnal excursion, this esteemed eatery serves as an ideal setting for revitalizing one's senses and satisfying hunger pangs.

In the wee hours of the morning, our group of four friends, comprising Lucy Y., David G., Sarah A., and myself, converged upon this gastronomic haven seeking sustenance. Prior to our arrival, I had enthusiastically endorsed this venue, having personally experienced its gastronomic excellence on a previous occasion. As we approached the entrance, we chanced upon a group of inebriated individuals, partially clothed and loitering near the restroom facilities, engaging in boisterous merriment. Such scenes served as a testament to the establishment's commitment to accommodating the varied inclinations of its patrons.

Upon entering the restaurant, we were promptly seated and presented with menus brimming with enticing options. My craving for a hearty breakfast led me to order the Smoked Salmon, skillfully prepared with onions and scrambled eggs, accompanied by a side of crispy hash browns. This simple yet elegant dish harmoniously married the rich flavors of smoked salmon and eggs, yielding a satisfying culinary experience that satiated my appetite and prepared me for a restful slumber.

While the prices at Grand Lux Cafe may be slightly higher than those of other 24-hour establishments, the superior quality of both the cuisine and service rendered it a worthwhile investment. It is essential to note that the late-night menu is the only option available after a certain hour, catering to the diverse preferences of the cafe's clientele."

"Wynn Casino epitomizes luxury and sophistication, offering an unparalleled gaming experience that is sure to captivate even the most discerning patron. Upon signing up for their esteemed Red Card, patrons are rewarded with a generous $10 FREE PLAY credit, which can be utilized to indulge in a myriad of exhilarating games of chance. Furthermore, the establishment boasts an impressive array of delectable cocktails, such as the decadent Chocolate Martini, which pairs perfectly with the ambiance of the lavish casino floor. As we savored our complimentary libations, we couldn't help but feel a sense of euphoria wash over us, culminating in an unforgettable afternoon of entertainment. Our encounter with the Mona Lisa slot machine proved particularly fruitful, as we walked away with a respectable sum of $12. Needless to say, our experience at Wynn Casino left an indelible mark on our hearts, and we eagerly anticipate the opportunity to return and indulge in the opulence that this esteemed institution has to offer."

This is a really good venue to hold meetings in Edinburgh. We hired the 'Glass Room' at the top of the building which had its own private balcony with stunning views across the city. \n\nThe Hub provided us with lunch - just sandwiches- but they finished it off with some really good, gooey chocolate cake which made me love the whole venue even more!! They also left some Edinburgh rock on the tables for us to munch through...so whenever my meeting became boring/overly bureaucratic I could have a sugar high to bring back my normal hyper-ness!

Belle ambiance de 'chalet' dans ce petit resto de la rue MCGill.

Bien situé a la limite du quartier des affaires et du Vieux-Port, Grange devient un endroit facile a adopter si vous voulez passer une soirée sur les quais après le travail. Le menu est simple et concis, (tartares, salades copieuses, burgers) mais contient des choix variés pour tous les palais. Les prix sont moyens-chers (25$ une assiette). Ils ont une bonne sélection de vins également.

Le service est plus qu'amical, quoi qu'un peu lent. Nous avons bien aimé notre expérience et serons probablement de retour !

I recently had the pleasure of partaking in the October Adults Night Out program, which offered an array of enticing features, including complimentary entry and adult beverages. My experience was largely enjoyable, as I relished the opportunity to explore the museum's vast collection and engage in stimulating conversations with fellow attendees. However, my enthusiasm was slightly dampened by a few logistical issues that hindered the overall efficiency of the event. Specifically, the queue to check in was excessively prolonged, which resulted in a sluggish pace that left attendees waiting for an extended period. Additionally, despite having pre-registered online, I neglected to print my tickets, which led to further delays. In light of this, I strongly advise all future attendees to print their tickets in advance to avoid any unnecessary inconvenience. Another drawback was the "beer garden" area, where an insufficient number of servers resulted in an excruciatingly slow line that significantly impeded the enjoyment of the alcoholic offerings. In fact, numerous individuals grew so disenchanted with the lengthy wait that they opted to give away their drink tickets or abandon the line altogether. To rectify these issues, I recommend implementing measures such as increasing the number of servers and streamlining the check-in process to enhance the overall experience for future attendees. Despite these shortcomings, I would still consider participating in another Adults Night Out event, provided that tangible improvements are made to address the aforementioned concerns.

I love this place.  My friends and I try to have a 'girl's night out' once a month and we frequent Radio Maria because of the delicious cuisine and the atmosphere.  It is relaxing and has several conversation pieces.  The service is spectacular.  This is one of my favorite local spots to dine in Champaign
Ordered for delivery here because I was at the TownePlace Suites nearby.  Lots of food and the sushi was awesome.  Delivered in less than 30 min on a sat night.

Across the street from Midwestern, it is definitely one of my favorite lunch places for our anchor lunch break between classes. They have a lunch special and offer student discounts. However, get here early because this place gets crowded and service can be rather slow for those who have to get to the next class within an hour.  Other than that, the food is very tasty from salads to paninis to pizzas. All delicious to my taste buds :) OH, and the tomato soup is a must try...the best I had so far in Phoenix... I could almost just have soup all day

Two words: Rose Macarons!

Ok, their other desserts are fabulous as well.  Just don't get the crepes (savory or sweet).

This place is what any business or person should aspire to be: detailed, refined, beautiful, clean, amazing...

"Gigantic sandwiches, colossal in their proportions and tantamount to a gastronomical odyssey, boast an unparalleled stature on the menu, while the quality of the bread, a fundamental component in this culinary masterpiece, vacillates between exceptional and mediocre, contingent upon the freshness of the day's batch. Mothers, in particular, demonstrate an unbridled fondness for the Philly cheese-steak variety, while patrons who crave an added layer of piquancy in their gustatory experience often opt for the Italian version, accompanied by a request for fiery peppers. The process of ordering and settling the bill can prove somewhat perplexing, as it is advisable to place one's order and proceed directly to the cash register to effect payment, thereby avoiding the inconvenience of possessing a ravenous appetite and awaiting settlement before satiating one's hunger. It remains a mystery how this establishment manages to thwart potential fraud, given the ease with which one could exploit the system by placing an order, lingering, and then absconding without remuneration. Notwithstanding, the complimentary potato chips served at this eatery, whose name eludes me at present, earn high praise and enjoy a reputation for excellence among patrons, many of whom, myself included, elect to partake in them despite not customarily indulging in such fare at other sandwich shops. Lastly, the BBQ variant holds a special allure for me, ascending to the pinnacle of my preferences among the assortment of delectable options available."

While not as spacious as Palazzo/Venetian, they do have nice rooms which comparable to Cosmo and the others. It may be the same size or even bigger. 

The difference between Signature and the others is there's a stove and microwave which means you can reheat some leftovers or cook some snacks. It comes in handy.

The only negative about Signature is it's off strip. I mean, really off strip. The only way to get on strip is to take a long walk through a tunnel which leads to MGM. It's not that bad but MGM is on one end of the strip and when you want to hit up Encore, it's definitely taxi time. Also, there is no casino in here.

The parking is a little wonky too. You need to be a guest to park here and there's no self-parking, it's all valet.

Besides those little details, it's a nice place to stay. Quiet, but nice.

"I thoroughly enjoy myself in this location, as the pervasive ambiance of joviality and congeniality permeates the atmosphere, rendering it an ideal setting for a pleasurable sojourn. The aquatic facility was a tranquil oasis, providing a refreshing respite from the sweltering heat. Furthermore, I had the pleasure of partaking in culinary delights at five distinct establishments, each offering a delectable array of gastronomical indulgences that satiated my palate. Additionally, I derived great delight in sauntering through the Forum Shops, immersing myself in the vibrant spectacle of merchandise and reveling in the sheer variety of retail experiences available. However, I must admit that the pungent odor of smoke was a significant drawback, as its intensity was rather overpowering and somewhat detracted from my overall enjoyment, particularly given the presence of my children, who, nonetheless, had an exceptional time."

"Flavors of India presents an adequate luncheon buffet, albeit with inconsistent quality on different days. Despite my occasional patronage, I yearn for a broader culinary spectrum. Notwithstanding, the rational pricing and hospitable service have coaxed me into a four-star assessment, pending further exploration."

If you seek authentic Italian cuisine within the Chandler/Tempe vicinity, this establishment is an optimal choice.  Operated by a genuine Italian family from New York, the atmosphere exudes a warm, welcoming ambiance upon entry, enhanced by the tasteful dÃ©cor and cordial interaction between the proprietors and patrons.  The service was prompt, efficient, and hospitable.  Our culinary excursion commenced with a delectable Caesar salad, boasting an impressive flavor profile.  My spouse opted for the linguine accompanied by a succulent red clam sauce, featuring copious amounts of garlic and clams, rendering it utterly savory.  I relished the baked ziti, an enormous serving brimming with rich, velvety sauce and generous portions of melted mozzarella cheese, resulting in an unforgettable epicurean experience.  Even my fastidious young daughter thoroughly enjoyed the fare, signaling a resounding success.  We concluded our meal with the heavenly cannoli dessert, providing a sublime finale to a meal already teeming with gastronomic delights.  Prices at this eatery are eminently reasonable, particularly considering the exceptional quality of the Italian cuisine served.  Furthermore, the utilization of coupons and remarkable takeout discounts transforms the dining experience into an unmitigated triumph.

"I have had the pleasure of procuring confectionaries from this establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say, they have consistently met and surpassed my expectations in terms of taste and quality. The frosting, in particular, has a delightful creaminess that is not overpowered by an excessive amount of sugar, which makes for a refreshing change of pace from the typical saccharine-laden birthday cake. Furthermore, the Asian-inspired flavors, such as green tea and sweet potato, while potentially unfamiliar to some, are truly exceptional and showcase the bakery's dedication to innovation and diversity. My only suggestion, and I implore the management to consider this, would be the implementation of a more modern payment system, such as Square or similar platforms, in order to alleviate the inconvenience and limitations associated with cash transactions, especially given the premium pricing of their products. This adjustment would not only enhance the overall customer experience but also align the bakery with contemporary standards adopted by other local businesses, such as East End Brewery and Commonplace Coffee."

Awaiting our arrival was a suave and attentive server, who presented us with an array of delectable beverages, including their signature mango mojitos, which we found to be utterly refreshing and tantalizing to the palate. Furthermore, the eatery offered a diverse selection of mouth-watering appetizers, one of which, a savory pan bread, left us in a state of gastronomic euphoria. It would be remiss of us not to mention the enticing entrees that followed, each dish expertly prepared and artfully presented. Despite its unassuming location within the confines of a strip mall, the proprietor has managed to create a warm and inviting ambiance, replete with stylish furnishings and appointments, thereby establishing an atmosphere conducive to an exceptional dining experience.

"It is truly laudable to witness a record store that deliberately eschews the mainstream in favor of showcasing obscure treasures. Underground Solu'shn takes great pride in providing an extensive array of hard-to-come-by gems and an exceptional selection of vinyl records, which, albeit at a premium price point of approximately 12-14 pounds per unit, offers patrons a unique opportunity to sample their desired albums on any of the available turntables prior to making a purchase, thereby establishing a 'try before you buy' policy that sets it apart from its larger, more commercialized counterparts. Consequently, for burgeoning DJs seeking to augment their music collections with scarce and coveted tracks, the likelihood of discovering such prized possessions within Solu'shn's inventory is quite high."

"I have an inclination to reference this location as 'The Key Shack,' due to its unpretentious appearance, which belies its efficacy in providing a diverse array of key-related services. Situated within the Park Road Shopping Center, this modest abode may appear somewhat questionable upon initial inspection, particularly when juxtaposed with the surrounding establishments; however, do not allow its humble visage to mislead you, for the proprietors possess the proficiency and expertise necessary to accomplish their tasks with expediency and precision. \n\nMy acquaintance with this establishment arose via a personal recommendation from a colleague, who extolled the virtues of their proficiency in duplicating obscure keys. In quest of a rare key for one of the upscale residential structures in the vicinity, I elected to pay a visit to this venue. Following a brief interval of approximately five minutes, during which time I engaged in financial transactions and acquired a novel key, I departed the premises feeling thoroughly satisfied with the quality of service I had received. Thus, if you are confronted with the challenge of replicating an uncommon key, I would unequivocally endorse this location as your optimal destination. Furthermore, upon completion of your business at 'The Key Shack,' you may choose to perambulate through the remainder of the shopping center, whereupon you will encounter an assortment of enticing establishments, including purveyors of delectable cupcakes, coffeehouses, craft stores, and antique emporiums."

I tried out Isis Salon about a month ago.  After reading the reviews on Isis, I decided to give it a try! Kelly was great! She was nice and listened to what I wanted. I loved the way my hair turned out! I got a haircut and partial highlights for $85 (half of what I normally spend!). Awesome price! I've gone to expensive salons before and just got an okay service....now that I've found Isis, I will definitely be coming back!

I am not inclined to indulge in uncritical enthusiasm for this establishment at present. Securing a reservation on a Sunday proved to be a straightforward process, which suggests that the restaurant's popularity may not be as pronounced as some reviews would suggest. The cost of dining here is reasonable, and our server provided attentive and responsive service throughout the meal. My dinner companion and I opted to sample the steak bernaise, which featured a citrusy butter sauce that unexpectedly delighted my taste buds. However, the sirloin itself was somewhat chewy in texture, although its thinness made it manageable when cut into smaller pieces. Notably, the portion size of the accompanying fries was quite generous. While the quality of the meal was satisfactory for the price, I remain skeptical about the accuracy of the restaurant's four-star rating, as assigned by an excess of two thousand Yelp reviewers. The dessert offerings were underwhelming, with the apple tartin in particular failing to meet our expectations. Rather than featuring fan-shaped apple slices, the dish consisted of a single large slice of apple baked beneath a layer of puff pastry. Overall, I would rate the culinary aspects of our meal as three stars, with the positive service experience contributing an additional star.

We visited Butters at approximately 11 am on a Saturday, and encountered a brief delay of roughly thirty minutes before being seated, which underscored the establishment's popularity among patrons. Upon being seated, our server promptly attended to our needs, acquiring our beverage preferences and expeditiously delivering a carafe of ice water to our table, alongside a steaming hot cup of coffee and a refreshing glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. The culinary offerings we sampled, specifically an omelet complemented by hash browns and pancakes, were indeed quite satisfying, and our server's attentiveness and dedication to ensuring an optimal dining experience were commendable, particularly given the high volume of clientele present at the time. It is worth noting that the demographic composition of the restaurant's patronage skewed towards middle-aged women, some of whom sported conspicuously augmented physical attributes, but this did not detract from the overall enjoyment of our repast. In conclusion, Butters emerges as a highly recommended venue for a satisfying breakfast, provided one is willing to tolerate a brief waiting period.

I have seen every single performer who has fronted this show, from really good to really bad but last night with Coco was the BEST.

Mel B. & ??? was awesome way back in the day when the show opened (but what do you expect with people who can SING & DANCE??).

Holly Madison was absolutely horrible. Might as well have taped a spot on the stage for her to stand because she had no idea what was going on. Sister looked like she was lost!

Angel Porrino! What a DOLL, way better (as in more enthusiastic about the 8 minutes on stage) than Holly was and way better to look at too. I hope we continue to see her around Vegas for awhile.

CoCo last night owned it! Thank god they put someone in the show again who could dance. Shake that big booty girl!!! I hope eventually they change more of the show (they changed it a little between Holly & Coco) so we have more Coco dancing.

"Indulged in a tardy midday repast.  The guacamole was delectable, as was the innovative sangria-infused margarita that I had the pleasure of consuming (alas, the moniker assigned to this potent potable escapes me at present).

Opted for a torta, and the meat was expertly marinated, boasting a subtle sweetness that did not overpower the palate.  The portion size was generous, bordering on excessive.  The fish tacos, too, were quite satisfactory, with each bite bursting with flavor.

Regrettably, the service proved subpar, leaving much to be desired.  My OpenTable reservation was not properly recorded, prompting an inquiry from the platform subsequent to my visit, querying the reason behind my non-attendance at the appointed hour.  Although the matter ultimately reached a successful resolution, such an occurrence ought to have been avoided initially."

"Culinary delights are utterly superb, complemented by exceptional customer service; boasting an expansive establishment, this eatery rarely necessitates a wait, making it an ideal venue for families to enjoy a delectable dining experience; it is highly recommended that you partake in the gastronomical indulgence."

We undertook an excursion to Edinburgh Castle at an early hour on a Sunday, with the intention of avoiding the throngs of tourists that typically congregate at this popular attraction during peak season. Our strategy proved effective, as we were able to explore the historic fortress without the burden of excessive crowding, thereby enhancing our overall experience. The castle's state of preservation was truly impressive, rendering it an indispensable sightseeing destination for anyone visiting Edinburgh.

We went out on a Sunday night just for dinner and to walk around the lake and village for a bit. We had 3 people and assumed it would be a little busy in the late afternoon early evening but oh my was it ever DESERTED. We parked in the Village parking garage and just saw a couple other car and walked through a passage to the lower village shopping area and it was almost scary/embarresing how empty it was. Walking through the main shopping area we thought we were in the twilight zone and would be attacked by zombies at any moment. We ate at the Black Pepper Grill which we had the ask the one guy if they were open and sat at a table in a restaurant where we were one of two total parties. Awesome food and service but just plain creepy with no people around especially at prime dinner time on a weekend. We walked over to the newly opened Ravella and it was warm and comfortable and had a great front bar that was had surprisingly cheap prices, but again just a random person walking through the hotel lobby. I really hope Lake Las Vegas comes back cause it has so much to offer...Until then I am going to film a episode of \"Life After People\" on the property

One of my favorite malls. Lots of fun stores, restaurants and activities.\n\nI gave 4 stars merely because this mall is hard to shop at during the summer and some of the major department stores and retailers are located far from the mall itself, so you have to drive and re-park a few times to hit all of your favorite stores. Otherwise, it's great!

"I have an immense fondness for occupying a seat at the bar, as it provides me with a truly delightful and satisfying encounter. The culinary offerings were utterly delectable, and their presentation was flawlessly executed, allowing me to thoroughly appreciate the proficiency and expertise that was invested in each dish, despite the fact that I did not wholeheartedly enjoy every single item on the menu. Notwithstanding its high prices, this establishment is undoubtedly worthy of a visit, making it an excellent choice for a special occasion or a night out with friends."

Has a some chairs out front so you can socialize under the hot summer sun. The employees are exceptionally friendly, particularly in the early hours of the morning when I typically grab a drink. Expect it to be moderately busy due to the location.

Visited some acquaintances residing at this off-strip hotel and indulged in a delectable breakfast. Our attentive server assisted us in making informed decisions regarding the menu and elucidated the substantial proportions. They are remarkably voluminous, compelling us to sample a few of their critically acclaimed dishes. We relished Sage Fried Chicken Benedict (comprising spinach, hardwood bacon, tomato & mozzarella, chipotle cream, scrambled eggs), and Griddled French Toast (ooey gooey delightfulness). Wow...talk about enormity! Our server graciously cautioned us about the generous serving sizes and offered to provide us with takeout containers, considerately allowing my companion to transport a portion to his hotel roommate. Since we only consumed half of each dish, it proved satisfactory. Although I cannot comment on the lunch or dinner offerings, their breakfast menu, highly commended by the concierge, left us thoroughly satiated and content. The sole drawback, stemming from my accommodations at the Strip, was the inconvenient drive. In the future, I shall venture to the establishment situated on West Sahara or Imperial Palace.

First time I ventured into the establishment, I requested a slice of their culinary masterpiece known as pizza, and subsequently, I was overcome with a sensation that they would need to prepare an entirely novel pie for my consumption. I was mildly irritated that no one saw fit to inform me of this minor detail. It seemed to me that this would be a fundamental aspect of communication. Thus, after inquiring and becoming cognizant of this fact, I opted to depart due to temporal constraints. However, I did not dismiss them altogether, as I was inclined to give them another opportunity to demonstrate their culinary prowess.

Upon placing an order this evening, I acquired an 18-inch pizza for the sum of $9.95 and, upon verifying the contents of my refrigerator, I discovered that I had indeed ordered a half dozen chicken wings, unbeknownst to me, until now. This revelation served to elucidate the reason behind the total cost of $20. Furthermore, I must commend the kitchen staff on their proficiency in preparing delectable poultry appendages, as they truly excelled in their execution. As a self-proclaimed authority on chicken wings, I have sampled a plethora of establishments throughout British Columbia, Canada, and I must say that only one restaurant has managed to challenge my gastronomical abilities, leaving me unable to complete all 12 specimens. The culinary artists at this particular venue have mastered the art of creating piquant yet savory wings, which they affectionately refer to as "911." While they may not be scorchingly hot, I have no doubt that their lingering effects will become apparent at some point tomorrow. In my opinion, this is the ultimate litmus test for assessing the quality of chicken wings, and I am pleased to report that this establishment has passed with flying colors.

"An exceptionally charming location, distinguished by an abundance of ultra-fresh components, serves delectable sandwiches and salads, complemented by prompt and amiable service, all within a captivating rural farm ambiance that fosters an unparalleled sense of affection."

"This culinary establishment boasts an impressive array of delectable barbecue offerings, which, unfortunately, were slightly marred by the fact that the poultry component of our meal was somewhat desiccated. Additionally, we noted a few minor shortcomings in terms of the tidiness of the interior, specifically pertaining to a certain sign adjacent to the fountain beverage dispenser advising against the disposal of unwanted items down the drain, as well as the unorthodox placement of waste receptacles. Despite these relatively insignificant drawbacks, our experience at this eatery was generally satisfying, albeit not quite sufficient enough to warrant a perfect rating of five."
Delicious Chicago Vienna Beef juicy hot dog with the works, and made from scratch french fries for $4. Best deal in town. Thanks for reading. The Bike Chaplain

This culinary establishment exudes an ambiance that is reminiscent of a refined dining experience, in contrast to the utilitarian nature of a fast-food restaurant, and offers a reasonable price point of $30 for an all-you-can-consume buffet, with the option to upgrade to unlimited beverages, including mimosas, bloody Marys, and champagne, for an additional $37. During the brunch period, which spans from 8 am to 3 pm, the venue boasts an extensive selection of delectable items, ranging from light and fluffy pancakes to succulent kalbi Korean short ribs, catering to a diverse array of palates. Patrons have the liberty to either craft their own personalized omelette, courtesy of a skilled chef, or indulge in a variety of seafood, Asian-inspired dishes, fresh fruits and vegetables, pasta, eggs benedict, and even sushi, via a self-service format. For those who possess a sweet tooth, the dessert section is a must-visit, featuring an assortment of mouthwatering gelato, accompanied by a medley of vibrant, bite-sized pastries, such as rich chocolate mousse atop tangy passion fruit, diminutive gold-flecked wafer cones, and chocolate-covered strawberries. Unlike traditional buffets, where portion control often poses a challenge, this establishment offers pre-portioned servings in miniature cups, bowls, and dishes, allowing patrons to sample a variety of flavors without worrying about overindulging. Although the wait time may be somewhat prolonged, the unique system in place, involving both a cashier line and a separate queue for entry into the buffet area, helps to streamline the process and minimize inconvenience for eager diners.

"While I do not customarily partake in a substantial morning repast, there are occasional instances in which I arrive at the workplace and recognize that failing to consume sustenance in a timely manner will result in an abrupt decline in my energy levels and productivity. This particular morning happened to be one such occasion, compelling me to venture forth to The Silver Spoon in quest of their delectable corned beef hash special. Unfortunately, it was not featured on that day's menu, prompting me to seek recommendations from Jono, who suggested the breakfast bagel sandwich as a suitable alternative. Given that an 'everything' bagel was available, I opted for that specific variety, pairing it with bacon as my protein of choice. Upon consuming this satisfying culinary creation, I felt compelled to momentarily suspend my engagement in discussions pertaining to financial matters in order to savor its flavors thoroughly."

"When seeking a fancy dress outfit, Party Mania serves as my singular and initial point of contact, catering to diverse dressing up occasions with their extensive array of offerings. Their inventory encompasses an assortment of pre-packaged costumes, including those tailored to specific themes such as superheroism and 80's disco, along with complementary accessories like wigs, nail prosthetics, headwear, masks, and gloves. Additionally, they provide attire suitable for hen nights, featuring items like L-plates and garters. As Halloween approaches, the store experiences a significant influx of customers seeking ideal costumes, and they also offer cosmetics, ribbons, and feathers to enhance one's ensemble. Conveniently located near the primary university campus at George Square, Party Mania is an easily accessible destination for students seeking dress-up attire. Furthermore, the store offers balloons, banners, and other themed embellishments to augment any celebration. While their products may be somewhat expensive, Party Mania's comprehensive selection ensures that customers can find everything they need to create the perfect fancy dress outfit."

Perfect shop for unique, witty, and humorous cards, gorgeous stationery, beautiful paper goods, and various novelties and gifts. I appreciate the staff are always helpful and courteous. Parking can be a pain, but once you score a spot, you will be delighted to explore all the goodies in the store.

After a prolonged duration of approximately six years, I decided to terminate my affiliation with the gym, and the process of cancellation was surprisingly hassle-free, much to my delight. Subsequently, I received a reimbursement for the unused portion of my membership period, which was a welcome surprise. Although I have fond memories of the gym and acknowledge its pleasant ambiance, my recent introduction to private yoga sessions has rendered my gym membership temporarily obsolete.

Stayed here recently because we got married in Caesars Palace. We stayed in a "deluxe room" in the Augustus Tower. We originally werent placed there but our taxi driver said to ask for that tower cause it over looks the Bellagio water show. Well we got the tower... but on the wrong side. Instead of seeing the water show, we got to see the roof of the building under us. Oh well.

The room was HUGE. I wish I had taken pictures. The bathroom was HUGE!!! The bathtub had jets in them and there was a tv on the opposite side of the tub! Watching tv while taking a shower was an amazing experience haha.

The bed was so comfortable and the pillows were amazing. I wish I knew what type they were so I could buy some! Our room was right next to the hallway where people get off the elevator (why do we always get placed near the elevator) but it was quiet. 

Overall, I would definitely stay here again!!

After getting it down on the dance floor, refresh your hot skin by stepping onto the outdoor patio and allowing the squirts of mist from the waterfall cool you down.  Pure bliss!!

This review is really for those, just like me, who simply DON'T DO LINES!  And I'm not talking cola lines either.. I'm talking those hour long waits where guys promise to buy you a drink if you allow them to perform the "I'm with her" trick.

I have yet to barge my way through the crowd, or stand in line at the bar, so I truly can't write a review based on that experience.

Each and every time we are fortunate enough to be accompanied by our very own body guard, who bypasses the door guys, has the best table waiting for us, escorts us to the front of the line in the powder room (sorry girls), and keeps a 6 foot radius clear around our secluded area..yay for bodyguards!!  

The table service in this place is phenomenal!  The wait staff are exceptionally nice and attentive. Your glass will never go empty!  And the little details like a chilled bowl of strawberries to accompany your glass of bubbly make all the difference.

And if you unfortunately have to wait in line, be sure you're dressed to impress with an attitude that shouts - you'd be lost without me!  And once you get in, gravitate towards the tables that are surrounded only by guys...you never  know, they may invite you in ;-)

This establishment offers the most delectable Dim Sum in Las Vegas, as evidenced by my three visits to Chang's within the past couple of months, during which the culinary offerings have been consistently exceptional. Notwithstanding the occasional oversight in beverage service, wherein we have had to request our drinks twice, the true focal point of this dining experience lies in the Dim Sum itself, which boasts an impressive array of options, conveniently presented via mobile carts that traverse the dining area, albeit with minimal interaction from the 'cart pushers.' Despite this minor drawback, the quality and variety of the fare, combined with the reasonable pricing for families of four, render this venue an ideal destination for those seeking a satisfying Dim Sum experience. However, it is worth noting that the limited availability of parking spaces has resulted in congestion in the parking lot, necessitating a brief delay until a spot becomes available.

"Goodness gracious! This culinary establishment is utterly remarkable, evoking an underground transportation system, yet distinguished by the presence of delectable pizza. The ambiance is endearing, augmented by the hospitable and affable nature of the staff."

I got a Groupon deal with 2 months of unlimited car washes for $15. Included in the membership (normally $5) is their "red towel" service. They give you a microfiber towel   to use and when you bring the dirty one back next time they give you a clean one. They include air and vacuums so you can finish up after the tunnel. There are also self-service bays if you want to do it yourself. 

I asked about adding one-off services (like wax) in the future and not only did they say sure, but gave me a free wax then and there. I've only been a few times but I'm very satisfied. I wish I could pause the tunnel to give my wheels some extra attention but that's not realistic. I also wish they opened a little earlier but 8-6 is perfectly reasonable.

After my Groupon is up, I'll be continuing my membership. At $16 a month I only need to go once a week to get my money's worth.

When we were residents of Peoria, we had an inclination to visit Greek Wraps with a frequency of approximately once a week. The hummus served at this establishment was of such exceptional quality that it was tantamount to a gastronomical experience that could potentially induce fatality. In fact, I have never had the misfortune of consuming anything inferior to excellent at this restaurant. The vegetable pita wrap, which was augmented with grilled eggplant and onions and complemented by a special yogurt-based sauce, was a culinary masterpiece. Similarly, the grilled lemon kebab, which was served with a tangy garlic sauce, was a delectable delight. 
  It is worth noting that Greek Wraps was a popular destination, and as such, a line of patrons awaiting service was a common occurrence. However, the duration of time spent waiting was more than compensated for by the freshness and quality of the cuisine, which was prepared to order. Unfortunately, the restaurant did not offer a delivery service, much to my dismay.

I'm having a good streak of pleasant experiences lately. Here for breakfast today and was pleasantly greeted and sat. Super friendly server and 100% efficient. Pancakes and eggs benedict were excellent. They do tend to undertoast the muffins at all good eggs so if you want it toasty remember to specify when ordering. My coffee at home is way better but it is adequate here. Good place and should be on your breakfast list. ......cat just jumped on me so that is all.

"My predilection for Tigerlilly is unequivocal, as it offers an unparalleled ambiance that is particularly well-suited for a leisurely cocktail or afternoon tea experience. My recent dining excursion to this esteemed establishment only served to reinforce my fondness for it, as the culinary offerings were indeed delectable, but the afternoon tea service truly stole the show. In conjunction with a Ketel One cocktail, we indulged in an assortment of exquisite pastries, scones, and sandwiches, all of which were presented with fastidious attention to detail by the friendly and accommodating staff. The interior design of Tigerlilly is a testament to the proprietors' commitment to creating a welcoming and refined environment, which permeates every aspect of the venue and consistently fosters a sense of elegance and poise among its patrons."

"The cost was somewhat prohibitive considering the quantity and quality of the fare provided, however, the culinary experience was largely satisfying, albeit with a few unexpected surprises in terms of pricing. Furthermore, the restaurant's assertion that the Krab within their California roll was, in fact, authentic Crab meat, served as a notable advantage. Ultimately, while the flavors were undoubtedly delectable, the tariff proved to be slightly elevated beyond my anticipated range."

"Oriental cuisine enthusiasts and devotees of American gastronomy alike can indulge in an extensive array of delectable options at this esteemed establishment, boasting a diverse menu that includes a sushi bar renowned for its exceptional quality. As an ardent patron, I derive immense satisfaction from partaking in their culinary offerings, particularly when they feature my preferred dishes. However, I must admit that the occasional unavailability of a particular item I relish can be a source of minor disappointment. Nevertheless, the impeccable service proffered by the staff consistently mitigates any potential dissatisfaction, rendering the dining experience truly enjoyable for both families and larger groups, and the all-you-can-eat option serves as a tantalizing bonus."

Archie's Cafe was the venue of my maiden visit, and I must say that the hospitality accorded to me was truly commendable. The culinary offerings, specifically the Pad Tai, which I requested to be prepared at a piquancy level of 6 on their spicy scale, was unfortunately not as fiery as my taste buds had anticipated. Despite this minor drawback, I found the ambiance of the establishment to be quite pleasant, thereby making it an excellent eatery in its entirety.

When it comes to indulging in bibliophilic pursuits, I tend to adopt a utilitarian approach, prioritizing efficiency and expediency over leisurely perusal. Consequently, I appreciate bookstores that showcase a curated selection of tomes at the forefront, facilitating a swift and practical purchasing experience. Borders excels in this regard, offering a judicious categorization of their wares, encompassing disparate genres and price points, thereby catering to my pragmatic book shopping style.  

My most recent visit to this establishment was motivated by the impending necessity for a novel for an upcoming weekend, during which my spouse would be occupied with preparations for the Arizona bar examination, leaving me with an abundance of uninterrupted time. Thus, I sought to procure a book that would captivate my attention and provide suitable diversion. Fortuitously, I encountered an intriguing volume on the bestsellers table, its appeal augmented by its accessibility and the absence of an arduous search.  

While Borders offers the advantage of a more navigable shopping experience compared to online retailers like Amazon, the prices they charge are often higher. However, this drawback is offset by the convenience of being able to peruse books in person, without the feeling of being overwhelmed by the vast array of options available on the internet.  

The staff at this particular store are affable and welcoming, contributing to a pleasant ambiance. Additionally, the presence of a Seattle's Best coffee shop within the premises provides an opportunity to satiate one's caffeine cravings while indulging in literary pursuits.

"Numerous tangible and interactive activities are available for participation, offering a diverse array of engaging experiences. My personal preferences incline towards the robotic entities, as they possess an unwavering proficiency in basketball shooting and an unrelenting competitive spirit in air hockey, thereby ensuring an enjoyable and enriching diversion from the monotony of daily life."

After arriving at our destination following a prolonged period of time, we were able to partake in a culinary experience that surpassed our expectations, as the quality of the edibles was truly exceptional. Furthermore, upon requesting additional piquancy, the restaurant staff was more than accommodating in providing us with an abundance of spice, thereby demonstrating their confidence in our ability to manage the fiery flavors. This aspect alone rendered the dining establishment worthy of our patronage. Additionally, the vegetarian curry dish was utterly delectable, and the wine list offered an extensive array of options. The service we received from the staff was also noteworthy, as they exhibited warmth and attentiveness throughout our visit, even going so far as to offer us supplementary rice when they noticed our supplies were dwindling.

"We opted to dine at this establishment for a speedy evening meal, owing to its contemporary ambiance and diverse culinary offerings. Upon perusing the menu, we were pleased to discover an array of delectable options, including several unconventional dishes that piqued our interest. The portions were generous, to say the least, and the fare was palatable, with each item showcasing the chef's dedication to quality and flavor. Furthermore, the service was exceptional, as the staff exhibited remarkable proficiency in their roles, effortlessly navigating our requests and queries with aplomb. A notable highlight was the unique presentation of certain dishes, wherein the chefs skillfully wrapped them in traditional Chinese pancakes at our table, fostering an air of authenticity and cultural immersion. Additionally, the beverage selection featured an assortment of wines and warm sakes, a welcome surprise given the limited offerings often found at comparable eateries. In conclusion, this venue presents a commendable alternative for those seeking satisfying Chinese cuisine in the Apache Junction area."

"Despite not being in close proximity to the establishment, if one is seeking exceptional Mexican cuisine, a visit to this restaurant is highly recommended. The staff members, without exception, displayed remarkable hospitality towards patrons. The interior and exterior spaces were meticulously maintained, creating a welcoming ambiance. Ample seating options were available, including outdoor arrangements. The menu offered an array of delectable dishes, including shrimp tacos served with a side of sweet plantains, which were thoroughly enjoyed. Additionally, the ultimate margarita was sampled, featuring a blend of three distinct types of tequila. Although the beverage was undoubtedly flavorful, the cost was somewhat of a deterrent. Nonetheless, the overall experience was satisfying, particularly considering the quality of the food and drinks."

So before heading home to L.A. from Las Vegas, we decided to have some lunch here.

Seating was quick and easy, our waitress was okay, but not sure if the whole place was ready to go, and i heard they opened a few weeks before, not sure if it was true or not, but some of those waiters were not all there.

Anyhow, the salad alone took forever to get to our table, and it arrived two minutes before our meals arrived, which is not cool, we need to enjoy the salad atleast half way before our meal gets there.

Had their Twisted Mac,Chicken & Cheese, and i was not disappointed at all, good lunch.

Just like any Hard Rock Cafe, the feel and your surroundings are Cool.

Hope to stop in again once i am in Las Vegas.

"The flagship Postino has undergone significant enhancements since its separation from LGO, culminating in the unveiling of a superior sequel (albeit, my personal bias is influenced by its proximity to my domicile and the absence of parking-related inconveniences). The harmonious integration of indoor and outdoor bar areas, coupled with a revitalized interior ambiance, serves as a testament to the establishment's commitment to creating a welcoming atmosphere. Furthermore, the menu boasts an array of delectable options, each dish showcasing impeccable preparation and seasoning techniques. Of particular note is a morning-inspired entree featuring a crispy slice of French bread, complemented by a succulent egg, grilled asparagus, and a tangy tomato salad - an absolute delight. Additionally, the venue offers an affordable wine selection during the daytime hours (including weekends), with the sparkling Sauvignon Blanc being a particularly noteworthy recommendation for those willing to venture beyond their vinous comfort zones. Overall, Postino has captured my affection, with the sole exception being occasional lapses in service quality, which regrettably precludes a perfect five-star appraisal."

"Hailing from the city of Las Vegas, I have had the pleasure of encountering yet another peculiarity in the vicinity of Scottsdale, prompting me to ponder why such an establishment does not exist in the aforementioned city. The prices at this particular venue were remarkably reasonable, with a mere twenty dollars securing a haircut in an ambiance that exuded an air of sophistication. Furthermore, the establishment offered a happy hour special, featuring beverages priced at a mere two dollars apiece, which could be enjoyed either within the bar area or while reclining in the stylist's chair. The gentleman responsible for administering my haircut exuded an aura of coolness and possessed extensive knowledge regarding his craft, leading me to surmise that this shall be my preferred destination for future haircuts."

Our family of 4 dined at Roy's on a Saturday evening for dinner. We walked in, were greeted and sat promptly at our reservation time. We were happy that we were seated in one of the off shoot rooms from the front area, much much less noisy. Waters were poured, server had introduced herself, complementary edamame were placed down and drink orders were taken. We ordered a Cosmo and a Martini on the rocks with extra olives. The Martini, came forgot the olives and there was a lime wedge with the Martini, wrong, sent it back and was redone and all was well.

We started off with appetizers of Tuna Poke and a Signature Roll, both very good. For entrees we had: Braised Short Ribs of Beef, Seared Sea Scallops, Blackened Island Ahi, and Tempura California White Sea Bass.

All were perfectly cooked and very good. I can't say anything bad, but for the prices, Roy's still had that "Chain Restaurant" aura about it. Can't put my finger on it, maybe the decor, the amount of tables, the scent or the lighting? I think its a great fine dining family restaurant. Would I come here for a romantic evening, maybe not. Service and Food very good.

Love this place. Its like a neighborhood bar, but all grown up. You can enjoy a nice delicious meal. The entertainment is always great. Make reservations, gets crowded during the summer months. Service is outstanding.
